Title: Republicans Take Control Of U.S.åÊSenate
Description: ['The GOP picks up seats, holds on to key governors\xe2\x80\x99 races, and winning governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in some blue states.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'What You Need To Know', 'Updates', '', '', 'What happened tonight', '', 'Republicans blew through expectations Tuesday night, winning the control of the U.S. Senate far earlier than projected, holding onto key governorships around the country, and winning other governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in very blue states.', 'And the GOP could still win more seats in the Senate, as Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s race heads to a December runoff.', 'The short-term political consequences aren\xe2\x80\x99t huge in Congress: Washington will remain iced for the last two years of President Obama\xe2\x80\x99s presidency, with Republicans now controlling both houses of Congress. What exactly Republicans will pursue next year is unclear; already, Sen. Ted Cruz has indicated he means to push hard for the repeal of Obamacare by any means necessary. But the wave of new lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 and the successful retention of Kansas Sen. Pat Roberts \xe2\x80\x94 gives Republicans more seats than expected down the road, even if they lose the majority in 2016.', 'The new Republican class is led by three young lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 Arkansas\xe2\x80\x99 Tom Cotton, Colorado\xe2\x80\x99s Cory Gardner, and Joni Ernst, who came out of nowhere this year to become Iowa\xe2\x80\x99s first female statewide elected official. Cotton and Ernst are the first Iraq War veterans to be elected to the Senate.', 'Currently an outspoken hawk in the House of Representatives, Cotton will likely become the latest addition to the Senate\xe2\x80\x99s core group of hawkish Republicans: Sens. John McCain, Lindsey Graham, and Kelly Ayotte, as well as a few others who share similar views on Israel, domestic surveillance, and U.S. military intervention. Ernst, who McCain and Sen. Marco Rubio campaigned for this fall, will probably also be more in line with this group.', 'Gardner, meanwhile, defeated Sen. Mark Udall this year in a tight Colorado race that became almost exclusively about reproductive issues \xe2\x80\x94 and Gardner\xe2\x80\x99s previous support for a personhood amendment. Gardner, along with the new senator-elect in North Carolina, Thom Tillis, became one of a class of Republicans to advocate for over-the-counter contraceptives. Republicans also flipped Senate seats in Montana, South Dakota, and West Virginia.', 'The new Senate class is joined by Republican successes in a number of governor\xe2\x80\x99s races \xe2\x80\x94 most notably Govs. Rick Scott of Florida and Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who looked to be in serious trouble during the final weeks of the campaign. Meaning: Walker\xe2\x80\x99s potential 2016 bid stays alive. The Republican, hailed by conservatives as a union buster, escaped again.', 'Scott and Walker aren\xe2\x80\x99t alone. Republican governor candidates also won in blue states like Maryland, Maine, and Illinois \xe2\x80\x94 as well as pulling out tighter races in Georgia, Michigan, and Arizona.', '', '', 'Who suffered the biggest loss in Maryland? Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley', '', '', '', 'Republican Larry Hogan wins Maryland gubernatorial race', 'Republican Larry Hogan has won the Maryland gubernatorial race with nearly 52% of the vote in one of the biggest surprises in the country.', 'Hogan won decisively, despite campaign support in recent weeks from President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama.', 'The Associated Press called the race for Hogan, a Maryland businessman, just after midnight:', 'Brown, an African American who was lieutenant governor under Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley, had in recent months been widely expected to coast to victory in Maryland, a deep blue state.', 'But in recent days the race was being called a toss up, even as Brown drummed up support from the President and First Lady at campaign events in the Democratic strongholds of Prince George\xe2\x80\x99s County and Baltimore.', '', '', 'Harry Reid congratulates Mitch McConnell', '', 'Harry Reid put out a statement congratulating Mitch McConnell on becoming the Senate majority leader.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to congratulate Senator McConnell, who will be the new Senate Majority Leader. The message from voters is clear: they want us to work together. I look forward to working with Senator McConnell to get things done for the middle class.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'Ernst defeats Braley in Iowa Senate race', '', '', 'Tillis defeats Hagan in North Carolina, Republicans win Senate control', 'Democrat Kay Hagan lost to Republican Thom Tillis in North Carolina', 'Hagan tried hard to make her campaign a referendum on Tillis\xe2\x80\x99 work in the state legislature. Tills tied Hagan to Obama and Washington Democrats at every turn.', 'Tillis had been the speaker of the North Carolina state house and under him, the legislature had passed a number of conservative laws that spawned \xe2\x80\x9cMoral Monday\xe2\x80\x9d protests through out the state. Progressives meanwhile weren\xe2\x80\x99t exactly thrilled with Hagan, who positioned herself as a moderate Republican.', 'Both Democrats and Republicans had poured money into the state. While Hagan had tried to distance herself from Obama, he recently cut a radio ad and spoke to several North Carolina radio stations to try and get out the vote for her.', '', '', 'Roberts wins re-election in Kansas Senate race', '', 'Republican Sen. Pat Roberts defeated independent challenger Gary Orman in Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 hotly contested and often times unpredictable Senate race.', 'Kansas was a key race that Republicans needed to retain in order to gain control of the Senate, but Roberts was considered to be vulnerable, with both Republicans and Democrats in Kansas attacking him for being out of touch.', 'The race was thrown into chaos when Democrat Chad Taylor withdrew from the race in September, leaving Roberts to face a more competitive challenger in Orman. Polls in the weeks leading up to the election had the race neck and neck, but in the end, Kansan\xe2\x80\x99s decided to send the Republican to the Senate, a trend they haven\xe2\x80\x99t veered away from since 1932.', '', '', 'Perdue defeats Nunn in Georgia Senate race', '', 'Republican David Perdue defeated Democrat Michelle Nunn in Georgia to occupy the Georgia Senate seat vacated by retiring Sen. Saxby Chambliss. This race was a key victory for Republicans in their path towards a majority in the Senate.', 'Perdue came under attack from the Nunn campaign for outsourcing jobs while CEO of Dollar General, a claim he denied. For her part, Nunn tried to distance herself from President Obama, at one point trying to associate herself with former President George H.W. Bush, but Perdue continued to associate Nunn with the President and his policies.', 'The race was seen as one of the most competitive in the country, with many predicting a potential run-off due to Georgia\xe2\x80\x99s requirement that a candidate get more than 50% of the vote to claim victory.', '', '', 'More Blue Dog Democrats lose', 'The ever dwindling group of so-called Blue Dog Democrats lost two more members tonight: John Barrow of Georgia and Nick Rahall of West Virginia.', 'Rahall has been in the House since the 1970\xe2\x80\x99s. Both men have been top targets for Republicans in recent cycles but have managed to hold on until now. Blue Dog Democrats are typically more conservative members and many were beat by Republicans in 2010. Rahall lost to Republican Evan Jenkins and Barrow lost to Rick Allen.', 'Democrat Jim Cooper of Tennessee won his re-election.', '', '', 'Massachusetts elects out LGBT attorney general \xe2\x80\x94 a first in the country', 'In Massachusetts, Maura Healey, is', 'the first out LGBT state attorney general in the country.', 'With 75 percent of precincts reporting \xe2\x80\x94 and despite a too-close-to-call governor\xe2\x80\x99s race for her boss, current Attorney General Martha Coakley \xe2\x80\x94 Healey was trouncing her opponent, John Miller, 63-37.', 'As an assistant attorney general in the Massachusetts Attorney General\xe2\x80\x99s Office, Healey played a key role in the state\xe2\x80\x99s fight against the Defense of Marriage Act, arguing at the 1st Circuit Court of Appeals against the law in 2012.', 'LGBT advocates celebrated the victory. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled for Maura Healey, who has become the first openly LGBT state attorney general in the country,\xe2\x80\x9d said Chuck Wolfe, the president of the Victory Fund, which backs out LGBT candidates for office. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s long been a fighter for our community, and now she\xe2\x80\x99ll be fighting for the whole of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Calling Healey \xe2\x80\x9can inspirational trailblazer,\xe2\x80\x9d Human Rights Campaign president Chad Griffin said, \xe2\x80\x9cMaura Healey is one of the staunchest advocates for equality we have in this country, and we join her in celebrating her historic victory tonight\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 adding that she \xe2\x80\x9cwill fight to guarantee civil rights and legal equality for all people of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Out congressional challengers have not fared as well on Tuesday, with Clay Aiken losing his bid for a House seat in North Carolina, Sean Eldridge losing in New York, and Richard Tisei losing in Massachusetts.', 'One of the state races being watched most closely by the Victory Fund is Mike Michaud\xe2\x80\x99s bid to unset Maine Gov. Paul LePage, but the race at this hour remains too close to call.', '', '', 'Obama calling election winners on both sides of the aisle', '', '', 'Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker wins re-election', '', 'Republican Gov. Scott Walker won his re-election bid in a competitive race against Madison School Board Member Mary Burke.', 'Walker, who survived a recall in 2012, campaigned on his conservative record of cutting taxes and fighting collective bargaining, promising more of the same in a second term. Burke argued that Walker\xe2\x80\x99s policies were too controversial and had failed to bring prosperity to Wisconsin.', 'The win ensures Walker will continue to be talked about as a potential GOP presidential contender in 2016.', '', '', 'Udall falls to Gardner in Colorado', '', 'Republican Rep. Cory Gardner defeated incumbent Democratic Sen. Mark Udall in a major victory for the Republican Party as they map out a path to a majority in the Senate.', 'Gardner attacked Udall for his support of the Affordable Care Act and other policies advocated by President Obama. Udall focused his campaign largely on women\xe2\x80\x99s issues.', '', '', 'Florida Gov. Rick Scott wins re-election', '', 'Incumbent Republican Gov. Rick Scott secured re-election in Florida, defeating Charlie Crist in a close and contentious race.', 'The state\xe2\x80\x99s economy took a central role in the campaign, with Scott citing job creation during his tenure as the main reason to keep him in office.', 'Crist was the former Republican governor of the state, before switching parties after a failed Senate bid in 2012, leading many in the state to question his policy convictions.', 'The race was among the most negative in the country, with animosity between the two candidates reaching a head in their second televised debate. Scott initially refused to come onto the debate stage because Crist had a small fan placed under his podium.', '', '', 'Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook on Election Day', 'She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t on the ballot, but Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook this Election Day, according to Facebook data. The rest of the list was made up of Republicans.', 'From Facebook:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe top election-related content shared by political figures on Facebook today. And they are listed in rank order by total number of interactions (likes, comments, shares).\xe2\x80\x9d', '1. Elizabeth Warren', '2. Paul Ryan', '3. Marco Rubio', '4. Scott Walker', '48.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '49.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '50.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '51.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'Republicans Take Control Of U.S. Senate', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Democratic Senator ‰ÛÏRegrets‰Ûù Comments About Joni Ernst‰ÛªsåÊLooks
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cI shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have said those things, I know that.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall, File', 'Jim Young / Reuters', 'Lucas Jackson / Reuters', 'Retiring Democratic Sen. Senator Tom Harkin says he \xe2\x80\x9cregrets\xe2\x80\x9d comments he made last week comparing Republican Iowa Senate candidate Joni Ernst\xe2\x80\x99s looks to those of Taylor Swift.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have said those things, I know that,\xe2\x80\x9d Harkin said in a statement. \xe2\x80\x9cI regret anytime someone feels offended by what I have said. But I am only human and I can make mistakes sometimes in how I say something. In fact, I have complimented her on running a very good campaign.', 'reported Sunday evening the retiring Democrat said at an event honoring him that last week Iowa voters shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be fooled because Joni Ernst is \xe2\x80\x9creally attractive\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9csounds nice.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cIn this Senate race, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been watching some of these ads,\xe2\x80\x9d Harkin said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd there\xe2\x80\x99s sort of this sense that, \xe2\x80\x98Well, I hear so much about Joni Ernst. She is really attractive, and she sounds nice.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWell I got to thinking about that. I don\xe2\x80\x99t care if she\xe2\x80\x99s as good looking as Taylor Swift or as nice as Mr. Rogers, but if she votes like Michele Bachmann, she\xe2\x80\x99s wrong for the state of Iowa.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Fox News Monday she was \xe2\x80\x9cvery offended\xe2\x80\x9d by Harkin\xe2\x80\x99s comments about her.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI was very offended that Sen. Harkin would say that. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s unfortunate that he and many of their party believe you can\xe2\x80\x99t be a real woman if you\xe2\x80\x99re conservative and you\xe2\x80\x99re female,\xe2\x80\x9d Ernst said. \xe2\x80\x9cAgain, I am greatly offended by that.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cI believe if my name had been John Ernst attached to my resume, Sen. Harkin would not have said those things,\xe2\x80\x9d Ernst added.', 'Democratic Senator "Regrets" Comments About Joni Ernst\'s Looks', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Joni Ernst ‰ÛÏGreatly Offended‰Ûù By Taylor Swift Comparison
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cI think it\xe2\x80\x99s unfortunate that he and many of their party believe you can\xe2\x80\x99t be a real woman if you\xe2\x80\x99re conservative and you\xe2\x80\x99re female.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Republican Iowa Senate candidate Joni Ernst said Monday she was \xe2\x80\x9cgreatly offended\xe2\x80\x9d by comments retiring Democratic Senator Tom Harkin said last week comparing her looks to that of Taylor Swift.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI was very offended that Sen. Harkin would say that. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s unfortunate that he and many of their party believe you can\xe2\x80\x99t be a real woman if you\xe2\x80\x99re conservative and you\xe2\x80\x99re female,\xe2\x80\x9d Ernst said on Fox News Monday morning. \xe2\x80\x9cAgain, I am greatly offended by that.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cI believe if my name had been John Ernst attached to my resume, Sen. Harkin would not have said those things,\xe2\x80\x9d Ernst added.', 'Sunday evening Harkin said last week at an event honoring him that Iowa voters shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be fooled because Joni Ernst is \xe2\x80\x9creally attractive\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9csounds nice.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cIn this Senate race, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been watching some of these ads,\xe2\x80\x9d Harkin said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd there\xe2\x80\x99s sort of this sense that, \xe2\x80\x98Well, I hear so much about Joni Ernst. She is really attractive, and she sounds nice.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWell I got to thinking about that. I don\xe2\x80\x99t care if she\xe2\x80\x99s as good looking as Taylor Swift or as nice as Mr. Rogers, but if she votes like Michele Bachmann, she\xe2\x80\x99s wrong for the state of Iowa.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Joni Ernst "Greatly Offended" By Taylor Swift Comparison', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! Title: Tom Harkin: Don‰Ûªt Be Fooled Because Joni Ernst Is ‰ÛÏReally Attractive,‰Ûù ‰ÛÏSoundsåÊNice‰Ûù
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t care if she\xe2\x80\x99s as good looking as Taylor Swift\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'AP Photo/Charlie Neibergall, File', 'Kevin Lamarque / Reuters', 'Retiring Democratic Iowa Sen. Tom Harkin says that Iowa voters shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be fooled because Joni Ernst is \xe2\x80\x9creally attractive\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9csounds nice.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cIn this Senate race, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been watching some of these ads,\xe2\x80\x9d Harkin said at the Story County Democrats\xe2\x80\x99 annual fall barbecue last week honoring the retiring senator. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd there\xe2\x80\x99s sort of this sense that, \xe2\x80\x98Well, I hear so much about Joni Ernst. She is really attractive, and she sounds nice.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWell I gotta to thinking about that. I don\xe2\x80\x99t care if she\xe2\x80\x99s as good looking as Taylor Swift or as nice as Mr. Rogers, but if she votes like Michele Bachmann, she\xe2\x80\x99s wrong for the state of Iowa.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Here is the video:', 'Tom Harkin: Don\'t Be Fooled Because Joni Ernst Is "Really Attractive," "Sounds Nice"', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! Title: Former Mortgage Scammer Cleaned Ebola Doctor‰Ûªs Apartment
Description: ['The attorney general flagged the contractor.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'The city says the work was performed correctly, but says the situation is under review.', '', '', 'The public face of the cleanup of the home of a New York doctor infected with Ebola is a former mortgage scammer and convicted felon released from prison in 2011 whose company won the high-stakes city contract despite his well-known recent past.', '', 'Mayor Bill de Blasio\xe2\x80\x99s aides have known of Salvatore Pane\xe2\x80\x99s background since Monday, officials confirmed to BuzzFeed News, and City Hall quietly stopped working with his firm \xe2\x80\x94 but a City Hall official defended his work.', 'New York State Attorney General Eric Schneiderman flagged the contract because his office \xe2\x80\x94 led at the time by now-Gov. Andrew Cuomo \xe2\x80\x94 won a judgment against Pane and his previous companies in 2010 for \xe2\x80\x9cengaging in fraudulent and illegal acts,\xe2\x80\x9d officials said.', '', 'Pane\xe2\x80\x99s practice of extracting money from New Yorkers under the guise of helping them with crushing mortgages had a', 'devoted to it. Now he\xe2\x80\x99s a leading public face of New York City\xe2\x80\x99s emergency response. He was interviewed by', ',', ', and in the', ';', 'reported that Cuomo personally called Pane to put Bio-Recovery on the Ebola case.', '', 'But none of those reports have drawn the connection between the handsome cleanup technician \xe2\x80\x94 pictured in Reuters photos outside the doctor\xe2\x80\x99s Harlem apartment \xe2\x80\x94 and the mortgage cases, perhaps because Pane has changed the spelling of his last name to \xe2\x80\x9cPain.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cOur attorneys became aware of this situation on Monday and we immediately notified the mayor\xe2\x80\x99s office and the governor\xe2\x80\x99s office,\xe2\x80\x9d Damien LaVera, the communications director for Attorney General Eric Schneiderman, told BuzzFeed News Friday. \xe2\x80\x9cWe will continue to monitor the situation, provide any assistance our state and city partners request, and take any actions we deem necessary to protect the public interest.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Pane, in an interview, rejected any connection between his past and his Ebola work, and confirmed his past criminal and civil legal issues as well as having changed his name.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI hope I\xe2\x80\x99ve done what I\xe2\x80\x99ve had to do to rebuild my life,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not a bad guy.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'A de Blasio aide said the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene verified that officials checked the cleanup of the apartment afterward, and found the work was successful and the job was performed correctly. There have been no allegations of subpar work by Bio-Recovery employees, according to the city.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe city first became aware of this situation this week, and has been reviewing the facts,\xe2\x80\x9d Phil Walzak, a spokesman for the mayor, told BuzzFeed News on Friday. \xe2\x80\x9cBio-Recovery has not received any further work from the city as we review this situation.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Melissa DeRosa, the communications director for Gov. Andrew Cuomo, said that after being alerted of the claim that the governor had contacted Pane, state officials checked to see if the state had any contracts with Pane. DeRosa told BuzzFeed News that Pane has no contracts with New York state.', 'Alerted to a statement \xe2\x80\x94 unsourced in the', 'report \xe2\x80\x94 that Cuomo had sought out the man he sued in his capacity as New York attorney general just four years ago, DeRosa said, \xe2\x80\x9cThis is completely false and \xe2\x80\xa6 deeply disturbing.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Asked about the reported call from Cuomo, Pane denied he\xe2\x80\x99d ever claimed to have spoken to the governor. He told BuzzFeed News, \xe2\x80\x9cWe were on call with every high-level government official, but I can\xe2\x80\x99t speak to if Gov. Cuomo was on the call.\xe2\x80\x9d Cuomo\xe2\x80\x99s office said no high-level officials spoke to Pane.', 'A city aide confirmed that Bio-Recovery was on calls with health officials related to the apartment cleaning, but said no commissioners or top City Hall officials were on the call to their knowledge.', 'In addition to Dr. Craig Spencer\xe2\x80\x99s apartment, Bio-Recovery also cleaned Gutter, the Brooklyn bar and bowling alley where Spencer had gone earlier this month.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe cleaned every square inch of the place \xe2\x80\x94 every hole in every bowling ball,\xe2\x80\x9d Pane told the', '. \xe2\x80\x9cEvery pin, every lane, every receiver, every sink, every toilet. We disposed of all paper goods, anything that was open \xe2\x80\x94 all toilet paper rolls. Because it\xe2\x80\x99s a bowling alley, we had to chemically strip the oil from the floors.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'But just a few years before he was playing a key role in a global public health crisis, Pane was in a different business \xe2\x80\x94 one in which he also marketed himself effectively, and one which ended badly.', 'In the late 2000s, Pane ran two distressed mortgage companies, American Modification Agency and Amerimod, and appeared widely on television as an expert on how to help people with troubled mortgages fix their problems. In 2010, Pane and his company \xe2\x80\x9cengaged in fraudulent, deceptive, and illegal business practices that violated New York\xe2\x80\x99s consumer protection and real property laws,\xe2\x80\x9d according to a pleading filed by then-state attorney general Andrew Cuomo. Justice Emily Jane Goodman of State Supreme Court in Manhattan filed a', 'against the companies.', 'On unrelated charges, Pane spent nine months, from June 2010 to March 2011, in jail for operating a vehicle without a license \xe2\x80\x94 first-degree aggravated unlicensed operation of a vehicle, according to', ', which is a felony.', 'In an interview with BuzzFeed News, Pane was adamant that Bio-Recovery is an upstanding company and separate from his past. He said he had begun doing cleanup work in 2001, working at his neighbor Vincent Santella\xe2\x80\x99s company. Pane said the two did work for, and were partners with, the late Ron Gospodarski, the first owner of Bio-Recovery, who died in April 2013. \xe2\x80\x9cWe all worked here and then we started working together,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', '\xe2\x80\x9cLet\xe2\x80\x99s not hurt a good company. If it does I\xe2\x80\x99ll resign,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. Pane said he had changed his surname from Pane to Pain because of an incident with a stalker.', 'In television and radio interviews, Pane has said the firm has more than 20 years of experience in crime scene cleanup. During the anthrax scare of 2001, Bio-Recovery decontaminated ABC Studios in Manhattan; the firm was then owned by Gospodarski. Pane told BuzzFeed News that another Bio-Recovery employee, Vincent Santella, bought the firm from Gospodarski\xe2\x80\x99s estate, though public documents weren\xe2\x80\x99t immediately available to confirm the details of the transaction.', 'City documents say Bio-Recovery has been a contractor for city agencies for the last six years, but there is no standing contract, and Bio-Recovery is contracted on a case-by-case basis. The contracts are too small, a city official said, to require detailed disclosure in the city\xe2\x80\x99s Vendex program, which was created to screen out questionable contractors.', 'And the continuity between the company\xe2\x80\x99s old and new ownership is far from clear.', 'A former employee of Bio-Recovery, Manny Sosa, told BuzzFeed News on Thursday, \xe2\x80\x9cThey are not the company we were. I have no idea who they are.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Pane said he knew Sosa, and charged that Sosa had been fired three years before Gospodarski\xe2\x80\x99s death.', 'When asked about Pane\xe2\x80\x99s comments on Friday, Sosa reiterated that he did not know Pane or Santella. He said he had worked for Gospodarski since 1999, and left on his own.', 'Today, Bio-Recovery is one of four crime scene cleanup entities connected with Pane:', ',', ',', ', and the', '.', 'list Pane as the operator of All Island Bio-Recovery and Santella as the regulatory contact.', 'When called, phone numbers on each of the websites go to the same business \xe2\x80\x94 Bio-Recovery. Additionally, many of the testimonials across the three sites \xe2\x80\x94 Bio-Recovery, All Island Bio-Recovery, and Crime Scene Cleanup \xe2\x80\x94 are identical. Two of the websites feature many of the same photos of cleanup sites.', 'Pane confirmed to BuzzFeed News that it is one business, and said the different sites are a \xe2\x80\x9cmarketing\xe2\x80\x9d tactic.', 'Multiple calls to other Bio-Recovery employees by BuzzFeed News were not returned.', 'There is at least one questionable claim on Bio-Recovery\xe2\x80\x99s website.', 'On the', 'of its website, Bio-Recovery claims to have an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau, \xe2\x80\x9cfor its many years of excellent service.\xe2\x80\x9d When the link is followed,', 'on the website says the business is not accredited with the organization.', 'When contacted by BuzzFeed News, a source at the Better Business Bureau said Bio-Recovery\xe2\x80\x99s use of the BBB seal on its website is against policy.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThey will be receiving a cease and desist letter\xe2\x80\x9d for using the BBB seal on the Bio-Recovery website, the source said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s trademark infringement.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Former Mortgage Scammer Cleaned Ebola Doctor\xe2\x80\x99s Apartment', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Uber Executive Suggests Digging Up Dirt On Journalists
Description: ['Senior Vice President Emil Michael floated making critics\xe2\x80\x99 personal lives fair game.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Michael apologized Monday for the remarks.', '', '', 'A senior executive at Uber suggested that the company should consider hiring a team of opposition researchers to dig up dirt on its critics in the media \xe2\x80\x94 and specifically to spread details of the personal life of a female journalist who has criticized the company.', 'The executive, Emil Michael, made the comments in a conversation he later said he believed was off the record. In a statement through Uber Monday evening, he said he regretted them and that they didn\xe2\x80\x99t reflect his or the company\xe2\x80\x99s views.', 'His remarks came as Uber', 'with the media and the image of its management team, who have been cast as insensitive and hyper-aggressive even as the company\xe2\x80\x99s business and cultural reach have boomed.', 'Michael, who has been at Uber for more than a year as its senior vice president of business, floated the idea at a dinner Friday at Manhattan\xe2\x80\x99s Waverly Inn attended by an influential New York crowd including actor Ed Norton and publisher Arianna Huffington. The dinner was hosted by Ian Osborne, a former adviser to British Prime Minister David Cameron and consultant to the company.', 'At the dinner, Uber CEO and founder Travis Kalanick, boyish with tousled graying hair and a sweater, made the case that he has been miscast as an ideologue and as insensitive to driver and rider complaints, while in fact he has largely had his head down building a transformative company that has beat his own and others\xe2\x80\x99 wildest expectations.', 'A BuzzFeed editor was invited to the dinner by the journalist Michael Wolff, who later said that he had failed to communicate that the gathering would be off the record; neither Kalanick, his communications director, nor any other Uber official suggested to BuzzFeed News that the event was off the record.', 'Michael, who Kalanick described as \xe2\x80\x9cone of the top deal guys in the Valley\xe2\x80\x9d when he joined the company, is a charismatic and well-regarded figure who came to Uber from Klout. He also sits on a board that advises the Department of Defense.', 'Over dinner, he outlined the notion of spending \xe2\x80\x9ca million dollars\xe2\x80\x9d to hire four top opposition researchers and four journalists. That team could, he said, help Uber fight back against the press \xe2\x80\x94 they\xe2\x80\x99d look into \xe2\x80\x9cyour personal lives, your families,\xe2\x80\x9d and give the media a taste of its own medicine.', 'Michael was particularly focused on one journalist, Sarah Lacy, the editor of the Silicon Valley website', ', a sometimes combative voice inside the industry. Lacy recently accused Uber of \xe2\x80\x9csexism and misogyny.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'that she was deleting her Uber app after', 'that Uber appeared to be working with a French escort service. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know how many more signals we need that the company simply doesn\xe2\x80\x99t respect us or prioritize our safety,\xe2\x80\x9d she wrote.', 'At the dinner, Michael expressed outrage at Lacy\xe2\x80\x99s column and said that women are far more likely to get assaulted by taxi drivers than Uber drivers. He said that he thought Lacy should be held \xe2\x80\x9cpersonally responsible\xe2\x80\x9d for any woman who followed her lead in deleting Uber and was then sexually assaulted.', 'Then he returned to the opposition research plan. Uber\xe2\x80\x99s dirt-diggers, Michael said, could expose Lacy. They could, in particular, prove a particular and very specific claim about her personal life.', 'Michael at no point suggested that Uber has actually hired opposition researchers, or that it plans to. He cast it as something that would make sense, that the company would be justified in doing.', 'In a statement through an Uber spokeswoman, Michael said: \xe2\x80\x9cThe remarks attributed to me at a private dinner \xe2\x80\x94 borne out of frustration during an informal debate over what I feel is sensationalistic media coverage of the company I am proud to work for \xe2\x80\x94 do not reflect my actual views and have no relation to the company\xe2\x80\x99s views or approach. They were wrong no matter the circumstance and I regret them.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The spokeswoman, Nairi Hourdajian, said the company does not do \xe2\x80\x9coppo research\xe2\x80\x9d of any sort on journalists, and has never considered doing it. She also said Uber does not consider Lacy\xe2\x80\x99s personal life fair game, or believe that she is responsible for women being sexually assaulted. (Lacy initially declined to comment on Michael\xe2\x80\x99s remarks; she', 'after this story was published.)', 'Hourdajian also said that Uber has clear policies against executives looking at journalists\xe2\x80\x99 travel logs, a rich source of personal information in Uber\xe2\x80\x99s posession.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAny such activity would be clear violations of our privacy and data access policies,\xe2\x80\x9d Hourdajian said in an email. \xe2\x80\x9cAccess to and use of data is permitted only for legitimate business purposes. These policies apply to all employees. We regularly monitor and audit that access.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'In fact, the general manager of Uber NYC accessed the profile of a BuzzFeed News reporter, Johana Bhuiyan, to make points in the course of a discussion of Uber policies. At no point in the email exchanges did she give him permission to do so.', 'At the Waverly Inn dinner, it was suggested that a plan like the one Michael floated could become a problem for Uber.', 'Michael responded: \xe2\x80\x9cNobody would know it was us.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Uber Executive Suggests Digging Up Dirt On Journalists', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Uber CEO: Obamacare Has Been ‰ÛÏHuge‰Ûù ForåÊBusiness
Description: ['Health care frees drivers from \xe2\x80\x9cThe Man.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The CEO of Uber said Friday that Obamacare has played a crucial role for his army of drivers, an unusual, partial endorsement of the president\xe2\x80\x99s signature policy from a man often cast as a hero of anti-government libertarianism.', 'that the new, subsidized market for health care has been a boon to companies like Uber, which are essentially digital middlemen relying on armies of independent contractors. Figures ranging from Uber drivers to Obamacare architect Jonathan Gruber called the health care overhaul crucial in the emergence of the sharing economy, but Uber had remained officially silent on the subject until Friday.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s huge,\xe2\x80\x9d Travis Kalanick, Uber\xe2\x80\x99s CEO and co-founder, said in response to a question about Uber and Obamacare at a', 'in Manhattan. Kalanick didn\xe2\x80\x99t comment on the specifics of the health care policy, but said he sees little sense in the traditional link between employment and health care; he said he believes all Americans should have access to some health care safety net, without losing the option of paying more money for private care.', 'And he said the success of Obamacare\xe2\x80\x99s core goal \xe2\x80\x94 creating a functioning individual market for health care \xe2\x80\x94 is very much in sync with Uber\xe2\x80\x99s vision of a liberated work force.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe democratization of those types of benefits allow people to have more flexible ways to make a living,\xe2\x80\x9d Kalanick said. \xe2\x80\x9cThey don\xe2\x80\x99t have to be working for The Man.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Uber is vastly the largest and most successful of a new wave of sharing economy companies, adding 50,000 new independent contractors to its platform nationwide every month, and Kalanick\xe2\x80\x99s endorsement comes as a new Republican Congress feels its way on issues touching both tech and a health care policy many of its leaders have sworn to repeal.', 'Uber CEO: Obamacare Has Been "Huge" For Business', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The FacebookåÊElection
Description: ['The social network may end TV\xe2\x80\x99s long dominance of American politics \xe2\x80\x94 and open the door to a new kind of populism.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed News and ABC News share exclusive access to Facebook\xe2\x80\x99s new \xe2\x80\x9csentiment data.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'At some point in the next two years, the pollsters and ad makers who steer American presidential campaigns will be stumped: The nightly tracking polls are showing a dramatic swing in the opinions of the electorate, but neither of two typical factors \xe2\x80\x94 huge news or a major advertising buy \xe2\x80\x94 can explain it. They will, eventually, realize that the viral, mass conversation about politics on Facebook and other platforms has finally emerged as a third force in the core business of politics, mass persuasion.', 'Facebook is on the cusp \xe2\x80\x94 and I suspect 2016 will be the year this becomes clear \xe2\x80\x94 of replacing television advertising as the place where American elections are fought and won. The vast new network of some 185 million Americans opens the possibility, for instance, of a congressional candidate gaining traction without the expense of television, and of an inexpensive new viral populism. The way people share will shape the outcome of the presidential election. Even during the 2014 midterms, which most Americans ignored, Facebook says it saw 43 million unique individuals engage in the political conversation. Now a rawly powerful video may reach far more voters in a few hours than a multimillion-dollar ad buy; and it will reach them from trusted sources \xe2\x80\x94 their friends \xe2\x80\x94 not via suspect, one-way channels.', 'And so we at BuzzFeed News are deeply excited to have nearly exclusive access (it\xe2\x80\x99s shared with a broadcast partner, ABC News) to a powerful new window into the largest political conversation in America. This data will be drawn from a Facebook project working in the tricky field of \xe2\x80\x9csentiment analysis,\xe2\x80\x9d the attempt to analyze people\xe2\x80\x99s feelings based on what they write, which we think may be the most important new source of political data in the 2016 elections. This project will allow BuzzFeed News reporters to ask Facebook for data on, for instance, how Iowans feel about Hillary Clinton, or which Republican candidate appears to be best liked by women.', 'The field of sentiment analysis is as famous for its pitfalls as for any successes. Sentiment analysis has been bad at detecting sarcasm, for instance. But there\xe2\x80\x99s good reason to think that if anyone can pull this off, it will be Facebook. First, it has access to a far, far larger sample of natural language than any other social network. What\xe2\x80\x99s more, that carries with it contextual data that can serve as a point of departure for sentiment analysis \xe2\x80\x94 the field, in particular, that allows people to include how they\xe2\x80\x99re feeling or what they\xe2\x80\x99re doing when they post status updates. And third, Facebook quite simply has some of the best data scientists in the world, and has built a company on a deep and comprehensive understanding of user data. We\xe2\x80\x99re also comfortable with Facebook\xe2\x80\x99s approach to its users\xe2\x80\x99 privacy with this data, which is anonymous and aggregate, with no data available for groups of interactions under 1,000.', '', 'The Facebook sentiment data BuzzFeed News will have access to is a new window into not just what Americans are talking about, but which way their sentiment is moving.', 'Some details from the first simple cut of sentiment data we got, spanning Oct. 26 to Nov. 5: Clinton, the most discussed Democrat on Facebook, and Warren have almost identical sentiment ratings \xe2\x80\x94 57% positive and 40% negative for Clinton; 56% positive and 40% negative for Warren.', 'Fascinatingly, Joe Biden, though subject of just a quarter Clinton\xe2\x80\x99s volume of conversation, is also viewed in a warmer light, with 67% of the conversation about him positive \xe2\x80\x94 a hint of the sort of politician, raw and authentic and occasionally stumbling, who thrives in this new medium.', 'On the Republican side, Chris Christie is the most discussed figure, but the results are far more mixed: 47% of the sentiment is positive, 45% negative. The twist: The conversation about Christie is far more negative inside his home state of New Jersey than outside it \xe2\x80\x94 just 33% positive in the state, but 52% positive outside it. The most warmly viewed Republicans are Condoleezza Rice and Paul Ryan. Sentiment about Jeb Bush, meanwhile, is underwater.', 'BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 staff, led on this project by Political Editor Katherine Miller and Data Editor Jeremy Singer-Vine and their teams, will dive deep into this data over the next two years. We anticipate bringing our readers and the broader web both daily updates and more complex news and analyses, always treating the data with analytical rigor, and comparing it with public polling and other sources of information. The data will be granular enough to see trends among and between states, between men and women inside states, and among age groups.', 'The Facebook sentiment data isn\xe2\x80\x99t a substitute for polling, in part because the huge sample of Americans on Facebook still isn\xe2\x80\x99t co-extensive with the electorate, but the sentiment data has the potential to be an important and telling complement to it.', 'We are devoting resources to this sentiment data set because of its place in the broad and evolving shift in American politics toward the social web.', 'This shift is not just about Facebook. First, starting about 10 years ago, political organizing and small-dollar fundraising moved to email, a good channel for politicians to communicate directly with their most loyal supporters. Then the inside conversation moved to the social web first, with the abrupt shift from the political blogosphere to Twitter in 2009 and 2010.', 'Candidates, however, have struggled to take the third and most vital element of politics \xe2\x80\x94 mass persuasion \xe2\x80\x94 to the web, and remain reliant on the dusty 30-second television ad, blasted out to voters in the', '.', 'What is beginning to dawn on campaigns is that persuasion works differently when it relies on sharing. It is a political truism that people are most likely to believe what their friends and neighbors tell them, a truth that explains everything from sophisticated and earnest door-knocking efforts to malign email-forward whispering campaigns. And the social conversation favors things that generations of politicians have been trained to avoid: spontaneity, surprise, authenticity, humor, raw edge, the occasional human stumble. (Joe Biden!) As mobile becomes increasingly central to the social web, I suspect that more voters in 2016 will be persuaded by a video in their Facebook mobile browsers than by any other medium.', 'This isn\xe2\x80\x99t a change in how the same politicians and campaigns distribute the same old media. It\xe2\x80\x99s a deeper change in which politicians will thrive. Platforms have always shaped presidential politics \xe2\x80\x94 think of John F. Kennedy\xe2\x80\x99s native grasp of television \xe2\x80\x94 and the 2016 election has the potential to be another turning point.', 'A few modern politicians appear to have a real feel for the raw emotion and, sometimes, (apparent) spontaneity that people will want to share.', 'blunt and casual economic 2011 tirade and', 'theatrical confrontations (and even his own', ') are the beginnings of that viral populism for which the social web has opened a real space.', 'BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 new project with Facebook sentiment data will tell us and our readers how this new viral politics affects the Americans it reaches. And the stakes, the presidency, are as high as they get.', 'The Facebook Election', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Why BuzzFeed Doesn‰Ûªt Do Clickbait
Description: ['You won\xe2\x80\x99t believe this one weird trick.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Jon Stewart was asked about BuzzFeed and', 'the other day, and had this to', ':', '\xe2\x80\x9cI scroll around, but when I look at the internet, I feel the same as when I\xe2\x80\x99m walking through Coney Island,\xe2\x80\x9d Stewart told', 'magazine. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s like carnival barkers, and they all sit out there and go, \xe2\x80\x98Come on in here and see a three-legged man!\xe2\x80\x99 So you walk in and it\xe2\x80\x99s a guy with a crutch.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'That may be the best definition I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever heard of what\xe2\x80\x99s referred to as \xe2\x80\x9cclickbait.\xe2\x80\x9d But it suggests that Stewart, like many people in the media industry, confuses what we do with true clickbait. We have admittedly (and at times deliberately) not done a great job of explaining why we have always avoided clickbait at BuzzFeed.', 'In fact \xe2\x80\x94 and here is a trade secret I\xe2\x80\x99d decided a few years ago we\xe2\x80\x99d be better off not revealing \xe2\x80\x94 clickbait stopped working around 2009.', 'I avoided talking about it because, well, a lot of our rivals hadn\xe2\x80\x99t yet figured it out and were becoming addicted to and deeply reliant on misleading headlines; since we weren\xe2\x80\x99t, there seemed to be no harm (to us) in letting others focus on the short-term. But last winter saw a particularly virulent strain of hyper-optimized clickbait take root: the tempting, vacuous \xe2\x80\x9ccuriosity gap\xe2\x80\x9d headline. Meanwhile, the many publisher Twitter accounts that auto-tweeted dozens of misleading, over-torqued headlines became Twitter\xe2\x80\x99s favorite joke \xe2\x80\x94 and spawned a set of fairly useful \xe2\x80\x9cspoiler\xe2\x80\x9d accounts.', 'Now it\xe2\x80\x99s no longer much of a secret that clickbait doesn\xe2\x80\x99t work. BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 Charlie Warzel wrote a', 'of the topic not long ago.', '\xe2\x80\x99s Nilay Patel probably described our position better than we ever have in', '\xe2\x80\x9cMost clickbait is disappointing because it\xe2\x80\x99s a promise of value that isn\xe2\x80\x99t met \xe2\x80\x94 the payoff isn\xe2\x80\x99t nearly as good as what the reader imagines,\xe2\x80\x9d Patel said. \xe2\x80\x9cBuzzFeed headlines pay off particularly well because they actually make fairly small promises and then overdeliver.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'in August, Facebook engineer Khalid El-Arini made clear what we all know: that readers don\xe2\x80\x99t want to be tricked by headlines; instead, they want to be informed by them.', 'Clickbait actually has its origins in old media, not the web, and specifically in the don\xe2\x80\x99t-touch-that-dial antics of television and radio. Because you won\xe2\x80\x99t believe what happens next\xe2\x80\xa6after the break. It\xe2\x80\x99s a pretty rough consumer experience to demand your audience sit through an ad, online or off. The banner ad, whose decline Farhad Manjoo recently', ', was also born during this era and created a business model in which clicks are tied directly to dollars \xe2\x80\x94 something many people assume is still how all online publishers make their money. But BuzzFeed has never sold a banner, and I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t even tell you how many monthly page views we get. And so our business model at least moderates that incentive to drag every last click out of our audience.', 'The worst form of this online is on a pennies-per-click business model in the transactional netherworld of outsourced sponsored content sitting at the bottom of articles around the web. All that matters in that space is the snappy headline. Grab the reader\xe2\x80\x99s attention, get the click \xe2\x80\x94 even if this isn\xe2\x80\x99t the craziest thing Ted Cruz has said yet; even if \xe2\x80\x9cParis Hilton \xe2\x80\x93 topless\xe2\x80\x9d is in fact demurely dressed and riding in a convertible; if this one easy trick won\xe2\x80\x99t actually lose you weight; and if you actually', 'believe what happens next.', 'If your goal \xe2\x80\x94 as is ours at BuzzFeed \xe2\x80\x94 is to deliver the reader something so new, funny, revelatory, or delightful that they feel compelled to share it, you have to do work that delivers on the headline\xe2\x80\x99s promise, and more. This is a very high bar. It\xe2\x80\x99s one thing to enjoy reading something, and quite another to make the active choice to share it with your friends. This is a core fact of sharing and the social web of Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and other platforms.', 'The best way to ensure your readers', 'choose to share a story or a post is to trick them. Anyone who has spent the last 20 years online knows the specific disgust that comes with a headline that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t deliver on its promise. It\xe2\x80\x99s the kind of taste you get in your mouth from a glistening but spoiled peach. The publisher got the page view, and ComScore doesn\xe2\x80\x99t record your flash of anger. But you\xe2\x80\x99re hardly going to subject your friends to this experience. (Maybe your enemies.)', 'In fact, the only real trick is that the work has to be good. And the only thing, other than mediocrity, that can really sabotage this strategy is writing a headline that overpromises and a story that underdelivers.', 'Great headlines, meanwhile, tell you a lot about what you\xe2\x80\x99re going to read, and persuade you to click because you know you\xe2\x80\x99ll find a story that will satisfy your interest. The lists that BuzzFeed has long been known for are, as list titles tend to be, extremely direct; \xe2\x80\x9c', '\xe2\x80\x9d is just that. As my colleague Ryan Broderick puts it, the goal is often, in fact, to \xe2\x80\x9cblow away the curiosity gap.\xe2\x80\x9d One of his recent headlines: \xe2\x80\x9c', '', 'The web\xe2\x80\x99s new allergy to clickbait applies, I should add, to those of us who are also working to build great front pages', 'Most people don\xe2\x80\x99t click on most headlines, but a good front page will inform you without forcing you to click.', '\xe2\x80\x99s incredible 2014', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe Islamic State\xe2\x80\x9d was, if anything, underhyped. And you may not be among the many people who read Jina Moore\xe2\x80\x99s recent dispatch headline, \xe2\x80\x9c', '\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 but if you saw the headline, you still learned something. A headline like', 'You won\xe2\x80\x99t believe what happened to this Ebola hospital\xe2\x80\x9d might (maybe) get more clicks \xe2\x80\x94 but the reader who scans it gets nothing at all. It\xe2\x80\x99s a form of pollution wherever it lives, whether on your homepage or your Twitter or Facebook feed.', 'Different people use the term \xe2\x80\x9cclickbait\xe2\x80\x9d differently, and it\xe2\x80\x99s sometimes thrown our direction to characterize entertaining web culture content that the author doesn\xe2\x80\x99t like. That is something different, a matter of taste. But whatever your taste, nobody likes being tricked. And whatever your goals as a publisher, there\xe2\x80\x99s no longer any argument for breaking promises to your readers.', 'You are signed in as', '.', "Why BuzzFeed Doesn't Do Clickbait", 'Your link was successfully shared!', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 9 Things The Big Republican WinåÊMeans
Description: ['Republican candidates won sweeping victories across America Tuesday night.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'That means a turn right from statehouses to Washington, and lots more.', '', '1.', 'Presidential candidates start to make their moves.', 'Kentucky Sen. Rand Paul was among the night\xe2\x80\x99s winners, and here\xe2\x80\x99s what two weeks of being on the trail with him showed: a candidate deliberately forming relationships with establishment figures, in marked contrast with his possible (probable) future rival Ted Cruz. There\xe2\x80\x99s', 'going on on both sides, sure, but he and Sen. Mitch McConnell appear to have reached a real understanding with each other that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t seem forced or awkward, and Paul has made it clear that he\xe2\x80\x99ll support McConnell for Republican leader.', 'In return, Paul likely expects help from McConnell in his presidential run, though he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t discuss the matter in an interview with BuzzFeed News on Tuesday. The establishment credentials he\xe2\x80\x99s building now may help Paul with his campaign \xe2\x80\x94 and by the way, the fact that he will run for president is almost certain. Just look at how much he\xe2\x80\x99s', 'Hillary Clinton. Watch for more of that as he gears up to decide on 2016 sometime in the spring of next year.', 'Another big winner: New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie. Though he\xe2\x80\x99s been scandal-ridden in recent months, tonight\xe2\x80\x99s victories \xe2\x80\x94 in the 3 M\xe2\x80\x99s (Maine, Maryland, and Michigan) and especially in Florida \xe2\x80\x94 can be traced in part to his role leading the Republican Governors Association, for which he helped raise an enormous war chest. That\xe2\x80\x99s capital he can use to go to fundraisers to tout his effectiveness at campaigning.', '2.', 'A hawkish new Senate.', 'This Republican Senate will be a huge problem for Obama as he attempts to achieve some foreign policy goals in the last two years of his presidency. Most immediately and maybe most importantly, Republicans will try to nix any Iran deal that they deem unsatisfactory \xe2\x80\x94 and on this, they have the support of plenty of Democrats. The deadline for the nuclear talks is Nov. 24. The new Senate will have the will and the manpower to push through new sanctions legislation if it chooses, and the fight over Iran policy could prove to be one of the defining battles of the waning Obama presidency.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s unclear where exactly the new Republican conference will be when it comes to foreign policy, but Tom Cotton and Joni Ernst, the new senators from Arkansas and Iowa, have seemed to exhibit a fairly hawkish foreign policy instinct. Foreign policy isn\xe2\x80\x99t the top issue voters care about, but their election could represent a cooling of enthusiasm for the anti-interventionist policies of libertarian Republicans that have garnered much attention in the past few years.', '3.', 'White House hopes of bipartisanship.', 'The sweeping Republican victory means President Obama \xe2\x80\x94 who came to office in 2008 on the elusive promise of unity \xe2\x80\x94 has a last chance to find bipartisan ways of working. Or at least to pay lip service to such an ideal.', 'Obama placed a round of calls Tuesday to Republican victors, and the White House says he will hold a bipartisan meeting Friday.', 'that he can connect with the new GOP leadership on issues such as corporate tax reform meant to funnel new funds into infrastructure projects, pre-kindergarten education funding, and funding for cybersecurity and fighting Ebola.', 'The hurdle in working with the new class of Republicans: Obama\xe2\x80\x99s own policies were, as he said, on the ballot, and they ran against them.', '4.', 'A victory that means surprisingly little.', 'The flip of the Senate will be remembered for one thing: It will be the first time in history that a major party took control of both chambers of Congress and absolutely nothing changed.', 'Despite Democrats\xe2\x80\x99 teeth-gnashing over judicial nominees, the reality is that Republican control will mean exactly the same thing for Obama\xe2\x80\x99s choices as it has for every other two-term president in the home stretch: Noncontroversial picks will get slow-walked, but passed, in the first year; and then the whole process will grind to a halt in the tumult of election-year politics.', 'Sure, there may some more hearings aimed at attacking the administration, but the reality is Senate Republicans are only marginally closer to the very conservative House Republicans than Senate Democrats have been. And with Obama still sitting in the Oval Office and Democratic leader Harry Reid back in the role of procedural monkey wrencher, nothing of consequence will make its way to the president\xe2\x80\x99s desk.', '5.', 'Weed is winning.', 'Washington, D.C., voters Tuesday allowed residents to possess and grow small amounts of marijuana, and voters in Oregon moved overwhelmingly to legalize recreational marijuana. A measure to legalize medical marijuana got 57% of the vote in Florida \xe2\x80\x94 not enough to pass, but a clear sign of momentum.', 'medical marijuana Tuesday.', 'And according to', ', 49% of Americans want to legalize marijuana in their states, while 46% oppose it.', 'The bottom line: The direction of voter sentiment \xe2\x80\x94 toward weed \xe2\x80\x94 is clear.', '6.', 'Pressure to act soon on immigration.', 'President Obama delayed promised relief for undocumented immigrants until after the election, for fear that the move would hurt crucial senators. And the move seems to have paid off, politically: Pollster Latino Decisions reports that Latino voters came out for Democrats by roughly the same margins as 2012.', 'Now Latino and immigrant rights groups \xe2\x80\x94 including DREAMers \xe2\x80\x94 plan to raise the pressure on Obama and demand that he keep his promise to act before the year is over. Advocates want Obama to go big, including millions of people and following the outlines of bipartisan Senate legislation. But advocates also fear that the administration may only protect 1\xe2\x80\x933 million people.', 'The big question: How broad a coalition assembles to press for White House action.', '7.', 'Ted Cruz will be a key player in the Capitol.', 'Republican Senate leader Mitch McConnell and House Speaker John Boehner \xe2\x80\x94 whose houses have not always played well together \xe2\x80\x94 are committed to being on the same page for the next two years to set their party up for success in 2016. That doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean they won\xe2\x80\x99t be conservatives, but it does mean that they\xe2\x80\x99ll want to appeal to moderates, to appear to work with President Obama, and to generally seem reasonable.', 'And McConnell, who won big in his own race and around the country Tuesday, will come in feeling he has a mandate. But then, so will his party\xe2\x80\x99s conservative wing \xe2\x80\x94 not exactly given to compromise.', 'And so the question for hopes of Republican cooperation: Will conservative leader Ted Cruz let it happen?', '8.', 'Obama\xe2\x80\x99s last shot at shaping the federal judiciary.', 'The president, who came in wanting to reshape the federal judiciary, has succeeded in making two Supreme Court appointments, tilting the ideological balance of a majority of the federal appeals courts, and diversifying the federal bench.', 'He loses much of his room to maneuver in 60 days.', 'In the next two months, the final batch of Obama appointees will be approved in the lame-duck Senate \xe2\x80\x94 and even then, only in the wake of a rule change limiting the use of filibuster to block appointments. Once the Republicans take over, and particularly in light of the judges pushed through under the filibuster rule change, it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to imagine Obama getting many more judges through \xe2\x80\x94 at least when it comes to the crucial appeals courts and Supreme Court.', '9.', 'Republicans will have to make a choice about LGBT rights.', 'The coming Congress will be the true test of whether the Republican Party wants to move on from the LGBT culture wars after the decisive legal victories of the marriage equality movement.', 'Pro-LGBT legislation is unlikely to proceed, but the real questions will be whether party leaders will allow anti-LGBT amendments or legislation to reach the floor and whether LGBT Republicans will have a voice at the table. As marriage cases continue to proceed through the courts, another issue will be whether the Republican Party will re-engage in the issue \xe2\x80\x94 attempt to turn the tide \xe2\x80\x94 or if it will instead allow the tide to continue unimpeded, if not endorsed.', '9 Things The Big Republican Win Means', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Republicans Take Control Of U.S.åÊSenate
Description: ['The GOP picks up seats, holds on to key governors\xe2\x80\x99 races, and winning governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in some blue states.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'What You Need To Know', 'Updates', '', '', 'What happened tonight', '', 'Republicans blew through expectations Tuesday night, winning the control of the U.S. Senate far earlier than projected, holding onto key governorships around the country, and winning other governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in very blue states.', 'And the GOP could still win more seats in the Senate, as Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s race heads to a December runoff.', 'The short-term political consequences aren\xe2\x80\x99t huge in Congress: Washington will remain iced for the last two years of President Obama\xe2\x80\x99s presidency, with Republicans now controlling both houses of Congress. What exactly Republicans will pursue next year is unclear; already, Sen. Ted Cruz has indicated he means to push hard for the repeal of Obamacare by any means necessary. But the wave of new lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 and the successful retention of Kansas Sen. Pat Roberts \xe2\x80\x94 gives Republicans more seats than expected down the road, even if they lose the majority in 2016.', 'The new Republican class is led by three young lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 Arkansas\xe2\x80\x99 Tom Cotton, Colorado\xe2\x80\x99s Cory Gardner, and Joni Ernst, who came out of nowhere this year to become Iowa\xe2\x80\x99s first female statewide elected official. Cotton and Ernst are the first Iraq War veterans to be elected to the Senate.', 'Currently an outspoken hawk in the House of Representatives, Cotton will likely become the latest addition to the Senate\xe2\x80\x99s core group of hawkish Republicans: Sens. John McCain, Lindsey Graham, and Kelly Ayotte, as well as a few others who share similar views on Israel, domestic surveillance, and U.S. military intervention. Ernst, who McCain and Sen. Marco Rubio campaigned for this fall, will probably also be more in line with this group.', 'Gardner, meanwhile, defeated Sen. Mark Udall this year in a tight Colorado race that became almost exclusively about reproductive issues \xe2\x80\x94 and Gardner\xe2\x80\x99s previous support for a personhood amendment. Gardner, along with the new senator-elect in North Carolina, Thom Tillis, became one of a class of Republicans to advocate for over-the-counter contraceptives. Republicans also flipped Senate seats in Montana, South Dakota, and West Virginia.', 'The new Senate class is joined by Republican successes in a number of governor\xe2\x80\x99s races \xe2\x80\x94 most notably Govs. Rick Scott of Florida and Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who looked to be in serious trouble during the final weeks of the campaign. Meaning: Walker\xe2\x80\x99s potential 2016 bid stays alive. The Republican, hailed by conservatives as a union buster, escaped again.', 'Scott and Walker aren\xe2\x80\x99t alone. Republican governor candidates also won in blue states like Maryland, Maine, and Illinois \xe2\x80\x94 as well as pulling out tighter races in Georgia, Michigan, and Arizona.', '', '', 'Who suffered the biggest loss in Maryland? Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley', '', '', '', 'Republican Larry Hogan wins Maryland gubernatorial race', 'Republican Larry Hogan has won the Maryland gubernatorial race with nearly 52% of the vote in one of the biggest surprises in the country.', 'Hogan won decisively, despite campaign support in recent weeks from President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama.', 'The Associated Press called the race for Hogan, a Maryland businessman, just after midnight:', 'Brown, an African American who was lieutenant governor under Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley, had in recent months been widely expected to coast to victory in Maryland, a deep blue state.', 'But in recent days the race was being called a toss up, even as Brown drummed up support from the President and First Lady at campaign events in the Democratic strongholds of Prince George\xe2\x80\x99s County and Baltimore.', '', '', 'Harry Reid congratulates Mitch McConnell', '', 'Harry Reid put out a statement congratulating Mitch McConnell on becoming the Senate majority leader.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to congratulate Senator McConnell, who will be the new Senate Majority Leader. The message from voters is clear: they want us to work together. I look forward to working with Senator McConnell to get things done for the middle class.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'Ernst defeats Braley in Iowa Senate race', '', '', 'Tillis defeats Hagan in North Carolina, Republicans win Senate control', 'Democrat Kay Hagan lost to Republican Thom Tillis in North Carolina', 'Hagan tried hard to make her campaign a referendum on Tillis\xe2\x80\x99 work in the state legislature. Tills tied Hagan to Obama and Washington Democrats at every turn.', 'Tillis had been the speaker of the North Carolina state house and under him, the legislature had passed a number of conservative laws that spawned \xe2\x80\x9cMoral Monday\xe2\x80\x9d protests through out the state. Progressives meanwhile weren\xe2\x80\x99t exactly thrilled with Hagan, who positioned herself as a moderate Republican.', 'Both Democrats and Republicans had poured money into the state. While Hagan had tried to distance herself from Obama, he recently cut a radio ad and spoke to several North Carolina radio stations to try and get out the vote for her.', '', '', 'Roberts wins re-election in Kansas Senate race', '', 'Republican Sen. Pat Roberts defeated independent challenger Gary Orman in Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 hotly contested and often times unpredictable Senate race.', 'Kansas was a key race that Republicans needed to retain in order to gain control of the Senate, but Roberts was considered to be vulnerable, with both Republicans and Democrats in Kansas attacking him for being out of touch.', 'The race was thrown into chaos when Democrat Chad Taylor withdrew from the race in September, leaving Roberts to face a more competitive challenger in Orman. Polls in the weeks leading up to the election had the race neck and neck, but in the end, Kansan\xe2\x80\x99s decided to send the Republican to the Senate, a trend they haven\xe2\x80\x99t veered away from since 1932.', '', '', 'Perdue defeats Nunn in Georgia Senate race', '', 'Republican David Perdue defeated Democrat Michelle Nunn in Georgia to occupy the Georgia Senate seat vacated by retiring Sen. Saxby Chambliss. This race was a key victory for Republicans in their path towards a majority in the Senate.', 'Perdue came under attack from the Nunn campaign for outsourcing jobs while CEO of Dollar General, a claim he denied. For her part, Nunn tried to distance herself from President Obama, at one point trying to associate herself with former President George H.W. Bush, but Perdue continued to associate Nunn with the President and his policies.', 'The race was seen as one of the most competitive in the country, with many predicting a potential run-off due to Georgia\xe2\x80\x99s requirement that a candidate get more than 50% of the vote to claim victory.', '', '', 'More Blue Dog Democrats lose', 'The ever dwindling group of so-called Blue Dog Democrats lost two more members tonight: John Barrow of Georgia and Nick Rahall of West Virginia.', 'Rahall has been in the House since the 1970\xe2\x80\x99s. Both men have been top targets for Republicans in recent cycles but have managed to hold on until now. Blue Dog Democrats are typically more conservative members and many were beat by Republicans in 2010. Rahall lost to Republican Evan Jenkins and Barrow lost to Rick Allen.', 'Democrat Jim Cooper of Tennessee won his re-election.', '', '', 'Massachusetts elects out LGBT attorney general \xe2\x80\x94 a first in the country', 'In Massachusetts, Maura Healey, is', 'the first out LGBT state attorney general in the country.', 'With 75 percent of precincts reporting \xe2\x80\x94 and despite a too-close-to-call governor\xe2\x80\x99s race for her boss, current Attorney General Martha Coakley \xe2\x80\x94 Healey was trouncing her opponent, John Miller, 63-37.', 'As an assistant attorney general in the Massachusetts Attorney General\xe2\x80\x99s Office, Healey played a key role in the state\xe2\x80\x99s fight against the Defense of Marriage Act, arguing at the 1st Circuit Court of Appeals against the law in 2012.', 'LGBT advocates celebrated the victory. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled for Maura Healey, who has become the first openly LGBT state attorney general in the country,\xe2\x80\x9d said Chuck Wolfe, the president of the Victory Fund, which backs out LGBT candidates for office. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s long been a fighter for our community, and now she\xe2\x80\x99ll be fighting for the whole of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Calling Healey \xe2\x80\x9can inspirational trailblazer,\xe2\x80\x9d Human Rights Campaign president Chad Griffin said, \xe2\x80\x9cMaura Healey is one of the staunchest advocates for equality we have in this country, and we join her in celebrating her historic victory tonight\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 adding that she \xe2\x80\x9cwill fight to guarantee civil rights and legal equality for all people of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Out congressional challengers have not fared as well on Tuesday, with Clay Aiken losing his bid for a House seat in North Carolina, Sean Eldridge losing in New York, and Richard Tisei losing in Massachusetts.', 'One of the state races being watched most closely by the Victory Fund is Mike Michaud\xe2\x80\x99s bid to unset Maine Gov. Paul LePage, but the race at this hour remains too close to call.', '', '', 'Obama calling election winners on both sides of the aisle', '', '', 'Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker wins re-election', '', 'Republican Gov. Scott Walker won his re-election bid in a competitive race against Madison School Board Member Mary Burke.', 'Walker, who survived a recall in 2012, campaigned on his conservative record of cutting taxes and fighting collective bargaining, promising more of the same in a second term. Burke argued that Walker\xe2\x80\x99s policies were too controversial and had failed to bring prosperity to Wisconsin.', 'The win ensures Walker will continue to be talked about as a potential GOP presidential contender in 2016.', '', '', 'Udall falls to Gardner in Colorado', '', 'Republican Rep. Cory Gardner defeated incumbent Democratic Sen. Mark Udall in a major victory for the Republican Party as they map out a path to a majority in the Senate.', 'Gardner attacked Udall for his support of the Affordable Care Act and other policies advocated by President Obama. Udall focused his campaign largely on women\xe2\x80\x99s issues.', '', '', 'Florida Gov. Rick Scott wins re-election', '', 'Incumbent Republican Gov. Rick Scott secured re-election in Florida, defeating Charlie Crist in a close and contentious race.', 'The state\xe2\x80\x99s economy took a central role in the campaign, with Scott citing job creation during his tenure as the main reason to keep him in office.', 'Crist was the former Republican governor of the state, before switching parties after a failed Senate bid in 2012, leading many in the state to question his policy convictions.', 'The race was among the most negative in the country, with animosity between the two candidates reaching a head in their second televised debate. Scott initially refused to come onto the debate stage because Crist had a small fan placed under his podium.', '', '', 'Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook on Election Day', 'She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t on the ballot, but Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook this Election Day, according to Facebook data. The rest of the list was made up of Republicans.', 'From Facebook:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe top election-related content shared by political figures on Facebook today. And they are listed in rank order by total number of interactions (likes, comments, shares).\xe2\x80\x9d', '1. Elizabeth Warren', '2. Paul Ryan', '3. Marco Rubio', '4. Scott Walker', '48.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '49.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '50.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '51.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'Republicans Take Control Of U.S. Senate', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Jina Moore‰Ûªs Ebola Story, And Why BuzzFeed News Is Investing In Foreign Correspondents
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to be in a kind of dialogue that involves eye contact.\xe2\x80\x9d']
