Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 Jina Moore arrived on Oct. 13 for her second trip to Liberia since the largest epidemic of Ebola on record spiraled out of control this summer. On her second day in the country, she sat down with a man she\xe2\x80\x99d gotten to know on the last trip, an assistant minister of health, who said something surprising: That by several measures, the number of new Ebola cases was going down.', 'This is not the sort of thing you want to speculate on, or to tweet. Media coverage of Ebola has been broadly alarmist, sloppy, and wrong, focused on the wrong place \xe2\x80\x94 New York \xe2\x80\x94 while West Africa suffered. Jina is a veteran correspondent who has thought deeply about \xe2\x80\x9cthe Africa story\xe2\x80\x9d and about telling Africans\xe2\x80\x99 stories. Her 2012 essay, \xe2\x80\x9c', ',\xe2\x80\x9d is required reading, and her coverage of Ebola in Liberia was early, humane, and wrenching.', 'Jina is, in short, exactly the sort of correspondent BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 foreign editor, Miriam Elder, looks to hire as we build a new kind of international news operation. Her story last Thursday', 'helps explain why BuzzFeed News is investing so heavily in putting great, experienced reporters around the world, doubling our foreign desk to more than a dozen correspondents. And', 'demonstrates why we think there\xe2\x80\x99s so much room for ambitious new journalism in this sometimes hidebound space.', 'Jina followed up on the official\xe2\x80\x99s stunning assertion with the kind of reporting that has, after decades of cuts to much of legacy media, increasingly been replaced by reliance on official sourcing and spin. The World Health Organization, keeper of the official Ebola numbers, was giving no hint that the shape of the epidemic had radically changed, so Jina worked her vast array of official and unofficial sources to verify the new pattern.', 'She started with the data, spending two and a half hours with the Health Ministry\xe2\x80\x99s numbers cruncher who supplies the WHO with data. She spoke to James Dorbor Jallah, the deputy incident manager at the National Ebola Command Center, who told her that \xe2\x80\x9cnew case numbers are going down.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Then she talked to the people in the business of beds and bodies. She called the \xe2\x80\x9cburial team\xe2\x80\x9d leader, whose heroism she\xe2\x80\x99d previously documented, who told her that his group was collecting fewer bodies, and that they were coming from treatment centers, not homes. She spoke to the doctor who supervises the country\xe2\x80\x99s Ebola Treatment Units, who had once told her that they were out of hospital beds \xe2\x80\x94 and who now said there were beds to spare. She spoke to the ETU nurses, who confirmed that the crowding had eased. She spoke to the people running the country\xe2\x80\x99s dedicated information line, who were getting fewer calls. (', ', which has done stellar work covering the crisis since the earliest days of the outbreak, had also reported a key element, Jina points out to me \xe2\x80\x94 the drop in ETU admissions,', ', \xe2\x80\x9cEbola Deaths Drop?\xe2\x80\x9d)', 'Jina\xe2\x80\x99s reporting would have been impossible from New York or Washington or Nairobi, where Jina is based. It is too complicated and high-stakes for phone calls \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to be in a kind of dialogue that involves eye contact. And graphs,\xe2\x80\x9d Jina told me. It is also still expensive, despite advances in communications that have deeply changed reporting and afford her an audience of unprecedented scale. It requires specialized training to avoid Ebola and a plan to give Jina the best medical care should, god forbid, she contract the virus. And, most of all, it requires Jina\xe2\x80\x99s remarkable combination of intelligence, rigor, experience, and hard work.', '\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to be able to put the data next to every tranche of human experience in responding to the Ebola outbreak, and to see that the human experience and the numbers line up,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cYou wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be able to do that anywhere else.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'It would have been hard for a reporter on her first trip to the country, who wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have noticed, for instance, that there were simply fewer ambulances screaming through the streets than there had been months earlier. And it would have been hard without Jina\xe2\x80\x99s long commitment to relying on the local sources who know the most, and not on international or American voices to tell African stories. About nine of her sources on the story were Liberian, she said, though she also spoke to a few officials at international organizations.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIf you just talk to some Liberians they know a lot of stuff, and they have a lot more hours of expertise in dealing with Ebola than anyone else in the world,\xe2\x80\x9d she told me.', 'Four days after Jina\xe2\x80\x99s story, the', 'and', 'made similar observations. Thursday, the', 'that Ebola is in fact down, based on the numbers Liberian officials had given Jina a week earlier.', 'This is a story we will continue to report, and to handle with care.', '\xe2\x80\x9cNo one wants to make it look like the crisis is over,\xe2\x80\x9d Jina said. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you stop too soon you have a bigger problem on your hands than if you never started at all.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But it\xe2\x80\x99s an important story and, most important amid a haze of panic and misinformation, it\xe2\x80\x99s a true story.', 'update', 'Updated with a link to', '.', '', 'You are signed in as', '.', "Jina Moore's Ebola Story, And Why BuzzFeed News Is Investing In Foreign Correspondents", 'Your link was successfully shared!', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: What We‰Ûªre Doing To Keep Building A Diverse Editorial Operation
Description: ['I sent this email to BuzzFeed\xe2\x80\x99s editorial staff this morning.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Diversity in BuzzFeed\xe2\x80\x99s editorial operation isn\xe2\x80\x99t a side project or special initiative. It\xe2\x80\x99s core to how we operate and how we hire.', 'As we enter another round of intense growth and hiring, I thought it was important to make clear our vision and to put out numbers that will help keep us accountable \xe2\x80\x94 to you, to our readers, and to others in our industry who care. Almost everyone here plays some role in hiring, and so I\xe2\x80\x99ve asked some editors to help come up with this statement of what we\xe2\x80\x99re trying to build and why. We\xe2\x80\x99ve also decided to share the current demographic data for the editorial operation and the company, as of September 2014, at the bottom of this e-mail.', 'So here it is, our rough and evolving hiring guide:', 'A definition:', 'BuzzFeed\xe2\x80\x99s working definition of diversity is this: enough people of a particular group that no one person has to represent the supposed viewpoint of their group \xe2\x80\x94 whether ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity, socioeconomic background, or disability. And if the group is a small one we should never expect one person to be the \xe2\x80\x9cdiverse\xe2\x80\x9d reporter or writer, or to speak for anyone other than themselves.', '4 Reasons It Matters:', 'First is the ethical imperative: Our industry, like all industries, should be open to anyone prepared to join it, and our industry, like most industries, has historically been terrible at inclusivity. But it\xe2\x80\x99s a mistake to look at diversity solely as an ethical imperative. In fact, diversity is an urgent and unending project for anyone who\xe2\x80\x99s ambitious about journalism and entertainment on the internet. Here are three reasons why:', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Reaching more readers: The internet is, in some ways, organized around identity. News and entertainment companies have often alienated or failed to reach consumers who don\xe2\x80\x99t hold the characteristics of the straight, white everyman. We are a new kind of media company with the opportunity to reach a huge global audience, and we need to build an organization that\xe2\x80\x99s capable of connecting with a vast range of readers.', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Hiring the best people: We have hired many of the best writers, editors, and reporters in the world, from a wildly diverse group of backgrounds. We want to keep doing that. Very few people, including minorities, would choose to be a tiny minority at work \xe2\x80\x94 or to work only with people just like them. In fact, most of the greatest journalists and writers will, all things being equal, choose to work in a diverse newsroom. We want them all to come work for us.', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Doing better work: Diversity makes us a better editorial operation. Underrepresented writers and journalists don\xe2\x80\x99t exist to solely to speak to readers who look like them. Diversity helps editorial organizations avoid the bland and often false conventional wisdom held in a room full of people who come from similar places. Having diverse writers on staff also brings a much wider array of stories that matter, and to more people. To get the biggest stories in the country and the world, we need as many insiders in as many communities as possible.', 'With all of this in mind, and in order to maximize our ability to create a great, diverse newsroom, we\xe2\x80\x99ve come up with a list of five things editors should do when hiring:', '1) Understand the beat or field you\xe2\x80\x99re hiring in:', 'There are some fields in the media that boast large, diverse pools of smart, hard-working people. There are other fields \xe2\x80\x94 particularly the most elite, like investigative reporting \xe2\x80\x94 that currently have smaller, whiter candidate pools. We often use our personal networks to hire from both, but in the first case, those networks can limit us. The latter is a harder problem, and one where we should be seeking to improve the pipeline ourselves.', '2) Insist on a diverse pool of serious candidates:', 'The final interview round should never just be several straight white men. One key is casting a wide net: Jobs should be listed whenever possible \xe2\x80\x94 having a link to send to a wide variety of networks makes it more likely that we\xe2\x80\x99ll have a diverse pool of candidates. And be thoughtful about the wording of job listings, and of using language in ways that inadvertently signals that we\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a guy, for someone who\xe2\x80\x99s straight, or for someone who doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have a disability.', '3) Look for opportunities to make hires that will increase the diversity of our readership:', 'We\xe2\x80\x99ve been focusing this year on news and buzz aimed at stories about and of interest to Latinos, which is to say, to a large share of Americans. The writers doing that aren\xe2\x80\x99t all Latino, but naturally most are. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll keep hiring obsessively focused maniacs, as we always have, at times to focus on the obsessions of one group or another \xe2\x80\x94 with the understanding that the organization of the web around identity often means that these are the most widely shared topics.', '4) Tap networks beyond your own:', 'Make an effort to look outside of job board applications and personal networks: To start, that means emailing the job to colleagues and journalists and writers elsewhere who are more connected to underrepresented communities. But it also means getting creative and seeking out great diverse journalists on your own \xe2\x80\x94 try HBCUs, professional organizations, and publications made for non-white audiences. Joel Greengrass\xe2\x80\x99 talent team is very focused on finding the right events and making the right connections; we recently had recruiters and senior editors at the National Association of Black Journalists convention, and will be at OUTC in October and the National Hispanic Media Convention in November.', '5) Create our own pipelines:', 'Tommy Wesely has done an outstanding job of creating, in our fellowship program, a diverse pipeline of current and future BuzzFeed stars. We\xe2\x80\x99ll continue to invest in that program, of course, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll also be looking looking to expand that vision in a couple of ways:', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Chances to create opportunities for mid-career journalists to become the top reporters of tomorrow. We\xe2\x80\x99re nearly ready to announce the details of a project Mark Schoofs is leading to bring in aspiring investigative journalists of color.', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Internships for students of color who are interested in journalism but aren\xe2\x80\x99t professionalized student journos.', 'Thanks for your wholehearted embrace of this mission. It\xe2\x80\x99s already made a big difference, and it offers us an opportunity to be leaders in this industry. And as you see, there\xe2\x80\x99s no simple answer \xe2\x80\x94 but if you\xe2\x80\x99ve got suggestions for more specific steps we can take, please let me know.', 'Ben', 'And here are the numbers:', 'You are signed in as', '.', "What We're Doing To Keep Building A Diverse Editorial Operation", 'Your link was successfully shared!', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The ‰ÛÏTotally Ridiculous‰Ûù RomneyåÊBoomlet
Description: ['Kristol is queasy.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'This is not a thing.', '', '@BuzzFeedAndrew', 'There\xe2\x80\x99s only one false note in', 'to Mitt Romney\xe2\x80\x99s quite nice new life, in which the former Republican nominee \xe2\x80\x94 rather than having the letter \xe2\x80\x9cL\xe2\x80\x9d for \xe2\x80\x9closer\xe2\x80\x9d branded on his forehead \xe2\x80\x94 is enjoying the low-level celebrity of airport selfies and ongoing flattery of sycophants who say they want him to run for president.', 'The false note: \xe2\x80\x9ca confluence of political realities has created a genuine opening for a Romney third act.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'There are a few people who think this is the case: true Romney loyalists and believers, Republicans like', ',', ', who just love the guy and write about it in', '. They are all but family; I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure what the actual family thinks. Members of his former political staff \xe2\x80\x94 people who talk to Romney regularly, and regard him highly \xe2\x80\x94 said Tuesday morning that they didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually think he\xe2\x80\x99d run, and viewed it, at best, as not a great idea. Indeed, some of his real admirers (and most people who worked for Romney do admire him) were trying out their eye-rolls Tuesday morning at this feeblest of boomlets.', 'This is, they say, not a thing.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI respect Romney, but have the queasy feeling that Romney \xe2\x80\x9816 would be a reprise of Dewey \xe2\x80\x9848,\xe2\x80\x9d', 'editor and former Romney champion Bill Kristol said in an email.', 'One top former Romney aide, who likes and respects Romney and thinks he would make a great president, agreed to speak on the condition of not being named or identified, and to outline the broad sense in what\xe2\x80\x99s left of Romneyworld.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s ridiculous \xe2\x80\x94 totally ridiculous,\xe2\x80\x9d the former aide said.', 'The core flaw is a kind of cluelessness about how this is going to work, a bit of wishful thinking indulged by a handful of donors who love Romney \xe2\x80\x94 but not actually much on the minds of the top Republican fundraisers now thinking about Paul and Cruz, Rubio and Bush, and the other more plausible candidates for president.', '\xe2\x80\x9cHere\xe2\x80\x99s the problem with the theory of the Romney candidacy, as much as I love the guy and as much as I think he\xe2\x80\x99d be a good president,\xe2\x80\x9d the former aide began. \xe2\x80\x9cThe problem with the way these [Romney donors and friends] are treating a potential Romney candidacy is that they act as though Romney, if he were to get into the race, picks up where he gets off. As though, because he was the last Republican nominee, he\xe2\x80\x99s still the Republican nominee unless he decides to bequeath it to someone else.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe field is not going to be nearly as weak as it was last time and nobody in the field, including the potential establishment candidates \xe2\x80\x94 Jeb or Chris Christie or Scott Walker \xe2\x80\x94 believe they should step aside for Mitt Romney,\xe2\x80\x9d the former aide predicted. \xe2\x80\x9cSo Romney gets into the race and he\xe2\x80\x99s suddenly competing with heavy-duty candidates who have as much claim on the mainstream donor base as he does, and suddenly he\xe2\x80\x99s in a messy primary where these people will be going at him in a very nasty way.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And here is the thing that Leibovich\xe2\x80\x99s piece really gets at: Mitt Romney has been surprised by his life since the defeat. He predicted he\xe2\x80\x99d be branded a \xe2\x80\x9closer for life\xe2\x80\x9d after 2012, his name \xe2\x80\x94 like Mike Dukakis\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x94 synonymous with defeat. Instead, he\xe2\x80\x99s regarded with warmth, if not passion, by people who still think he would have made a decent president, and don\xe2\x80\x99t all blame him for blowing it.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI think Romney really likes where he is right now,\xe2\x80\x9d said the former aide. \xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99s saying, \xe2\x80\x98Wow \xe2\x80\x94 I ran and I lost and I\xe2\x80\x99m still held in high esteem\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\xa6 He\xe2\x80\x99s really taken aback by that. He wants to bottle that.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And to run would, probably, be to give that up for good.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWouldn\xe2\x80\x99t it be truly pathetic if on his third time he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t even win the nomination?\xe2\x80\x9d asked the former aide. \xe2\x80\x9cThen he does have the \xe2\x80\x98L\xe2\x80\x99 and he\xe2\x80\x99s truly truly a diminished figure.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI think he personally has thought that through more than the people who are pushing him to run.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The "Totally Ridiculous" Romney Boomlet', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: A Right-Wing Truck Dispatcher Is America‰Ûªs Fairest New Election Night VoteåÊCounter
Description: ['The networks and one news wire used to control how and when Americans learned who won on election night \xe2\x80\x94 not anymore these days.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cI want to fundamentally change how results are reported.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'There was really no reason to think that the \xe2\x80\x9cAce of Spades HQ Decision Desk\xe2\x80\x9d would be a hopeful sign for American democracy in 2014.', 'The Decision Desk swings into action on primary election nights, with Brandon Finnigan, a burly 29-year-old, nailed to a busted black leather armchair at one of those cheap beige aluminum desks, halfhearted fake wood top, toward the back of a low-slung house at a truck stop crossroads deep in California\xe2\x80\x99s monotonous Inland Empire. Dripping sweat every day since the air conditioner broke, Finnigan is the sole employee of a small truck dispatching company where he pulls the noon-to-midnight shift. He manages the dispatching job on one computer monitor. Finnigan\xe2\x80\x99s second monitor, however, is for election results.', 'Between calls from drivers broken down in San Diego, and between visits from men there to drop off paperwork, he tracks election results for', 'a conservative blog run by an anonymous, combative figure known only as Ace. Ace and his site\xe2\x80\x99s mission has not, historically, been the sort of thing David Brooks gets excited about. The blog\xe2\x80\x99s motto is, \xe2\x80\x9cEvery normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit upon his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.\xe2\x80\x9d Its founder\xe2\x80\x99s scabrous', 'has at times given offense: \xe2\x80\x9cPlease don\xe2\x80\x99t call Sandra Fluke a slut,\xe2\x80\x9d he', '(and later deleted) of the abortion rights advocate and liberal icon . \xe2\x80\x9cRespect her for what she is, a shiftless rent-a-cooch from East Whoreville.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And yet, politics is always surprising, and the eternal Washington consensus \xe2\x80\x94 that anything that\xe2\x80\x99s good for democracy must come from the center \xe2\x80\x94 has not been borne out here.', 'Finnigan \xe2\x80\x94 along with his dozens of volunteer Google spreadsheet jockeys \xe2\x80\x94 is the most ambitious face of a major and democratizing shift in the way Americans learn about the results of the most important elections in the country.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI want to fundamentally change how results are reported,\xe2\x80\x9d Finnigan told BuzzFeed News. His goal is both to modernize the local election boards and to deflate what he sees as false drama imposed by slow Associated Press calls and desperate television commentators. \xe2\x80\x9cI understand you need an element of suspense and you need something to jibber-jabber about on election night. But you got to jibber-jabber all year. I just want the results.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Until about 2011, the way Americans received their information \xe2\x80\x94 who won, who lost \xe2\x80\x94 was dominated by the television networks. Their theatrical presentation and deliberate mystification turned their \xe2\x80\x9canalysts\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 smart, numerate political hands with years of election experience \xe2\x80\x94 into a kind of political priesthood whose calls, particularly in the disputed 2000 election, were alleged to have shaped the outcome of a close race. Virtually all other contests were \xe2\x80\x9ccalled\xe2\x80\x9d by only one entity: the AP. The news wire neither rushes nor explains its decisions, which have been turned into a different kind of mysterious black box in part because it is bound contractually to share its results first with the news organizations who pay for those decisions. The AP essentially controlled when Americans learned who won an election.', 'But something significant has changed in the last few years: The geeky new obsession with political data. It really started with liberal bloggers who took polling seriously, and with the nerd king Nate Silver, who made his name reassuring Democrats that Barack Obama was, still, winning.', 'The conversation has moved from polling to the polls. The people counting the actual votes \xe2\x80\x94 county officials across the United States \xe2\x80\x94 have started putting precinct-by-precinct tallies online. Now that same data that only the AP could access, anyone can access. And so a group of a couple dozen devoted journalists and partisans assemble on Twitter on Tuesday nights through the summer and fall to watch election returns, county by county, pop up on the websites of registrars and clerks. They parse the results as they come in, they argue over what they mean, and sometimes they catch the sort of substantial errors \xe2\x80\x94 transposed digits, or uncounted ballots \xe2\x80\x94 that happen occasionally in preliminary election counts. They typically reach a consensus about who will win long before the AP has made its once-definitive call, based on the same factors the AP looks at \xe2\x80\x94 the likelihood that the candidate who trails in the vote can close the gap with the outstanding votes, given both statistics and the voting history of the precincts waiting to be counted.', 'Now Finnigan and his ragtag Decision Desk have taken that transformation a step further. His volunteers, unlike the rest of amateur and professional media alike, don\xe2\x80\x99t just rely on published figures and AP tallies. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also begun to replicate the AP\xe2\x80\x99s vast information-gathering network at the clerks\xe2\x80\x99 offices that don\xe2\x80\x99t report data swiftly online, organizing a cadre of what\xe2\x80\x99s now 130 volunteers to collect results directly from local officials. It\xe2\x80\x99s the next logical step for the small fraternity of election-night analysts, doing in public what the large media institutions have typically done in the dark. And while they have a tiny fraction of the AP\xe2\x80\x99s roughly 5,000 local reporters gathering results, they naturally focus on the relative handful of races of national interest, and have become central to a political conversation that has been for years now shaped on Twitter. Their slick website, built by a volunteer developer and blogger named John Ekdahl to aggregate both polling and election results,', 'this week.', 'The volunteer election callers have caught major errors, including thousands of uncounted votes in Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s Fairfax County last year. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also hashed out bitterly partisan controversies in remarkably objective terms. And perhaps most importantly, they\xe2\x80\x99ve punctured the mystery around the mechanics of democracy and produced flashes of consensus in a country whose partisans often seem to occupy different realities, and whose media have never been less trusted.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThose of us in the amateur election projection world on election night are using our familiarity with the nooks and crannies of geography to beat the AP to the punch. The AP\xe2\x80\x99s job is to be cautious, but most of the time these elections can be called well before the AP does,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dave Wasserman, an editor at the', 'who tweets from @redistrict (and caught the Fairfax County error), but laments that he has to be absent from Twitter for big election nights \xe2\x80\x94 because he\xe2\x80\x99s under contract to NBC.', 'AP\xe2\x80\x99s Washington bureau chief, Sally Buzbee, said she welcomes the Twitter conversation.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAnything that helps people understand how elections happen and the process and of democracy is terrific. Transparency is wonderful,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, adding that participating in the Twitter conversation would distract analysts from their jobs and undermine the organization\xe2\x80\x99s core mission. \xe2\x80\x9cEverybody in AP is comfortable that we don\xe2\x80\x99t break news on Twitter \xe2\x80\x94 we break news by giving our stuff to news organizations.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But the participants in the new, live results conversation see the AP as a stodgy monopolist, ripe for disruption.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhat', 'is doing is really great because it\xe2\x80\x99s so transparent \xe2\x80\x94 and because the AP needs competition,\xe2\x80\x9d said David Nir, the political director of the venerable liberal site', 'and often the man running @DKElections, another of the core election night feeds. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat the AP does is very opaque and nobody knows what goes on behind the wizard\xe2\x80\x99s curtain.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'From behind his Fontana desk, Finnigan shares the bipartisan goodwill.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhen you\xe2\x80\x99re dealing with people who really love elections, like we do and they do, partisanship doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really matter \xe2\x80\x94 you want to report what\xe2\x80\x99s going on,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', '', 'Finnigan traces his start as an unofficial election junkie to 2004. He was an art major at McDaniel College outside Baltimore, a little stoned, watching the results come in \xe2\x80\x94 and frustrated as theatrical network anchors \xe2\x80\x9ckept holding back\xe2\x80\x9d on declaring George W. Bush the victor.', '\xe2\x80\x9cOnce I heard the number of absentees, I was like \xe2\x80\x94 there\xe2\x80\x99s no reason for [John Kerry] to not concede, he\xe2\x80\x99s not going to win,\xe2\x80\x9d Finnigan recalled.', 'In 2006, he followed his girlfriend to California for the summer, then decided to stay, landed the truck dispatching job, and dropped out of school. The job gave him ample time to become more politically engaged online, moving to the right from his undergraduate libertarianism to hold strong views not just on lower taxation and less government but also strong opposition to abortion. He\xe2\x80\x99s also \xe2\x80\x9cextremely libertarian\xe2\x80\x9d on drugs and LGBT rights. He found a home on', ', a blog devoted in part to heated combat with the liberal and mainstream media. Its founder\xe2\x80\x99s sheer obsessive energy has at times put the site in the center of the national conversation, as when Ace (who didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond to a request for his real name, which Finnigan also doesn\xe2\x80\x99t know) caught a strange, quickly deleted tweet by Rep. Anthony Weiner and helped start the chain of events that led to his resignation.', 'Finnigan started commenting there and emailing Ace in 2007; the founder soon asked him to blog, and he provided obsessive electoral coverage, along with longer apolitical diversions \xe2\x80\x94 a piece on', ', and a', 'to his other hobby, astronomy.', 'Finnigan, working weeknights alone in the Fontana office, started the informal \xe2\x80\x9cAce of Spades Headquarters Decision Desk\xe2\x80\x9d in 2012, with only the vague approval of Ace. Then, he and a small handful of volunteers began tracking publicly available results of the hottest elections in a Google Doc. They gradually grew more numerous and sophisticated, and this February Finnigan emerged as a major figure in that small, influential Twitter conversation as @AOSHQDD. This summer, his team began to really take on the AP at its own game: not just projecting elections based on public results, but also calling county offices directly to feed the tallies into a spreadsheet.', 'What followed was an inspiring spectacle: Students, stay-at-home moms, retirees, people battling with cancer and looking for a distraction \xe2\x80\x94 a range of members of Ace\xe2\x80\x99s conservative community \xe2\x80\x94 dove in. There were a dozen volunteers, then 30; now some 130 are \xe2\x80\x9cself-assembling\xe2\x80\x9d for this November.', 'One of those volunteers is Carol Tarasewicz, who is home from her longtime job as controller for a real estate management company with neck pain, \xe2\x80\x9cliving on painkillers,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. She\xe2\x80\x99d been listening to the conservative talker Mark Levin, and talked Finnigan into letting her monitor Levin\xe2\x80\x99s hobbyhorse, House Majority Leader Eric Cantor\xe2\x80\x99s widely ignored primary. She tracked the county-by-county results obsessively, and frantically emailed Finnigan when Chesterfield County went for his rival, David Brat.', 'At 6:31 p.m.,', 'the race for Brat. AP followed about half an hour later.', 'And what did Tarasewicz get out of the evening\xe2\x80\x99s work? The thrill, and the distraction.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s fun \xe2\x80\x94 that was the most exciting night of my life since Scott Brown won in Massachusetts,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.', '', 'The amateurs are still a long way from replacing AP. One major difference is the scale: The AP calls state legislative contests in 50 states, county, and city races in some places, for an expected total of more than 5,000 this year.', 'Another is the philosophy. The AP believes, for instance, that it has a public trust not to issue its magical call on major races in situations where that could prevent people from turning out for still-competitive down-ballot ones. So this August in Hawaii, where voting was delayed in two storm-damaged precincts for a week, the AP waited a week before calling the Democratic senatorial primary \xe2\x80\x94 despite the fact that results from the other precincts made the result a foregone conclusion.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe don\xe2\x80\x99t want to do anything that suppresses voter turnout,\xe2\x80\x9d said Buzbee.', 'For Finnigan, who had made the call on election night, calling was a matter of simple math, and of transparency with what was, after all, public data: \xe2\x80\x9cThere was absolutely no way those districts were going to overturn [Brian] Schatz\xe2\x80\x99s lead,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'In the radical transparency of Twitter and the web, there\xe2\x80\x99s also less of a trade-off between speed and accuracy than the AP has. Your readers see the same data you do. If you get it wrong, they see where you\xe2\x80\x99re coming from, and you can correct. And neither Finnegan nor the AP executives pretend there\xe2\x80\x99s more than intelligent analysis, memory, and judgment to figuring out whether a race is really done. Finnigan has, this year, gotten 47 out of 48 right. (The AP got just six of 4,653 calls wrong in 2012, Buzbee.)', 'If 2004 spurred Finnigan\xe2\x80\x99s frustration with the mainstream media mystification, it was 2012 that brought home to him the value to his own movement of aggressive, accurate election results. In the waning days of the 2012 election, many conservatives simply refused to believe public polling suggesting President Obama would easily win reelection. Instead, they resorted to amateur \xe2\x80\x9cunskewing\xe2\x80\x9d of the polls \xe2\x80\x94 removing Democrats from their samples. The plan seemed reasonable; it turned into an embarrassing debacle, evidence to conservatives and their enemies alike of a dangerous detachment from reality that crystallized when Karl Rove, late into the defeat, tried to persuade Fox News not to accept its own analysts\xe2\x80\x99 call.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI wanted to punch my TV set when Rove said \xe2\x80\x98no,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d said Finnigan. \xe2\x80\x9cWe knew Florida was doomed about an hour in, and here\xe2\x80\x99s a guy who\xe2\x80\x99s a supposed expert \xe2\x80\xa6 That whole mentality of not trusting things and being distrustful of the numbers \xe2\x80\x94 no, the polls are what they are, accept that.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'American elections have always been, in close races, frighteningly contingent. The machines are rusty, the volunteers are clueless, the voters get confused. And some of what has undermined recent confidence in the machinery of democracy is substantive and irresolvable disputes over voting practices: Did an early call in 2000 send Republicans in the Florida panhandle home? How many Kerry voters were dissuaded by the long lines in Cleveland?', 'But that lack of confidence also at times misunderstands a system\xe2\x80\x99s piecemeal fragility and makes it hard to manipulate on a large scale. And Twitter has played a surprisingly powerful role in nipping what could have easily become perennial conspiracy theories in the bud. This was never clearer than in a high-profile Wisconsin judicial race in 2011, where the Republican clerk of Waukesha County discovered \xe2\x80\x9cmissing\xe2\x80\x9d votes that added 8,000 to the Republican candidate\xe2\x80\x99s margin \xe2\x80\x94 something that liberals and conservatives on Twitter argued about, and then agreed on.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know any serious analyst who thinks that election was stolen,\xe2\x80\x9d said', '\xe2\x80\x99 Nir.', 'This, too, is a shared partisan interest \xe2\x80\x94 there may be few matters of broad national consensus left, but the importance of trustworthy elections is one.', 'The deep motives that draw', 'and', 'together, though, remain partisan. Partisans don\xe2\x80\x99t just want to enjoy the drama. They want to win. Nir got his start running the', ', a blog whose aim was in part to demystify polling results and tell liberal', 'readers where to volunteer and where to donate.', 'founder Markos Moulitsas recalled in an email that in his first year blogging, 2002, he got carried away by wishful thinking of a Democratic sweep \xe2\x80\x94 and vowed, after that, to maintain a \xe2\x80\x9cslavish devotion to data.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe want to win. Not spin. Win. And in order to do that, you have to look at the real facts, not what you want to happen,\xe2\x80\x9d said', 'Executive Editor Susan Gardner in an email. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd I would guess that\xe2\x80\x99s why Ace of Spaces, on the other side of the aisle, is better than \xe2\x80\x98objective\xe2\x80\x99 news sources.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Finnigan\xe2\x80\x99s host, Ace, is less philosophical about the matter. He takes an anarchist approach to his own site, and so Finnigan thanked him, at the time of the relaunch, for \xe2\x80\x9cour total indifference and utter lack of influence, encouragement, or inspiration.\xe2\x80\x9d Ace responded with the headline, \xe2\x80\x9cLocal Moron Makes Good.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Ace said in an email that he had paid little attention to the machine Finnigan was building and tuning, until the night of June 10, when he was having dinner with a friend, who looked up from his phone to report that Cantor had lost. Ace didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe it.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIs that confirmed? Is that from a real source?\xe2\x80\x9d he asked.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s from your site,\xe2\x80\x9d the friend replied.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI was a bit worried, wondering if [Finnigan] had gotten too far ahead of the numbers,\xe2\x80\x9d Ace recalled. \xe2\x80\x9cBut as the numbers came in, of course, they confirmed his call.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', "A Right-Wing Truck Dispatcher Is America's Fairest New Election Night Vote Counter", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The Tech Industry‰Ûªs Newest Acquisition: AmericanåÊPolitics
Description: ['A hiring spree, and a head of steam.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'The relationship is \xe2\x80\x9cradically changing.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Silicon Valley is hiring up all the political people.', 'Uber last month brought on David Plouffe, who made his name running Barack Obama\xe2\x80\x99s 2008 campaign. Snapchat this week hired Jill Hazelbaker, a top aide to Sen. John McCain\xe2\x80\x99s rival campaign. And Spotify will announce today that it has tapped Jonathan Prince, a former aide to both Clintons who is also close to the Obama White House, as its global head of communications and public policy, Prince confirmed to BuzzFeed News.', 'This hiring spree \xe2\x80\x94 and those are only the highest-profile, most recent additions to a list of tech executives that also includes topmost Democrats like Facebook\xe2\x80\x99s Sheryl Sandberg and Microsoft\xe2\x80\x99s Mark Penn \xe2\x80\x94 is part of what finally feels like a consummation of the long, awkward relationship between Silicon Valley and American politics.', 'Tech has been, from the puzzled perspective of Washington\xe2\x80\x99s political class, always arriving, never quite there. Its sheer wealth, enormous economic vitality, and immense cultural force should have brought massive clout. But tech companies instead have a reputation for throwing the most lavish parties at political conventions \xe2\x80\x94 and then getting smoked in the back room by old-line cable and telecoms companies. The energy behind a real populist uprising, \xe2\x80\x9cStop SOPA,\xe2\x80\x9d never quite forms into a permanent interest. The industry\xe2\x80\x99s highest policy priorities \xe2\x80\x94 hiring more foreign engineers, for instance \xe2\x80\x94 don\xe2\x80\x99t make it into law.', 'A new generation of tech companies, however, have made Silicon Valley\xe2\x80\x99s political needs less theoretical, and more immediate. They are taking on pre-existing, real-world industries. (The purely virtual ideas \xe2\x80\x94 search, portals, email \xe2\x80\x94 have been taken.) It\xe2\x80\x99s harder to ignore politics when you\xe2\x80\x99re changing the world, not just the web. And so these companies \xe2\x80\x94 Uber and Airbnb are the most obvious \xe2\x80\x94 have found a sweet spot where founders\xe2\x80\x99 disdain for politics and regulators meets the smartest political strategy money can buy.', 'The relationship between tech and politics is \xe2\x80\x9cradically changing,\xe2\x80\x9d said Ace Smith, a San Francisco political consultant whose clients have included the biggest names in both Democratic politics and technology. The startups jangling transportation, housing, and an array of other consumer areas have \xe2\x80\x9copened the tech world\xe2\x80\x99s eyes to needing a broader perspective, and it\xe2\x80\x99s opened every one else\xe2\x80\x99s eyes \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s really brought them much more into the world of politics and government and communications.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Indeed, 2014 feels like the end of one era and the beginning of another.', 'A generation ago in Silicon Valley, \xe2\x80\x9cyou didn\xe2\x80\x99t even think about government until you were a public company \xe2\x80\x94 and even then it was a culture of avoidance,\xe2\x80\x9d said Matt Mahan, who has worked for a decade at the intersection of politics and tech and now runs Brigade, a startup aimed at reforming U.S. politics. The next step for Silicon Valley has been, at times, a relatively naive engagement, and a sense that the language, speed, and opportunism of technology trends could be applied to the sclerotic field of American politics. The last entrant in that category will, perhaps, be FWD.us, a group that aimed to bring Silicon Valley money and sophistication to the immigration fight, got tangled over its own feet, and wound up', 'its president last week.', 'Now Uber, in particular, is winning more fights than it\xe2\x80\x99s losing in an endless series of tussles with local regulators. The same is true for Airbnb, whose spokesman, Nick Pappas, had previously been selling Obamacare from the West Wing press office. (Two other former top Democratic staffers also work there.) These companies carry the confidence (at times, arrogance) and sense of destiny that has driven Silicon Valley\xe2\x80\x99s burst of innovation; they also are being shaped by urgent battles with regulators of the sort that Microsoft, for instance, didn\xe2\x80\x99t quite see coming (on a far larger scale) until the Department of Justice', '. They are showing a new willingness to compromise the purism that sometimes made tech companies leery of dirtying themselves up in Washington.', 'There\xe2\x80\x99s no single factor driving the accelerating convergence between tech and politics, but rather four or five. Along with the new kind of company, there\xe2\x80\x99s the sheer wealth now accumulated in the Valley, as a wave of acquisitions and IPOs make young, mostly Democratic millionaires and billionaires (along with the occasional libertarian like Peter Thiel \xe2\x80\x94 and Rand Paul did recently announce he\xe2\x80\x99s setting up a San Francisco office): \xe2\x80\x9cThe Bay Area has emerged as the prime ATM\xe2\x80\x9d for the Democratic Party, said Chris Lehane, a top Democratic strategist based in California. There\xe2\x80\x99s also the old-fashioned lobbying muscle \xe2\x80\x94 a combination of powerful branding and clever tactics \xe2\x80\x94 that some firms have deployed to protect their interests; a company less dextrous than Apple might have been crushed by regulators and the public for avoiding U.S. taxes with complex accounting and overseas subsidiaries.', 'A fourth factor is that the kind of marketing companies now need mirrors campaign skills. The breakneck construction of a new brand, the risk and opportunity in being defined fast and early on a national scale, the centrality of media to marketing are all shared between presidential campaigns and the hottest startups. Snapchat, for instance, has emerged as one of the main ways young Americans communicate \xe2\x80\x94 but also had to fight the early perception that it\xe2\x80\x99s basically a sexting tool. Spotify will have to navigate a regulatory regime shaped by record labels, and a communications campaign now as much about facing off with Apple and Google as with Rdio and Pandora.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s a symmetry between the disruptive nature of communications in government and politics, and the disruptive nature of the companies that are coming to dominate Silicon Valley,\xe2\x80\x9d said Joe Lockhart, a former Clinton White House press secretary who later worked for Facebook, and who added that reporters constantly ask him about the convergence between tech and politics, a story he used to think was overblown.', '\xe2\x80\x9cNow I think the time has actually arrived,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'Tech\xe2\x80\x99s cultural cachet, meanwhile, is luring operatives who might make the same or more money as lobbyists or working for old-line trade groups. \xe2\x80\x9cThe companies that everyone is interested in going to work for are all internet companies,\xe2\x80\x9d said Michael Beckerman, who heads the Internet Association, a trade group that includes many top Silicon Valley firms.', 'The convergence between tech and politics has taken in more Democrats than Republicans, for reasons as much generational and cultural as ideological. Plouffe pointed, in an email to BuzzFeed News, to the top tech talent that worked on both Obama campaigns, on the rescue of Healthcare.gov, and other projects. Tech\xe2\x80\x99s generally progressive stands on social issues are a good fit with Democrats. But its individualistic economic values have already started to reshape a Democratic Party operative class that used to find off-cycle work with labor unions.', 'And alongside that convergence there is another aspiration in tech, a reformist impulse. It has fueled a few successful projects \xe2\x80\x94 websites like OpenSecrets and Fundrace that put campaign donations online \xe2\x80\x94 and many more less successful attempts to engage citizens in writing legislation, for instance. A new wave of those are being born too, led by Brigade and by Crowdpac.com, among others. They are, as the cliche goes, Uber but for engagement; they assume (naively, to many in politics) that citizens would like to contribute money, time, and influence to public life but don\xe2\x80\x99t have good enough tools. But politics is usually moved by candidates and causes, and they are building powerful tools for the next Barack Obama.', 'All in all, the sense among the political class that tech can\xe2\x80\x99t quite figure out politics, and that it perpetually punches below its weight, seems finally to be ending. The structure of power in U.S. politics, indeed, seems on the cusp of a real shift, one that will be played out in the arena where politics always reshapes itself, the coming national presidential campaign. And there remains so much space for dramatic change. Any given telco still has more lawyers and lobbyists working on the Federal Communications Commission than all the tech companies combined, Beckerman said. And Silicon Valley has a lot of upside.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99re still punching below their weight,\xe2\x80\x9d reflected a top former Obama aide who now consults tech companies. \xe2\x80\x9cI mean \xe2\x80\x94 who\xe2\x80\x99s got cultural capital in next 50 years? Comcast? Or Google, Facebook, Twitter? Really, it\xe2\x80\x99s bananas that Comcast still gets away with what it gets away with.\xe2\x80\x9d', "The Tech Industry's Newest Acquisition: American Politics", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: This Is How The Clinton CampaignåÊBegins
Description: ['Actually, it\xe2\x80\x99s been going on for years.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Let\xe2\x80\x99s just get this out of the way now: She\xe2\x80\x99s running.', 'Hillary Clinton, who will be spending Sunday at an Iowa greasefest, has not announced her second candidacy for president. She hasn\xe2\x80\x99t, in fact, done much since she left Foggy Bottom; she hasn\xe2\x80\x99t done much politics since the Summer of 2008. And so the obsessive observers of her career and of American presidential politics have not had an occasion to declare the obvious. After all, what has changed, other than the passage of time?', 'But asking what has changed is not quite the right question to ask of a Clinton campaign. That\xe2\x80\x99s because campaigning has been the Clintons\xe2\x80\x99 default mode since at least the late 1980s. And their campaign by now is not the typical, tiny pre-campaign organization of a married couple and a couple of trusted advisers. It is a vast apparatus of relationships and obligations, promises and chits, that has been moving steadily forward. It began when she stood on a stage with her old rival Barack Obama in a place called Unity, New Hampshire, in June of 2008, and swore her allegiance to the Democratic nominee and, less noticeably, to her own ability to fight another day. This is a road that leads straight to this weekend\xe2\x80\x99s stop, Senator Tom Harkin\xe2\x80\x99s famous steak fry.', 'This isn\xe2\x80\x99t the first time a Clinton campaign began with this steady march from inaction to inevitability. In fact, I wrote the same words that top this column 10 years ago, about the same woman. Then I was a local politics reporter and got a bit of mileage out of a', 'piece in a genre I\xe2\x80\x99ve always liked: stating the obvious, forcefully.', 'It was outrageously premature, but even then I\xe2\x80\x99d been covering the junior senator from New York long enough to have the clear sense that this wasn\xe2\x80\x99t exactly about covering one woman\xe2\x80\x99s decision, more about an apparatus that, switched on, was chugging away.', 'Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton has a re-election campaign in front of her in 2006, but as far as many around her are concerned, the train has already departed for a destination two years farther out-the Presidency.', '\xe2\x80\x9cShe is going to focus on going for Senate and getting that out of the way, but the eye is always on the prize,\xe2\x80\x9d a former aide to Mrs. Clinton told', '.', 'I reached back out this month to the usual suspects I quoted in that piece \xe2\x80\x94 organizer Harold Ickes, a couple anonymice, and strategist Howard Wolfson to ask if I should write it again. \xe2\x80\x9cSeems reasonable,\xe2\x80\x9d replied Wolfson, who now works for Mike Bloomberg. (That was an improvement on his 2004 reply: \xe2\x80\x9cYou can say, \xe2\x80\x98Wolfson would not discuss \xe2\x80\x9808.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d)', 'Today\xe2\x80\x99s Clinton campaign, like the one back then, is a tractor trailer moving down the highway, one whose driver \xe2\x80\x94 Hillary \xe2\x80\x94 can exert some control over its direction and speed, but whose stopping distance is measured in miles, and who can barely control the thing at all once it\xe2\x80\x99s rolling downhill.', 'So the question isn\xe2\x80\x99t what she\xe2\x80\x99s done to run; it\xe2\x80\x99s whether she\xe2\x80\x99s made any effort to hit the brakes, or whether anything has fallen unexpectedly across her path. Since leaving the State Department last February, Clinton has focused primarily on making money. She\xe2\x80\x99s on the speaking circuit, which while occasionally embarrassing is obviously a much cleaner and less compromising way to cash in than the rainmaking roles \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cadvising,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cconsulting,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9clobbying\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 where non-celebrity politicians make their bread. She\xe2\x80\x99s written an innocuous book, come out on the correct side of various major issues \xe2\x80\x94 from Syria to Ferguson \xe2\x80\x94 once the dust had settled and the politics were clear; and rested up a bit. Her husband has been uncharacteristically low-profile, her daughter has left a job that threatened to become an embarrassing instance of patronage.', 'Clinton hasn\xe2\x80\x99t done anything much, that is. Certainly nothing even the most obsessive readers of tea leaves would interpret as a decisive move.', 'But then that is the weird thing about the Clinton campaign. The campaign is the default. The tractor trailer has now proceeded rather far down the highway. It\xe2\x80\x99s moving at a constant speed, not doing anything much to attract attention. But all the exits have passed, and all that\xe2\x80\x99s left are those runaway truck ramps, not the sort of place Clintons historically wind up.', 'This Is How The Clinton Campaign Begins', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Michigan Agrees That Supreme Court Should Take Same-Sex MarriageåÊCase
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cGiven the importance of the issue \xe2\x80\xa6 Michigan does not oppose review by\xe2\x80\x9d the Supreme Court.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'State asks justices to uphold constitutionality of Michigan\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Lawyers for Michigan on Monday asked the Supreme Court to hear an appeal of the case challenging the state\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages.', 'This, even though the state was successful in its appeal to the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals, where a three-judge panel', 'earlier this month that the ban is constitutional.', 'On Monday, the state said that the court should take the case, \xe2\x80\x9c[g]iven the importance of the issue,\xe2\x80\x9d and affirm \xe2\x80\x94 or agree with \xe2\x80\x94 the 6th Circuit opinion upholding the ban.', 'The certiorari petition', 'the Supreme Court to review and reverse the 6th Circuit decision was filed a week earlier by the attorneys for the same-sex couple that had sued the state.', '\xe2\x80\x9cOnly this Court can resolve these deep conflicts among the circuits,\xe2\x80\x9d Michigan Attorney General Bill Schuette and Solicitor General Aaron Lindstrom wrote for the state in Monday\xe2\x80\x99s filing. \xe2\x80\x9cCertiorari is warranted.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Here is how the Michigan attorney general presents the issue the state wants to see resolved:', 'The main issue, the state says, is the question of \xe2\x80\x9cwho decides\xe2\x80\x9d important issues:', 'The different reasoning used by different circuits hearing marriage appeals, as well as the 6th Circuit decision upholding the marriage bans, create \xe2\x80\x9cdeep conflicts\xe2\x80\x9d that should lead the Supreme Court to step in:', 'The Michigan attorney general presses the argument that the marriage question should be left to the \xe2\x80\x9cdemocratic political system\xe2\x80\x9d:', 'Read', ':', 'Michigan Agrees That Supreme Court Should Take Same-Sex Marriage Case', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: NOM Loses, Again, In Appeal Trying To Intervene In Oregon‰Ûªs MarriageåÊCase
Description: ['The National Organization for Marriage is still fighting a marriage case that, for most people, ended more than six months ago.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The National Organization for Marriage\xe2\x80\x99s long-shot request to intervene in the case over Oregon\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ban \xe2\x80\x94 which has been rejected twice previously \xe2\x80\x94 was rejected by the full 9th Circuit Court of Appeals on Monday.', 'The ruling comes in a side-issue that has been pending, even as same-sex couples have been marrying in the state for more than six months \xe2\x80\x94 ever since a federal court judge', 'Oregon\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages as unconstitutional on May 19.', 'NOM, which sought unsuccessfully to intervene in the', 'challenging the ban, had then appealed the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s intervention denial to the 9th Circuit. After a three-judge panel of the 9th Circuit rejected NOM\xe2\x80\x99s appeal, the group, in early September, asked the full 9th Circuit to reconsider its appeal.', 'In light of the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s decision to dismiss the appeal of the proponents of California\xe2\x80\x99s Proposition 8 because it held that the proponents did not have standing to bring an appeal when state officials chose not to do so, NOM \xe2\x80\x94 with an even less clear interest in protecting Oregon\xe2\x80\x99s law than the Prop 8 proponents had in California \xe2\x80\x94 was seen as mounting an exceptionally uphill battle.', 'There had been no public word from the 9th Circuit on NOM\xe2\x80\x99s request until Monday, when the court announced that no judges on the 9th Circuit requested a vote on whether to reconsider NOM\xe2\x80\x99s appeal. As such, the court held, \xe2\x80\x9c[T]he National Organization for Marriage\xe2\x80\x99s petition for rehearing en banc is denied.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'NOM could file a petition for certiorari with the Supreme Court, asking the justices to take on their case.', 'NOM had previously, despite being denied intervention in the Oregon case,', 'to take the issue to the Supreme Court, when it asked the justices to stop same-sex couples from marrying in the state while the issue of its intervention denial could be resolved. In June, the Supreme Court', 'that stay request with no explanation.', "NOM Loses, Again, In Appeal Trying To Intervene In Oregon's Marriage Case", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Louisiana Same-Sex Couples Ask Supreme Court To Hear Their MarriageåÊCase
Description: ['A fifth petition asks the justices to resolve questions about same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'The Louisiana request comes before the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals has weighed in on the case.', '', 'NEW YORK CITY \xe2\x80\x94 In addition to the four sets of plaintiffs who filed', 'with the Supreme Court in the past week, asking the justices to take up a case addressing same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights, a fifth case \xe2\x80\x94 this one out of Louisiana \xe2\x80\x94 has now found its way up to the high court.', 'Plaintiffs in the case challenging Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages on Thursday filed a request at the Supreme Court seeking review of their case \xe2\x80\x94 before the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals has done so. Kenneth Upton, with Lambda Legal, is the lead counsel on the filing to the justices.', 'The 5th Circuit tentatively scheduled arguments in marriage cases out of Louisiana, where the district court judge upheld the ban, and Texas, where the district court judge struck down the ban, for appellate arguments in the beginning of January.', 'Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s request, a petition for a writ of certiorari before judgment, is a rare procedural move that parties can take to try to bypass the appeals court and get immediate review by the Supreme Court. Multiple parties to litigation challenging the Defense of Marriage Act filed such petitions in 2012 as the issue made its way up to the justices.', 'Read', ':', 'Louisiana Same-Sex Couples Ask Supreme Court To Hear Their Marriage Case', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Marriage Equality Comes To Montana, Federal JudgeåÊRules
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cThis injunction shall take effect immediately.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'A federal judge struck down Montana\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages on Wednesday afternoon, days after canceling a hearing previously scheduled in the case.', 'The order stopping state officials from enforcing the ban takes effect immediately, meaning same-sex couples can apply immediately for marriage licenses there.', 'Montana is the last state within the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals in which same-sex couples can marry, fallout from an October decision by the appeals court holding Nevada and Idaho\xe2\x80\x99s marriage bans unconstitutional. Since then, Arizona and Alaska bans have also been struck down.', 'Read', ':', 'Marriage Equality Comes To Montana, Federal Judge Rules', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great!
