Title: Kamala Harris Charts Her Path As A Progressive Prosecutor
Description: ['The California attorney general is a rising national Democratic star.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'For now, though, Kamala Harris would rather talk about the evolution of Fourth Amendment law than D.C. political news.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 California Attorney General Kamala Harris wants people to stop saying \xe2\x80\x9crevenge porn.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'The term \xe2\x80\x94 often used when an ex spreads nude photos or video after a breakup \xe2\x80\x94 totally gets it wrong, Harris says. She argues the word \xe2\x80\x9crevenge\xe2\x80\x9d suggests that someone is justified in sharing a consensual photo, and the word \xe2\x80\x9cporn\xe2\x80\x9d suggests the victim did something morally wrong.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe have unfortunately a history around criminal justice policy on crimes against women and children of \xe2\x80\x94 especially when it involves sex \xe2\x80\x94 blaming the victim, frankly,\xe2\x80\x9d she told BuzzFeed News on Monday in a wide-ranging interview in the second-floor lounge at the Mayflower Hotel.', '', 'This is something done with \xe2\x80\x9cthe intent and certainly the effect of, at the very least, embarrassing her \xe2\x80\x94 but subordinating her in so many ways and really violating not only her privacy but her dignity.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Harris is not having it.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cSo we are changing the name, and calling it cyber exploitation,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cWhich in fact is what\xe2\x80\x99s at play.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Harris is one of the Democratic Party\xe2\x80\x99s rising stars \xe2\x80\x94 a charismatic attorney general in the country\xe2\x80\x99s biggest state. She\xe2\x80\x99s the state\xe2\x80\x99s first black attorney general; she\xe2\x80\x99s the state\xe2\x80\x99s first Asian-American attorney general; she\xe2\x80\x99s the first woman to hold the position. She was considered a strong prospect to succeed Attorney General Eric Holder, and she\xe2\x80\x99s certainly considered a strong prospect in California\xe2\x80\x99s state politics, where both senators and the governor are reaching the end of their careers.', 'She is a career prosecutor, a \xe2\x80\x9cvery conscious decision\xe2\x80\x9d she made out of law school, who sometimes clashes with other elements of the party of progressives \xe2\x80\x94 even as her stature within the party rises.', 'Despite all of that, Harris doesn\xe2\x80\x99t talk like most strong prospects for national office.', '', 'She\xe2\x80\x99s not especially attuned to the D.C. news cycle, for one. She favors substantive, legal-process-heavy answers on topics ranging from the situation in Ferguson to a recent Supreme Court case in which her office argued unsuccessfully against requiring police to obtain a search warrant to examine the contents of an arrested person\xe2\x80\x99s cell phone. She goes into great detail when discussing her self-described \xe2\x80\x9csmart on crime\xe2\x80\x9d approach to the job \xe2\x80\x94 an attempt to find balance between her roles as prosecutor and partisan.', 'She also can be disarmingly candid \xe2\x80\x94 at one point, while talking about cyber sex crimes she noted that, \xe2\x80\x9csince the beginning of time, people would all agree, the camera was created to take a photograph of the naked human body.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'She spoke Wednesday at the Center for American Progress\xe2\x80\x99 Making Progress Policy Conference, featuring a number of top progressives \xe2\x80\x94 Sen. Elizabeth Warren, New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, and Housing and Urban Development Secretary Julian Castro.', '', 'The gathering is taking place as another Democrat, Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon, faces national scrutiny over his handling of the fatal shooting of Michael Brown and the impending grand jury decision whether to indict the man who shot him, police officer Darren Wilson.', '', 'Harris is among those watching the situation play out \xe2\x80\x94 saying that she is \xe2\x80\x9ctroubled\xe2\x80\x9d by what\xe2\x80\x99s been happening there \xe2\x80\x94 but quickly broadened the discussion beyond Ferguson.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cIf there\xe2\x80\x99s a distrust of law enforcement \xe2\x80\x94 and, by extension, government \xe2\x80\x94 all of the systems break down, at least for certain populations,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cWhen I charge a case \xe2\x80\xa6 it\xe2\x80\x99s in the name of the people and the premise there is that a crime against any of us is a crime against all of us. If there are specific communities that are not receiving the full benefit of the protections we created, it\xe2\x80\x99s a problem for all of us.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Asked about the history of distrust between the black community and law enforcement, Harris said, \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s all of our responsibilities to acknowledge it and deal with it where it occurs. And it\xe2\x80\x99s not just because it\xe2\x80\x99s the morally right thing to do, I believe it\xe2\x80\x99s in the best interest of public safety for everyone.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'She pointed to training and hiring as the most important counters to tensions between the black community and police \xe2\x80\x94 and between the police and other groups in especially diverse, immigrant-heavy California. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a matter of those of us in a position of authority and responsibility in law enforcement to understand the culture and the mores of those various communities, so when we walk in there we understand exactly what the perspective of the people we\xe2\x80\x99re interacting with might be.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Enter Harris the prosecutor: \xe2\x80\x9cIt is also a reciprocal relationship, and that\xe2\x80\x99s going to be again about leaders, whoever they are, taking on the responsibility for also saying, \xe2\x80\x98When you get stopped and asked a question, just, just don\xe2\x80\x99t run. Stay there and answer the question, if you can. If you, if your lawyer, whatever,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d she paused, reiterating her initial point. \xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99re reciprocal relationships.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Ferguson also provoked bipartisan criticism of federal programs that provide local police with military equipment for free \xe2\x80\x94 a point of discussion that has faded somewhat as the months have passed since the initial protests.', '', 'Harris\xe2\x80\x99 position as a prosecutor puts her at odds, somewhat, with the national progressive conversation about police issues. She said the militarization of police forces is a \xe2\x80\x9clegitimate conversation to be had.\xe2\x80\x9d But she also said she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t think \xe2\x80\x9cin general\xe2\x80\x9d that police have become too militarized.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cI would say we\xe2\x80\x99d have to look at specifics,\xe2\x80\x9d she explained. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think in general that\xe2\x80\x99s the case, but I think there are certainly examples that concern us about that. Wherever it occurs is a problem for all of us. It\xe2\x80\x99s not just about, \xe2\x80\x98Oh, that\xe2\x80\x99s happening over there.\xe2\x80\x99 If there is a sense that, by the people, that law enforcement is militarized and is exercising excessive force, that\xe2\x80\x99s going to be an issue for everybody and that needs to be addressed.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'That tension between the prosecutor and the progressive was on display in last year\xe2\x80\x99s case over whether police would need to obtain a search warrant before examining the contents of an arrested person\xe2\x80\x99s cell phone.', '', 'Asked about it, Harris was first philosophical about the role of technology and the internet in today\xe2\x80\x99s society.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe are at a moment in time, which is really I think an inflection point,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cWhen I think about technology I think of it in the context of, there was the creation of fire, the wheel, electricity, and this. This is a bleeping gamechanger. \xe2\x80\xa6 It\xe2\x80\x99s incredible in terms of its expanse and its potential and the ubiquitous nature of it, right? And so everyone is adapting. We are at this point figuring out, in particular Fourth Amendment privacy.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'In figuring that out, Harris\xe2\x80\x99 office took the position that police should not need a warrant to search an arrested person\xe2\x80\x99s cell phone. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd the court said, \xe2\x80\x98We disagree,\xe2\x80\x99 and I respect the court\xe2\x80\x99s decision,\xe2\x80\x9d Harris said. \xe2\x80\x9cSo my perspective as of today is respectful of the court\xe2\x80\x99s decision.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'From smartphone access to sexual assault, Harris\xe2\x80\x99 more macro approach to changes in the law \xe2\x80\x94 the evolution of the law \xe2\x80\x94 was on display, especially in the case of California\xe2\x80\x99s affirmative consent law, which requires universities receiving state funds to include the policy.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cI think that the idea behind that is a good one, which is not just about, \xe2\x80\x98Did she actually say yes?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d Harris said. \xe2\x80\x9cNow, there are going to be abuses, and this is part of the argument against that, that can be abused. Good public policy is not crafted around the abuses,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, adding that the system can \xe2\x80\x9chandle and address\xe2\x80\x9d such abuses.', '', 'Harris also noted that consideration must be given to someone who wants to report an assault, even if the person doesn\xe2\x80\x99t want to prosecute it. \xe2\x80\x9cSo it\xe2\x80\x99s a complex issue, right, in terms of how the public policy should be constructed and what\xe2\x80\x99s the role of campus police, what\xe2\x80\x99s the role of the academic staff, the public health staff of the university.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cI think we\xe2\x80\x99re getting smarter, but there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of work to be done.\xe2\x80\x9d', '5.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '6.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'Kamala Harris Charts Her Path As A Progressive Prosecutor', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: South Carolina Attorney General Asks Chief Justice To Stop Same-Sex Marriages FromåÊStarting
Description: ['Unless the Supreme Court intervenes, same-sex couples will be able to marry in South Carolina beginning at noon Thursday.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'South Carolina Attorney General Alan Wilson on Tuesday evening asked Chief Justice John Roberts to stop same-sex couples from being able to marry in the state beginning Thursday.', 'Wilson is seeking a stay during his appeal of a trial court ruling from last week that the state\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages is unconstitutional.', 'The application, which Roberts can decide on his own or refer to the full court for resolution, was filed just hours after the 4th Circuit Court of Appeals denied a similar request.', 'The trial court judge put', 'on hold until noon Thursday, Nov. 20, and the state had asked the 4th Circuit and now the Supreme Court to keep that ruling on hold during its appeal.', 'Since the justices turned down five states\xe2\x80\x99 requests on Oct. 6 to take a marriage case appeal \xe2\x80\x94 including a decision from the 4th Circuit striking down Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ban \xe2\x80\x94 the justices have, on three occasions, turned down requests to issue stays of lower court rulings during appeals. This includes one, in', ', since the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals upheld four other states\xe2\x80\x99 bans.', 'Now, however, with', 'from the plaintiffs in those four states\xe2\x80\x99 cases asking the Supreme Court to take one or more of the appeals and resolve the question, Wilson is hoping that he can get a stay issued from the court to stop the trial court ruling from going into effect Thursday.', 'Specifically, South Carolina is asking the chief justice to grant a stay pending appeal because, the filing asserts, the 4th Circuit Court was wrong in its decision in the case challenging Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ban,', ', which the Supreme Court let stand on Oct. 6.', 'Read', ':', 'South Carolina Attorney General Asks Chief Justice To Stop Same-Sex Marriages From Starting', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Michigan Officials: March Same-Sex Marriages From The State Are "Void"
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9c[I]t is as if the marriages never existed,\xe2\x80\x9d Michigan Attorney General Bill Schuette argues.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The impact of the shifting court rulings on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights was made unambiguously clear by Michigan Attorney General Bill Schuette in a Friday night court filing: \xe2\x80\x9c[F]rom a legal standpoint,\xe2\x80\x9d he wrote of the same-sex couples who got married in the state this March, \xe2\x80\x9cit is as if the marriages never existed.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Should the judge in that case decide now whether Michigan must recognize', 'entered into by same-sex couples there on March 21 and 22, Schuette argued, the marriages should be found to be void and Michigan should not be ordered to treat the couples as married.', 'The filing came even as other same-sex couples', 'on Friday \xe2\x80\x94 with more filings expected Monday \xe2\x80\x94 asking the justices to take up an appeal of the issue and bring nationwide resolution to the questions of whether same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry and have their marriages recognized.', 'The filing from Schuette came in a case brought by the ACLU this summer, asking a court to order Michigan to recognize the marriages of those couples immediately. However, after the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals last week', 'the trial court ruling that had led to those couples being allowed to marry, the court in this secondary case asked the state and plaintiffs to tell the court how the 6th Circuit decision in', 'impacted their case.', 'The state argued that its first choice was for the court to put the secondary case on hold until the', 'case is resolved. Though, if the court does decide the secondary case,', ', now, the state is seeking a stark result: voiding the marriages that the state granted to same-sex couples earlier this year.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt has been [the state\xe2\x80\x99s] position from the outset of this litigation that Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages were conditionally valid; the condition being the affirmance of the district court\xe2\x80\x99s decision in', ', which established the sole premise for the legality of Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages,\xe2\x80\x9d the state lawyers wrote. \xe2\x80\x9cNow that the Sixth Circuit has reversed the district court\xe2\x80\x99s decision in', ', that condition cannot be met, and Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages are therefore void.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The state continued: \xe2\x80\x9c[T]he unqualified reversal by the Sixth Circuit in', 'nullifies the district court\xe2\x80\x99s decision completely, and it is as if the legal premise upon which Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages are based never existed.\xe2\x80\x9d As such, \xe2\x80\x9cbecause the marriages rested solely on the district court\xe2\x80\x99s erroneous decision, which has now been reversed, it is as if the marriages never existed,\xe2\x80\x9d the state concludes.', 'After a stay was', 'of the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s order in the', 'case, which stopped any more same-sex couples from marrying, Gov. Rick Snyder \xe2\x80\x94 who Schuette is representing in both cases \xe2\x80\x94', ', \xe2\x80\x9cAfter comprehensive legal review of state law and all recent court rulings, we have concluded that same-sex couples were legally married at county clerk offices in the time period between U.S. District Judge Freidman\xe2\x80\x99s ruling and the 6th U. S. Circuit Court of Appeals temporary stay of that ruling.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Nonetheless, in Friday\xe2\x80\x99s filing Schuette claims that \xe2\x80\x9cit is, and has been, Defendants\xe2\x80\x99 position that a reversal of', 'by the Sixth Circuit renders Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages void.\xe2\x80\x9d If the court disagrees, however, the state provides the court with a third option: Because the 6th Circuit', 'decision also rejected recognition claims from other states, recognition of same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages is not constitutionally required in Michigan. As such, the state need not \xe2\x80\x94 and under its now-reinstated laws, cannot \xe2\x80\x94 recognize the marriages that it granted earlier this year.', '\xe2\x80\x9cPlaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 argument for recognition of their marriages is more tenuous than the arguments set forth in the companion cases to', 'because Plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 marriages were never sanctioned by the public policy of any State,\xe2\x80\x9d the state argued of the March marriage licenses issued to same-sex couples in Michigan. \xe2\x80\x9cInstead, the marriages occurred when the district court incorrectly invalidated Michigan\xe2\x80\x99s public policy.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The plaintiffs are to respond by Nov. 21, at which point the court will decide whether a hearing on the issue is needed.', 'Meanwhile, on Monday the plaintiffs in the primary Michigan marriage case \xe2\x80\x94 April DeBoer and Jayne Rowse \xe2\x80\x94 are expected to file their petition at the Supreme Court asking it to hear their appeal, reverse the 6th Circuit decision, and resolve the issue once and for all.', 'Read', ':', 'Michigan Officials: March Same-Sex Marriages From The State Are "Void"', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Same-Sex Marriage Heads Back To The SupremeåÊCourt
Description: ['Married same-sex couples and widowers in Ohio file the first of four petitions expected over the coming days asking the high court to resolve issues about marriage and marriage recognition.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Update: Tennessee same-sex couples also filed their request with the Supreme Court on Friday, and couples in Michigan and Kentucky filed their requests on Monday.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Married same-sex couples and, in two instances, the widowers of men who died asked the Supreme Court on Friday to hear their appeal of a recent appeals court ruling upholding Ohio\xe2\x80\x99s ban on recognizing their marriages, which were granted in other states.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThese cases are about love, from birth to death,\xe2\x80\x9d the lawyers for the plaintiffs write, in setting up the case. \xe2\x80\x9cOhio does not contest the validity of their out-of-state marriages; it simply refuses to recognize them,\xe2\x80\x9d they later note.', 'The lawyers, which include the ACLU and Lambda Legal and are led by longtime Ohio advocate Alphonse Gerhardstein, filed the petition for a writ of certiorari on Friday, asking the court to take the case and reverse last week\xe2\x80\x99s', 'by the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals upholding Ohio\xe2\x80\x99s 2004 state and constitutional amendment barring recognition of same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages.', 'Although the justices earlier this fall', 'requests to hear appeals in several marriage cases, at least one justice has said that could change if a circuit split developed \xe2\x80\x94 if appeals courts reached differing conclusions on the issue \xe2\x80\x94 which they now have. At least two justices \xe2\x80\x94 Antonin Scalia and Clarence Thomas \xe2\x80\x94', 'the court to take the cases even without a circuit split.', 'The Ohio litigation \xe2\x80\x94 which itself is actually two cases \xe2\x80\x94 is one of four cases expected to hit the Supreme Court on Friday or Monday, according to lawyers in the cases.', 'Two of the cases \xe2\x80\x94 Ohio and Tennessee \xe2\x80\x94 only seek recognition of same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages conducted elsewhere, while the Kentucky and Michigan cases seeks to order the states to actually grant marriage licenses to same-sex couples. As suc', 'Lawyers in the Tennessee marriage recognition case are expected to file a similar petition with the court on Friday. Lawyers for plaintiffs in marriage cases out of Michigan and Kentucky are expected to file their petitions with the court on Friday or Monday as well.', 'The lawyers are moving the cases forward as quickly as possibly \xe2\x80\x94 with all four sets of lawyers', 'a chance to ask the full 6th Circuit to rehear the case \xe2\x80\x94 in an attempt to have the Supreme Court accept the case for review in its current term, which would mean a decision would be expected by June 2015.', 'update', 'The Tennessee plaintiffs have filed their petition for a writ of certiorari with the Supreme Court, making it the second filing out of the 6th Circuit.', 'The couples are asking the justices to hear their marriage recognition case, an appeal from last week\xe2\x80\x99s 6th Circuit decision upholding Tennessee\xe2\x80\x99s ban on such recognition.', 'In addition to the legal team below \xe2\x80\x94 which included the National Center for Lesbian Rights, William Harbison, longtime LGBT rights lawyer Abby Rubenfeld and other Tennessee lawyers \xe2\x80\x94 the counsel of record in today\xe2\x80\x99s filing was Douglas Hallward-Driemeier, a partner at Ropes & Gray in Washington.', 'Hallward-Driemeier served in the George W. Bush administration\xe2\x80\x99s Justice Department, as an assistant to the solicitor general, from 2004 to 2009.', '', 'Here is where they describe the circuit split, which is the reason why the plaintiffs in all four cases expect that the justices will take at least one of these cases:', 'Even though both the Ohio and Tennessee cases only have plaintiffs seeking recognition of out-of-state marriages, the Tennessee plaintiffs tell the justices their case is about the \xe2\x80\x9cfundamental right to marry\xe2\x80\x9d in Friday\xe2\x80\x99s filing:', 'Read', ':', 'Read', ':', 'update', 'On Monday, petitions seeking Supreme Court review were filed by plaintiffs in the case out of Michigan, which involves only a marriage claim, and combined cases out of Kentucky, which involve marriage and marriage recognition claims. With those filings, petitions from all four states in the 6th Circuit are before the justices. The states will now have to file their response, after which the justices can consider whether to take one or more of the cases.', '', 'Read', 'out of Kentucky:', 'Read', 'out of Michigan:', 'Same-Sex Marriage Heads Back To The Supreme Court', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Justices Clarence Thomas And Antonin Scalia Are NotåÊHappy
Description: ['They apparently wish the Supreme Court had heard appeals of cases challenging states\xe2\x80\x99 bans on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Justices Clarence Thomas and Antonin Scalia are apparently unhappy with the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s decision last month not to hear appeals of cases striking down five state bans on marriages for same-sex couples.', 'The views were expressed, unusually, in', 'denying a request by Arizona officials on an immigration issue.', 'The Arizona officials asked the court to enforce a measure that was struck down by a federal appeals court last month \xe2\x80\x94 the measure bars bail for undocumented immigrants \xe2\x80\x94 while the state officials try to appeal that decision to the Supreme Court.', 'In a statement published Thursday and joined by Scalia, Thomas complained that, while the court has generally heard cases when federal or state laws have been found to be unconstitutional by lower courts, the justices \xe2\x80\x9chave not done so with any consistency, especially in recent months\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 specifically pointing to the various marriage cases that the justices have declined to hear.', 'As such, Thomas (and Scalia) joined the order denying Arizona\xe2\x80\x99s request on Thursday \xe2\x80\x9cbecause there appears to be no \xe2\x80\x98reasonable probability\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d that four justices would vote to hear the appeal of the Arizona case. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is unfortunate.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Thomas went on to explain, writing that the Supreme Court has \xe2\x80\x9crecognized a strong presumption in favor of\xe2\x80\x9d hearing appeals when federal statutes have been held unconstitutional. \xe2\x80\x9cStates deserve no less consideration. \xe2\x80\xa6 Indeed, we often review decisions striking down state laws, even in the absence of a disagreement among lower courts,\xe2\x80\x9d Thomas wrote, noting, among other cases, the court\xe2\x80\x99s decision to hear the appeal of California\xe2\x80\x99s Proposition 8 marriage ban \xe2\x80\x94 an appeal that the court ended up dismissing in 2013 on the technical grounds of standing.', 'Then, turning to the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s current term, Thomas noted, \xe2\x80\x9cBut for reasons that escape me, we have not done so with any consistency, especially in recent months\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 citing the court\xe2\x80\x99s decision to deny the marriage case appeal requests out of Utah, Oklahoma, Virginia, and Wisconsin at the start of the term and the stay requests denied since in marriage cases pending in Idaho and Alaska.', 'Of Arizona\xe2\x80\x99s request in the immigration case, and, implicitly, stating the pair\xe2\x80\x99s view as to the marriage cases, Thomas wrote, \xe2\x80\x9cAt the very least, we owe the people of Arizona the respect of our review before we let stand a decision facially invalidating a state constitutional amendment.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Thomas noted that Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s Arizona decision was only on a stay request and not a full request for the court to hear officials\xe2\x80\x99 appeal, but then added, \xe2\x80\x9cOur recent practice, however, gives me little reason to be optimistic.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s statement, though unusual, was hinted at on Wednesday.', 'After not having made their views known earlier as to the marriage cases cited in the Arizona case order, Scalia and Thomas', 'on Wednesday that they would have granted a stay in Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request that its marriage ban be kept in effect during its appeal of a lower court ruling finding that it is unconstitutional. A majority of the justices disagreed, the stay was lifted, and same-sex couples began marrying in Kansas on Thursday.', 'Justices Clarence Thomas And Antonin Scalia Are Not Happy', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Arizona Law That Denies Bail For Undocumented Immigrants Cannot Be Enforced During CourtåÊAppeal
Description: ['After a brief stay, the Supreme Court denies government officials\xe2\x80\x99 request to keep Arizona\xe2\x80\x99s Proposition 100 in effect during an appeal request.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Arizona cannot enforce Proposition 100, which denies bail to undocumented immigrants, while it seeks Supreme Court review of an appeals court ruling that held the measure unconstitutional.', 'The Supreme Court on Thursday', 'Arizona officials\xe2\x80\x99 request for a stay pending a request for certiorari, allowing the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals', 'striking down the measure to stay in effect during the attempted appeal.', 'Justice Anthony Kennedy had initially issued a stay of the 9th Circuit ruling in response to the officials\xe2\x80\x99 request while the court considered the matter.', 'Arizona Law That Denies Bail For Undocumented Immigrants Cannot Be Enforced During Court Appeal', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Supreme Court Allows Same-Sex Marriages To Proceed InåÊKansas
Description: ['Justices Antonin Scalia and Clarence Thomas would have stopped them.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The Supreme Court effectively allowed same-sex couples to begin marrying in Kansas on Wednesday afternoon.', 'The Supreme Court denied Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request for a stay of the trial court order striking down the state\xe2\x80\x99s ban as unconstitutional, ending a hold Justice Sonia Sotomayor had', 'earlier this week while the court considered the request.', 'Justices Antonin Scalia and Clarence Thomas would have granted the stay, according to the brief order issued by the court\xe2\x80\x99s Public Information Office a little past 5 p.m. ET Wednesday.', 'On Nov, 4, U.S. District Court Judge Daniel Crabtree', 'Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 ban as unconstitutional, putting the ruling on hold until 5 p.m. CT Nov. 11.', 'In the meantime, the state sought a stay pending its appeal from the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals, which', 'the request on Nov. 7. On Monday, state officials sought a stay from Sotomayor, who oversees such requests out of the 10th Circuit. Sotomayor', 'a stay, pending further order by her or the court.', 'After the same-sex couple plaintiffs filed a response with the court opposing the stay on Tuesday, the court was silent. Crabtree\xe2\x80\x99s temporary stay expired, and all that remained was word from the justices.', 'On Wednesday, the court answered, with the justices denying the stay request and vacating, or ending, Sotomayor\xe2\x80\x99s stay.', 'Although the justices gave no reasons for their decisions, the decision by Scalia and Thomas to note their position that they would have granted a stay marked a change from recent stay requests out of', 'and', 'on marriage cases. In those matters, no justices announced opposition to the decision to allow same-sex couples to marry during any appeals.', 'In Kansas\xe2\x80\x99', 'to the justices, they pointed to two distinctions that could have explained the reason why Scalia and Thomas would have granted the stay. First, the state noted', 'state court litigation, arguing that the federal court should not have proceeded with the case at all. Additionally, the state pointed to the recent', 'of the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals to uphold the ban same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages in four states, asserting that the court should issue a stay in their case because it was now likely that the justices would be hearing a case on the constitutional marriage question.', 'With the order issued before 5 p.m. CT, Kansan same-sex couples could yet marry on Wednesday.', 'update', 'It was not immediately clear what effect the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s order \xe2\x80\x94 and underlying district court order \xe2\x80\x94 would have on the pending Kansas Supreme Court litigation and', 'of Johnson County District Judge Kevin Moriarty\xe2\x80\x99s order that allowed for same-sex couples to marry briefly in Johnson County, Kansas.', 'It also was not clear whether the Kansas Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s order would bar same-sex couples from marrying in Johnson County under the federal court order.', 'The Kansas Supreme Court order only referenced Moriarty\xe2\x80\x99s order for Johnson County, however, so no other counties should be impacted by the pending state court litigation.', '', 'Here is the relevant portion of the pending Kansas Supreme Court order:', 'update', 'Attorney General Derek Schmidt issued a statement noting Wednesday\xe2\x80\x99s Supreme Court stay denial and acknowledging that the district court\xe2\x80\x99s injunction \xe2\x80\x94 halting enforcement of the state\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ban \xe2\x80\x94 is in effect.', 'Asked about the questions surrounding Johnson County, Schmidt\xe2\x80\x99s spokesman, Clint Blaes, would not respond beyond providing the statement, adding, \xe2\x80\x9cWe do not have any additional comment at this time.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Supreme Court Allows Same-Sex Marriages To Proceed In Kansas', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Federal Judge Strikes Down South Carolina‰Ûªs Same-Sex MarriageåÊBan
Description: ['The ruling is on hold until noon on Nov. 20.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'A federal judge struck down South Carolina\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages Wednesday, although he put his ruling on hold until noon on Nov. 20.', 'U.S. District Court Judge Richard Mark Gergel\xe2\x80\x99s', 'followed the prior decision of the 4th Circuit Court of Appeals in striking down Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s similar ban. The Supreme Court declined to hear an appeal of that case,', ', meaning that the 4th Circuit ruling is binding law on all states within the 4th Circuit \xe2\x80\x94 which includes South Carolina.', '\xe2\x80\x9c[T]he Court finds that', 'provides clear and controlling legal authority in this Circuit and that Plaintiffs are entitled to judgment as a matter of law,\xe2\x80\x9d Gergel wrote.', 'Gergel\xe2\x80\x99s ruling put South Carolina\xe2\x80\x99s governor and attorney general, who had been defendants in the lawsuit brought by a lesbian couple, on the losing side of the debate \xe2\x80\x94 although the judge ruled that Gov. Nikki Haley was not a proper party to the lawsuit because she had not taken enforcement actions relating to stopping same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages. Attorney General Alan Wilson, however, was found to be a proper defendant, as was the probate judge who denied the couple their marriage license.', 'In addition to arguing that they should not have been defendants in the lawsuit, they argued that a 1972 Supreme Court decision \xe2\x80\x94 recently relied upon by the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals in upholding marriage bans there \xe2\x80\x94 could trump other lower court rulings on marriage and related Supreme Court rulings. Gergel, however, ruled that the 4th Circuit, in the', 'case, \xe2\x80\x9chas exhaustively addressed the issues raised by the Defendants and firmly and unambiguously recognized the fundamental right of same sex couples to marry and the power of the federal courts to address and vindicate that right.\xe2\x80\x9d', "Federal Judge Strikes Down South Carolina's Same-Sex Marriage Ban", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Chaos In Michigan As LGBT Job Protection Bill HitsåÊDeadline
Description: ['A disagreement over whether a non-discrimination bill should include gender identity protections sends Republicans and national LGBT groups scrambling.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'A key player has gone rogue, two sources say.', '', 'Bill Pugliano / Getty Images', 'NICHOLAS KAMM/AFP / Getty Images', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The heavily funded national effort to secure LGBT job protections in Michigan appeared early Wednesday to be in danger of failing \xe2\x80\x94 although advocates were hopeful that much could still change in the coming hours and days of the late session of the Michigan legislature.', 'National LGBT organizations have made passage of an LGBT non-discrimination bill a priority in Michigan this year, spending hundreds of thousands of dollars and devoting staff and organizing time to the effort.', 'Now, in the last week when new legislation can be submitted for the session, the co-chair of a business coalition created to pass sexual orientation and gender identity nondiscrimination legislation appears to have gone rogue, according to two sources.', 'Two activists on the ground in Lansing told BuzzFeed News on Tuesday evening that AT&T Michigan President Jim Murray has been actively lobbying for a bill that would only include sexual orientation, and leave out gender identity protections.', 'In an interview with BuzzFeed News, Murray, the co-chair of the', ', said on Tuesday afternoon that he \xe2\x80\x9cprefers\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cwill be pushing\xe2\x80\x9d for a bill that includes both sexual orientation and gender identity.', 'Asked if he would oppose the narrower, sexual orientation-only bill if it proceeds, Murray said, \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know, definitively, that I can speak to that.\xe2\x80\x9d He noted that a narrower bill hadn\xe2\x80\x99t yet been introduced, and added, \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t want to oppose anything [at this point], but we are really going to be pushing the five-word bill.\xe2\x80\x9d The \xe2\x80\x9cfive-word bill\xe2\x80\x9d refers to the measure that includes protections on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity.', 'Whether the worker protections bill should include gender identity has become a major point of behind-the-scenes contention \xe2\x80\x94 and a potentially critical one to a nondiscrimination bill passing.', 'The broader bill has had key Republican supporters, though. Gov. Rick Snyder, a Republican elected to a second term last week,', 'the inclusion of gender identity protections in the bill earlier this year. One of the state\xe2\x80\x99s leading Republican advocates for the measure, state Rep. Frank Foster, also supported the broader bill \xe2\x80\x94 a stance that', 'contributed to his primary loss earlier this year.', 'But Murray\xe2\x80\x99s efforts pushing a \xe2\x80\x9ctwo-word bill\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 one that only includes sexual orientation \xe2\x80\x94 have undermined support for the broader bill with gender identity protections, according to activists.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAs of about an hour-and-a-half-ago,\xe2\x80\x9d the other advocate said at 8 p.m. Tuesday, \xe2\x80\x9cthe story was it would only be a two-word bill\xe2\x80\x9d introduced on Wednesday.', 'National organizations have been working frantically in support of a bill that would include gender identity, intent on avoiding a repeat of the 2007 vote on a sexual orientation-only version of the federal LGBT job bias bill, the Employment Non-Discrimination Act. The vote caused significant acrimony in the LGBT community and has led all national organizations to affirm since that they only would support job bills that include both sexual orientation and gender identity protections.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAdvocates of LGBT freedom concluded together a number of years ago that nondiscrimination efforts should be pursued in a fully inclusive way,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jeff Cook-McCormac, the senior adviser to the Paul Singer-backed American Unity Fund, said Tuesday night, \xe2\x80\x9cand American Unity Fund strongly agrees with that conclusion.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cA nondiscrimination measure cannot pass in Michigan unless its fully inclusive,\xe2\x80\x9d Cook-McCormac said.', 'The first public signals of concern about how the Michigan effort is trending came from a notable source: the Human Rights Campaign, the group that took took the most heat for not opposing the sexual orientation-only vote in 2007. The group issued a news release a little before noon Tuesday urging \xe2\x80\x9cIntroduction of Fully Inclusive Non-Discrimination Bill\xe2\x80\x9d in Michigan.', '\xe2\x80\x9cA fully inclusive non-discrimination bill that covers both sexual orientation AND gender identity is the only acceptable option,\xe2\x80\x9d HRC president Chad Griffin said in the release. \xe2\x80\x9cThe Human Rights Campaign and our coalition partners will oppose anything less.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The coalition partners include state groups like the ACLU of Michigan and Equality Michigan, as well as national groups that include the American Unity Fund and Gill Action \xe2\x80\x94 the political arm of the prominent donor Tim Gill\xe2\x80\x99s efforts.', 'Kirk Fordham, the executive director of Gill Action, echoed Griffin and Cook-McCormac\xe2\x80\x99s remarks, writing, \xe2\x80\x9cWe, too, support only and inclusive bill and would oppose anything less than that. We\xe2\x80\x99ve made that position clear to the GOP and Democratic leaders in the state.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Despite the unified effort from three organizations representing some of the biggest financial and organizing players in the national LGBT movement, the effort to move a bill that includes gender identity protections is facing pressure. Advocates say it\xe2\x80\x99s coming from Murray. Murray did not respond to an email Tuesday night asking for comment on the advocates\xe2\x80\x99 claims.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe know if the bill went to the floor clean, we have the votes to pass,\xe2\x80\x9d one of the advocates said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt is purely resting with the [House] Speaker [Jase Bolger] not wanting to move a five-word bill forward and Jim Murray making sure that whatever moves doesn\xe2\x80\x99t include gender identity.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Bolger, also a Republican, was one of the targets of the national advocates, getting $50,000', 'to his leadership fund from both Singer and Gill \xe2\x80\x94 but he has recently', 'the need for the transgender protections.', 'update', 'The story was updated to clarify that Snyder has not made recent statements in support of a bill with both sexual orientation and gender identity protections and that Bolger has made recent statements questioning the need for gender identity protections.', '', 'Chaos In Michigan As LGBT Job Protection Bill Hits Deadline', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: LGBT Leaders Square Off Over Future Of Fight For Anti-Discrimination Job Protections
Description: ['With federal workplace legislation stalled, most LGBT advocates appear ready to embrace a 2012 ruling from the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission that protects trans workers.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Except one: the National LGBTQ Task Force.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Advocates have had a tough time advancing federal LGBT workplace protections for decades \xe2\x80\x94 and yet, in the Obama era, one of the rare successes on that front has proven to be the most divisive.', 'How to best achieve the legal protections has become a contentious issue under the Obama administration. Advocates have had to make complex lobbying decisions: Should they push for new legislation to protect LGBT workers, executive action to help some LGBT workers, or both?', 'After President Obama took the executive action path', 'for the time being in April 2012, a federal agency \xe2\x80\x94 the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission \xe2\x80\x94 gave transgender workers their biggest victory ever by', 'that the ban on \xe2\x80\x9csex discrimination\xe2\x80\x9d in the Title VII of the Civil Rights Act includes anti-transgender discrimination.', 'Many LGBT groups, however, were slow to embrace the ruling at first, which is binding on the federal government but not courts \xe2\x80\x94 although they give deference to the agency ruling. As time wore on, more and more groups began embracing the decision \xe2\x80\x94 with a few LGBT groups taking cases to the EEOC on behalf of transgender clients. Even then, many groups have been loathe to highlight the EEOC decision, as they press for passage of the federal bill to ban LGBT job bias, the Employment Non-Discrimination Act; other federal efforts; or similar state efforts.', 'Now, with the legislative route basically closed to LGBT advancements for the remainder of the Obama administration with a newly elected Republican Congress, most LGBT organizations are pushing the EEOC ruling as a key tool for fighting discrimination \xe2\x80\x94 except one.', 'In a new graphic released last month, the National LGBTQ Task Force claimed that \xe2\x80\x9c[t]here are no federal protections for employment non-discrimination\xe2\x80\x9d for transgender people.', 'A commissioner of the EEOC, Chai Feldblum, says the Task Force is painting an \xe2\x80\x9cincomplete\xe2\x80\x9d picture of legal protections for LGBT people in America \xe2\x80\x94 specifically, by understating the work of the EEOC. Several other LGBT organizations, in comments to BuzzFeed News this week, echo that criticism, with a Human Right Campaign spokesman saying that \xe2\x80\x9c[t]he fact that it\xe2\x80\x99s incomplete makes it wrong.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The 2012 EEOC decision came from the case of Mia Macy, who challenged anti-transgender discrimination by bringing a complaint accusing the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives of violating the Title VII ban on sex discrimination. The EEOC, in a unanimous decision, agreed with Macy \xe2\x80\x94 setting the agency and the federal government on a path in which that interpretation was reality. The Justice Department', 'in favor of Macy\xe2\x80\x99s claim a year later, and the EEOC began', 'other complaints of anti-transgender discrimination.', 'Asked about the graphic, Kylar Broadus, the Task Force\xe2\x80\x99s senior public policy counsel and Transgender Civil Rights Project director, said in a terse statement, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Task Force follows the Macy decision rendered by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) which is an administrative agency and not a court of law. EEOC rulings are used as guidance by courts of law in most instances. Courts aren\xe2\x80\x99t bound by EEOC rulings but usually give great deference to them. Court decisions rendered by appeals courts become law. A case has to be brought to win or set precedent in a particular circuit which is why there is still need for a federal statute protecting workers.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Although EEOC rulings are not binding on the courts, courts do give deference to the agency\xe2\x80\x99s interpretation \xe2\x80\x94 and two federal appellate courts have, even before the', 'decision, had found that sex discrimination prohibitions under', 'or the', 'protected against anti-transgender discrimination. In recent months, moreover, the EEOC went beyond', 'within the agency \xe2\x80\x94 filing', 'in Michigan and Florida using Title VII in suing companies for anti-transgender discrimination.', 'Finally, Broadus said in his statement, \xe2\x80\x9cA federal statute would provide protection across the country for everyone and curtail the need for more litigation.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The federal legislation, long sought by LGBT advocates, has been the Employment Non-Discrimination Act, which provides explicit protections based on sexual orientation and gender identity and', 'the Senate last year. It has no support from the Republican leadership in the current House, however, and last week\xe2\x80\x99s midterm election results make the chance of pro-LGBT legislation even more unlikely in the next Congress.', 'Feldblum, the first and only out LGBT EEOC commissioner, helped draft ENDA before her appointment to the EEOC and, in response to an inquiry from BuzzFeed News about the matter, noted that she, like the Task Force, continues to support the idea of such legislation, writing, \xe2\x80\x9cI agree that a strong federal law (one without any exemptions beyond those of current civil rights laws ) is very important to enact for purposes of certainty of protection.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Further, she noted, \xe2\x80\x9cI also agree that EEOC determinations are not binding on the courts. Indeed, our agency sometimes argues positions that are not accepted by the courts. So the statement \xe2\x80\xa6 is not wrong as a legal matter.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cBut it is incomplete \xe2\x80\x94 both as a legal and practical matter,\xe2\x80\x9d she countered. \xe2\x80\x9cIt fails to capture the reality that the EEOC currently helps thousands of individuals each year get recourse (& remedies) for their discrimination claims, without ever going to court. And they get that through the legal system set up for administrative relief via the EEOC. And that is what our 53 EEOC offices across the country are now doing right now for LGBT people under our Title VII jurisdiction. Thus, there are practical remedies being achieved through the administrative system right now in every state in the country.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'More than that, as noted, the agency has gone to court with their interpretation, bringing', 'last month in Michigan and Florida on behalf of transgender workers who faced employment discrimination.', '\xe2\x80\x9cTo begin where I started,\xe2\x80\x9d Feldblum concluded, \xe2\x80\x9cthat doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean an explicit federal law is unnecessary. To the contrary, it would be hugely helpful. It\xe2\x80\x99s just important not to downplay the real practical protection that exists now.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'The unusual decision for an EEOC commissioner to speak out against the actions of an advocacy group was buttressed by other LGBT organizations, who echoed Feldblum\xe2\x80\x99s criticism in statements provided to BuzzFeed News in response to inquiries.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI agree with Commissioner Feldblum. Their statement is incomplete,\xe2\x80\x9d the executive director of the National Center for Transgender Equality, Mara Keisling, said of the Task Force\xe2\x80\x99s comment. \xe2\x80\x9cWe strongly believe job discrimination against trans people is illegal everywhere in this country under Title VII.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'HRC\xe2\x80\x99s Sainz was more direct, saying of the Task Force\xe2\x80\x99s statement, \xe2\x80\x9cWe certainly don\xe2\x80\x99t agree with those sentiments. The fact that it\xe2\x80\x99s incomplete makes it wrong.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Tico Almeida, the president of Freedom to Work, said he was \xe2\x80\x9cconfused and a little bit saddened\xe2\x80\x9d by the Task Force\xe2\x80\x99s statement, saying it \xe2\x80\x9cdownplay[s] the real legal protections that currently exist thanks to the tremendous EEOC victory achieved by the courageous Mia Macy.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'No Task Force officials emailed on Tuesday evening responded to a request for a response to Feldblum\xe2\x80\x99s comments.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not just the', 'decision, either. President Obama eventually', 'the executive order that he rejected in 2012, leading the Department of Labor to', ', expected to be finalized in coming months, barring federal contractors from discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity. The order expands a prior order, enforced by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs within the Labor Department, that bars contractors from discriminating on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.', 'The problems of inconsistent education about and application of the current legal protections, in addition to the fact that they have not been buoyed by a definitive federal court ruling, and the lack of explicit LGBT protections, are real. As Keisling said, \xe2\x80\x9c[I]n most states, the protections are not as clear as they need to be for employers and employees. We need state and local laws, as well as an explicit federal law, to make it absolutely clear to everyone that trans people have rights.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'On a point where the Task Force, other advocates, and Feldblum agree, HRC\xe2\x80\x99s Sainz noted, \xe2\x80\x9cSince the Supreme Court has yet to address either gender identity or sexual orientation claims under Title VII, a federal non-discrimination law will ensure long term protections for LGBT workers and provide additional clarity to employers about their obligations to LGBT people.\xe2\x80\x9d He added that \xe2\x80\x9c[a]dministrative and court success compliment efforts to attain full protections for LGBT people legislatively.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Freedom to Work, along with Lambda Legal, has put that concept to work \xe2\x80\x94 further confounding Almeida as to why the Task Force has staked out the position it has \xe2\x80\x94 by successfully', 'a case before the EEOC on behalf of a transgender person.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI would like to see the big national LGBT organizations use their ample budgets on a public education campaign to promote the historic nature of the', 'decision so that more LGBT Americans will know that the EEOC is open for business and willing to help,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'The biggest of those groups, HRC, had been slow to talk about the effect and impact of the', 'decision, but \xe2\x80\x94 particularly in light of last week\xe2\x80\x99s election results \xe2\x80\x94 appears to be ready to take up Almeida\xe2\x80\x99s challenge.', '\xe2\x80\x9cBoth the', 'EEOC decision and the Office of Federal Contact Compliance Programs (OFCCP) Directive 2014-2 have provided real, immediate remedies for transgender workers,\xe2\x80\x9d HRC\xe2\x80\x99s vice president for communications, Fred Sainz, told BuzzFeed on Tuesday, referencing the OFCCP\xe2\x80\x99s', '\xe2\x80\x94 years', 'the issue was first raised \xe2\x80\x94 applying the', 'decision to existing federal contractor protections.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIn addition, LGB people may also have claims under Title VII if they have experienced discrimination that involves sex stereotyping,\xe2\x80\x9d Sainz added, noting an area where', 'suggest further change could be coming. \xe2\x80\x9cAny LGBT worker who has experienced gender identity or sexual orientation based discrimination should consider filing a complaint with the EEOC. Once the amendments to Executive Order 11246 go into effect, LGB people working for a federal contractor who has a new or renewed contract may file a complaint with OFCCP. Transgender people working for a federal contractor who experience discrimination may file with OFCCP immediately.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'update', 'Additional language was added to the story to clarify that EEOC Commissioner Feldblum made the statement in response to an inquiry from BuzzFeed News.', '', 'LGBT Leaders Square Off Over Future Of Fight For Anti-Discrimination Job Protections', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Justice Sonia Sotomayor Stops Same-Sex Marriages In Kansas ForåÊNow
Description: ['Sotomayor calls for a response to Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request for a stay pending appeal by 5 p.m. Tuesday.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Justice Sonia Sotomayor issued an order early Monday evening that stops same-sex couples in Kansas from being able to marry beginning after 5 p.m. CT Tuesday. She added, however, that she or the full Supreme Court could issue an order that changes that at some point in the future.', 'The move came in response to the request from Kansas Attorney General Derek Schmidt filed with Sotomayor earlier Monday.', 'After the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals', 'the state\xe2\x80\x99s request for a stay last week, Schmidt had said he would be asking for a stay from Sotomayor \xe2\x80\x94 who hears procedural requests like this from the 10th Circuit.', 'In addition to arguments raised by other states\xe2\x80\x99 officials in support of a stay, Kansas officials argue that the federal courts never should have taken on the issue \xe2\x80\x94 as the Kansas Supreme Court had ordered briefing on the implications of the 10th Circuit\xe2\x80\x99s ruling that Utah\xe2\x80\x99s similar marriage ban is unconstitutional on Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 ban.', 'In her Monday order, Sotomayor also called for a response to Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request by 5 p.m. ET Tuesday. Sotomayor can then decide the matter on her own, or she can refer the question to the full court.', 'Although the Supreme Court had been granting stays in similar circumstances earlier this year, it changed course in October after', 'several states\xe2\x80\x99 requests to hear appeals of challenges to their states\xe2\x80\x99 bans. Since then, the court has allowed multiple rulings against bans on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages to take effect, even during appeals.', 'Notably, as to a request made by Idaho officials, Justice Anthony Kennedy', 'in October while the court considered the matter. Later that week, the court', 'Idaho\xe2\x80\x99s request for a stay.', 'After last week\xe2\x80\x99s', 'from the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals upholding four states\xe2\x80\x99 bans, however, lawyers on both sides of the issue will be watching the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s handling of the Kansas issue for some signals on whether the 6th Circuit decision has changed the dynamic on the issue with the justices.', 'update', 'This post has been updated to include news of Justice Sonia Sotomayor\xe2\x80\x99s order.', '', 'Here is the opening of Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 application:', 'Here is the order from Justice Sotomayor:', 'Read Kansas\xe2\x80\x99', ':', 'update', 'The plaintiffs in the case filed their opposition to Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 stay request, arguing, \xe2\x80\x9cThe public interest would be best served by this Court adhering to the consistent practice it has followed since it denied the petitions for certiorari on October 6, 2014, and denying the application for a stay pending appeal.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Read', ':', 'Justice Sonia Sotomayor Stops Same-Sex Marriages In Kansas For Now', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ACLU Not Commenting On Obama‰Ûªs Attorney GeneralåÊPick
Description: ['While several progressive, particularly civil rights groups, praised Obama\xe2\x80\x99s nomination of U.S. Attorney Loretta Lynch to be the next attorney general, the American Civil Liberties Union was silent.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 President Obama\xe2\x80\x99s rushed announcement on Saturday morning that he has', 'U.S. Attorney Loretta Lynch as his nominee to succeed Attorney General Eric Holder was met with laudatory news releases from many on the left.', 'One notable group is missing from the praise for the Brooklyn prosecutor: the American Civil Liberties Union. In the past, the group has clashed with the Obama administration\xe2\x80\x99s Justice Department on national security and press freedom issues.', 'Although the head of the ACLU\xe2\x80\x99s Washington Legislative Office', 'about the future of the Justice Department, the group has been silent about Lynch.', '\xe2\x80\x9c[W]e\xe2\x80\x99re not going to issue a statement or do interviews about her,\xe2\x80\x9d a spokesperson told BuzzFeed News Saturday in response to a Friday evening request for comment, adding that Buzzfeed News would be informed if the group decided to speak out.', 'Among those who issued support for Lynch\xe2\x80\x99s nomination were the NAACP Legal Defense Fund, Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights, and the Human Rights Campaign \xe2\x80\x94 all civil rights groups that have generally supported Holder\xe2\x80\x99s tenure.', "ACLU Not Commenting On Obama's Attorney General Pick", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Tennessee Same-Sex Couple Talks About Marriage Fight, Supreme Court Possibility
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cWe were married, not married, married, not married,\xe2\x80\x9d Sophy Jesty says of her fight to force Tennessee to recognize her marriage to Val Tanco.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cRight now, our family remains legally divided.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 While the focus on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights in the nation\xe2\x80\x99s capital has centered around whether and when the Supreme Court will take on the issue, Val Tanco and Sophy Jesty presented another side of the story when they talked with reporters in video', 'Friday by the', ', in Knoxville, Tennessee.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI was with a sick baby at home,\xe2\x80\x9d Tanco said, when asked where she was when she found out that the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals had reversed the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s', 'in their case and upheld the constitutionality of Tennessee\xe2\x80\x99s ban on recognizing her marriage to Jesty.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAnd I was at work,\xe2\x80\x9d Jesty added, saying that Tanco had texted her with the news.', 'After a reporter noted that the couple \xe2\x80\x94 who married in New York before moving to Tennessee \xe2\x80\x94 was considered married by Tennessee when their daughter, Amelia, was born, the very real impact of the back-and-forth decisions of courts across the nation in the past years was made succinctly clear.', '\xe2\x80\x9cNow, we\xe2\x80\x99re not married in this state, which, it\xe2\x80\x99s been this way for the past couple months. We were married, not married, married, not married,\xe2\x80\x9d Jesty said. \xe2\x80\x9cRight now, our family remains legally divided.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s always hope when there\xe2\x80\x99s not an answer yet, so having the definite answer was sad, was hard,\xe2\x80\x9d Tanco said of the three-month wait for the ruling from the 6th Circuit.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cMy name is on her birth certificate,\xe2\x80\x9d Jesty said of Amelia, adding, \xe2\x80\x9chopefully they won\xe2\x80\x99t ask for that back.\xe2\x80\x9d In light of the fact that their marriage is not recognized currently, however, she noted, \xe2\x80\x9cRight now, I don\xe2\x80\x99t have any legal rights over Amelia.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re dependent on the goodwill of people we don\xe2\x80\x99t know,\xe2\x80\x9d Tanco said, adding, \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve had nothing but support here in Knoxville \xe2\x80\xa6 and I would like to think that, yes, Sophy would be allowed to make decisions for both myself and Amelia, but I would like to have the legal backup to that, I would like to be 100% sure that that\xe2\x80\x99s the way it is going to go.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And, though the couple laughed when asked if they had ever considered whether their case might go to the Supreme Court, there was no doubt Friday that the focus was clearly on', '\xe2\x80\x94 and the national impact a decision would have.', '\xe2\x80\x9cSo many families that are in limbo or don\xe2\x80\x99t have rights would just immediately be taken care of by a Supreme Court decision in our favor,\xe2\x80\x9d Jesty said.', 'Saying that she is \xe2\x80\x9chopeful that they do take it this term,\xe2\x80\x9d Jesty added, \xe2\x80\x9cotherwise we have to wait another year, and of course that\xe2\x80\x99s another year that we\xe2\x80\x99re living with our family, and Amelia\xe2\x80\x99s growing up, that I would really just like to have us legally recognized.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Watch the full video from', ':', 'Tennessee Same-Sex Couple Talks About Marriage Fight, Supreme Court Possibility', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re
