Title: Absent Supreme Court Action, Same-Sex Marriages To Start InåÊKansas
Description: ['The 10th Circuit Court of Appeals denied Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request to keep marriages on hold during any attempted appeal by the state.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The 10th Circuit Court of Appeals refused to stop same-sex couples from being able to marry in Kansas starting next week in a brief order filed on Friday.', 'Absent Supreme Court action in the coming days, a trial court', 'from earlier this week finding that Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages is unconstitutional will go into effect at 5 p.m. Nov. 11.', 'The 10th Circuit, earlier this year, ruled in challenges to Utah and Oklahoma\xe2\x80\x99s bans that such laws are unconstitutional, decisions that the Supreme Court let stand when they turned down the states\xe2\x80\x99 request to hear appeals of the cases on Oct. 6.', 'Applying the 10th Circuit\xe2\x80\x99s precedent, U.S. District Court Judge Daniel Crabtree found that Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 ban could not stand either. He put the ruling on hold until Nov. 11 to allow the state time to seek a stay if it wished to do so \xe2\x80\x94 which it did.', 'Judges Carlos Lucero and Robert Bacharach issued the order denying Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 request for a longer stay, writing, \xe2\x80\x9cWe conclude that defendants have failed to make the showings necessary to obtain a stay, and we deny the emergency motion for a stay pending appeal.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'As such, same-sex couples likely will be able to marry in Kansas later on Tuesday, Nov. 11, or, if no offices remain open past 5 p.m., then on Wednesday, Nov. 12.', 'The court\xe2\x80\x99s conclusion:', 'update', 'Kansas Attorney General Derek Schmidt will ask the Supreme Court, in a request to be filed with Justice Sonia Sotomayor, for a stay of the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s ruling during Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 appeal.', '', 'Absent Supreme Court Action, Same-Sex Marriages To Start In Kansas', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Supreme Court To Take Up Obamacare SubsidiesåÊCase
Description: ['The justices agree to hear challenge by conservatives to subsidies under the federal health exchange.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 Wading back into the partisan fight over Obamacare, the Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear conservatives\xe2\x80\x99 challenge to the subsidies provided for under the law.', 'The question is whether the subsidies are permitted in the states that rely on the federal health exchange, which the 4th Circuit Court of Appeals', 'was the case.', 'The case,', ', centers around whether the Affordable Care Act and a subsequent IRS rule make subsidies available to people using the federal exchange \xe2\x80\x94 as opposed to only being available under state exchanges.', 'The government argues the law said that the government could do this. In July, the three-judge panel of the 4th Circuit said the law is ambiguous and the regulation allowed for it, and therefore that the subsidies given to individuals purchasing health care through the federal exchange are permitted by the law.', 'Another three-judge panel of the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals', 'the opposite conclusion. The full court there agreed to rehear the case en banc next month (in other words, the full court will rehear it). Because of that decision, there was not the traditional circuit split \xe2\x80\x94 or disagreement between appeals courts \xe2\x80\x94 that the justices generally wait for before taking up a case.', 'The justices also agreed to take a procedural case about whether district courts can allow additional time for \xe2\x80\x9cservice of process.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'update', 'White House Press Secretary Joshua Earnest called the case \xe2\x80\x9canother partisan attempt to undermine the Affordable Care Act.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Friday\xe2\x80\x99s order list from the Supreme Court:', 'Supreme Court To Take Up Obamacare Subsidies Case', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Obama Introduces Loretta Lynch As His Pick For AttorneyåÊGeneral
Description: ['If confirmed by the Senate, Lynch will be the first black woman to hold the post.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Updated \xe2\x80\x94 Nov. 8, 2.20 p.m. ET', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 President Obama announced Saturday that he is nominating U.S. Attorney Loretta Lynch to replace outgoing Attorney General Eric Holder.', 'Lynch, the chief federal prosecutor in the Eastern District of New York, would be the first black woman to serve as the nation\xe2\x80\x99s top law enforcement officer.', 'At a ceremony in the Roosevelt Room of the White House, President Obama described Lynch, 55, as a \xe2\x80\x9ctough and fair\xe2\x80\x9d prosecutor who deserves Senate confirmation without delay.', '\xe2\x80\x9cShe has spent years in the trenches as a prosecutor, aggressively fighting terrorism, financial fraud, cybercrime, all while vigorously defending civil rights,\xe2\x80\x9d Obama said.', '\xe2\x80\x9cLoretta might be the only lawyer in America who battles mobsters and drug lords and terrorists, and still has the reputation for being a charming people person,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'Accepting the nomination, Lynch thanked the president for placing his trust in her.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI pledge today to you and to the American people that if I have the honor of being confirmed by the Senate, I will wake up every morning with the protection of the American people my first thought,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd I will work every day to safeguard our citizens, our liberties, our rights, and this great nation which have given so much to me and my family.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The president also thanked Eric Holder, the outgoing attorney general, for his service, describing America as \xe2\x80\x9csafer and freer\xe2\x80\x9d as a result.', '', 'In a statement to the press on Friday evening, White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest praised Lynch\xe2\x80\x99s record of public service.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMs. Lynch is a strong, independent prosecutor who has twice led one of the most important U.S. Attorney\xe2\x80\x99s Offices in the country,\xe2\x80\x9d Earnest said. \xe2\x80\x9cShe will succeed Eric Holder, whose tenure has been marked by historic gains in the areas of criminal justice reform and civil rights enforcement.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The Alliance for Justice, a generally progressive group that tracks judicial and other legal nominations, strongly backed Lynch for the role.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIn addition to handling major cases involving everything from police brutality to cybercrime, Lynch is a key policy advisor to Eric Holder. We are confident that Lynch will build on Holder\xe2\x80\x99s strong legacy of standing up for civil rights and ensuring equal justice for all Americans,\xe2\x80\x9d AFJ president Nan Aron said in a statement. \xe2\x80\x9cWe call on Ms. Lynch to take a leading role in addressing the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s repeated efforts to deny access to the courts and the ballot box.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The nomination was initially reported by CNN on Friday. Administration officials said early Friday evening that Obama would nominate Lynch on Saturday.', 'At the regular press briefing Friday, White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest declined to comment on the report and said no attorney general decision has been made.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI know that there is a lot of attention around some news reports indicating that the president\xe2\x80\x99s prepared to announce his nominee to be the next attorney general,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cThe president has not made a decision on that, and we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to have any personnel announcements on that matter at all today.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Latino advocacy groups had been', 'the White House to nominate Labor Secretary Tom Perez to replace Holder. Solicitor General Donald Verrilli Jr., the Justice Department\xe2\x80\x99s top Supreme Court lawyer, also had been discussed as a possible pick.', 'Arturo Vargas, executive director of the National Association of Latino Elected and Appointed Officials \xe2\x80\x94 one of the groups that pushed Perez\xe2\x80\x99s name for the attorney general job \xe2\x80\x94 said he was \xe2\x80\x9cdisappointed\xe2\x80\x9d Perez didn\xe2\x80\x99t get the nomination. But he said Lynch was someone Latino advocates can work with, and he didn\xe2\x80\x99t expect much public outcry from the Latino groups that pushed Perez.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s no net loss here,\xe2\x80\x9d Vargas said, noting there are three Latino members of Obama\xe2\x80\x99s cabinet. \xe2\x80\x9cPerez remains as Labor Secretary.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Perez was a former head of the Department of Justice\xe2\x80\x99s civil rights division and had a background that energized civil rights advocates. Lynch has had less experience with voting rights and some of the other key points of focus for Holder\xe2\x80\x99s Department of Justice, but a former assistant to Perez while he led the civil rights division said Lynch has the record to continue on the issues Holder has focused on.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI doubt it will mean much of a change,\xe2\x80\x9d Samuel Bagenstos, who is now a professor at University of Michigan law school, wrote in an email. \xe2\x80\x9cLynch\xe2\x80\x99s office has one of the more active civil rights units of any US Attorney\xe2\x80\x99s office, and I think she\xe2\x80\x99s been very supportive of their work.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Obama Introduces Loretta Lynch As His Pick For Attorney General', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! Title: Missouri‰Ûªs Same-Sex Marriage Ban Is Unconstitutional, Federal JudgeåÊRules
Description: ['A second ruling in the state this week.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '[Update: Same-sex couples are marrying Friday in Jackson County, Missouri.]', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 A federal judge on Friday declared Missouri\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages unconstitutional, echoing a state court\xe2\x80\x99s conclusion earlier this week.', 'U.S. District Court Judge Ortrie Smith, a 1995 appointee of President Clinton, ruled that the ban violates the fundamental right to marriage and violates equal protection because it discriminates on the basis of sex.', 'Notably, Smith did not decide the case on the basis of sexual orientation discrimination, finding that a prior decision of the 8th Circuit Court of Appeals \xe2\x80\x94 in which appeals from federal courts in Missouri are heard \xe2\x80\x94 limited sexual orientation-based claims.', 'The decision orders the director of the Jackson County Department of Recorder of Deeds to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.', 'Earlier this week, a state court judge', 'that Missouri officials couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop St. Louis officials from allowing same-sex couples to marry.', 'update', 'Missouri\xe2\x80\x99s attorney general announced he will appeal Friday\xe2\x80\x99s ruling.', '', 'update', 'Jackson County, Missouri, announced it would begin issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples on Friday afternoon.', '', 'Read', ':', "Missouri's Same-Sex Marriage Ban Is Unconstitutional, Federal Judge Rules", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update Title: Same-Sex Couples Heading To Supreme Court After Appeals CourtåÊLoss
Description: ['Update: Couples from the Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, and Tennessee marriage cases all will be seeking Supreme Court review.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed News talks with the lawyers for the same-sex couples in all four states\xe2\x80\x99 cases.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 From Michigan and Ohio to Kentucky and Tennessee, same-sex couples and their lawyers were reeling Thursday after the decision of the 6th Circuit Court of Appeals to', 'the states\xe2\x80\x99 bans on marriages, reversing lower court decisions.', 'Almost immediately, though, the question turned to what\xe2\x80\x99s next.', 'On Thursday evening, lawyers from cases in all four states talked with BuzzFeed News about the next steps, with multiple attorneys saying that a call is planned for Friday so that the four teams of lawyers can confer about Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s decision and steps forward.', 'Lawyers in all four cases told BuzzFeed News they plan to appeal the three-judge ruling \xe2\x80\x94 but not everyone has decided what the path forward should look like. The plaintiffs could either ask the full 6th Circuit to rehear the case, called an en banc rehearing, or they could go directly to the Supreme Court and file a petition for a writ of certiorari, the formal way the court agrees to hear an appeal.', 'The decision, of course, has an impact outside of the four states, as a Supreme Court decision \xe2\x80\x94 should the court take a case \xe2\x80\x94 would have nationwide impact, and some advocates are still hoping to see that happen this term, which would mean a decision expected by June 2015.', 'Some were ready on Thursday evening already to say that they will be skipping the en banc step and heading straight to the Supreme Court. Lawyers for the plaintiffs in the Michigan case, which is seeking full marriage rights, and the Ohio case, which solely involves seeking recognition of same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages granted elsewhere, tell BuzzFeed News they plan to file cert petitions in the Supreme Court in the coming weeks.', 'Al Gerhardstein, representing Ohio\xe2\x80\x99s James Obergefell, said he will be filing a cert petition at the Supreme Court, hopefully by next Friday, Nov. 14. Dana Nessel said that she would be doing the same on behalf of her Michigan clients, April DeBoer and Jayne Rowse, although she did not lay out a timeline for the filing.', '\xe2\x80\x9cJustice [Ruth Bader] Ginsburg said they were waiting for a split on this issue \xe2\x80\x94 and they certainly have that now,\xe2\x80\x9d Nessel said.', 'Lawyers for the Kentucky and Tennessee cases, on the other hand, said they have not made a decision which route to take \xe2\x80\x94 although Dan Canon, the lawyer for the Kentucky plaintiffs, said, \xe2\x80\x9cAll signs point to a petition for certiorari without seeking en banc or a petition for rehearing.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Shannon Minter, an attorney with the National Center for Lesbian Rights who is one of the attorneys in the Tennessee case, said only that they have \xe2\x80\x9ca whole team of counsel and we are talking in the near future,\xe2\x80\x9d but that no decision had been made.', 'Canon, while expressing confidence in his case, said he was not ready yet to shut the door on the possibility of requesting an en banc rehearing, noting, \xe2\x80\x9cI think it would be foolish of anyone to be overconfident in taking this to the Supreme Court.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But Gerhardstein, the Ohio lawyer, wants to move ahead \xe2\x80\x94 and he wants everyone else to come with him.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIf they think they want to go en banc, I\xe2\x80\x99m going to talk them out of it,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cIf we move quickly, and we\xe2\x80\x99re all coordinated \xe2\x80\xa6 the goal [would be] to be heard this term \xe2\x80\x94 and I think the country needs it.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'If the cases split paths, with some choosing an en banc route, the move could, theoretically, slow things down. If, say, the Tennessee plaintiffs file for an en banc rehearing, the Supreme Court justices could hold any other states\xe2\x80\x99 marriage petitions until the 6th Circuit decides whether to hear the case en banc.', 'That delay, particularly if the 6th Circuit declines to hear the case en banc, wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily last a long time. But it could be long enough to mean that the Supreme Court wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t get around to deciding whether to hear one of the other cases until it is too late for the case to be heard this term. Such a decision would then push the selected case into the next term, which begins in October 2015.', 'Gerhardstein and Nessel want to avoid that, with Nessel saying, \xe2\x80\x9cThese couples deserve some finality, an answer to this question.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'update', 'The Tennessee plaintiffs will be seeking immediate Supreme Court review of Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s decision, lawyers tell BuzzFeed News.', '\xe2\x80\x9c[G]iven the urgency of the issues for the Tennessee plaintiff couples, we will be asking the Supreme Court to review the Sixth Circuit decision rather than seeking en banc review,\xe2\x80\x9d National Center for Lesbian Rights lawyer Shannon Minter wrote to BuzzFeed News.', '', 'update', 'The Kentucky plaintiffs will be seeking immediate Supreme Court review of Thursday\xe2\x80\x99s decision, the couples\xe2\x80\x99 lawyer tells BuzzFeed News.', '\xe2\x80\x9cSince it seems as though review of this issue by the Supreme Court is an inevitability, we are not seeking en banc review. We hope to have the Kentucky case fully briefed and before the SCOTUS at the earliest possible date,\xe2\x80\x9d Dan Canon wrote to BuzzFeed News.', '', 'update', 'Abby Rubenfeld, the lead lawyer for the Tennessee plaintiffs, updated BuzzFeed News about Friday\xe2\x80\x99s call with the counsel from all four states.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe just had a conference call with the attorneys from all four Sixth Circuit states on the marriage cases. We were all in agreement to apply for certiorari at the supreme court, and not to first seek en banc review in the Sixth Circuit,\xe2\x80\x9d she explained. \xe2\x80\x9cGiven the significance of the issue, the reality that it will end up in the Supreme Court ultimately, and the harms that all of our clients are suffering each day that their marriages are not recognized, we want to get to the Supreme Court sooner rather than later.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe hope to file within two weeks, and hopefully sooner, so that we can still be on the docket for this term\xe2\x80\x94which means resolution by june 30, 2015,\xe2\x80\x9d she added.', '', 'Same-Sex Couples Heading To Supreme Court After Appeals Court Loss', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Federal Appeals Court Upholds Four States‰Ûª Same-Sex MarriageåÊBans
Description: ['6th Circuit Court of Appeals splits with other federal appeals courts, upholding Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, and Tennessee\xe2\x80\x99s bans.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'The decision sets up a likely Supreme Court showdown over the issue.', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The 6th Circuit Court of Appeals upheld four states\xe2\x80\x99 bans on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages on Thursday, splitting with the decision of four other appellate courts and likely setting up a Supreme Court showdown on the issue.', 'Judge Jeffrey Sutton, writing for the 2-1 majority of the court, wrote the opinion upholding the constitutionality of Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, and Tennessee\xe2\x80\x99s bans \xe2\x80\x94 reversing trial court decisions striking down each ban, or the ban on recognition of same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages granted elsewhere, below.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhen the courts do not let the people resolve new social issues like this one, they perpetuate the idea that the heroes in these change events are judges and lawyers,\xe2\x80\x9d he wrote. \xe2\x80\x9cBetter in this instance, we think, to allow change through the customary political processes, in which the people, gay and straight alike, become the heroes of their own stories by meeting each other not as adversaries in a court system but as fellow citizens seeking to resolve a new social issue in a fair-minded way.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Specifically, Sutton wrote that the 6th Circuit \xe2\x80\x94 and all \xe2\x80\x9cinferior\xe2\x80\x9d courts \xe2\x80\x94 are still bound by the 1972 decision of the Supreme Court in', ', in which the court dismissed a same-sex couple\xe2\x80\x99s marriage claim \xe2\x80\x9cfor want of a substantial federal question.\xe2\x80\x9d Many other courts, including several other appeals courts, have held that Baker is no longer good law in light of the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s development of pro-LGBT decisions since then.', 'Even outside of that, however, of the constitutional claims brought by same-sex couples \xe2\x80\x94 including \xe2\x80\x9coriginalism; rational basis review; animus; fundamental rights; suspect classifications; evolving meaning\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 Sutton concluded, \xe2\x80\x9cNot one of the plaintiffs\xe2\x80\x99 theories, however, makes the case for constitutionalizing the definition of marriage and for removing the issue from the place it has been since the founding: in the hands of state voters.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Judge Deborah Cook joined Sutton\xe2\x80\x99s opinion, while Judge Martha Craig Daughtrey dissented from the decision.', 'In addressing the majority\xe2\x80\x99s opinion, Daughtrey examined the four other appellate opinions \xe2\x80\x94 from the 4th, 7th, 9th, and 10th circuits \xe2\x80\x94 before concluding, \xe2\x80\x9c[I]t would seem unnecessary for this court to do more than cite those cases in affirming the district courts\xe2\x80\x99 decisions in the six cases now before us.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'She then added: \xe2\x80\x9cBecause the correct result is so obvious, one is tempted to speculate that the majority has purposefully taken the contrary position to create the circuit split regarding the legality of same- sex marriage that could prompt a grant of certiorari by the Supreme Court and an end to the uncertainty of status and the interstate chaos that the current discrepancy in state laws threatens.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'In responding to the entire premise of Sutton\xe2\x80\x99s ruling in her conclusion, Daughtrey wrote, \xe2\x80\x9cIf we in the judiciary do not have the authority, and indeed the responsibility, to right fundamental wrongs left excused by a majority of the electorate, our whole intricate, constitutional system of checks and balances, as well as the oaths to which we swore, prove to be nothing but shams.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'In the coming days, any of the plaintiffs could ask the Supreme Court to review the decision, which \xe2\x80\x94 if the justice take the appeal \xe2\x80\x94 could set up a Supreme Court hearing on the issue this coming March and a decision expected by the end of June.', 'In September, in fact, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg', 'this possibility, noting that \xe2\x80\x9csome urgency\xe2\x80\x9d would be added to the issue if the 6th Circuit issued a ruling that differed with the others.', '3.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'Here\xe2\x80\x99s how Judge Sutton, writing the majority opinion, sets up the case:', 'Sutton first found that the 1972 Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s summary dismissal of a marriage claim in', 'still applies to lower courts:', 'Sutton then hits at his central point, and ultimate decision:', 'Sutton found two rational bases for upholding the bans, first the \xe2\x80\x9cresponsible procreation\xe2\x80\x9d argument:', 'Noting, however, that same-sex couples make a good policy \xe2\x80\x94 not legal \xe2\x80\x94 argument for marriage equality:', 'Secondly, Sutton agreed that the \xe2\x80\x9cwait and see\xe2\x80\x9d argument provided for a rational basis:', 'Sutton also held that the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s prior recognition of \xe2\x80\x9cmarriage\xe2\x80\x9d as a fundamental right does not include same-sex couples:', 'Sutton concludes for the court:', 'Judge Daughtrey, meanwhile, was not impressed with Sutton\xe2\x80\x99s handiwork:', 'Examining the district court decision in the Michigan case \xe2\x80\x94 where a full trial was held \xe2\x80\x94 Daughtrey countered Sutton\xe2\x80\x99s two bases for upholding the bans:', 'Looking at the other appeals court\xe2\x80\x99s decisions, Daughtrey then noted:', 'Read', ':', "Federal Appeals Court Upholds Four States' Same-Sex Marriage Bans", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced Title: With Attorney General Pick, Obama Will Set The Tone For His Last TwoåÊYears
Description: ['Will the president keep liberalism on the table by nominating Tom Perez?']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The first, biggest, clearest sign of how President Obama will govern in the last two years of his presidency will be whether he decides to nominate Labor Secretary Tom Perez to take over the Justice Department.', 'Administration officials have not signaled who will be nominated to replace Attorney General Eric Holder since he announced his intention to step down earlier this year \xe2\x80\x94 and now after Tuesday\xe2\x80\x99s Republican wave, the White House has dwindling time before the GOP takes control of the Senate.', 'Nominating Holder\xe2\x80\x99s replacement will signal loudly \xe2\x80\x94 more than anything the president said in an hour-long news conference Wednesday where \xe2\x80\x9ccompromise\xe2\x80\x9d appeared to be the word of the day \xe2\x80\x94 how aggressive the White House plans to be in the final two years of the Obama presidency. It will likely be the first big move Obama takes in the post-midterm landscape. Who will his nominee be, and when will the name be sent to the Senate?', 'Obama mostly brushed the question of the attorney general nomination aside this week, citing \xe2\x80\x9ca number of outstanding candidates\xe2\x80\x9d under consideration. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m confident that we\xe2\x80\x99ll find somebody who is well-qualified, will elicit the confidence of the American people, will uphold their constitutional obligations and rule of law, and will get confirmed by the Senate,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'Perez is the liberals\xe2\x80\x99 pick, with Latinos \xe2\x80\x94 from the', 'to the', '\xe2\x80\x94 already outright endorsing him for attorney general. Perez has a strong base of support from the broader civil rights community from his time running the Civil Rights Division at the Justice Department, as well, and he\xe2\x80\x99s got plenty of friends backing him in', '. On Monday, Perez will be addressing the annual dinner of the National Women\xe2\x80\x99s Law Center, along with longtime Obama friend and Commerce Secretary Penny Pritzker. The speech will give Perez the chance to woo another main group of the liberal coalition \xe2\x80\x94 and he\xe2\x80\x99ll be doing it with Pritzker at his side.', 'Picking Perez, and potentially sending him through the lame-duck session of the Senate, would be an aggressive, confrontational move \xe2\x80\x94 the Labor secretary is not popular at all with Republicans, particularly regarding', 'on \xe2\x80\x9cdisparate impact\xe2\x80\x9d enforcement of civil rights laws and regulations. The confirmation process for Perez\xe2\x80\x99s current position was heated.', 'The alternative is more sedate: The administration could nominate someone like Solicitor General Don Verrilli, a former lawyer at Jenner & Block who has represented big corporate interests, as well as the government and pro bono clients \xe2\x80\x94 something that might be seen as a way of \xe2\x80\x9ccompromising and being constructive,\xe2\x80\x9d as Obama discussed on Wednesday.', 'Outside potential changes to the criminal justice system \xe2\x80\x94 an increasingly bipartisan interest \xe2\x80\x94 liberal legislation is off the table over the next two years. Obama could make few more clear signs that he wants to empower the Justice Department to take the lead on cementing a liberal or progressive legacy for the administration than going with Perez.', 'With Attorney General Pick, Obama Will Set The Tone For His Last Two Years', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Judge Rules Missouri Can‰Ûªt Keep St. Louis Officials From Marrying Same-SexåÊCouples
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9c[T]he infringement of the fundamental right to marry \xe2\x80\xa6 is unconstitutional in violation of the Due Process Clause to the Fourteenth Amendment of the United States Constitution.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 A state court judge in Missouri on Wednesday ruled that the state\xe2\x80\x99s ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages is unconstitutional, allowing same-sex couples to marry in St. Louis.', 'With no stay putting his ruling on hold, Judge Rex Burlison\xe2\x80\x99s ruling means same-sex couples, at least within St. Louis, should be able to marry immediately.', 'The state had filed the lawsuit over the summer to stop St. Louis officials from issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples.', 'Although Burlison declared the state\xe2\x80\x99s ban unconstitutional, the only apparent direct impact of the litigation is that St. Louis officials can issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.', 'BuzzFeed News has asked Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon and Attorney General Chris Koster\xe2\x80\x99s offices for information about whether the state will appeal the ruling and whether the state officials will interpret the ruling as having statewide effect.', 'The statewide LGBT group, PROMO Missouri, suggested that all residents of Missouri could now marry same-sex partners if they wished by going to St. Louis City Hall:', 'ALL Missouri residents can get their marriage licenses in St. Louis City now located at the St. Louis City Hall! #ShowMeMarriage', 'About a month ago, another state judge', 'that Missouri had to recognize the marriages of same-sex couples who marriage legally elsewhere \xe2\x80\x94 a decision that state officials did not appeal.', 'Here is the court\xe2\x80\x99s order:', 'Same-sex couples began applying for marriage licenses almost immediately in St. Louis:', 'NOW: Emotional for first same-sex couple to show up at #STL City Hall. @kmoxnews', 'Read', ':', 'update', 'Missouri Attorney General Chris Koster has appealed the ruling, he said in a statement, but will not seek a stay of the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s ruling pending appeal.', '', 'update', 'The only comment from Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon\xe2\x80\x99s office on today\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ruling was a spokesman\xe2\x80\x99s comment that \xe2\x80\x9cfor right now we\xe2\x80\x99ll need to refer you to the Missouri Attorney General\xe2\x80\x99s Office.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', "Judge Rules Missouri Can't Keep St. Louis Officials From Marrying Same-Sex Couples", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Federal Judge Strikes Down Kansas Same-Sex Marriage Ban On ElectionåÊDay
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9c[T]he Court concludes that Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 same-sex marriage ban violates the Fourteenth Amendment to the Constitution.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'No marriages immediately, as ruling is on hold until Nov. 11. [Update: Kansas attorney general will appeal the ruling.]', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 As voters in Kansas went to the polls to vote whether to re-elect their statewide officials, as well as Sen. Pat Roberts, a federal judge threw another issue into the middle of the day with a ruling that the states\xe2\x80\x99 ban on same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriages is unconstitutional.', 'Weddings didn\xe2\x80\x99t start on Election Day, though, as U.S. District Court Judge Daniel Crabtree issued a temporary stay, putting the ruling on hold until 5 p.m. CT Nov. 11 \xe2\x80\x94 or at such time as the state and county officials inform the court that they will not be appealing the ruling.', 'The ruling in Kansas follows the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s decision in October to let a lower court ruling stand from the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals that found Utah\xe2\x80\x99s similar ban to be unconstitutional. Because appeals from federal courts in Kansas are heard by the 10th Circuit, that ruling binds federal judges in Kansas.', '\xe2\x80\x9cBecause Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 constitution and statutes indeed do what Kitchen forbids,\xe2\x80\x9d Crabtree wrote, \xe2\x80\x9cthe Court concludes that Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 same-sex marriage ban violates the Fourteenth Amendment to the Constitution.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Read', ':', 'update', 'Kansas Attorney General Derek Schmidt is not done yet, saying in a statement that he will appeal Tuesday\xe2\x80\x99s ruling to the 10th Circuit Court of Appeals, seeking an immediate en banc appeal \xe2\x80\x94 or, a review by the full appeals court.', 'The prior decisions in the Utah and Oklahoma marriage cases came from a three-judge panel. The full court will have to vote on whether it wants to consider the en banc appeal once Schmidt requests it.', '', 'Federal Judge Strikes Down Kansas Same-Sex Marriage Ban On Election Day', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Republicans Take Control Of U.S.åÊSenate
Description: ['The GOP picks up seats, holds on to key governors\xe2\x80\x99 races, and winning governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in some blue states.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'What You Need To Know', 'Updates', '', '', 'What happened tonight', '', 'Republicans blew through expectations Tuesday night, winning the control of the U.S. Senate far earlier than projected, holding onto key governorships around the country, and winning other governors\xe2\x80\x99 races in very blue states.', 'And the GOP could still win more seats in the Senate, as Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s race heads to a December runoff.', 'The short-term political consequences aren\xe2\x80\x99t huge in Congress: Washington will remain iced for the last two years of President Obama\xe2\x80\x99s presidency, with Republicans now controlling both houses of Congress. What exactly Republicans will pursue next year is unclear; already, Sen. Ted Cruz has indicated he means to push hard for the repeal of Obamacare by any means necessary. But the wave of new lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 and the successful retention of Kansas Sen. Pat Roberts \xe2\x80\x94 gives Republicans more seats than expected down the road, even if they lose the majority in 2016.', 'The new Republican class is led by three young lawmakers \xe2\x80\x94 Arkansas\xe2\x80\x99 Tom Cotton, Colorado\xe2\x80\x99s Cory Gardner, and Joni Ernst, who came out of nowhere this year to become Iowa\xe2\x80\x99s first female statewide elected official. Cotton and Ernst are the first Iraq War veterans to be elected to the Senate.', 'Currently an outspoken hawk in the House of Representatives, Cotton will likely become the latest addition to the Senate\xe2\x80\x99s core group of hawkish Republicans: Sens. John McCain, Lindsey Graham, and Kelly Ayotte, as well as a few others who share similar views on Israel, domestic surveillance, and U.S. military intervention. Ernst, who McCain and Sen. Marco Rubio campaigned for this fall, will probably also be more in line with this group.', 'Gardner, meanwhile, defeated Sen. Mark Udall this year in a tight Colorado race that became almost exclusively about reproductive issues \xe2\x80\x94 and Gardner\xe2\x80\x99s previous support for a personhood amendment. Gardner, along with the new senator-elect in North Carolina, Thom Tillis, became one of a class of Republicans to advocate for over-the-counter contraceptives. Republicans also flipped Senate seats in Montana, South Dakota, and West Virginia.', 'The new Senate class is joined by Republican successes in a number of governor\xe2\x80\x99s races \xe2\x80\x94 most notably Govs. Rick Scott of Florida and Scott Walker of Wisconsin, who looked to be in serious trouble during the final weeks of the campaign. Meaning: Walker\xe2\x80\x99s potential 2016 bid stays alive. The Republican, hailed by conservatives as a union buster, escaped again.', 'Scott and Walker aren\xe2\x80\x99t alone. Republican governor candidates also won in blue states like Maryland, Maine, and Illinois \xe2\x80\x94 as well as pulling out tighter races in Georgia, Michigan, and Arizona.', '', '', 'Who suffered the biggest loss in Maryland? Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley', '', '', '', 'Republican Larry Hogan wins Maryland gubernatorial race', 'Republican Larry Hogan has won the Maryland gubernatorial race with nearly 52% of the vote in one of the biggest surprises in the country.', 'Hogan won decisively, despite campaign support in recent weeks from President Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama.', 'The Associated Press called the race for Hogan, a Maryland businessman, just after midnight:', 'Brown, an African American who was lieutenant governor under Martin O\xe2\x80\x99Malley, had in recent months been widely expected to coast to victory in Maryland, a deep blue state.', 'But in recent days the race was being called a toss up, even as Brown drummed up support from the President and First Lady at campaign events in the Democratic strongholds of Prince George\xe2\x80\x99s County and Baltimore.', '', '', 'Harry Reid congratulates Mitch McConnell', '', 'Harry Reid put out a statement congratulating Mitch McConnell on becoming the Senate majority leader.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to congratulate Senator McConnell, who will be the new Senate Majority Leader. The message from voters is clear: they want us to work together. I look forward to working with Senator McConnell to get things done for the middle class.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'Ernst defeats Braley in Iowa Senate race', '', '', 'Tillis defeats Hagan in North Carolina, Republicans win Senate control', 'Democrat Kay Hagan lost to Republican Thom Tillis in North Carolina', 'Hagan tried hard to make her campaign a referendum on Tillis\xe2\x80\x99 work in the state legislature. Tills tied Hagan to Obama and Washington Democrats at every turn.', 'Tillis had been the speaker of the North Carolina state house and under him, the legislature had passed a number of conservative laws that spawned \xe2\x80\x9cMoral Monday\xe2\x80\x9d protests through out the state. Progressives meanwhile weren\xe2\x80\x99t exactly thrilled with Hagan, who positioned herself as a moderate Republican.', 'Both Democrats and Republicans had poured money into the state. While Hagan had tried to distance herself from Obama, he recently cut a radio ad and spoke to several North Carolina radio stations to try and get out the vote for her.', '', '', 'Roberts wins re-election in Kansas Senate race', '', 'Republican Sen. Pat Roberts defeated independent challenger Gary Orman in Kansas\xe2\x80\x99 hotly contested and often times unpredictable Senate race.', 'Kansas was a key race that Republicans needed to retain in order to gain control of the Senate, but Roberts was considered to be vulnerable, with both Republicans and Democrats in Kansas attacking him for being out of touch.', 'The race was thrown into chaos when Democrat Chad Taylor withdrew from the race in September, leaving Roberts to face a more competitive challenger in Orman. Polls in the weeks leading up to the election had the race neck and neck, but in the end, Kansan\xe2\x80\x99s decided to send the Republican to the Senate, a trend they haven\xe2\x80\x99t veered away from since 1932.', '', '', 'Perdue defeats Nunn in Georgia Senate race', '', 'Republican David Perdue defeated Democrat Michelle Nunn in Georgia to occupy the Georgia Senate seat vacated by retiring Sen. Saxby Chambliss. This race was a key victory for Republicans in their path towards a majority in the Senate.', 'Perdue came under attack from the Nunn campaign for outsourcing jobs while CEO of Dollar General, a claim he denied. For her part, Nunn tried to distance herself from President Obama, at one point trying to associate herself with former President George H.W. Bush, but Perdue continued to associate Nunn with the President and his policies.', 'The race was seen as one of the most competitive in the country, with many predicting a potential run-off due to Georgia\xe2\x80\x99s requirement that a candidate get more than 50% of the vote to claim victory.', '', '', 'More Blue Dog Democrats lose', 'The ever dwindling group of so-called Blue Dog Democrats lost two more members tonight: John Barrow of Georgia and Nick Rahall of West Virginia.', 'Rahall has been in the House since the 1970\xe2\x80\x99s. Both men have been top targets for Republicans in recent cycles but have managed to hold on until now. Blue Dog Democrats are typically more conservative members and many were beat by Republicans in 2010. Rahall lost to Republican Evan Jenkins and Barrow lost to Rick Allen.', 'Democrat Jim Cooper of Tennessee won his re-election.', '', '', 'Massachusetts elects out LGBT attorney general \xe2\x80\x94 a first in the country', 'In Massachusetts, Maura Healey, is', 'the first out LGBT state attorney general in the country.', 'With 75 percent of precincts reporting \xe2\x80\x94 and despite a too-close-to-call governor\xe2\x80\x99s race for her boss, current Attorney General Martha Coakley \xe2\x80\x94 Healey was trouncing her opponent, John Miller, 63-37.', 'As an assistant attorney general in the Massachusetts Attorney General\xe2\x80\x99s Office, Healey played a key role in the state\xe2\x80\x99s fight against the Defense of Marriage Act, arguing at the 1st Circuit Court of Appeals against the law in 2012.', 'LGBT advocates celebrated the victory. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re thrilled for Maura Healey, who has become the first openly LGBT state attorney general in the country,\xe2\x80\x9d said Chuck Wolfe, the president of the Victory Fund, which backs out LGBT candidates for office. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s long been a fighter for our community, and now she\xe2\x80\x99ll be fighting for the whole of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Calling Healey \xe2\x80\x9can inspirational trailblazer,\xe2\x80\x9d Human Rights Campaign president Chad Griffin said, \xe2\x80\x9cMaura Healey is one of the staunchest advocates for equality we have in this country, and we join her in celebrating her historic victory tonight\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 adding that she \xe2\x80\x9cwill fight to guarantee civil rights and legal equality for all people of Massachusetts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Out congressional challengers have not fared as well on Tuesday, with Clay Aiken losing his bid for a House seat in North Carolina, Sean Eldridge losing in New York, and Richard Tisei losing in Massachusetts.', 'One of the state races being watched most closely by the Victory Fund is Mike Michaud\xe2\x80\x99s bid to unset Maine Gov. Paul LePage, but the race at this hour remains too close to call.', '', '', 'Obama calling election winners on both sides of the aisle', '', '', 'Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker wins re-election', '', 'Republican Gov. Scott Walker won his re-election bid in a competitive race against Madison School Board Member Mary Burke.', 'Walker, who survived a recall in 2012, campaigned on his conservative record of cutting taxes and fighting collective bargaining, promising more of the same in a second term. Burke argued that Walker\xe2\x80\x99s policies were too controversial and had failed to bring prosperity to Wisconsin.', 'The win ensures Walker will continue to be talked about as a potential GOP presidential contender in 2016.', '', '', 'Udall falls to Gardner in Colorado', '', 'Republican Rep. Cory Gardner defeated incumbent Democratic Sen. Mark Udall in a major victory for the Republican Party as they map out a path to a majority in the Senate.', 'Gardner attacked Udall for his support of the Affordable Care Act and other policies advocated by President Obama. Udall focused his campaign largely on women\xe2\x80\x99s issues.', '', '', 'Florida Gov. Rick Scott wins re-election', '', 'Incumbent Republican Gov. Rick Scott secured re-election in Florida, defeating Charlie Crist in a close and contentious race.', 'The state\xe2\x80\x99s economy took a central role in the campaign, with Scott citing job creation during his tenure as the main reason to keep him in office.', 'Crist was the former Republican governor of the state, before switching parties after a failed Senate bid in 2012, leading many in the state to question his policy convictions.', 'The race was among the most negative in the country, with animosity between the two candidates reaching a head in their second televised debate. Scott initially refused to come onto the debate stage because Crist had a small fan placed under his podium.', '', '', 'Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook on Election Day', 'She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t on the ballot, but Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren was the most popular politician on Facebook this Election Day, according to Facebook data. The rest of the list was made up of Republicans.', 'From Facebook:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe top election-related content shared by political figures on Facebook today. And they are listed in rank order by total number of interactions (likes, comments, shares).\xe2\x80\x9d', '1. Elizabeth Warren', '2. Paul Ryan', '3. Marco Rubio', '4. Scott Walker', '48.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '49.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '50.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '51.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'Republicans Take Control Of U.S. Senate', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Justice Department To Monitor Tuesday‰Ûªs Elections In 18åÊStates
Description: ['Locations chosen based on department\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cindependent and nonpartisan consideration and expertise,\xe2\x80\x9d Attorney General Eric Holder says.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 One of the key issues liberals flag as a', 'of Attorney General Eric Holder\xe2\x80\x99s tenure is his work on voting issues \xe2\x80\x94 a legacy he aims to continue on Tuesday when the Justice Department stations election monitors in 18 states across the country.', 'Holder, in a statement Monday, said of the effort, \xe2\x80\x9cOver the last few months, leaders from the Voting Section of the Civil Rights Division have received information from a wide variety of citizens and groups. Based upon our independent and non-partisan consideration and expertise, we have dispatched federal monitors to polling places around the country \xe2\x80\x94 just as we do during every election season.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The Justice Department has regularly taken such action since the passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965, the department noted in an accompanying release.', '', 'On the monitors\xe2\x80\x99 actions, Holder said in the statement, \xe2\x80\x9cThese officials will gather information on numerous aspects of local election procedures, including whether voters are treated differently depending on their race or color; whether jurisdictions are adequately serving individuals with disabilities; whether jurisdictions are complying with the provisional ballot requirements of the Help America Vote Act; and whether jurisdictions are complying with the Voting Rights Act\xe2\x80\x99s requirement to provide bilingual election materials and assistance in areas of need.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The Justice Department will be on the ground Tuesday to monitor polling places in 28 jurisdictions:', '- Maricopa County, Arizona;', '- Alameda County, California;', '- Napa County, California;', '- Duval County, Florida;', '- Hillsborough County, Florida;', '- Lee County, Florida;', '- Orange County, Florida;', '- Fulton County, Georgia;', '- Gwinnett County, Georgia;', '- Chicago, Illinois;', '- Finney County, Kansas;', '- Robeson County, North Carolina;', '- Colfax County, Nebraska;', '- Douglas County, Nebraska;', '- Bergen County, New Jersey;', '- Cibola County, New Mexico;', '- Orange County, New York;', '- Cuyahoga County, Ohio;', '- Hamilton County, Ohio;', '- Lorain County, Ohio;', '- Lehigh County, Pennsylvania;', '- Richland County, South Carolina;', '- Charles Mix County, South Dakota;', '- Shannon County; South Dakota;', '- Shelby County, Tennessee;', '- Harris County, Texas;', '- Waller County, Texas; and', '- Milwaukee, Wisconsin.', 'Attorney General Holder\xe2\x80\x99s message:', '', "Justice Department To Monitor Tuesday's Elections In 18 States", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: NRA Ad Firm Actually Hired A Consultant To Disprove Grindr AdåÊClaims
Description: ['The previously reported ad supporting Republican Senate candidate Tom Cotton on the gay hook-up app is \xe2\x80\x9c100% fake,\xe2\x80\x9d the political consulting firm working with the NRA says.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '[Update: Grindr spokesman says no ad networks ran the ads in question on the app.]', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The political consulting firm that has worked with the National Rifle Association to promote Tom Cotton\xe2\x80\x99s Senate run in Arkansas hired a consultant Thursday to look into claims that the gun-rights group advertised on a gay hook-up app.', 'Brett Buereck, the president of Majority Strategies, the firm that has advertised for Cotton on behalf of the NRA, told BuzzFeed News that the ad is \xe2\x80\x9c100% fake\xe2\x80\x9d on Thursday. He said the firm had engaged a third party for the investigation \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cDr. Neal Krawetz, the man who authenticated the president\xe2\x80\x99s birth certificate.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Buereck sent BuzzFeed News an eight-page report from Krawetz, which states, \xe2\x80\x9cThe findings in this report conclude that the screenshot was altered and the ad was digitally inserted into the picture.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'On Wednesday,', '', 'that \xe2\x80\x9cthe NRA is running ads for a socially conservative Republican candidate\xe2\x80\x9d on the app, Grindr.', 'Asked about the pro-Cotton ad and', 'that appeared to support Iowa Republican Senate candidate Joni Ernst, Grindr initially released a statement saying, \xe2\x80\x9cWe have both direct advertisers as well third party ad networks which supply advertising to the app. The ads you reference were served by one of these third party ad networks.\xe2\x80\x9d Noting the company has a policy against third-party ad networks using political ads, the Grindr statement concluded, \xe2\x80\x9cIn this instance, we\xe2\x80\x99ve reached out to the third party networks to have these ads removed.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Within hours, though, the NRA and Majority Strategies', 'the group wasn\xe2\x80\x99t responsible for the ad. Additionally, Buereck claimed the ad was \xe2\x80\x9cdoctored.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'On Thursday morning, asked whether the ad could have inadvertently shown up on Grindr through a third-party ad network purchase, NRA spokesman Andrew Arulanandam told BuzzFeed News, \xe2\x80\x9cNeither the NRA nor any of our immediate vendors, or those down the line, purchased ad space on Grindr. This was not an NRA ad. The ad was doctored and is a fake. Period.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Arulanandam added that Buereck would be able to provide more details. A couple hours later, Buereck did respond to BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 questions, stating, \xe2\x80\x9cWe can say definitively that we did not permit Grindr to run this ad. Most sophisticated firms are now targeting based on audience and not apps or websites. Based on the error analysis that our mobile firm did, it is highly likely that the image was doctored using photoshop or another tool.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Grindr has not responded to several requests from BuzzFeed News on Thursday about the statements from the NRA and its consulting firm.', 'update', 'Grindr officials tell BuzzFeed News that the alleged ads in question had not run on the app.', 'After the publication of this story, Grindr responded with a statement from Grindr CEO Joel Simkhai: \xe2\x80\x9cGrindr serves billions of ads on its network and we have no knowledge of the ad mentioned. We do not welcome the NRA to advertise with us.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'In a follow-up email with a spokesman for Grindr, the person told BuzzFeed News that, although Grindr had reached out to its third-party ad networks asking them to remove the ads on Wednesday, \xe2\x80\x9c[N]one of the ad networks had run the ads.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Read', ':', 'NRA Ad Firm Actually Hired A Consultant To Disprove Grindr Ad Claims', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Supreme Court Halts Missouri Execution
Description: ['The order stopping Mark Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s execution came less than three hours before he was due to be executed Wednesday.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'update', 'The Supreme Court issued an order halting the execution of Mark Christeson hours before it was due to take place.', 'The court \xe2\x80\x94 over the dissent of Justices Antonin Scalia, Clarence Thomas, and Samuel Alito \xe2\x80\x94 issued a stay of execution while Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s petition for Supreme Court review of his request for new lawyers to be appointed for him is considered.', '', 'Mark Christeson is due to be executed by Missouri at 12:01 a.m. Oct. 29 for the murder of Susan Brouk and her two children, Kyle and Adrian.', 'In an unusual filing at the Supreme Court on Monday, however, several former state and federal judges argue that the execution should not go forward because the \xe2\x80\x9crush to execute\xe2\x80\x9d Christeson has \xe2\x80\x9cprivileged finality above fairness.\xe2\x80\x9d The former judges ask the Supreme Court to step in \xe2\x80\x9cto restore balance to the administration of the death penalty.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Christeson attempted to seek federal review of his conviction through a habeas corpus petition filed in 2005, but the federal district court denied his petition because it was filed late. The same lawyers who had represented him in that late filing \xe2\x80\x94 Eric Butts and Phil Horwitz \xe2\x80\x94 have continued to represent him since then.', 'Earlier this year, when Christeson found out that his habeas corpus petition had been dismissed and that the state was readying to execute him, attorney Jennifer Merrigan began attempting to have another lawyer appointed for Christeson.', 'The new lawyer, she argued, could bring a claim that Butts and Horwitz\xe2\x80\x99s actions are egregious enough that Christeson should still be able to pursue federal review of his conviction. Butts and Horwitz could not be expected to make that argument, she stated, as it would mean impugning their own legal work. As such, she concluded, they have a conflict of interest and Christeson should get a new lawyer.', 'After the trial court and 8th Circuit Court of Appeals denied the request for substitution of counsel, Merrigan has', 'the Supreme Court to do so \xe2\x80\x94 and to grant Christeson a', 'so this can be worked out.', 'Merrigan is not alone. Several former judges \xe2\x80\x94 including retired 6th Circuit Court of Appeals Judge Nathaniel Jones, other former federal judges, former state supreme court justices, and other former state judges \xe2\x80\x94', 'with the court in support of Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s claim. They argue that \xe2\x80\x9cthe lower courts set the terrible precedent that federal courts can reject a capital inmate\xe2\x80\x99s request for relief without considering the core of his argument, or even ensuring that his attorneys are capable of representing his interests.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Another request for a stay of execution for Christeson based on Missouri\xe2\x80\x99s secrecy surrounding its execution protocol, filed by Butts, was denied by the full 8th Circuit. Butts could seek to appeal that denial at the Supreme Court.', 'Merrigan lays out Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s claim in Monday\xe2\x80\x99s filing at the Supreme Court:', 'Merrigan also claims that Butts and Horwitz have revealed privileged communications with Christeson in order to protect their own interests:', 'The lower courts\xe2\x80\x99 decisions, Merrigan argues, conflict with recent Supreme Court decisions on related issues:', 'Merrigan argues that Christeson tried to receive substitute counsel as soon as he learned Butts and Horwitz had a conflict:', 'Merrigan also argues that Butts and Horwitz had long abandoned Christeson by failing to file his initial petition for federal habeas review on time:', 'In the former judges\xe2\x80\x99 filing in support of Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s request, they echo Merrigan\xe2\x80\x99s arguments:', 'And also assert that the handling of Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s case raises larger questions about the courts\xe2\x80\x99 role in overseeing executions:', 'update', 'Justice Samuel Alito has called for additional briefing on whether Merrigan is authorized by Christosen to make the request for substitution of counsel.', '', 'update', 'Attorney Merrigan detailed in', 'that Christeson \xe2\x80\x9chad repeatedly urged Ms. Merrigan and Mr. Perkovich to replace his appointed lawyers.\xe2\x80\x9d Several statements are included in the supplemental briefing that was requested by Justice Alito.', '\xe2\x80\x9cBecause client communications are confidential, we had not previously filed those with the Court (though the record is replete with examples of his consent). Upon receiving the Court\xe2\x80\x99s order this afternoon, we spoke with our client and obtained his consent to reveal those confidential communications,\xe2\x80\x9d Merrigan told BuzzFeed News on Tuesday afternoon.', '', 'update', 'Ethics professors and lawyers specializing in habeas corpus review also have', 'to support Christeson\xe2\x80\x99s request at the Supreme Court.', '', 'update', 'Missouri officials tell the Supreme Court in', 'Tuesday that \xe2\x80\x9cthe record does not show that Christeson has authorized Merrigan, Mills or Perkovich to move for substitution of counsel.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Supreme Court Halts Missouri Execution', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: National Organization For Marriage Spends More Than $100K In North Carolina SenateåÊRace
Description: ['North Carolina House Speaker Thom Tillis is aiming to unseat Sen. Kay Hagan.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '[Update: NOM released a new TV ad for Tillis on Tuesday.]', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The National Organization for Marriage is dropping more than $100,000 into the heated North Carolina Senate race in its final days.', 'The group, which opposes same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights, spent $117,000 in postcard mailers distributed on Monday in support of Republican North Carolina House Speaker Thom Tillis or in opposition to Democratic Sen. Kay Hagan. The information was reported in a filing with the Federal Election Commission.', 'Tillis, in his role as speaker, has attempted to fight lawsuits that resulted in bringing marriage equality to North Carolina earlier this month.', 'Additionally, NOM will be running a television ad in support of \xe2\x80\x9ctraditional marriage\xe2\x80\x9d during the 6 p.m. news broadcast in Charlotte, North Carolina. The ad will run three times, at a cost of $8,400. The agreement form for the ad states that it is not communicating \xe2\x80\x9ca message relating to any political matter of national importance,\xe2\x80\x9d does not list any candidates referenced in the ad, and is signed by Frank Schubert \xe2\x80\x94 the man behind ads supporting California\xe2\x80\x99s Proposition 8 and similar measures elsewhere.', 'In a message to supporters', 'on Monday afternoon, NOM\xe2\x80\x99s president, Brian Brown, mentioned the North Carolina activity, as well as some action the group is taking in other states.', '\xe2\x80\x9cTelevision ads have been purchased and will be on the air this week in North Carolina and Arkansas. Automated phone calls have been made in California, Massachusetts, and Oregon. Mailers have been sent out in North Carolina and are being sent out in California,\xe2\x80\x9d he wrote.', 'The group earlier', 'its opposition to the two out gay Republican congressional candidates, Carl DeMaio and Richard Tisei. On Oct. 25, the group spent $4,000 on calls opposing DeMaio and $2,000 on calls opposing Tisei.', 'update', 'The new television ad, released Tuesday, expressly calls for Tillis\xe2\x80\x99 election and Hagan\xe2\x80\x99s defeat.', '', 'Here is NOM\xe2\x80\x99s North Carolina ad:', '', 'update', 'As NOM noted earlier on Monday, they also have an ad for Arkansas, which they also debuted Tuesday. The ad supports Tom Cotton, who is running to unseat Sen. Mark Pryor.', '', 'Here is NOM\xe2\x80\x99s Arkansas ad:', '', 'Information on NOM\xe2\x80\x99s North Carolina mailer:', 'Information on NOM\xe2\x80\x99s television buy in Charlotte, North Carolina:', 'National Organization For Marriage Spends More Than $100K In North Carolina Senate Race', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Libertarians‰Ûª Relationship With Same-Sex Marriage GetsåÊSerious
Description: ['In the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals, the Cato Institute makes new arguments for limits on states\xe2\x80\x99 rights in a brief filed in the Louisiana marriage case with the progressive Constitutional Accountability Center.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 The Cato Institute, a libertarian think-tank, made a vigorous case for same-sex couples\xe2\x80\x99 marriage rights on Friday \xe2\x80\x94 going further than it ever has in supporting the constitutional claims making their way across the nation.', 'In a brief filed in support of same-sex couples challenging Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s marriage ban at the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals, the Cato Institute joined the progressive Constitutional Accountability Center in arguing that the court should strike down the ban.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe Fourteenth Amendment guarantees to all people\xe2\x80\x94regardless of race, sexual orientation, or other group characteristics\xe2\x80\x94equality of rights, including the fundamental right to marry,\xe2\x80\x9d the groups argue. \xe2\x80\x9cThese protections are the \xe2\x80\x98supreme Law of the Land,\xe2\x80\x99 overriding laws enacted through the democratic process, whether adopted by state legislatures or by the voters.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The \xe2\x80\x9codd couple\xe2\x80\x9d pairing of the two groups \xe2\x80\x94 similar to Ted Olson and David Boies\xe2\x80\x99 leadership in fighting California\xe2\x80\x99s Proposition 8 and Virginia\xe2\x80\x99s similar ban \xe2\x80\x94 is not new. They\xe2\x80\x99ve filed joint briefs opposing the bans in most of the recent marriage challenge appeals, including in', '. In Friday\xe2\x80\x99s filing, however, they made two new arguments \xe2\x80\x94 both of which could have an impact beyond the marriage landscape.', 'The groups argued that the federal trial court decision upholding Louisiana\xe2\x80\x99s ban was wrong, calling out U.S. District Court Judge Martin Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s deference to the \xe2\x80\x9cdemocratic process\xe2\x80\x9d as a misreading of the 14th Amendment. Additionally, they argued that the recent Supreme Court decision upholding Michigan\xe2\x80\x99s voter-approved ban on affirmative action in higher education,', ', does not back up the trial court\xe2\x80\x99s decision.', 'Ilya Shapiro, the scholar who signed the brief for the Cato Institute, told BuzzFeed News that the brief was consistent with the group\xe2\x80\x99s long-held interest in \xe2\x80\x9cwanting an engaged judiciary to enforce individual rights.\xe2\x80\x9d As to the changes in this brief, Shapiro pointed to', 'put out by the Constitutional Accountability Center that was written by David Gans as forming some of the underlying basis for the changes in Friday\xe2\x80\x99s filing.', 'In the filing, the groups argue, \xe2\x80\x9cThe district court here lost sight of \xe2\x80\xa6 foundational equal protection principles, instead empowering the people of Louisiana to \xe2\x80\x98disparage and to injure\xe2\x80\x99 loving, committed same-sex couples, \xe2\x80\x98whose moral and sexual choices the Constitution protects,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d quoting from the Supreme Court\xe2\x80\x99s decision striking down the Defense of Marriage Act. \xe2\x80\x9cThat is a majoritarian bridge too far.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'After detailing the history of the Equal Protection Clause of the 14th Amendment, the brief concludes that the amendment \xe2\x80\x9cestablished equality under the law and equality of rights for all persons as a constitutional mandate, forbidding the people of a state from using the democratic process to subject minorities to adverse, discriminatory treatment and take away their fundamental rights. The district court\xe2\x80\x99s contrary conclusion is sharply at odds with the Fourteenth Amendment\xe2\x80\x99s text and history.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Then, the groups addressed the decision by the trial court \xe2\x80\x94 that has been made by supporters of marriage bans across the nation \xe2\x80\x94 that the', 'Supreme Court decision \xe2\x80\x9cstand[s] for the proposition that a majority of the people of Louisiana could use the democratic process to single out same-sex couples for adverse treatment and deny them the right to marry.\xe2\x80\x9d To the contrary, they argue, \xe2\x80\x9cThis is an unsupportable reading of', ', divorced from its context and inconsistent with its reasoning.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Read', ':', "Libertarians' Relationship With Same-Sex Marriage Gets Serious", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 10 faÌÄå_ons dont votre vie est diffÌÄå©rente ÌÄåÊ 18, 25, et 30åÊans

Title: 10 Ways Life Is Different At 18, 25, And 30 YearsåÊOld
Description: ['Because everything changes.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Everything.', '', '1.', 'Friendship:', 'At 18: Your friends will be your BFFs, no doubt about it.', 'At 25: You\xe2\x80\x99ve lost some along the way, but you have at least 10 to go out dancing with.', 'At 30: You count them with one hand, but they are basically family.', '2.', 'The relationship with your body:', 'At 18: You can eat pretty much anything without worrying too much.', 'At 25: You\xe2\x80\x99re the bomb.', 'At 30: They were right, everything falls.', '3.', 'Work:', 'At 18: You can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to finish school and get a full-time job.', 'At 25: You start to build your career.', 'At 30: It\xe2\x80\x99s where you spend most of your day. Including weekends.', '4.', 'Relationships:', 'At 18: You still believe that love is forever.', 'At 25: You\xe2\x80\x99ve had your heart broken at least once.', 'At 30: Love? What love? You just want someone to help you live through the winter.', '5.', 'Traveling:', 'At 18: You go wherever your buddies go and sleep anywhere.', 'At 25: You want to explore the world and everything has to be an adventure.', 'At 30: You need the beach, a comfortable hotel, and a mojito in hand.', '6.', 'Exercise:', 'At 18: You have all the energy in the world for it.', 'At 25: You do it to stay in shape.', 'At 30: You pay for the gym every month but haven\xe2\x80\x99t actually been in it for the past two years.', '7.', 'Your place:', 'At 18: You still live with your parents and your room is your hideaway from the world.', 'At 25: You live with your best friend and share leftovers all the time.', 'At 30: You get to run around your apartment naked without anyone freaking out.', '8.', 'Babies:', 'At 18: Aww, cute.', 'At 25: Your friends start reproducing and you want nothing to do with that.', 'At 30: Your biological clock won\xe2\x80\x99t shut the fuck up.', '9.', 'Alcohol:', 'At 18: The more, the better.', 'At 25: You get drunk on special occasions.', 'At 30: It\xe2\x80\x99s your best friend.', '10.', 'The relationship with your parents:', 'At 18: You fight with them all the time. They just don\xe2\x80\x99t get you.', 'At 25: You call them before any important decision.', 'At 30: You are turning into them.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '10 Ways Life Is Different At 18, 25, And 30 Years Old', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: 8 Diferencias entre terminar una relaciÌ_n a los 18, 25 y 30 aÌ±os
Description: ['Porque a todos nos rompieron el coraz\xc3\xb3n alguna vez.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'Cuando te dicen \xe2\x80\x9ctenemos que hablar\xe2\x80\x9d:', 'A los 18: Hiperventilas hasta que te desmayas.', 'A los 25: Sospechas, pero prefieres esperar.', 'A los 30: Ya sabes que se viene.', '2.', 'D\xc3\xb3nde se juntan:', 'A los 18: En la casa de tus padres.', 'A los 25: En un caf\xc3\xa9.', 'A los 30: \xe2\x80\x9cEhh\xe2\x80\xa6 \xc2\xbfMe acaban de dejar por SMS?\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'Pre juntada:', 'A los 18: Practicas todo lo que quieres decir para no olvidarte de nada.', 'A los 25: Tienes la mente abierta, preparada para hablar y
