Title: The Definitive Ranking Of Ways To Flirt With YouråÊCrush
Description: ['LOL, LinkedIn requests.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '17.', 'Voicemails', 'Aside from checking your voicemail being an arduous process that no human should ever undergo, it somehow always makes your voice sound 1000x sadder and creepier, like the villain in a Liam Neeson movie. There is almost no way to pull this off and look cute.', '16.', 'Facebook Pokes', '\xe2\x80\x9cPoking\xe2\x80\x9d hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been a thing since 2008, and even back then it was pretty weird. Why is it called \xe2\x80\x9cpoking,\xe2\x80\x9d anyway? Why not \xe2\x80\x9cwinking\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to take you out\xe2\x80\x9d-ing? Has anyone ever been poked and felt romantic afterward?', '15.', 'Facebook Messages', 'Everyone Facebook messages each other, and the read receipts make everyone kind of dread these, so all of us have a pile of unread Facebook messages we\xe2\x80\x99re avoiding like the plague. Don\xe2\x80\x99t be part of the plague. (Also, the Facebook and Facebook Messenger apps are now SEPARATE on iPhones, which is all sorts of messed up and unsexy.)', '14.', 'LinkedIn Requests', 'NICE ATTEMPT AT BEING SUBTLE AND TRYING TO \xe2\x80\x9cNETWORK.\xe2\x80\x9d Not only will your crush never check LinkedIn if they have a steady job, but also, whaaaaat? You have so many other options! (See below.)', '13.', 'Snapchats', 'You don\xe2\x80\x99t need to send a dick pic for Snapchat flirting to still be kind of awkward. Seriously, what are you going to send? Your face? Your cat? How does one even flirt on this?', '12.', 'Facebook Comments', 'Writing on Facebook in general is always a little awkward because like, no one else really cares and it\xe2\x80\x99s kind of uncomfortable for everyone to see you flirting out in the wild. It\xe2\x80\x99s the equivalent of sharing the same side of a diner booth \xe2\x80\x94 you can, but do you NEED to?', '11.', 'Emails', 'Emails are fine. They\xe2\x80\x99re not good or bad and they can be versatile and be used to carefully disguise how much you want to bone the other person if you\xe2\x80\x99re just forwarding tickets to an event.', '10.', 'Twitter Direct Messages', 'What\xe2\x80\x99s good is that the person had to have followed you back for this interaction to happen, so the creep factor is hypothetically gone, unless, of course, you say something creepy. It\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of power, too much for some, but if used correctly, it can be kind of cool.', '9.', 'Retweets', 'This is flattery in its highest form. You\xe2\x80\x99re not only agreeing with the person, you\xe2\x80\x99re volunteering to share their thoughts about nonfat yogurt with the world. No one\xe2\x80\x99s ever gotten annoyed with a retweet.', '8.', 'Calls', 'Calling is intimate and bold, so it gets a lot of points. But the act of calling can be quite terrifying, and picking up the phone even more so. Definitely gets the blood rushing!', '7.', 'Handwritten Notes', 'These are tricky because a really thoughtful, funny, romantic note on good paper written in perfect cursive pretty much makes you Mr. Darcy. But sloppily written on a Post-it with a joke that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t quite land? Serious serial killer vibes.', '6.', 'Facebook Likes', 'They\xe2\x80\x99re simple, they\xe2\x80\x99re easy, and you can do a lot of these without worrying that you\xe2\x80\x99re coming on too strong. They\xe2\x80\x99re the best way to say, \xe2\x80\x9cI want my body on your body\xe2\x80\x9d while also saying, \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve got my own life and will subtly wink at you by liking everything you do.\xe2\x80\x9d', '5.', 'Texts', 'This is a no-brainer. You want to move things forward with your crush? Text them regularly with funny musings about your day while also showing interest in their passions. Done, easy.', '4.', 'Gchats', 'Chatting on Google during the day (when you\xe2\x80\x99re at work or in class) is sneaky and sexy. It\xe2\x80\x99s basically like hooking up in a bathroom during a wedding that isn\xe2\x80\x99t yours.', '3.', 'Twitter Favs', 'Same benefits as Facebook likes, except you\xe2\x80\x99re approving thoughts over cute photos, showing that you appreciate their mind and their humor. Keep \xe2\x80\x98em coming.', '2.', 'Talking in Real Life', 'This is what everything else is leading up to after all, isn\xe2\x80\x99t it?', '1.', 'Instagram Likes', 'Is there anything more satisfying in this world than putting up a stone cold sexy selfie and having your crush respond with a resounding \xe2\x80\x9cHELL YAAAAAS\xe2\x80\x9d with the mere double tap of an iPhone screen? No, there isn\xe2\x80\x99t.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'The Definitive Ranking Of Ways To Flirt With Your Crush', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 10 Diferencias de la vida entre los 18, 25 y 30 aÌ±os
Description: ['Porque todo cambia.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Todo.', '', '1.', 'Las amistades:', 'A los 18: Tus amigos son los mejores amigos para siempre, sin duda alguna.', 'A los 25: Has perdido algunos en el camino pero tienes a por lo menos 10 personas con quien salir a bailar.', 'A los 30: Los cuentas con los dedos de una mano pero son pr\xc3\xa1cticamente como familia.', '2.', 'La relaci\xc3\xb3n con tu cuerpo:', 'A los 18: Puedes comer de todo sin preocuparte mucho.', 'A los 25: Est\xc3\xa1s en tu mejor momento pero a\xc3\xban no lo sabes.', 'A los 30: Ten\xc3\xadan raz\xc3\xb3n, todo se empieza a caer.', '3.', 'Tu trabajo:', 'A los 18: No puedes esperar a terminar de estudiar para trabajar.', 'A los 25: Empiezas a entender que tipo de carrera quieres.', 'A los 30: Es donde pasas la mayor\xc3\xada de tu tiempo. Incluyendo los fines de semana.', '4.', 'La relaci\xc3\xb3n con el sexo opuesto:', 'A los 18: Todav\xc3\xada crees en el amor para siempre.', 'A los 25: Te han roto el coraz\xc3\xb3n por lo menos una vez.', 'A los 30: \xc2\xbfAmor? \xc2\xbfQu\xc3\xa9 amor? S\xc3\xb3lo quieres a alguien para superar el invierno.', '5.', 'Los viajes:', 'A los 18: Vas donde vayan tus amigos y duermes en\xe2\x80\xa6 bueno, cualquier lugar.', 'A los 25: Quieres explorar las grandes maravillas del mundo y todo tiene que ser una aventura.', 'A los 30: Necesitas una playa, un c\xc3\xb3modo hotel y un mojito en mano.', '6.', 'Ejercicio:', 'A los 18: Tienes toda la energ\xc3\xada del mundo para hacerlo.', 'A los 25: Lo haces para verte bien.', 'A los 30: Pagas una membres\xc3\xada al gimnasio aunque hayan pasado 2 a\xc3\xb1os desde la \xc3\xbaltima vez que fuiste.', '7.', 'Tu casa:', 'A los 18: Todav\xc3\xada vives con tus padres y tu cuarto es tu escondite del mundo.', 'A los 25: Vives con tu mejor amigo y comparten comida china los domingos.', 'A los 30: Puedes correr desnudo por tu apartamento sin que nadie se horrorice.', '8.', 'Tu relaci\xc3\xb3n con beb\xc3\xa9s:', 'A los 18: Aww, tiernos.', 'A los 25: Tus amigos comienzan a tener bebitos y tu no quieres saber nada con tener uno propio.', 'A los 30: El reloj biologico no se calla ni por un segundo.', '9.', 'Alcohol:', 'A los 18: Cuanto m\xc3\xa1s, mejor.', 'A los 25: Te emborrachas en ocasiones especiales.', 'A los 30: Es tu mejor amigo.', '10.', 'La relaci\xc3\xb3n con tus padres:', 'A los 18: Peleas con ellos todo el tiempo. Es que no te entienden.', 'A los 25: Los llamas antes de cualquier decisi\xc3\xb3n importante.', 'A los 30: Te has convertido en ellos.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '10 Diferencias de la vida entre los 18, 25 y 30 a\xc3\xb1os', '\xc2\xa1Tu enlace fue compartido!', 'M\xc3\xa1s Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", '\xc2\xa1Tu correo ha sido enviado!', "Great! having and have names for all of them.', 'At 25: You plan trips together.', 'At 30: You plan what you\xe2\x80\x99re having for dinner\xe2\x80\xa6tonight.', '10.', 'Breaking up:', 'At 18: You cry day and night and swear never to love someone so much.', 'At 25: Your friends keep you company until you feel better.', 'At 30: Nothing that a drink can\xe2\x80\x99t fix.', '11.', 'Getting over your ex:', Title: 21 People Share The Best Advice They‰Ûªve Ever Received After AåÊBreakup
Description: ['The bad news: This will hurt.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'The good news: It won\xe2\x80\x99t forever.', '', '1.', 'Remember that nothing is truly permanent:', '2.', 'Try singing a song that makes you feel empowered \xe2\x80\x93 at the top of your lungs:', '\xe2\x80\x9cSing Gloria Gaynor\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98I Will Survive\xe2\x80\x99 to yourself loudly around the house. It is silly but it helps. It helps because it is silly?\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'Use a powerful quote:', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s silly, but after I was brutally dumped, my friend texted me a Max Ehrmann quote, \xe2\x80\x98And whether or not it is clear to you, no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x94 and I wrote it on a Post-it note and kept it in my pocket for a really long time.', '.\xe2\x80\x9d', '4.', 'Try out the baby penguin trick:', '\xe2\x80\x9cOne time my friend sent me a GIF of a little baby penguin running, then falling down, and getting back up again and continuing to run like nothing happened. She said, \xe2\x80\x98Look, if the little penguin can fall over and keep going, so can you.\xe2\x80\x99 We still talk about that baby penguin when other bumps in the road come up.\xe2\x80\x9d', '5.', 'Use the \xe2\x80\x9cpenduluming\xe2\x80\x9d theory:', '\xe2\x80\x9cMy best friend and I have developed this theory, which usually bubbles up after breakups, that we call penduluming. Basically it\xe2\x80\x99s the idea that we are always correcting for things that didn\xe2\x80\x99t work in the past \xe2\x80\x94 so say you date someone who\xe2\x80\x99s closed off and uncommunicative, chances are the next time around your secret inner lizard brain will be looking for someone who\xe2\x80\x99s very talkative.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cOf course, this doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really ~solve~ anything, since the odds are some new type of problem will crop up (or the thing you thought you wanted doesn\xe2\x80\x99t actually turn out to be the case).', 'Master of your own fate, et cetera.\xe2\x80\x9d', '6.', 'Think of that person, formerly known as your significant other, at their lowest:', '\xe2\x80\x9cI like to imagine the person pooping. Every time I miss him, I think of him being really constipated on the toilet. Or really \xe2\x80\xa6 opposite of constipated. It feels good.\xe2\x80\x9d', '7.', 'Use your broken self:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere is something s\xcc\xb6p\xcc\xb6e\xcc\xb6c\xcc\xb6i\xcc\xb6a\xcc\xb6l\xcc\xb6 horrifying about the emotional state you\xe2\x80\x99re in when going through a breakup: You\xe2\x80\x99re a pulverized, raw, garbage ball of feelings. My best advice is: USE IT. If your thing is writing, write the hell out of it; if your thing is dancing or tightrope walking or making a ton of money (lol) \xe2\x80\x94 do that thing. In those moments when you\xe2\x80\x99re up in the middle of the night feeling like you\xe2\x80\x99re being murdered in real time and can\xe2\x80\x99t sleep, you can take that energy to the page or to the piano or to the\xe2\x80\xa6whatever it is you do. Frequently, whatever comes out of that effort is a very direct representation of your cloudy, miserable mental state. But it\xe2\x80\x99s also incredibly freeing to get the feelings ~out~.', ': Do not do whatever it is at the person. Write a letter but don\xe2\x80\x99t send it. Sing a song, but don\xe2\x80\x99t put their name in it and share it with all your Facebook friends.', '8.', 'Obliterate the memory and give it time:', '\xe2\x80\x9c', 'But \xe2\x80\x94 and I know this doesn\xe2\x80\x99t sound at all comforting \xe2\x80\x94 the best ways to get over a broken heart is a combination of distraction and time. It doesn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like you\xe2\x80\x99ll ever stop hurting, but then one morning you just wake up and \xe2\x80\x93 poof! The feeling is gone.\xe2\x80\x9d', '9.', 'Use the power of music:', '10.', 'Look out for No. 1:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThis is a lot of advice from a cluster of great people in my life, but basically it\xe2\x80\x99s to focus on yourself (', ') and better yourself. Give yourself and the breakup enough space, and do your best not to cave in to jealousy if, say, he or she is dating someone else.\xe2\x80\x9d', '11.', 'Use these three simple rules:', '\xe2\x80\x9c1) Lean into your friends, family, and people who love you.', '2) Be ACTIVE. When my heart was broken, I started swimming, running, hiking, and rock climbing. It felt amazing to know that my body was still capable of moving, functioning, and remaining strong. I loved savoring each stroke and step. I\xe2\x80\x99d tell myself: I\xe2\x80\x99m blessed to have arms to hold things, hands to grasp, legs to move, and feet to stand on.', '3) Get out! A broken heart can be debilitating, and I sometimes felt too weak/sad to make plans or be around people. But being with people was crucial to my healing. While it\xe2\x80\x99s important to have time to mourn, getting out reminded me that there was still a big, bustling, adventurous world beyond myself. It encouraged me to press forward and focus on everything I had versus everything I didn\xe2\x80\x99t have.\xe2\x80\x9d', '12.', 'Listen to your dad:', '\xe2\x80\x9cMy dad always said, \xe2\x80\x98If it\xe2\x80\x99s meant to be, it will be.\xe2\x80\x99 So if you\xe2\x80\x99re having second thoughts about a breakup, don\xe2\x80\x99t cave in and be weak. Even though it\xe2\x80\x99s not working right now, maybe years later you\xe2\x80\x99ll cross paths again.', 'Unfortunately, you may not know how bad it is until it\xe2\x80\x99s over. Like really over. You\xe2\x80\x99ll find clarity being alone, and that\xe2\x80\x99s when you\xe2\x80\x99ll thrive. You can\xe2\x80\x99t force things or make someone love you. If it\xe2\x80\x99s meant to be, it will be.\xe2\x80\x9d', '13.', 'And, listen to your mom too:', '\xe2\x80\x9cI went through my roughest heartbreak a couple years ago. I showed up in the fetal position to my sister\xe2\x80\x99s home where she had the sisterly duty of getting me back on my feet. When it first happened my mom kept repeating this stupid phrase to me, \xe2\x80\x98When one door closes, another door opens.\xe2\x80\x99 It actually really bothered me at the time, but then again, everything really bothers me when I\xe2\x80\x99m heartbroken. But now, I think about this phrase all the time. After the breakup I got to move across the country, live in New York City, be in the lives of my nieces and nephew, make new friends, and land a dream job in a field I love! So it IS true.', 'I would also say that it\xe2\x80\x99s OK to feel sad and shitty and heartbroken. It was those feelings of heartache, betrayal, and loneliness that shaped how I feel about love and dating today. It gave me perspective on what is actually important in my life. So BE SAD, EAT ALL THE ICE CREAM, and start to embrace the new life you just got.\xe2\x80\x9d', '14.', 'Hold your head up, seriously:', '\xe2\x80\x9cLike physically. Don\xe2\x80\x99t walk with your head slumped and sad \xe2\x80\x93 walk upright!\xe2\x80\x9d', '15.', 'Eat cold lasagna in your bed and wait for that \xe2\x80\x9caha\xe2\x80\x9d moment:', '\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\x98Everything happens for a reason.\xe2\x80\x99', '\xe2\x80\x98Shut up, everyone says that, it\xe2\x80\x99s not helping.\xe2\x80\x99', '\xe2\x80\x98Don\xe2\x80\x99t you think if you were meant to be together then you would be together right now and you wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be sitting on your bed, crying, eating cold lasagna and watching', '?\xe2\x80\x99', 'That was a lightbulb moment for me.\xe2\x80\x9d', '16.', 'Separate yourself, mentally and physically, from that person:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThis seems simple enough, but what\xe2\x80\x99s helped me is to stop thinking about \xe2\x80\x98we,\xe2\x80\x99 start thinking about \xe2\x80\x98me,\xe2\x80\x99 and quit talking about it with anyone that will listen. It\xe2\x80\x99s really a matter of separating yourself from that person, not just physically, but mentally as well. It helps in figuring out what didn\xe2\x80\x99t work in the relationship, why it went wrong, or even just coming to terms with the fact that nothing might have been wrong, it all just sucked and you need to move on. Allow yourself to be as awesome, if not better, for the next person that comes around.\xe2\x80\x9d', '17.', 'Use all your resources:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe best human advice I got was from a friend, who took the time to write me an email that instigated the rest of my life. She said that even though it didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel like it, I now had the opportunity to choose any bubble and get into it. And so I floated off to a different city and never looked back.', 'The best non-human advice was science. That was after googling anything to make myself feel better that I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the only one who was having crying spells and worries I would never make it out of the sad, twisty rabbit hole. Knowing that looking at pictures of an ex was the brain equivalent of cocaine, for instance, helped me classify it as a drug and cut out the addiction.', 'But mostly knowing people who had been broken for a lifetime after a devastating breakup was what kept me going: I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to dedicate my entire life to ghosts and what wasn\xe2\x80\x99t, but rather what could be.\xe2\x80\x9d', '18.', 'Immerse yourself in cinema:', '\xe2\x80\x9cI had a college buddy who would watch', 'after every breakup. Maybe that sounds kind of boring though.\xe2\x80\x9d', '19.', 'Remember what\xe2\x80\x99s important:', '\xe2\x80\x9cAfter I got dumped, a friend told me \xe2\x80\x98I know for a fact that you\xe2\x80\x99ll be OK. When it comes to breakups, there are two kinds of people. People who think the best part of their life is their love life, who will have a hard time getting over it, and people who think the best part of their life is their career. You\xe2\x80\x99re in that second category.\xe2\x80\x99', 'It reminded me of who I was, what I cared about, and all the great things I wanted to accomplish that did not involve having a boyfriend. I got over it almost instantly, by focusing on my work. But I guess if you\xe2\x80\x99re in the first category, this advice sucks.\xe2\x80\x9d', '20.', 'Do things IRL:', '\xe2\x80\x9c', 'Skulking around online can feel kind of healing in a cathartic way, but heed this warning: There\xe2\x80\x99s absolutely nothing in your computer box that can replace the feeling of a real hug from a real friend when your heart is broken. Step away from the glowing screen and get lots of hugs from the people who love you.\xe2\x80\x9d', '21.', 'Do something challenging you\xe2\x80\x99ve always thought you should do:', '\xe2\x80\x9cI went to culinary school when I was so heartbroken it felt like a physical illness. That helped.', 'Do not talk to the person that broke your heart. Do not look at his or her internet presence on any platform or in any form. Block that shit.', 'Do your best not to talk to and/or follow his or her friends online, get rid of them for a couple months, even if they are your friends; they will understand that you need some space and you do and you will stay friends with them if it is meant to be but the truth is you probably have lots of friends that won\xe2\x80\x99t remind you of your heartbreak that love you whom it will be great to spend a little more time with anyway.', 'If you get to a place where you feel embarrassed because you still need to talk to someone about your feelings about him or her, but you feel like a burden to your friends or are too embarrassed to keep talking to your friends about it, consider seeing a therapist and don\xe2\x80\x99t be embarrassed. It\xe2\x80\x99s important to talk until you are healed and that can take a while.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'You are signed in as', '.', "21 People Share The Best Advice They've Ever Received After A Breakup", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 14 Things People With Tongue Piercings Are Tired OfåÊHearing
Description: ['Did I ever ask for your opinion?']

Title: 22 Things That Happen When Someone Breaks Up WithåÊYou
Description: ['What time is it?']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s crying time!', '', '1.', 'You go about life thinking everything\xe2\x80\x99s fine.', '2.', 'When suddenly you hear the much dreaded words\xe2\x80\xa6', '\xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t give you what you want.\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'And so the tears begin.', '4.', 'You try to drown your sorrows with alcohol but soon realize that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really work.', '5.', 'And so the tears continue.', '6.', 'Your friends try distracting you.', '7.', 'But you can only think of one thing and one thing only.', '8.', 'And so the tears continue.', '9.', 'And you get angry. And you yell. And you yell some more.', 'And more.', '10.', 'You become suspicious of everyone and everything.', '11.', 'And immediately your tears turn into hate.', '12.', 'And you just want to see them suffer.', '(A little.)', '13.', 'You spend hours with your friends planning your revenge.', '14.', 'Until finally you\xe2\x80\x99re able to get some strength.', 'IT\xe2\x80\x99S TIME TO SHOWER!', '15.', 'You put on your best outfit.', '16.', 'And meet a bunch of new people.', '17.', 'Sure, you might end up going out with someone who\xe2\x80\x99s not for you.', '18.', 'And although the tears may come back, you know that they won\xe2\x80\x99t last that long.', '19.', 'Because soon you\xe2\x80\x99ll be feeling like your old self again.', '20.', 'Your confidence will be unstoppable.', '21.', 'And when you least expect it\xe2\x80\xa6', '22.', '\xe2\x80\xa6you\xe2\x80\x99ll find someone worthy to spend your time with.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '22 Things That Happen When Someone Breaks Up With You', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: Conoce al zorro mÌÁs buen mozo de Instagram
Description: ['Est\xc3\xa1 viajando alrededor del mundo haciendo amigos a trav\xc3\xa9s de Instagram.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'Conoce a Julio:', '2.', '\xc3\x89l es nada m\xc3\xa1s ni nada menos que el zorro m\xc3\xa1s cool de Instagram.', '', '3.', 'Julio ha estado viajando por el mundo conociendo a Instagramers.', '', '4.', 'Julio es la creaci\xc3\xb3n de', 'y', ', ambos argentinos, quienes quer\xc3\xadan acercar la comunidad de Instagram. Ellos nos visitaron y nos contaron un poco m\xc3\xa1s de su proyecto.', '', 'Quer\xc3\xadamos contar una historia. Ya el viaje estaba planeado, nos \xc3\xadbamos a juntar con la gente. Pero quer\xc3\xadamos contar una historia de un zorro antisocial que est\xc3\xa1 en Argentina, que camina solitario por la calles de Argentina y a trav\xc3\xa9s de la red social de Instagram empieza a conocer gente y empieza a compartir un poco su personalidad y esa es la idea.', 'En realidad la idea nuestra en un principio era con un lobo. Porque era un animal de manada y quer\xc3\xadamos hacer algo por ese lado, pero al mismo tiempo como la historia va por el lado del antisocial, el zorro es de la familia de los lobos, pero es un animal solitario.', '', '', 'Nos la hizo un amigo que hace t\xc3\xadteres y cosas para publicidad y fuimos con la idea. Nosotros no quer\xc3\xadamos comprar una m\xc3\xa1scara en un lugar de disfraces.', 'Al principio asustaba demasiado, ahora igual cuando est\xc3\xa1 as\xc3\xad sobre una mesa asusta m\xc3\xa1s pero si te lo pones es como m\xc3\xa1s divertido.', '', '', 'Mucha gente que nos pide ponerse la m\xc3\xa1scara. La gente mayor la agarran en la calle y empiezan a jugar, los chicos por lo general se asustan.', 'El aeropuerto siempre que la abren, la cara del guardia de seguridad que se queda asombrado y dice, \xe2\x80\x9c\xc2\xbfqu\xc3\xa9 es esto?\xe2\x80\x9d Pero todos se terminan ri\xc3\xa9ndose.', 'Yendo de San Pablo a Madrid Julio se perdi\xc3\xb3 junto a nuestras maletas. Estuvimos dos d\xc3\xadas sin Julio, desesperados. Lo pusimos en la red para que reclamen a la aerol\xc3\xadnea, algunos pensaban que era un chiste y parte de la historia y nos dec\xc3\xadan, \xe2\x80\x9cno, Julio est\xc3\xa1 ac\xc3\xa1 conmigo en China, Julio est\xc3\xa1 ac\xc3\xa1 conmigo en Brasil\xe2\x80\x9d y despu\xc3\xa9s de dos d\xc3\xada lleg\xc3\xb3 y hab\xc3\xada dado muchas vueltas en la caja y termino todo roto, lo tuvimos que arreglar. Fue terrible pero sobrevivi\xc3\xb3.', '', '', 'Mi abuelo (Agustin) se llamaba Julio.', '', '13.', '', '', 'instagram.com', '14.', '', '', 'facebook.com', 'This post has been translated from English.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Conoce al zorro m\xc3\xa1s buen mozo de Instagram', '\xc2\xa1Tu enlace fue compartido!', 'M\xc3\xa1s Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", '\xc2\xa1Tu correo ha sido enviado!', "Great! Title: Meet The Best Looking Fox Of Instagram
Description: ['He\xe2\x80\x99s traveling around the world making friends on Instagram.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'Meet Julio:', '2.', 'He\xe2\x80\x99s just the coolest fox on Instagram.', '', '3.', 'He\xe2\x80\x99s been traveling the world meeting awesome Instagrammers.', '', '4.', 'Julio is a creation of', 'and', ', both Argentine, who wanted to bring the Instagram community around the world closer together. They visited', 'and told us a little bit more about their project.', '', 'We had already planned our trip and we knew the people that we wanted to visit, but we wanted to tell a story. So we came up with the idea of having this antisocial fox that walks around the streets of Argentina by himself, and then thanks to Instagram he begins to share his adventure with other people.', 'The initial idea was to have a wolf because he\xe2\x80\x99s a pack animal and we wanted to do something along those lines. But we went for a fox because they are lonely animals.', '', '', 'A friend of ours that does puppets and things like that for ads helped us. We didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to buy a mask in a costume store! In the beginning what he created was too scary, so we had to work with him on that. Now, seeing the mask on a table is kind of scary, but when you put it on it looks much more fun.', '', '', 'A lot of people ask us if they can put on the mask. Old people grab it on the street and start playing with it, children tend to get scared.', 'In airports security guards always open the bag and ask us what is this all about, but everyone ends up laughing at it.', 'Once when we were flying from S\xc3\xa3o Paulo to Madrid the airline lost our bags, with Julio in them. We were two days without Julio and we were desperate. We asked our network of people to help us complain on social networks and some people actually thought this was part of our adventure. After two days of being lost, we got Julio back and he was all torn apart, so we had to fix him. It was terrible, but he survived.', '', '', 'My grandfather (Agustin) was named Julio.', '', '13.', '', '', 'instagram.com', '14.', '', '', 'facebook.com', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Meet The Best Looking Fox Of Instagram', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: The Differences Between Going Out At 18, 25, AndåÊ30
Description: ['Because we all get old.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'Pregaming:', 'At 18: You call everyone you know and the pregame lasts for five hours.', 'At 25: It turns into dinner and drinks to avoid not wanting to go out later.', 'At 30: Pregame? What? No, you need a nap before you leave your house.', '2.', 'Your outfit:', 'At 18: Less is more.', 'At 25: You have one perfect outfit that never fails you.', 'At 30: It\xe2\x80\x99s all about being comfortable.', '3.', 'Standing in line:', 'At 18: It\xe2\x80\x99s the best moment of the night, the party is about to begin!', 'At 25: Is it your favorite moment? Title: 22 expÌ©riences que seules les personnes avec des piercings connaissent
Description: ['Tout le monde a une opinion sur vos piercings.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Que vous leur demandiez, ou non.', '', '1.', 'Les gens qui vous jugent syst\xc3\xa9matiquement.', 'Apparemment, piercings = personne effrayante.', '2.', 'Quand on vous dit que \xc3\xa7a va \xc3\xaatre difficile de trouver du travail.', 'Je ne crois pas non.', '3.', 'Les gens qui vous demandent pourquoi vous vous d\xc3\xa9figurez.', 'Je ne sais pas, mais demandez-le moi encore une fois et c\xe2\x80\x99est vous que je d\xc3\xa9figure.', '4.', 'Quand vous coincez votre piercing quelque part.', '', 'Et c\xe2\x80\x99est difficile \xc3\xa0 d\xc3\xa9coincer.', '5.', 'Les gens qui vous demandent si se faire percer fait mal.', 'Une aiguille a litt\xc3\xa9ralement perc\xc3\xa9 ma peau, alors d\xe2\x80\x99apr\xc3\xa8s toi ?', '6.', 'Les gens qui sont persuad\xc3\xa9s que vous allez regretter vos piercings un jour ou l\xe2\x80\x99autre.', 'La seule chose que je regrette, c\xe2\x80\x99est cette conversation.', '7.', 'Et les gens qui vous regardent fixement.', 'Sans doute parce que vous \xc3\xaates magnifique avec ces piercings !', '8.', 'Quand vous regrettez l\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa8rement votre d\xc3\xa9cision pendant la cicatrisation.', 'Pourquoi tu me fais si mal, piercing ?', '9.', 'Mais que vous voulez un nouveau piercing d\xc3\xa8s que le dernier a cicatris\xc3\xa9.', '', '10.', 'Les gens qui vous demandent pourquoi vous avez des piercings.', 'Et aucune r\xc3\xa9ponse ne les satisfait.', '11.', 'Les gens qui vous disent : \xc2\xab J\xe2\x80\x99esp\xc3\xa8re que \xc3\xa7a ne va pas s\xe2\x80\x99infecter ! \xc2\xbb', '\xc2\xab Bah ouais, moi aussi. \xc2\xbb', '12.', 'Devenir un(e) expert(e) lorsqu\xe2\x80\x99il s\xe2\x80\x99agit de soigner/nettoyer des coupures.', '', 'Vous l\xe2\x80\x99avez d\xc3\xa9j\xc3\xa0 fait\xe2\x80\xa6 environ quatre fois par jour pendant des mois.', '13.', 'Vouloir changer vos bijoux tout le temps, mais finalement garder ceux avec lesquels vous avez \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 perc\xc3\xa9(e) la premi\xc3\xa8re fois.', '', '\xc3\x87a arrive.', '14.', 'Lever les yeux au ciel lorsque quelqu\xe2\x80\x99un de connu rend votre piercing \xc3\xa0 nouveau \xc2\xab populaire. \xc2\xbb', 'Vous \xc3\xaates tellement avant-gardiste.', '15.', 'Jouer avec vos piercings TOUT. LE. TEMPS.', '', '16.', 'En avoir VRAIMENT marre d\xe2\x80\x99entendre les gens dire \xc2\xab Mais t\xe2\x80\x99es canon, pourquoi tu t\xe2\x80\x99es inflig\xc3\xa9 \xc3\xa7a ? \xc2\xbb', 'JE SUIS TOUJOURS CANON. BYE.', '17.', 'Quand on vous demande si vous avez des piercings cach\xc3\xa9s.', 'T\xe2\x80\x99AIMERAIS BIEN LE SAVOIR ?', '18.', 'Quand vos amis vous demandent de les accompagner et de leur tenir la main quand ils se font percer, car vous \xc3\xaates l\xe2\x80\x99expert(e).', '', 'Et passer tout votre temps \xc3\xa0 planifier votre prochain piercing.', '19.', 'Assister au piercing de quelqu\xe2\x80\x99un d\xe2\x80\x99autre et avoir plus peur que quand vous vous faites vous-m\xc3\xaame percer.', '', '20.', 'Les gens qui vous demandent de quoi vous aurez l\xe2\x80\x99air avec vos piercings quand vous serez vieille/vieux.', '21.', 'Quand on vous dit que vous allez vous lasser de vos piercings un jour ou l\xe2\x80\x99autre.', 'OH, T\xe2\x80\x99ES M\xc3\x89DIUM MAINTENANT ?', '22.', 'Et puis vous regarder dans le miroir, voir vos piercings et vous sentir bien, quoi que les gens disent.', '', 'Et c\xe2\x80\x99est tout ce qui compte.', "Ce post a \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 traduit de l'anglais par les utilisateurs de Duolingo, un service qui permet aux \xc3\xa9tudiants en langue de pratiquer leurs comp\xc3\xa9tences linguistiques en traduisant des textes dans leur langue maternelle. Aidez-nous \xc3\xa0 am\xc3\xa9liorer BuzzFeed et son contenu: envoyez vos r\xc3\xa9actions et suggestions \xc3\xa0 france@buzzfeed.com. Votre avis nous int\xc3\xa9resse!", 'You are signed in as', '.', '22 exp\xc3\xa9riences que seules les personnes avec des piercings connaissent', 'Votre lien a \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 partag\xc3\xa9 avec succ\xc3\xa8s !', 'Plus de Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Votre email a \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 envoy\xc3\xa9 !', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 9 Diferencias entre salir a bailar a los 18, 25 y 30 aÌ±os
Description: ['Porque la edad llega para todos.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'El pre:', 'A los 18: Llamas a todo el mundo y el pre dura cinco horas.', 'A los 25: Se convierte en una cena para no correr el riesgo de no querer ir a bailar despu\xc3\xa9s.', 'A los 30: \xc2\xbfPre? Nada de eso. Necesitas una siesta antes para aguantar la noche.', '2.', 'Tu vestimenta:', 'A los 18: Menos es m\xc3\xa1s.', 'A los 25: Tienes un outfit que nunca te falla.', 'A los 30: Cuanto m\xc3\xa1s c\xc3\xb3modo mejor.', '3.', 'Fila:', 'A los 18: Es el mejor momento, a final de cuentas es cuando comienza la fiesta.', 'A los 25: \xc2\xbfEs tu momento preferido? No, pero bueno, te la aguantas.', 'A los 30: No.', '4.', 'M\xc3\xbasica:', 'A los 18: Cualquier m\xc3\xbasica es m\xc3\xbasica.', 'A los 25: Comienzas a ser m\xc3\xa1s selectivo.', 'A los 30: \xe2\x80\x9cAyyy \xc2\xbfpueden bajar la m\xc3\xbasica as\xc3\xad podemos conversar?\xe2\x80\x9d', '5.', 'Coquetear:', 'A los 18: Vale todo.', 'A los 25: Lo importante es intentar.', 'A los 30: \xc2\xbfSer\xc3\xa1 que todav\xc3\xada s\xc3\xa9 hacer esto?', '6.', 'Tomar alcohol:', 'A los 18: Cuanto m\xc3\xa1s mejor.', 'A los 25: Esencial para poder divertirte.', 'A los 30: Sientes que ir por un trago a la barra es como competir con ni\xc3\xb1os.', '7.', 'Ir al ba\xc3\xb1o:', 'A los 18: Lo haces en cualquier lado.', 'A los 25: Prefieres que el lugar tenga una puerta que funcione y papel higi\xc3\xa9nico.', 'A los 30: \xc3\x9anicamente vas al ba\xc3\xb1o en tu casa.', '8.', 'Volver a casa:', 'A los 18: \xc2\xbfCasa? \xc2\xa1No! Vamos de after.', 'A los 25: A las dos y media te estas yendo a tu casa.', 'A los 30: No llegas a la medianoche.', '9.', 'El d\xc3\xada siguiente:', 'A los 18: \xc2\xbfQu\xc3\xa9 hacemos hoy?', 'A los 25: \xc2\xbfPor qu\xc3\xa9 tome tanto?', 'A los 30: \xc2\xbfPor qu\xc3\xa9? \xc2\xbfPOR QU\xc3\x89?', 'This post has been translated from English.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '9 Diferencias entre salir a bailar a los 18, 25 y 30 a\xc3\xb1os', '\xc2\xa1Tu enlace fue compartido!', 'M\xc3\xa1s Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", '\xc2\xa1Tu correo ha sido enviado!', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 7 Ilustradores latinos que tienes queåÊconocer
Description: ['Sonrisas aseguradas.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'Alberto Montt - Chile.', '', '', 'Para ordenar mis ideas.', '2.', 'Y, viste como es - Argentina.', '', 'Dibujo para mantener la cordura (no creo que est\xc3\xa9 funcionando)', '3.', 'Sara Fratini - Venezuela.', '', 'A dibujar me inspiran todas esas mujeres que no ten\xc3\xadan voz y ahora la tienen. Todo eso que no sale en los medios y tambi\xc3\xa9n lo que sale, toda la objetivaci\xc3\xb3n de la mujer me lleva a dibujar m\xc3\xa1s, para contrarrestar la campa\xc3\xb1a televisiva.', '4.', 'Hay Milanesa! - Argentina', '', 'Creo que depende mucho del d\xc3\xada, pero probablemente lo que m\xc3\xa1s me inspira a dibujar son las cosas que tomamos como normales y que en realidad no deber\xc3\xadan serlo.', '5.', 'La Cope - Argentina.', '', 'Me inspiro en las situaciones de la vida diaria, tanto m\xc3\xada como de mis amigas. Un mal d\xc3\xada en el trabajo, una situaci\xc3\xb3n en el colectivo, una cita, todo eso que nos pasa todos los d\xc3\xadas es lo que intento ilustrar con humor.', '6.', 'Eduardo Salles - Mexico.', '', 'Siempre ha sido la forma m\xc3\xa1s divertida y r\xc3\xa1pida de crear, analizar, explicar, criticar o ver al mundo arder >:)', '7.', 'Olea - Chile.', '', '', 'Dibujo porque soy muy malo para conversar y para contar las cosas que se me ocurren. Es como mi lenguaje de mudo. Siempre he dibujado. Entiendo la vida en dos niveles: el real y el gr\xc3\xa1fico. Inseparables.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '7 Ilustradores latinos que tienes que conocer', '\xc2\xa1Tu enlace fue compartido!', 'M\xc3\xa1s Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", '\xc2\xa1Tu correo ha sido enviado!', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 22 Things Only People With Piercings Will Understand
Description: ['We\xe2\x80\x99re way holier than you.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'People will automatically judge you.', 'Piercings = terrible person, apparently.', '2.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ve been told countless times that it will be hard to find a job.', 'Watch. Me.', '3.', 'People will ask you why you ruined your face.', 'I don\xe2\x80\x99t know, but ask me again and I\xe2\x80\x99ll ruin yours.', '4.', 'You will at some point get your piercing(s) stuck on something.', '', 'And it will be difficult to undo.', '5.', 'People will ask you if getting pierced hurt.', 'I mean, a needle literally went through my skin, so what do you think?', '6.', 'People will try to tell you that you\xe2\x80\x99ll regret your piercings.', 'The only thing I\xe2\x80\x99m regretting is this conversation.', '7.', 'And people will stare.', 'PROBABLY AT HOW AMAZING YOU LOOK WITH PIERCINGS!!!!', '8.', 'During the healing process you will mildly regret your decision.', 'WHY ARE YOU BEING SUCH A BITCH, PIERCING?', '9.', 'But as soon as the piercing heals, you immediately want another.', '', ':: makes appointment at shop ::', '10.', 'People will ask why you got piercings, and no answer will ever be good enough.', 'Because I wanted to, obviously.', '11.', 'People will tell you, \xe2\x80\x9cHope it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t get infected!\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And you\xe2\x80\x99re like, yeah me too, LOL.', '12.', 'You are an EXPERT when it comes to healing/cleaning cuts.', '', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ve done it before\xe2\x80\xa6like four times a day for months at a time.', '13.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ll want to change up your jewelry all the time, but you\xe2\x80\x99ll end up sticking with the original piece of jewelry with which you were pierced.', '', 'It happens.', '14.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ll roll your eyes when someone famous makes your piercing \xe2\x80\x9cpopular\xe2\x80\x9d again.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99re a ~trendsetter.~', '15.', 'You will play with your piercing(s) ALL. THE. DAMN. TIME.', '', ':: bites lip ring ::', '16.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ll get REAL tired of people saying, \xe2\x80\x9cBut you\xe2\x80\x99re so pretty, why did you do that to yourself?\xe2\x80\x9d', 'I\xe2\x80\x99M STILL PRETTY. BYE.', '17.', 'You\xe2\x80\x99ll be asked if you have hidden piercings.', 'WOULDN\xe2\x80\x99T YOU LIKE TO KNOW?', '18.', 'Friends will ask you to go with them and hold their hand when they get pierced because you\xe2\x80\x99re the expert.', '', 'And you\xe2\x80\x99ll spend the entire time planning out your next piercing.', '19.', 'Witnessing someone else get a piercing will freak you out more than actually getting a piercing yourself.', '', 'OH MY GOD WHAT IS THAT NEEDLE DOING?', '20.', 'People will ask about how your piercings will look when you\xe2\x80\x99re older.', 'They\xe2\x80\x99ll look fabulous, same as now.', '21.', 'And then they\xe2\x80\x99ll suggest that you\xe2\x80\x99ll get tired of your piercing(s) in a month.', 'OH ARE YOU PSYCHIC NOW?', '22.', 'People may not approve, but when you look in the mirror and see your piercings, you feel fucking fabulous.', '', 'And that\xe2\x80\x99s all that matters.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '22 Things Only People With Piercings Will Understand', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: A Conversation On Latino Identity, Skin Color, And Portrayal In Hollywood
Description: ['Everyone wants to reach Latinos in the U.S., particularly during Hispanic Heritage Month.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Here 12 Latinos go beyond the spicy and the', 'to discuss things people still don\xe2\x80\x99t get about us.', '', '', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m the editor of Latino coverage and a BuzzFeed News reporter. I probably identified as a New Yorker first for a long time. But of course being Puerto Rican and Ecuadorian was always a core part of who I am. It\xe2\x80\x99s a part of you that you embrace and love; whether visiting the Puerto Rican side in El Barrio in Harlem or the Ecuadorian side in Queens and New Jersey, it\xe2\x80\x99s ever present. I\xe2\x80\x99ve also always been American \xe2\x80\x94 dualities are a beautiful thing.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m a reporter for BuzzFeed News. I identify first and foremost as Mexican \xe2\x80\x94 I was born and raised in Mexico City, and came to the U.S. for college. I do not have American citizenship, but I\xe2\x80\x99m lucky enough to have an H1B work visa. I also think of myself as a criollo, because my ancestors were mostly Spaniards rather than indigenous people. This last bit means that I don\xe2\x80\x99t have a personal claim to the struggles of many Chicanos, Mexican-Americans, and other U.S. Latinos.', 'I am an associate editor for BuzzFeed Espa\xc3\xb1ol. I identify myself as Guatemalan \xe2\x80\x94 I was born and raised in Guatemala and moved to the United States at the age of 15. Although I\xe2\x80\x99ve been in this country for almost 11 years, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think of myself as American, but I also don\xe2\x80\x99t consider myself an immigrant. I am lucky enough to live in a city that embraces diversity, so I never feel out of place. However, I could never call myself an American because my Guatemalan culture is the most important thing and my favorite thing about me.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m an editorial fellow at BuzzFeed. I identify first as a New Yorker, but whenever someone asks where I\xe2\x80\x99m from, I identify as being from Peru and Spain. I have never used Peruvian-American nor do I ever think I will. While it\xe2\x80\x99s probably the right definition to use, I feel more comfortable and grew up saying some variation of \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m from Peru\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cMy parents are from Peru.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m an editorial fellow and I identify as Mexican-American. I was born and raised in the border town of El Paso, Texas, where both cultures perfectly co-exist. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never been able to consider myself a complete American because of my ties with the Mexican culture. Everything I learned was in Spanish first and through the \xe2\x80\x9cMexican way.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m a staff writer and I identify as Mexican-American/Chicano, born and raised in L.A. Both of my parents immigrated from Mexico to Los Angeles back in the mid-\xe2\x80\x9980s. I grew up in a Mexican household, spoke Spanish first and foremost, and attended a predominantly white high school. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been labeled Latino, Hispanic, American, but I like to stick with Mexican-American. Being Chicano is a point of pride with me, and I like to wear it on my sleeve.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m the audio editor. Latino identity has always been a tricky subject for me. I was born in S\xc3\xa3o Paulo, Brazil, where my dad is from, and grew up in New England, where my mom is from. I grew up going back and forth between the U.S. and Brazil and always identified myself as Brazilian. I\xe2\x80\x99d say I\xe2\x80\x99m Brazilian first, Latino second, and definitely not Hispanic (Hispanic people = colonized by Spain). People forget about Brazil when they talk about Latinos, but I like to remind them that Brazil is a huge country \xe2\x80\x94 the ninth-largest world economy, and almost half of South America.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m a staff writer. Growing up in Miami, Latinos formed a dominant culture, so it was more likely that people were defined in terms of not being Latino or Latin American (\xe2\x80\x9cAmericanos,\xe2\x80\x9d we\xe2\x80\x99d call them). In Miami, I was Cuban. Moving to New York City for college, I felt more of a pressure to define myself as something other than \xe2\x80\x9cjust that\xe2\x80\x9d from other people, particularly from non-Latinos. This was also the first time I was told I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t \xe2\x80\x9cwhite,\xe2\x80\x9d despite growing up with the idea that, as a Caucasian, I was both a white person and a Latina person, and that one identity does not cancel out the other. Again, I grew up learning about and living among white, Asian, indigenous, and Afro-Latinos, so the idea that one can indeed hold multiple identities is not foreign to me. Besides, there\xe2\x80\x99s a difference between race and ethnicity. Today, I identify as white (but not capital-W \xe2\x80\x9cWhite\xe2\x80\x9d), Cuban, and Latina. Being Latina means that I feel a connection to other people with overlapping experiences and reference points, particularly when it comes to our continued misrepresentation.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m the editor for BuzzFeed Espa\xc3\xb1ol and BuzzFeed Brasil. I was born in Argentina but grew up between Colombia, Brazil, Argentina, and now the U.S. My dad is Italian, my mom is Spanish, and those two cultures are very present throughout my life. How do I identify? A third-culture kid. Yes, my passport says I\xe2\x80\x99m Argentine, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t identify 100% as such \xe2\x80\x94 I\xe2\x80\x99m a mix of it all.', 'I am an associate editor for BuzzFeed Rewind. I identify as Latino. I was born and raised in L.A. My mother is originally from Guatemala, and my father is from Mexico. I have a large family that is of mixed race (mostly white American) \xe2\x80\x94 this has perhaps factored into how I view my Latino identity.', 'Staff writer. I identify as Latino. I have mixed ancestry and have spent my entire life in the United States. I was born and raised in Texas and identify as a Texan more than anything else.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m a reporter for BuzzFeed News. I\xe2\x80\x99m half Colombian and half American. I was born in Colombia and moved to the U.S. when I was 13, but I grew up straddling both cultures. I identify as Colombian-American, but these feel like distinct halves, rather than a blended whole; at any given moment one side is active and the other is more or less dormant. This applies to language, cultural tastes and preferences, sense of humor, and the like. As such it\xe2\x80\x99s hard for me to say that I \xe2\x80\x9cidentify as Latino\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 I do sometimes. Besides, as far as things that determine the course of my life, I think my whiteness and socioeconomic background (my \xe2\x80\x9cprivilege\xe2\x80\x9d) trump these geographic and cultural affiliations.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cLatino\xe2\x80\x9d was a word I didn\xe2\x80\x99t really use growing up in New York City; if I were forced, I would have said Hispanic. But working in media aimed at Hispanic-Americans, I came to appreciate Latino identity, shared experiences, and the knowledge that everyone from brands to politicians wants to treat Latinos like they\xe2\x80\x99re all the same. While that\xe2\x80\x99s obviously silly, and there are a whole host of differences among U.S. Latinos, I\xe2\x80\x99m really interested personally in the similarities and shared experiences. A smart man once told me Latino identity is blossoming because of social media and the internet, and I\xe2\x80\x99ve come to see it as increasingly true.', 'The word \xe2\x80\x9cLatino\xe2\x80\x9d never had a negative connotation for me. I always felt, as Adrian points out, that being Latino is about the shared experiences that bind us.', 'I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know what Latino is anymore. Growing up, I always thought Latino meant people who looked like me: brown, speaks Spanish, probably from Mexico or some other Central or South American country. As I went to high school and then to college, I realized that Latino goes way beyond that. There are black Latinos, white Latinos, Asian Latinos, Latinos who don\xe2\x80\x99t speak Spanish, etc. It\xe2\x80\x99s SO complex. So vast. I generally stick to Mexican-American for this reason.', 'I really like how Norberto\xe2\x80\x99s answer touches upon just how broad and diverse a group we are. Like, what binds us together? We encompass so many experiences, religions, languages, countries, political views. I think, not to be touchy-feely about it, but it\xe2\x80\x99s based on a sense of familiarity. Despite all these differences within the group, there are things we have in common that you recognize in specific moments.', 'To be brutally honest, when I moved to the U.S. I hated being called Latina because i felt like ~most~ people were using it to talk down to me. I feel in four years a lot has changed and there\xe2\x80\x99s more a sense of empowerment within the U.S. Latinos here.', 'I think the \xe2\x80\x9cbeing talked down to\xe2\x80\x9d element is also a reason why it\xe2\x80\x99s important to identify as Latin@ in a public way. It allows us to dictate, for ourselves, what that word means and the associations that go along with it.', 'Alex is getting at something. I think of Latinidad less as a fixed category that you either fall into or not and more as a network of solidarity based on a shared history. To call yourself Latino or Latina is, in my mind, to cast your lot with other people whose position in the world was shaped by the history of Spanish and Portuguese colonialism in the Americas. When you call yourself Latino or Latina, you are assuming your part in that history \xe2\x80\x94 whether you ancestors did good or bad things \xe2\x80\x94 and you decide that you want to take responsibility for redeeming what went wrong and continues to go wrong with that history. I also think that this is a kind of solidarity that makes the most sense in the United States.', 'I dig Nico\xe2\x80\x99s point. \xe2\x80\x9cA network of solidarity based on a shared history.\xe2\x80\x9d A Mexican-American from East L.A. can have the same experiences with a Cuban-American from Miami. I think that\xe2\x80\x99s really cool and a point of pride for many Latinos. The U.S. is one big melting pot. Unless you\xe2\x80\x99re Native American, no one is truly American. People have different backgrounds in this country and, for me at least, it\xe2\x80\x99s cool to distinguish ourselves from the rest of the lot. Latin@ is our thing. And I dig that.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s really hard to use this one word/identity to define a huge group of people, but Nico, I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure there\xe2\x80\x99s always a \xe2\x80\x9cshared\xe2\x80\x9d history as much an implied one. As Latin American Studies grad students, we spent an entire year studying Spanish influences on Latin America, and one day discussing anything about Brazil. I feel warmly when I\xe2\x80\x99m accepted as a Latina, but there\xe2\x80\x99s always a moment of pause and separation when I remind people that Brazil is still a part of the whole jam. Sometimes I feel like I\xe2\x80\x99m on some kind of insane life quest in search of the answer to this exact question of what Latino ~really~ means.', 'One point I\xe2\x80\x99d like to add about \xe2\x80\x9cshared history\xe2\x80\x9d being a part of Latino identity is the role that the United States has played in that shared history. Latinidad is something that exists, directly or indirectly, in relation to the United States: as interventionist power, as immigrant destination, as finishing school and playground for elites. This may be one reason why it\xe2\x80\x99s easier for Latin Americans from different countries to relate to one another in the United States than in Latin America itself. Which reminds me \xe2\x80\x94 for me personally, being Latino in the United States is less something I feel internally than something I feel when I communicate with others. I\xe2\x80\x99m Latino when I\xe2\x80\x99m speaking Spanish in Queens, not necessarily when I\xe2\x80\x99m walking around Central Park. Obviously, this has to do with the fact that I\xe2\x80\x99m also American, I\xe2\x80\x99m white, and I speak accentless English. As such, my being Latino is never wielded against me or thrown in my face, and often isn\xe2\x80\x99t even perceived \xe2\x80\x94 which is not the case with most Latinos and with many in this discussion.', '', 'That we are all the same. One-size-fits-all kinda thing.', 'YES! One hundred percent agree with Conz. I feel oftentimes that ALL Latinos are portrayed as a Mexican stereotype.', 'I think what the media always gets wrong is when they try to \xe2\x80\x9cconnect\xe2\x80\x9d with Latinos and use a headline with the word spicy,', ', or that awful', 'story about Latinos growing from picking crops to running the farm. I always wonder, who are they targeting? Actual Latinos or other demos that will click and \xe2\x80\x9clearn\xe2\x80\x9d more of who we are?', 'To add to Ann-Marie\xe2\x80\x99s point, I FUCKING HATE IT WHEN WE GET REFERRED TO AS SPICY. For real? \xe2\x80\x9cSpicy\xe2\x80\x9d? Like, WTF? Also, English-language media is the worst when it comes to Cinco de Mayo. If I have to see another white news anchor dancing around in a sombrero and poncho and shaking a maraca, I\xe2\x80\x99m going to punch a wall.', 'I agree with the whole thing about using words in Spanish to describe us. However, what really makes me mad is the ignorance of people with geography. They think we all live in the same place. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s important to differentiate each culture so we can embrace their uniqueness. People really need to pay attention in their ninth-grade geography class.', 'Can we just ban all food-related comparisons forever? One thing I\xe2\x80\x99ve struggled with as a writer as well as a reader is how easily these stupid, simple garbage words and metaphors really stick. If I have to look at another damn headline that draws a comparison between pubic hair and the country of my birth, I\xe2\x80\x99m going to scream. It\xe2\x80\x99s dismaying to see when writers don\xe2\x80\x99t take their words or language seriously. Words hold a very specific power and perpetuate very real, extremely problematic stereotypes.', 'Another thing that irks me about the things are marketed to Latinos is that it reveals that many companies and orgs are just NOW paying attention to us. And, while it\xe2\x80\x99s true that we\xe2\x80\x99re a growing population, the reality is that we\xe2\x80\x99ve been an integral part of this country for generations. We been here.', 'This outreach never acts like we\xe2\x80\x99re American and mainstream. There was a', 'that in marketing to Latino millennials actually made fun of how brands usually try to reach young Hispanics. It did it in a really funny, smart way, because it treated Latinos as normal \xe2\x80\x94 trying to go to work, buying groceries. Sad that it came off as a breath of fresh air.', 'When I first moved to the U.S. and told people I came from Colombia, I\xe2\x80\x99d often hear one of two things: some comment about the drug trade, or some comment about attractive women. It\xe2\x80\x99s a pitfall of the ever-so-slightly informed, as opposed to the totally ignorant \xe2\x80\x94 those who reduce our countries of origin to stereotypes derived either from headlines (poverty-stricken hellhole with car bombs) or travel brochures (cruise ship paradise with cocktails and hip shaking).', '', 'I\xe2\x80\x99ll be the first to admit that I had a very ignorant view of white people growing up. White people were white. They can\xe2\x80\x99t be Latino. They don\xe2\x80\x99t know what I\xe2\x80\x99ve been through. They don\xe2\x80\x99t look like me, so we\xe2\x80\x99re different. They look like the people who oppress me. I had a very militant ideology at the time. And only later in life do you learn that you\xe2\x80\x99re a complete dumbass thinking this way. Anyone can be Latino, regardless of the color of their skin.', 'I totally, feel you Norberto \xe2\x80\x94 I had to actively divorce myself from the lessons I learned from my Brazilian family about race, class, and gender. It hurts and it\xe2\x80\x99s not easy to come up against the fact that this part of you that you love isn\xe2\x80\x99t always perfect. There\xe2\x80\x99s definitely something to the idea that as representatives of the Latino community we don\xe2\x80\x99t want to hurt our own cause by coming to terms with the serious failings that do exist. But being visible and complete as a diverse entity requires having some discussions that aren\xe2\x80\x99t always easy.', 'I have always felt that colorism and race is the biggest elephant in the room in the Latino community. Both are extremely prevalent, yet nobody ever talks about it. I am dark compared with most of my relatives and friends, and have always been treated differently because of it. Class is also a factor that ties into that. The people who have the most also coincidentally have the most European blood and a lighter complexion. It is even present in Spanish- and Portuguese-language media. If it ain\xe2\x80\x99t white, it ain\xe2\x80\x99t right.', 'Some of this is so ingrained in Latino families. Like you\xe2\x80\x99ll have darker family members who said they wanted a grandchild with green eyes or something. Implicit in that is wanting to be whiter, to', ', or improve the race, as they say, so unfortunately.', 'Norberto is right when he says that a person can be Latino irrespective of the color of their skin. I would add that there are Latinos of all classes. Sure, we are all Latinos \xe2\x80\x94 but that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that we get a free pass to not contend with the very real differences among us. The fact that there are light-skinned Mexicans at the helm of tech companies, for example, should not be counted as a political victory for Latinos.', 'That\xe2\x80\x99s another flaw in how Latinos are represented in both American culture overall and within Spanish-language media \xe2\x80\x94 by showing mostly light-skinned or, like, \xe2\x80\x9clightly bronzed\xe2\x80\x9d Caucasian Latinos, it not only fails to represent all the different races within this group, it also works to portray us as a monolith that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have its own issues to work through. Classism and colorism cast very, very long shadows over U.S. Latinos and Latin Americans, and have from the get-go. To ignore that is to ignore both the current reality of what it means to be part of the Latino experience, broad as that is, as well as the history of Latinos. So when I read something like the', 'or', 'article on Latinos \xe2\x80\x9cbecoming\xe2\x80\x9d white or choosing to identify as a certain race, it essentially ignores or glosses over the colorism and classism present within the community.', 'Adding to Alex\xe2\x80\x99s point, we like to blame English-language media a lot \xe2\x80\x94 but we also have to look at ourselves for how our Spanish-language media puts white people up on a pedestal. Just look at shows like', 'and', 'and you won\xe2\x80\x99t see too much brown in there.', '', 'Latinas on Spanish-language TV must ALWAYS be some sort of sexy. And in some shows, like', ', you can see women in the background dancing half-naked and stuff. Latinas in the media always have to be sexy and attractive first and foremost. It\xe2\x80\x99s just upsetting that there is so much pressure to look a certain way in order to even be considered to be on TV as a Latina.', 'Aaand there\xe2\x80\x99s this really complicated thing that happens when stereotypes that you really need to leave behind decide to follow everybody into the \xe2\x80\x9cBrave! New! World! of being a Latin@.\xe2\x80\x9d', ', it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to think of a moment when being a Latina on TV/in film doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean performing your sexuality in some way.', 'All I got to say here is that I don\xe2\x80\x99t LOOK like Sofia Vergara, I don\xe2\x80\x99t SOUND like Sofia Vergara, and I honestly think that the fact that the most popular portrayal of a Latina right now is Sofia Vergara is really harming us women in more ways than we might understand.', 'And that extends to the way Latinas are portrayed and discussed online, again both within English- and Spanish-language media. Do a Google image search for \xe2\x80\x9cLatina.\xe2\x80\x9d Take a glance at the coverage of women, particularly Latin American women, during the last World Cup. That\xe2\x80\x99s why I admire efforts like the one to', '\xe2\x80\x9d on Tumblr, because it cements the reality that it\xe2\x80\x99s up to us, particularly behind the scenes, to dictate, for ourselves, how we\xe2\x80\x99re represented. And a big part of that means leaving the door open behind you for other Latinas as well.', '', 'Gina Rodriguez has a new show,', ', and I think she sort of exemplifies where we\xe2\x80\x99re coming from a little bit. She\xe2\x80\x99s a Latina on TV, on her own terms, and has', 'like that of a maid. She feels she has a duty as a Latina on TV, and that\xe2\x80\x99s cool in my book.', 'Guillermo del Toro. I think because he is someone who is admired more for his storytelling and visionary style than he is for being a Latino.', 'My dad. Because he took a chance accepting a job in a country he didn\xe2\x80\x99t know and took my mom on an adventure. And after that, we all couldnt stop moving around the world and discovering new places/cultures.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m going to with Gabriel Iglesias. The dude is hilarious and he\xe2\x80\x99s himself. As he\xe2\x80\x99s said in the past, he\xe2\x80\x99s not a \xe2\x80\x9cLatino\xe2\x80\x9d comedian. He\xe2\x80\x99s a comedian who happens to be Latino. I\xe2\x80\x99ve always admired that mentality.', 'Rosairo Caicedo. She\xe2\x80\x99s from Colombia, and is a retired social worker who lives in New Haven and does a ton of really incredible work for undocumented people there. The kind of exhausting, unglamorous work that gets zero attention and yet makes all the difference in the world.', 'Honestly, Diego Maradona. He\xe2\x80\x99s never been afraid to be who he wants to be.', 'My parents, who immigrated from Peru, and despite arriving here and doing jobs they didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to do at first, made sure to somehow still get back in journalism. They now run their own community newspaper.', 'Teens on Tumblr. They show that young Latinos are awesome, creative, informed, intelligent, inspired, weird, and hilarious.', 'Jennifer Lopez. She has managed to stay relevant for a very long time, and is also a smart woman who is extremely business-savvy. She is essentially the whole package, beauty and smarts.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99d go with my Chicano professors from college. Most of them are authors and I think them writing about Latino literature really blazes a trail.', 'Manny Garcia. He\xe2\x80\x99s a kick-ass journalist, an unwavering mentor, and a good, humble person.', '', 'Maaan, my mom makes a bomb-ass', ', and if it\xe2\x80\x99s endless, that with', 'and her sauce with onions, it\xe2\x80\x99s a wrap. Music would be \xe2\x80\x9cVivir Mi Vida\xe2\x80\x9d by Marc Anthony, a banger until the end of time.', 'I would definitely, hands down, bring a huge pot full of', '. I\xe2\x80\x99d sing myself Marc Anthony and J.Lo tunes.', 'Walter Mercado and Pitbull.', 'Enchiladas & OV7 Albums.', 'Dulce de leche and Soda Stereo, all of their albums.', 'Green', 'with fried eggs. And Rubi.', 'Al pastor tacos and Celia Cruz.', 'Ceviche and Gallo (Guatemala\xe2\x80\x99s premium beer).', 'The complete works of Alfonos Reyes. And I\xe2\x80\x99d also like an endless supply of', '. Wait, no. Make that mezcal. The cheap kind.', 'Oh man, this is a tough one. I would for sure bring my mom\xe2\x80\x99s black beans \xe2\x80\x94 so delicious \xe2\x80\x94 and', '!', 'A stack of old cumbia and currulao records, and a stack of Garc\xc3\xada M\xc3\xa1rquez\xe2\x80\x99s books.', '', 'NO EMOJI CAN DESCRIBE HOW AWESOME WE ARE.', '::100 100 fire emoji little smirking dude::', '::Smirking dude:: because we\xe2\x80\x99re just too cool for everyone so they be hatin\xe2\x80\x99 on us.', '::Smiley caca:: because we\xe2\x80\x99re the shit.', '::Rocket emoji:::: because we are out of this world.', 'Smdh.', 'I hate emojis. Ban emojis!', 'I just realized I hate emojis. I\xe2\x80\x99m with Nico.', '+1 Conz. There is no emoji to describe how wonderful and awesome we are.', 'The ::smiling emoji:: \xe2\x80\x94 it represents how amazing it is to be part of such an awesome and diverse culture.', 'I feel like the ::smiling monster:: is in on the joke and has flipped it on itself \xe2\x80\x94 the way I want all of the Latinos to do. The Latino emoji smiley monster is beaming Latinidad in all directions like the sun. And it\xe2\x80\x99s a monster nobody wants to even DEAL with, which\xe2\x80\xa6well, you know, appropriate.', 'Well, this took a turn.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'A Conversation On Latino Identity, Skin Color, And Portrayal In Hollywood', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 22 Cosas que pasan cuando te rompen el corazÌ_n

Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'T\xc3\xba vas por la vida pensando que todo es color de rosa.', '2.', 'Cuando de repente te dicen las tan temidas palabras\xe2\x80\xa6', '\xe2\x80\x9cNo te puedo dar lo que quieres\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'Y entonces comienzan las lagrimas.', '4.', 'Intentas ahogar tus penas en alcohol, pero te das cuenta r\xc3\xa1pidamente que eso no funciona.', '5.', 'Y contin\xc3\xbaan las lagrimas.', '6.', 'Tus amigos intentan distraerte a toda costa.', '7.', 'Pero t\xc3\xba solo puedes pensar en lo que no tendr\xc3\xa1s nunca m\xc3\xa1s.', '8.', 'Y entonces contin\xc3\xbaan las lagrimas.', '9.', 'Y te enojas. Y gritas. Y gritas un poco m\xc3\xa1s.', 'Y m\xc3\xa1s.', '10.', 'Y comienzas a sospechar de todo lo que te dicen.', '\xe2\x80\x9cQue esta con otra persona\xe2\x80\x9d. \xe2\x80\x9cQue le dio like al instagram de no se quien\xe2\x80\x9d.', '11.', 'E inmediatamente tus lagrimas se convierten en odio.', '12.', 'Y lo \xc3\xbanico que quieres hacer es verlo sufrir.', '(un poquito).', '13.', 'Pasas horas creando teorias conspirativas con tus amigos.', '14.', 'Finalmente logr\xc3\xa1s juntar un poco de fuerza.', '\xc2\xa1ES HORA DE BA\xc3\x91ARSE!', '15.', 'Te pondr\xc3\xa1s tu mejor ropa.', '16.', 'Y saldr\xc3\xa1s a conocer a un mont\xc3\xb3n de gente nueva.', '17.', 'Posiblemente intentes salir con alguien que no sea para ti.', '18.', 'Y aunque las lagrimas vuelvan, sabes que ser\xc3\xa1 momentaneo.', '19.', 'Porque pronto volveras a sentirte como antes.', '20.', 'Tu confianza ser\xc3\xa1 invencible.', '21.', 'Y cuando menos lo esperes\xe2\x80\xa6', '22.', 'Encontrar\xc3\xa1s a alguien con quien compartir tu tiempo.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '22 Cosas que pasan cuando te rompen el coraz\xc3\xb3n', '\xc2\xa1Tu enlace fue compartido!', 'M\xc3\xa1s Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", '\xc2\xa1Tu correo ha sido enviado!', "Great! Title: Mattel Launched Mariachi Barbie And This Is What She LooksåÊLike
Description: ['Mariachi Barbie is Mattel\xe2\x80\x99s improvement on last year\xe2\x80\x99s Chihuahua-toting version.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '1.', 'For its', 'collection, Mattel has created Barbies that represent different cultures and countries around the world.', '2.', 'This year\xe2\x80\x99s doll for Mexico is dressed in a full mariachi outfit.', '3.', 'As the', 'describes, \xe2\x80\x9cBarbie wears a fitted black bolero jacket and cropped trousers trimmed in intricate golden brocade that mirrors the pattern on her impressive, wide-brimmed sombrero.\xe2\x80\x9d', '4.', '\xe2\x80\x9cFlourishes include a brilliant pink tie, low ponytail and tall black boots,\xe2\x80\x9d it concludes.', '5.', 'On social media people seemed to be divided as to whether this Barbie is a good idea or not.', 'Mattel\'s new Mariachi Barbie intended to celebrate Mexican culture. When White folks "dress up" it\'s not celebratory', 'Omg @ this "mariachi" Barbie holy shit.', 'so great to see that in a Barbie... It can get kids talking abt mariachi music, provides an opp to have a discussion.', '8.', 'This is not the first Mexico doll that Mattel has included in its collection. Title: ‰ÛÏDownton Abbey‰Ûù Exclusive Season 5 Video Hints At The Dowager‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏShady‰ÛùåÊPast
Description: ['Watch executive producer Gareth Neame and the cast of', 'offer up some playful hints about the show\xe2\x80\x99s upcoming guest stars and storylines.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cYou have to take control of your feelings before they take control of you.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Nick Briggs', 'Richard E. Grant as art historian Simon Bricker; Ed Speleers as footman Jimmy Kent; and Anna Chancellor as Lady Anstruther in Season 5 of', '.', 'When Season 5 of British costume drama', '\xe2\x80\x94 which will launch on Sunday, Jan. 4, on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '\xe2\x80\x94 kicks off, the Crawley family is once again contending with shifting societal tides in the interregnum period in England. As new opportunities arise for the working class, the landed gentry must find new ways of staying afloat. Season 5 of the Julian Fellowes-created drama features a few new faces turning up at the Crawleys\xe2\x80\x99 country estate, perhaps to aid them in this quest, as the below video indicates:', '4.', 'Richard E. Grant (', ') appears in a multiple-episode story arc as art historian Simon Bricker, who arrives at Downton with a keen appreciation for beauty.', '5.', 'Anna Chancellor (', ') guest stars as the oft-mentioned (but never before glimpsed) Lady Anstruther, who has a bit of unfinished business with footman Jimmy (Ed Speleers).', 'Oh, Jimmy.', '6.', 'Sue Johnston (', ') appears in several episodes as a new lady\xe2\x80\x99s maid, Miss Denker, for Violet (Maggie Smith). She may spell trouble for the carefully ordered existence in the Dower House.', 'Watch out, Spratt (Jeremy Swift).', '7.', 'But that\xe2\x80\x99s not the only thing that may disrupt Violet\xe2\x80\x99s patrician facade: Rade Serbedzija (', ') appears as Kuragin, a man with a certain connection to the Dowager Countess.', 'Rade Sherbegia as Kuragin; Maggie Smith as Violet, Dowager Countess of Grantham; Lily James as Lady Rose.', '8.', 'Wait, what?', '9.', 'Violet!', '10.', 'In fact, this sounds *exactly* like something Violet would caution against.', 'So who is Kuragin? And what exactly does he mean to Violet? Well, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have to wait until January to find out. But as executive producer Gareth Neame points out in the above video, Mary (Michelle Dockery) will \xe2\x80\x9cdiscover that Violet herself had a bit of a shady past that has been buried for a very long time.\xe2\x80\x9d', '11.', 'Scandal!', '12.', 'Season 5 of', 'begins Sunday, Jan. 4, on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '.
