Title: What‰Ûªs Behind Our Obsession With ‰ÛÏToo Many Cooks‰Ûù
Description: ['Adult Swim\xe2\x80\x99s surreal satire of sitcoms subverts our expectations of nostalgia.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'You might be able to go home, but it will never be the same.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d began as an Adult Swim parody that aired on Cartoon Network\xe2\x80\x99s late-night block for a week or so at the end of October, but since then, the surreal and twisted 11-minute video has gone viral in a way that even its creators,', '. What is it about this short that has exerted such a magnetic pull on so many?', '\xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d is, on the surface, initially a parody of 1970s and 1980s sitcoms that once populated the television landscape. These are the types of shows you might recall watching from the couch of your grandparents\xe2\x80\x99 house, shows like', ',', ',', ', and', 'with their familiar theme songs and title sequences, once hallmarks of the sitcom form. They\xe2\x80\x99re insidiously comfortable in a way; it\xe2\x80\x99s often impossible to watch just one of these. Networks wisely capitalized on this, building entire programming blocks around anodyne shows \xe2\x80\x94 many of which were family comedies \xe2\x80\x94 that were, in their ways, almost identical to one another. There\xe2\x80\x99s a setup, a beat, a punch line. Cue the laugh track and pause. There\xe2\x80\x99s a cheer when a beloved character enters the room, an audible and predictable reaction whenever a character kisses another or when a character gets in trouble or puts another in their place.', 'This is the communal language of television; we all know and understand these cues instinctively \xe2\x80\x94 know when to laugh, when to grimace, when to cheer. On \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks,\xe2\x80\x9d it may not be exactly', 'or', 'that you\xe2\x80\x99re reminded of, but an infinite number of other, similarly structured sitcoms that are recognizable callbacks to a very different time in comedies. It\xe2\x80\x99s a conceptual lure, rather than a specific one, that \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d casts out, capturing an era before the rise of single-cams and the eradication of theme songs and title sequences. It was still a time where everybody knew your name and, as the song tells us, they were always glad you came. Where the actors would stop what they were doing and look up and smile at the camera, a literal welcome to the viewer, a psychological semaphore waving', ', the actor\xe2\x80\x99s name emblazoned in yellow beneath their toothy glare. Because it\xe2\x80\x99s part of our pop culture DNA, we know instinctively what this signals and what it represents. It is pure bubble gum nostalgia, saccharine and devoid of calories, and that look of false acknowledgement toward the viewer makes us complicit in what it\xe2\x80\x99s selling.', 'CBS Television Distribution', 'Warner Bros. Television', 'Which is why it\xe2\x80\x99s interesting that \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d aired during Adult Swim\xe2\x80\x99s 4 a.m. block, which has hosted a number of fake infomercials, those ubiquitous and vapid marketing exercises that stoners and insomniacs love-hate in their own ways, recalling the very archetypes that Western civilization holds as precious. Highly unnecessary junk is dressed up as something essential and vital as perfect families gather around the dinner table to eat baked potatoes and steak cooked with improbable gadgets. It\xe2\x80\x99s a hairbrush that holds an iPhone. Or a food dehydrator. Or an exercise tool that\xe2\x80\x99s guaranteed to make you lose weight and regain your sexual attractiveness.', ', they whisper.', 'In their own way, sitcoms sold the very idealized version of the families gathered in these infomercials, actors pretending that the laughter and smiles around the hearth \xe2\x80\x94 or the breakfast table or exercise room or whatever \xe2\x80\x94 are genuine. This isn\xe2\x80\x99t', 'family, they assert; they\xe2\x80\x99re better than your family. They\xe2\x80\x99re perfect families, their problems always solved in 30 minutes, their issues reduced to familiar tropes punctuated by guffaws.', 'And so \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d takes this setup \xe2\x80\x94 the familiar title sequence, those yellow actor names, the trite adage masquerading as a punny title \xe2\x80\x94 and subverts the form and the audience expectations. A family comedy using the title and theme song morphs into a black family comedy into a cop drama into a', 'cartoon into a cheesy sci-fi space opera (C.O.O.K.S. \xe2\x80\x9cdefending humanity\xe2\x80\x9d against B.R.O.T.H.) into a medical drama ad infinitum, recycling and reusing archetypes we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen a thousand times. But the sketch is more than just playing with these forms; it quickly becomes darker, more surreal (Lars von Trier as \xe2\x80\x9cPie\xe2\x80\x9d), and more malevolent. That happy couple now kisses other lovers, that sexy neighbor is now always topless, and that adorable cat is now bleeding as it attempts to crawl, painfully, across the kitchen floor. This, Kelly seems to say, is not what you expected or craved \xe2\x80\x94 it is going to take your nostalgia and smash it into a billion pieces.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d moves into a true Lynchian mode, piling up bodies among an eerily distorted soundtrack, blood and guts flying everywhere, a psycho cannibal (William Tokarsky) playing all of the roles before eating body parts he takes out of the oven. He then stalks and murders a woman after she attempts to hide in the closet. It\xe2\x80\x99s an archetype of a different sort, a horror flick designed to prey on our primal fears that nonetheless pokes fun at the sitcom setup as a female actor\xe2\x80\x99s name follows her wherever she runs. Hiding in the closet, behind a folding slatted door, she\xe2\x80\x99s given away by the warm glow of those yellow letters, a glow that is meant to unconsciously remind us of the light from the television set.', 'But it\xe2\x80\x99s not just the woman who is being slain here, even as the red emergency button is pushed and the terror of the slasher plot is jettisoned. \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d wants to destroy our collective nostalgia for this form altogether. It holds up the 1980s sitcom as something worth celebrating but finds it as hollow as the products that those infomercials are peddling. They\xe2\x80\x99re unnecessary and empty, they\xe2\x80\x99re relics of a time that we long for but shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t return to. In fact, we shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t try. The collection of assembled cast members at the end, all smiling happily for the camera, isn\xe2\x80\x99t the actual ending; it\xe2\x80\x99s a fiction predicated on our own psychological need to see our best selves reflected on screen, to see the sitcom triumph over the harshness and horror of the killer. But he\xe2\x80\x99s there at the very end, worming his way into the extended family portrait, his head remaining on screen even after everything else vanishes into the darkness. Fade to black.', 'The split-second show that follows uses the all-too-familiar refrain of a man entering the front door and bellowing, \xe2\x80\x9cHoney, I\xe2\x80\x99m home,\xe2\x80\x9d an ur-sitcom staple, before the laugh track rings out and the end credits roll. It reduces the sitcom to its barest element, the setup, the gag, the most tired joke line of all joke lines. There are reasons why television moved past this format and these archetypes, why our comedies today \xe2\x80\x94 or at least the more intelligent ones \xe2\x80\x94 strive for more than just pratfalls and laugh tracks. And, consequently, there are reasons why the form idealized and then ultimately cast off by \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d reminds us of something distant and dusty from our childhoods or adolescence. In exploiting those forms, Kelly and \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d point toward the danger of nostalgia, which might have the power to tug on your heartstrings, but also to rip them right out of your chest.', 'Watch the full 11-minute \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d here:', '', 'correction', 'The psycho killer is played by William Tokarsky. An earlier version of this post misstated the actor.', '', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'What\xe2\x80\x99s Behind Our Obsession With \xe2\x80\x9cToo Many Cooks\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏDownton Abbey‰Ûù Isn‰Ûªt Going Away Any TimeåÊSoon
Description: ['ITV and PBS\xe2\x80\x99', 'have announced a sixth season of the Julian Fellowes-created period drama, just as the show wraps up its current season in the U.K.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The world within the Abbey walls may be changing at a rapid pace, but', 'itself isn\xe2\x80\x99t going anywhere.', 'ITV today announced that it had commissioned a sixth season of Julian Fellowes\xe2\x80\x99 domestic soap, which will go into production in 2015. U.S. broadcaster PBS also announced that', 'will be airing the sixth go-round as well.', 'The news comes just as', 'wraps its current run on Nov. 9 in the U.K., which scored a consolidated audience of 10.4 million so far. Per tradition, a Christmas Special will air on ITV on Christmas Day.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe have had an amazing reaction to the story lines, acting and production values of', 'this year and the whole team is thrilled to be moving ahead with a new season of the show,\xe2\x80\x9d executive producer Gareth Neame said in a statement. \xe2\x80\x9cThis will provide audiences with a fresh opportunity to see what will befall our much loved characters.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'executive producer Rebecca Eaton offered the following statement upon the news of the renewal: \xe2\x80\x9cGood news! Just as our audience settles in for the beloved Crawley family drama, we can announce that Season 6 will arrive a year later. How lucky can you get?\xe2\x80\x9d\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Those wondering about the', 'still have a little bit longer to wait: It\xe2\x80\x99s set to begin on Jan. 4, 2015.', '', '4.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Downton Abbey" Isn\'t Going Away Any Time Soon', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: Robert Downey Jr. To Reportedly Reprise Role As Iron Man In ‰ÛÏCaptain AmericaåÊ3‰Ûù
Description: ['It appears that the Marvel Cinematic Universe will get its', ', drawing on a popular comics limited series that will pit Iron Man against Cap.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Robert Downey Jr. is said to be ready to suit up again as Iron Man, as first reported by', '.', 'The 49-year-old actor will reportedly reprise his role as Tony Stark, aka the invincible Iron Man, in the third installment of Marvel\xe2\x80\x99s', 'film series, which stars Chris Evans as the time-displaced patriot soldier. If the deal closes, it will be Downey Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s first appearance in the', 'franchise, although he has previously played Tony in', ',', ',', ',', '(where his role is uncredited), and', '. He has also completed work as the snarky playboy character in', ', due out next year.', 'Production on', 'is expected to begin in Spring 2015, with a release date of May 6, 2016, set for the film.', 'Marvel Studios, Disney, and Downey Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s reps declined to comment about Downey Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s deal when reached by BuzzFeed News.', '', 'The appearance of Downey Jr. as Iron Man in the as-yet-untitled', 'lends credence to rumors that Marvel will be adapting the popular 2006-07 comics limited series', ', which found Iron Man and Captain America squaring off over the Superhero Registration Act \xe2\x80\x94 drafted into law, and requiring that superheroes register and disclose their civilian identities, after a tragedy that kills a number of children at a school in Stamford, Connecticut. Iron Man is a supporter of the registration act, while Captain America sees the initiative as an assault on personal freedoms, and he firmly opposes it and Tony Stark. Their schism results in the Avengers splitting at the seams, with heroes taking sides in the battle, a \xe2\x80\x9ccivil war\xe2\x80\x9d breaking out among the superheroes, with many seeing Tony Stark as a villain.', 'The news comes as Marvel Comics today announced', '#1, a new comic that will debut in 2015. The below artwork was sent out to press without any further details.', '', 'Is a reboot or a revisiting of the 2006 series? It\xe2\x80\x99s still very much unclear, though interestingly the above image also features Spider-Man, a pivotal member of the original', 'storyline who publicly disclosed his secret identity during the series.', 'Current and', 'in Hollywood indicate that Marvel Studios and Sony Pictures may be close to a deal to allow Spider-Man to appear in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, though neither side could confirm any such talks had taken place.', 'Robert Downey Jr. To Reportedly Reprise Role As Iron Man In "Captain America 3"', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏThe Good Wife‰Ûù Is The Best Show On Television RightåÊNow
Description: ['The CBS legal drama, now in its sixth season, continually shakes up its narrative foundations and proves itself fearless in the process.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Spoilers ahead, if you\xe2\x80\x99re not up to date on the show.', '', 'CBS', 'CBS', 'There is no need to be delicate here: If you\xe2\x80\x99re not watching', ', you are missing out on the best show on television. I won\xe2\x80\x99t qualify that statement in the least \xe2\x80\x94 I\xe2\x80\x99m not talking about the best show currently airing on broadcast television or outside of cable or on premium or however you want to sandbox this remarkable show. No, the legal drama is the best thing currently airing on any channel on television.', 'That', 'is this perfect in its sixth season is reason to truly celebrate. Few shows embrace complexity and risk-taking in the way that this show has done and, even after last year\xe2\x80\x99s stellar season \xe2\x80\x94 which saw Alicia Florrick (Julianna Margulies) and Cary Agos (Matt Czuchry) leave their mentors and start their own law firm and which shocked us with', '(Josh Charles) \xe2\x80\x94 the show has pushed itself into even more challenging territory more than 100 episodes into its run.', 'Created by husband-and-wife team Robert and Michelle King,', 'has always looked to test the plasticity of its concept. Initially a legal procedural with serialized elements, the show balanced a case-of-the-week format for Alicia with ongoing domestic issues. The first season followed Alicia as she struggled with the decision to stand by her husband, incarcerated Illinois State\xe2\x80\x99s Attorney Peter Florrick (Chris Noth), even after he admitted to sleeping with prostitutes. How would she care for their two teenage children, Zach (Graham Phillips) and Grace (Makenzie Vega), while juggling a demanding career and competing with associates 20 years younger than her? And what of her unresolved feelings for her employer, Will?', 'But these basic queries soon became further tempered by the deep themes that the show has enjoyed exploring over the years, issues of morality, marriage, technology, and legality.', 'incisively probes our collective cultural institutions to find spots of vulnerability and exposes these potential weaknesses, prodding them with a well-sharpened blade. If the show has been about, as the Kings have suggested in interviews numerous times, the \xe2\x80\x9ceducation of Alicia Florrick,\xe2\x80\x9d viewers have been able to see how Margulies\xe2\x80\x99 Alicia has had to compromise her ethical integrity in pursuit of other goals, some lofty and idealistic and others personal and perhaps selfish. Alicia has had to exist in the harsh glare of the public spotlight and make choices that others, living lives of quiet privacy, have not. Every one of her actions has been under scrutiny, both that of the public within the show\xe2\x80\x99s narrative and that of the viewer.', 'CBS', 'CBS', 'CBS', 'is historically no stranger to shaking things up. The show pushed Alicia together with tough-as-nails legal snoop Kalinda Sharma (Archie Panjabi) in the pilot episode, allowing for their friendship \xe2\x80\x94 developed over drinks and shared workloads \xe2\x80\x94 to unfold, only to explode this dynamic by revealing that Kalinda had slept with Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s husband when she worked at the state\xe2\x80\x99s attorney\xe2\x80\x99s office. (That Alicia then packed up all of Peter\xe2\x80\x99s stuff and had it moved to an apartment, while he was rejoicing over his re-election, was cause for celebration as well as sorrow.)', 'And while the', ', there is perhaps some hope that, in Season 6, the duo might finally mend their rift: In the Oct. 12 episode (\xe2\x80\x9cOppo Research\xe2\x80\x9d), the writers went to lengths to bring up the affair between Kalinda and Peter, and the looming threat of Lemond Bishop (Mike Colter), a drug kingpin in a slick Brioni suit, might bring the two women back together somehow. Or it might not: The show has proven itself impossible to predict at times, not least of all because of the suspended Alicia/Kalinda developments. It\xe2\x80\x99s Alicia who brings up the affair, and Alicia who seems to be carrying a grudge \xe2\x80\x94 and yet Margulies makes her enmity all the more sympathetic because of how nuanced her performance is. Even when she\xe2\x80\x99s prickly or righteously indignant, Alicia remains innately sympathetic.', 'That\xe2\x80\x99s no easy feat, particularly as Alicia has of late considered running for state\xe2\x80\x99s attorney, a position once held by her philandering husband (now Illinois state governor) and one that offers some semblance of symmetry. After standing by her man at press conferences in which the most personal details of her private life were held out for the 24-hour news cycle, wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t it just be perfect if she ended up replacing Peter, at least symbolically, in the position he held when their lives imploded?', 'But Alicia has a lot to consider: the current S.A., James Castro (Michael Cerveris), has a vendetta against her; her partner Cary is currently facing trial for drug-related charges; Diane Lockhart (Christine Baranski) has now joined them at the firm as a new partner; her nascent campaign is already compromised thanks to Bishop; and there is more trouble at home. Which brings us back to the opposition research of this week\xe2\x80\x99s episode, written by the Kings; even as Alicia must confront what Eli (Alan Cumming) and her potential campaign manager Jonathan Elfman (Steven Pasquale) are telling her about her own life and that of her family. Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s coldness, her ability to compartmentalize, her fury at Zach \xe2\x80\x94 after discovering that he lied to her about his girlfriend having an abortion \xe2\x80\x94 is further compounded by the fact that Alicia realizes that she should have noticed what was going on in her home. Her flashbacks to Zach and Nisa (Rachel Hilson) kissing in his bedroom, and of Zach furtively washing his sheets, reveal the conflict at play inside Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s mind. Is she guilty of not paying enough attention to her kids? Has she placed her role as a partner above that of mother?', 'These are not the things that race through Peter\xe2\x80\x99s mind, by the way: The show is clear to depict the weight of this discovery on Alicia, and she masks her guilt by lashing out, by making a list, by sublimating her emotion over the telephone and channeling it inward. It is a reminder that working mothers don\xe2\x80\x99t have the luxury of looking the other way, and it\xe2\x80\x99s a reminder that the sacrifices that Alicia has made do carry heavy consequences.', 'CBS', 'CBS', 'That\xe2\x80\x99s a testament to', 'itself, which never shies away from portraying its characters as realistically flawed (even \xe2\x80\x9cSaint Alicia\xe2\x80\x9d herself) or as second-guessing themselves, even as the show itself takes bigger and bigger risks with its storytelling. I never imagined a day when Lockhart/Gardner wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be the central locus for the show or that Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s love interest would be shot to death in court without a single warning or without a resolution to their star-crossed romance. But life takes us in very strange directions, and', 'has proved itself more than willing to shake up the very underpinnings of its central conceit. Lovers quarrel and fall out, people die, firms dissolve, careers fracture, and the world keeps spinning.', 'Alicia may not win the battle for state\xe2\x80\x99s attorney (or, who knows, she could!), but the fact that the Kings are willing to push the characters out of their comfort zones \xe2\x80\x94 potentially setting up a day when Cary and Diane are on the opposite side of the courtroom as Alicia \xe2\x80\x94 is part of the fun of watching', '. Anything is possible at this point. That\xe2\x80\x99s unheard of, especially for a show that has aired 116 episodes to date and which, as we\xe2\x80\x99re often reminded, produces 22 episodes a season in a television landscape that now puts a far higher reward on shorter-run cable fare. That it has pushed the boundaries of broadcast television under the eye of trigger-happy censors is remarkable.', 'Even working within the restrictions of a traditional broadcast network,', 'still manages to be the most nuanced adult drama in terms of the hard questions it poses about our lives, our society, and about our priorities. It is smart, steamy, and unflinching, turning its gaze to red-button topics from which many shows flee in terror. It is even, at times, also one of the most consistently amusing shows, offering both shrewd cultural commentary and genuine guffaws.', 'It helps that the cast is flawless at every turn: Witness Margulies\xe2\x80\x99 look of horror when she learns of Zach\xe2\x80\x99s secret or Czuchry\xe2\x80\x99s face when he\xe2\x80\x99s forced to cut open his hand in prison earlier this season. Or Panjabi, always so confident and glowering, subtly shaking in the presence of Colter\xe2\x80\x99s imposing Bishop, who manages to intimidate merely by being polite and poised. Baranski can do more with a raised eyebrow or Cumming with a sharp breath than many actors can in an entire scene. (Diane\xe2\x80\x99s emotional breakdown upon seeing Will\xe2\x80\x99s corpse remains a tour de force.) The cast is clearly game for whatever new drama comes their way, deftly upping their performances as plots tighten or loosen around their characters. There is a natural dexterity to how well their performances balance the equally taut scripts from the Kings and the writing staff, words that leap off of the page and out of the actors\xe2\x80\x99 mouths with a lush richness that is impossible at times to capture.', 'That the show manages to be this stellar at this point, rather than resting on its well-earned laurels, is what makes it truly exceptional \xe2\x80\x94', 'isn\xe2\x80\x99t content to just be merely good; it constantly pushes itself to be extraordinary.', 'airs Sundays at 9 p.m. on CBS.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe Good Wife\xe2\x80\x9d Is The Best Show On Television Right Now', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: "The Affair‰Ûù Advances Hollywood‰Ûªs Heated War-Between-The-Sexes Conversation
Description: ['The new Showtime drama joins movies', 'and', 'in its exploration of gender wars, a topic that\xe2\x80\x99s currently heating up the pop culture landscape.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: Minor spoilers for both films and the series ahead.', '', '', 'While we can attempt to empathize, it\xe2\x80\x99s impossible to truly ever know every crevice of someone\xe2\x80\x99s psyche, whether it\xe2\x80\x99s the stranger you pass in the street or your own spouse. Other people are innately unknowable.', ', whose', ', takes this notion to an operatic and hyper-intense place as the audience is forced to contend with the unreliability of two narrators \xe2\x80\x94 Nick Dunne (Ben Affleck), the seemingly perfect husband with a quick and easy smile, and Amy Dunne (Rosamund Pike), a Cool Girl with her sharp nails very much intact. The plot of Gillian Flynn\xe2\x80\x99s novel', 'and the subsequent film adaptation, also written by Flynn and directed by David Fincher, toys with the preconceptions of the viewer, jumping back and forth between male and female perspective, between past and present, between fact and fiction, in a tantalizing and telling way, though it never attempts to capture the realities of everyday marriage. The more realistic film', 'presents the complete breakdown of the marriage between Eleanor Rigby (Jessica Chastain) and Connor Ludlow (James McAvoy), flitting between his and her viewpoints as they attempt to regain their equilibrium in the face of searing loss. It\xe2\x80\x99s the grounded and ultimately gut-wrenching counterpoint to', ', depicting both sides of their struggle with poignancy and grit. If', 'is the cinematic equivalent of a head-on collision,', 'is more like a glancing blow that nonetheless ends up destroying you.', 'In their own ways, neither film is easy to watch as they portray the vast chasm of perception between the male and female characters \xe2\x80\x94 and each is structured in a way that borrows from the mystery format: Did Nick kill Amy? Just what are Eleanor and Connor running from? They achieve their ends in very different ways, however:', 'builds to a Grand Guignol crescendo of horror, while', 'ultimately parcels out the central issue between the estranged couple, posing the question of whether two people, having fallen apart, can ever grow back together.', ', as a result, becomes a film of two halves \xe2\x80\x94 his and hers \xe2\x80\x94 as it shifts between the female and male views of the couple. The couple here is far more reliable than Amy and Nick, and', 'director Ned Benson goes to lengths so that neither appears wholly responsible for the breakdown in their marriage \xe2\x80\x94 they\xe2\x80\x99re both relatable and relatably flawed. The director actually created three films out of the material that he shot on the project:', 'and', 'and', ', which are being released in select theaters this weekend, showing the extremes of perspective that unfold over the course of their plots.', 'Merrick Morton / Twentieth Century Fox and Regency Enterprises', 'Steven Lippman/SHOWTIME', 'The Weinstein Company', 'Interestingly, both films opened within a month of each other and coincide with the launch of Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s own his-and-her-story: the sophisticated drama', '(which begins Sunday, Oct. 12, though it is already available to stream online), from former', 'writer Sarah Treem. If', 'and', 'represent the two poles in terms of their treatment of the concept,', 'lingers intriguingly somewhere in between. Like its cinematic cohorts,', 'offers up dueling perspectives from the male and female POVs, but it adds another significant layer of complexity to the equation, one that makes', 'more than mere steamy extramarital drama.', 'In the new series, the viewer is introduced to aging family man Noah Solloway (Dominic West) and soulful Alison Bailey (', '\xe2\x80\x99s Ruth Wilson), who initially cross paths at a Hamptons diner where she is waiting tables and he is visiting with his wife (a dynamic Maura Tierney) and their unruly brood of children. Despite the differences in their situation, Noah and Alison wind up embarking on an affair together and\xe2\x80\xa6something terrible happens. We\xe2\x80\x99re not quite sure what that thing is (I have a theory), but in the future, the duo is interviewed, separately, by detectives at a police precinct in a', '-like structure that makes the viewer weigh what they\xe2\x80\x99ve seen and judge whether it is true, false, or exists in the hazy gray territory of in-between.', 'Each episode of', 'is split in two parts, one from Noah\xe2\x80\x99s perspective, and the other from Alison\xe2\x80\x99s as they recount their first meeting and initial impressions of one another. And here\xe2\x80\x99s where', 'enters provocative territory as their recollections \xe2\x80\x94 seen through both the prism of time and that of their respective genders \xe2\x80\x94 makes each interaction entirely different, depending on who is recounting the story. And by different, I mean just that: Scenes play out in a myriad of unexpected and dissimilar \xe2\x80\x94 at times contradictory \xe2\x80\x94 ways.', 'Steven Lippman/SHOWTIME', 'Steven Lippman/SHOWTIME', 'Steven Lippman/SHOWTIME', 'Noah and Alison\xe2\x80\x99s attitudes, their clothes, expressions, and even intentions brutally shift depending on which of them is the storyteller. In Noah\xe2\x80\x99s version, Alison is a sultry temptress, luring him into an outdoor shower with a crooked finger before taking her clothes off. She\xe2\x80\x99s a home-wrecker and a seductress who wants to make him forget about his sleeping wife back at the house. Alison holds all of the power, sexually speaking, and Noah\xe2\x80\x99s male desire all too easily succumbs to the corporeal offer she\xe2\x80\x99s making him. In Alison\xe2\x80\x99s version, however, she is emotionally fragile, grieving for a dead child, and married to a rancher \xe2\x80\x94 an exceptionally well-cast Joshua Jackson, whose initial appearance here is utterly unforgettable \xe2\x80\x94 who doesn\xe2\x80\x99t understand her in the least. (She\xe2\x80\x99s a soul sister of Eleanor Rigby for many of these reasons.) It\xe2\x80\x99s Noah who is pursuing', ', it\xe2\x80\x99s Noah whose advances are unwanted and make her uncomfortable, and Noah who catches her in a compromising position that he clearly does not understand.', 'That', ',', ', and', 'are being released within a month of one another seems coincidental, even if their impact is not: What', 'and its gender-war siblings want to get at is the way that gender informs \xe2\x80\x94 and sometimes betrays \xe2\x80\x94 our perspectives. In an era of #YesAllMen and #NotAllMen and of gender-specific readings of', ', these projects don\xe2\x80\x99t display the similarities between men and women so much as they do ferociously stab at the way that we are inherently unalike, in the way in which we construct our personas \xe2\x80\x94 Cool Girls and Flailing Guys \xe2\x80\x94 and in which we view our interactions, connections, and disentanglements.', 'With', ', Noah and Alison\xe2\x80\x99s inherent biases are clear from the start, and the show plays with them in alluring ways, forcing each of them to recount something intimate and personal at the distance of time. Memory is a fragile thing \xe2\x80\x94 we know that eyewitnesses can be notoriously unreliable \xe2\x80\x94 but', 'adds to that complexity by forcing them to recount these \xe2\x80\x9cfacts\xe2\x80\x9d from a vantage point in the future. Neither Noah nor Alison are reliable narrators of their own shared story but the police investigation complicates things far more greatly, just as it does for Nick in', ': Under the glaring light of an interrogation room, we might all change our stories, present the best versions of ourselves, and subtly shade the truth even just a little bit to present ourselves as less culpable.', 'Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s', 'might be the closest yet that television comes to depicting the shifting, combative, and contentious war between the sexes. The result of which makes for compelling \xe2\x80\x94 if at times, deeply uncomfortable \xe2\x80\x94 viewing, a truly adult drama from which, like a certain encounter between Alison and Noah, it\xe2\x80\x99s often impossible to look away.', 'premieres Sunday, Oct. 12, at 10 p.m. on Showtime. The pilot episode is available on Showtime On Demand or Showtime Anytime and \xe2\x80\x94 in an edited form \xe2\x80\x94 below.', '', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"The Affair\xe2\x80\x9d Advances Hollywood\'s Heated War-Between-The-Sexes Conversation', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏTwin Peaks‰Ûù Co-Creator Mark Frost On The Series‰Ûª Return To Television
Description: ['Damn fine news: After 25 years,', 'is', '.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed News spoke to Frost about the revival and what fans can expect.', '', 'Aaron Spelling Prods/Courtesy Everett Collection', 'Aaron Spelling Prods/Courtesy Everett Collection', 'Earlier this summer,', 'were unearthed for the series\xe2\x80\x99 complete Blu-ray release. But that was nothing compared to what happened on Oct. 6, as the impossible suddenly became a reality: Co-creators David Lynch and Mark Frost announced that', 'would be', ', its resolution as hazy and unclear as a fever dream.', 'Nine episodes of a', 'revival series will air on Showtime in 2016 as a limited series, one that promises a resolution of sorts for FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) and one that signals a reunion of Lynch and Frost, who will write every episode, with Lynch set to direct as well. For Frost, it\xe2\x80\x99s a unique position to be in, one that has been three years in the making.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a very rich feeling, to finally be able to tell the world about it, because we\xe2\x80\x99ve been living with it for three years,\xe2\x80\x9d Frost told BuzzFeed News shortly after the limited series announcement was made. \xe2\x80\x9cPeople\xe2\x80\x99s reactions are so fantastic. The thought that something like this could make so many people excited and hopefully happy fills you with the kind of joy you don\xe2\x80\x99t get most days. So it\xe2\x80\x99s a wonderful opportunity to close the circle.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Frost also talked about Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s announcement, why there are exactly nine episodes planned for the resurrected', ', whether composer Angelo Badalamenti will return with another iconic score, and what fans can expect from this most unlikely news. In the words of the Little Man From Another Place, let\xe2\x80\x99s rock.', 'Well, you know, the heart of this whole experience, from the beginning, has been this friendship that we share. Everything that we\xe2\x80\x99ve done has started and flowed from that. In a way, it\xe2\x80\x99s a wonderful way to continue the friendship, and deepen the experience for both of us, as friends, as collaborators, and as people, working to tell a story together. Neither of us has ever collaborated with anybody else in this way, and it\xe2\x80\x99s a very special relationship. I guess you can say it\xe2\x80\x99s like the U.S. and Great Britain, in diplomatic terms. It\xe2\x80\x99s the special relationship in my life, creatively, and I think in his in the same way. First and foremost, it\xe2\x80\x99s a wonderful chance to work together with a very good, dear friend.', 'I think that the main thing is \xe2\x80\x94 you\xe2\x80\x99re different people 20 years later. You\xe2\x80\x99re older and hopefully wiser, and you\xe2\x80\x99ve had a lot more life experience. You\xe2\x80\x99re bringing all that to the table. That\xe2\x80\x99s certainly been our experience; that\xe2\x80\x99s what it feels like to me. We\xe2\x80\x99re not just trying to bring back the show because we can bring back the show; we\xe2\x80\x99re doing it because we feel there\xe2\x80\x99s something more to say with it, and it\xe2\x80\x99s the perfect vehicle for expressing those thoughts and feelings.', 'Well, if you think back about the first season, if you put the pilot together with the seven that we did, you get nine hours. It just felt like the right number. I\xe2\x80\x99ve always felt the story should take as long as the story takes to tell. That\xe2\x80\x99s what felt right to us.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s kind of all of those things. It\xe2\x80\x99s different and yet the same. It\xe2\x80\x99s reassuring, and yet, I hope, equally startling and unsettling. And, more than anything it does,', 'is kind of a way to look at the world. And this is a chance to refine that vision, so many years later. As you say, it\xe2\x80\x99s a very unique opportunity.', 'Aaron Spelling Prods/Courtesy Everett Collection', 'Aaron Spelling Prods/Courtesy Everett Collection', 'What\xe2\x80\x99s cool about the life the show has had is that, when we were making it the first time, we never felt like we were just doing business. We were trying to make something that was special to us. I think everybody who was a part of it at some level would attest to that feeling. There was something in the air. Now, to be able to write the next volume so many years later, you bring into the equation the most poignant aspect of being alive, and that\xe2\x80\x99s the passage of time. It\xe2\x80\x99s something we\xe2\x80\x99re all up against, and thematically, it\xe2\x80\x99s the center of the strength now, so all those things together conspire to give us a fantastic opportunity to bring this back to life. And hopefully, for a whole new group of people.', 'I think that remains to be seen, and I think that\xe2\x80\x99s something the viewers should judge for themselves. Everybody probably feels more or less the same inside as they did back then. The internal experience of being alive hasn\xe2\x80\x99t changed a whole hell of a lot. The world around us has changed exponentially. That\xe2\x80\x99ll certainly be a factor in our storytelling here.', '', 'Well, obviously there are some very key people we want to make sure are gonna be along for the ride, and we\xe2\x80\x99re gonna be attending to that at posthaste.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99d have to say it\xe2\x80\x99s too early to determine that yet. In the case of everyone that we\xe2\x80\x99ve lost, it\xe2\x80\x99s something that we\xe2\x80\x99ll have to do a lot of thinking about.', 'Courtesy Everett Collection', 'Courtesy Everett Collection', 'I would expect every bit as important as before. The music was a central part of the experience for everybody. I\xe2\x80\x99ll never forget the first time I heard the theme. People used to play it in piano bars. \xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99d never had an experience like that in my life. So I\xe2\x80\x99m pretty hopeful that it\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be just as important this time around.', 'Yeah, I\xe2\x80\x99m gonna leave all that up to David. I\xe2\x80\x99m sure he\xe2\x80\x99s gonna do his darndest to make the right thing happen.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s more a case of digging deeper into our own thoughts about it. It started with us; we figure it\xe2\x80\x99ll end with us. It isn\xe2\x80\x99t like we ran a contest for most interesting plot twist and decided to go with whoever won. We\xe2\x80\x99re gonna rely on our own resources for this, and hopefully, surprise people as much as we did the first time.', 'Well, I think what we\xe2\x80\x99re gonna do is take the whole mythology that we\xe2\x80\x99ve created into consideration, and do the best we can to be faithful to the things that are out there, that, after all, we originally had a lot to do with. Everything\xe2\x80\x99s on the table.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99d hate to prejudge for people what their perceptions should be, or even to direct them. I always like, as you know, the work to speak for itself. It\xe2\x80\x99s too early really to answer this question, I guess is a long-winded way of saying that. We\xe2\x80\x99ll let people tell us what they think, and how they feel, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll go from there.', 'Hmm. One thing I can guarantee they will see \xe2\x80\x94 they will see a cup of coffee fly through a window. Just to give you one mundane specific. I hope that they walk away from the end of this next chapter feeling like it all comes together and it all makes sense.', 'Yeah, from your lips to god\xe2\x80\x99s ear. I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a great way to put it. We\xe2\x80\x99d like it to do all of the above.', 'returns in 2016 on Showtime.', 'CBS Home Entertainment', '9.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '10.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '11.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '"Twin Peaks" Co-Creator Mark Frost On The Series\' Return To Television', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏTwin Peaks‰Ûù kehrt 2016 mit einer Mini-Serie auf Showtime zurÌ_ck
Description: ['25 Jahre nach dem Ende der Original-Serie auf ABC kehrt David Lynchs and Mark Frosts surreale Serie zur\xc3\xbcck.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cThat gum you like is going to come back in style.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'Nach vielen Ger\xc3\xbcchten haben', 'endlich konkreten Anlass, sich zu freuen: Die surreale und bahnbrechende 90er-Jahre-Serie von David Lynch und Mark Frost kommt 2016 zur\xc3\xbcck ins Fernsehen.', 'Showtime hat \xc3\xbcber eine Pressemitteilung angek\xc3\xbcndigt, dass Lynch und Frost alle neun Folgen der Neuauflage schreiben und produzieren werden, die dann 25 Jahre nach ihrem Ende auf ABC ausgestrahlt werden sollen. Noch spannender ist, dass Lynch bei den neuen Folgen Regie f\xc3\xbchren soll. Die Serie soll im n\xc3\xa4chsten Jahr gedreht werden und spielt in der Gegenwart. Sie soll Handlungsstr\xc3\xa4nge fortf\xc3\xbchren, die nie zu Ende gef\xc3\xbchrt wurden, als die Originalserie eingestellt wurde.', '\xe2\x80\x9cDie mysteri\xc3\xb6se Welt von', 'zieht uns zu sich zur\xc3\xbcck.\xe2\x80\x9d, werden Frost und Lynch in der Pressemitteilung zitiert. \xe2\x80\x9cWir sind sehr gespannt. M\xc3\xb6ge der Wald mit Euch sein.\xe2\x80\x9d Zus\xc3\xa4tzlich dazu hat Showtime bekannt gegeben. dass die 30 Folgen der Originalserie auch ausgestrahlt werden sollen.', 'Dieses Video ver\xc3\xb6ffentlichte Showtime heute als Teaser der R\xc3\xbcckkehr von', '', 'Frost und Lynch twitterten die Ank\xc3\xbcndigung.', 'Dear Twitter Friends\xe2\x80\xa6 it is happening again.', '', 'Dear Twitter Friends\xe2\x80\xa6 it is happening again.', '', 'lief von 1990 bis 1991 , fesselte die US-Fernsehnation und sp\xc3\xa4ter auch das internationale Publikum. Millionen versuchten, die r\xc3\xa4tselhaften Hinweise zu entschl\xc3\xbcsseln, wer die Teenagerin Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee) denn nun get\xc3\xb6tet habe. W\xc3\xa4hrend der von FBI Special Agent Dale Kooper (Kyle MacLachlan) und Sheriff Harry S. Truman (Michael Ontkean) gef\xc3\xbchrten Ermittlung kommen dunkle Geheimnisse der Bewohner der nur scheinbar idyllischen Stadt Twin Peaks ans Licht. Der auf der Serie basierende Film', 'von 1992 f\xc3\xbcllte einige der Informationsl\xc3\xbccken \xc3\xbcber die letzte Woche im Leben der Laura Palmer. Ganz im Lynch-Stil spielt der Film nach der letzten Serienfolge. (Ja, der Film ist schr\xc3\xa4g und, wie', 'Szenen zeigen, extrem machtvoll.)', '', 'Die Nachricht \xc3\xbcber die m\xc3\xb6gliche Wiederauferstehung kam in den letzten Jahren immer mal wieder auf und begann mit der Ver\xc3\xb6ffentlichung von', 'auf BlueRay dieses Jahr. Dort waren gel\xc3\xb6schte Szenen aus dem oben erw\xc3\xa4hnten Film enthalten. Aber am 3. Oktober kamen die Erfinder der Serie dann mit einem Tweet um die Ecke, der Fans vor Begeisterung ausflippen lie\xc3\x9f:', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style!', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style.', 'Diese Spr\xc3\xbcche kommen', 'Fans bekannt vor, weil sie in einem kryptischen Hinweis vorkommen, den Dale erh\xc3\xa4lt, als er \xe2\x80\x94', '\xe2\x80\x94 die metaphysische Black Lodge besucht. Das andere interessante Element aus dieser Begegnung mit dem Man From Another Place (Michael J. Anderson) ist, dass Cooper auch den Geist von Laura Palmer selbst trifft. Sie sagt ihm bei dieser Gelegenheit, dass sie ihn in 25 Jahren wiedersehen wird.', 'Das ist nicht nur prophetisch, sondern offenbar auch bedeutsam. Twin Peaks spielte vor 25 Jahren, was dazu f\xc3\xbchrt, dass es jetzt genau 25 Jahre her ist, dass Laura und Cooper diese Begegnung hatten. Gruselig, oder?', '', '11.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '12.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'This post has been translated from English.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Twin Peaks" kehrt 2016 mit einer Mini-Serie auf Showtime zur\xc3\xbcck', 'Dein Link wurde erfolgreich geteilt', 'Meistgelesen auf BuzzFeed', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Die Mail wurde verschickt!', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: åÇ Twin Peaks åÈ fait son retour suråÊShowtime
Description: ['Le drame surr\xc3\xa9aliste de David Lynch et Mark Frost revient \xc3\xa0 la t\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9 apr\xc3\xa8s 25 ans d\xe2\x80\x99absence.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Apr\xc3\xa8s plusieurs jours de rumeurs et de sp\xc3\xa9culations, voil\xc3\xa0 enfin une bonne nouvelle pour les fans de \xc2\xab Twin Peaks \xc2\xbb : le drame phare des ann\xc3\xa9es 1990, sign\xc3\xa9 David Lynch et Mark Frost, va faire son retour.', 'Selon', ', Lynch et Frost \xc3\xa9criront les neuf \xc3\xa9pisodes de la s\xc3\xa9rie, qui sera diffus\xc3\xa9e sur la cha\xc3\xaene am\xc3\xa9ricaine Showtime en 2016, 25 ans apr\xc3\xa8s la fin de la s\xc3\xa9rie. Encore plus intriguant : Lynch s\xe2\x80\x99est engag\xc3\xa9 \xc3\xa0 r\xc3\xa9aliser chaque \xc3\xa9pisode d\xe2\x80\x99une heure.', 'Showtime a publi\xc3\xa9 cette vid\xc3\xa9o ce lundi 6 octobre en guise de teaser :', '', '\xc2\xab Twin Peaks \xc2\xbb, dont les 30 \xc3\xa9pisodes ont \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 diffus\xc3\xa9s entre 1990 et 1991, a captiv\xc3\xa9 la nation am\xc3\xa9ricaine, alors que les t\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9spectateurs essayaient de d\xc3\xa9crypter les indices sur la mort de Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee). Au fil de l\xe2\x80\x99enqu\xc3\xaate \xe2\x80\x94 men\xc3\xa9e par l\xe2\x80\x99agent sp\xc3\xa9cial du FBI Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) et le Sheriff Harry S. Truman (Michael Otkean) \xe2\x80\x94, les sombres secrets des habitants excentriques de cette petite ville d\xe2\x80\x99apparence idyllique ont \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 r\xc3\xa9v\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9s. Un film, \xc2\xab Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me \xc2\xbb, sorti en 1992, jetait la lumi\xc3\xa8re sur les derniers jours de Laura Palmer. (Oui, le film est vraiment barr\xc3\xa9, et, comme le prouvent', ', extr\xc3\xaamement puissant.)', 'La nouvelle d\xe2\x80\x99une possible r\xc3\xa9surrection de la s\xc3\xa9rie avait surgi ces derni\xc3\xa8res ann\xc3\xa9es et a repris cette ann\xc3\xa9e avec la sortie de \xc2\xab Twin Peaks: The Complete Mystery \xc2\xbb en Blu-ray. Mais le 3 octobre, les co-cr\xc3\xa9ateurs de la s\xc3\xa9rie ont publi\xc3\xa9 sur Twitter un message qui a affol\xc3\xa9 les fans :', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style!', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style.', '\xc2\xab Le chewing-gum que vous aimez tant va revenir a la mode. \xc2\xbb', 'Cette r\xc3\xa9f\xc3\xa9rence est famili\xc3\xa8re pour les fans de la s\xc3\xa9rie.', '\xe2\x80\x93 Il s\xe2\x80\x99agit d\xe2\x80\x99un indice \xc3\xa9nigmatique que Cooper re\xc3\xa7oit dans un \xc3\xa9tat de semi-r\xc3\xaave. C\xe2\x80\x99est aussi \xc3\xa0 ce moment qu\xe2\x80\x99il rencontre l\xe2\x80\x99esprit de Laura Palmer qui lui dit qu\xe2\x80\x99elle le verra \xc2\xab dans 25 ans \xc2\xbb.', 'Or la s\xc3\xa9rie se d\xc3\xa9roulait en 1989. Il y a donc 25 ans.', '', 'This post has been translated from English.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '\xc2\xab Twin Peaks \xc2\xbb fait son retour sur Showtime', 'Votre lien a \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 partag\xc3\xa9 avec succ\xc3\xa8s !', 'Plus de Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Votre email a \xc3\xa9t\xc3\xa9 envoy\xc3\xa9 !', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏTwin Peaks‰Ûù To Return In 2016 With A Showtime LimitedåÊSeries
Description: ['David Lynch and Mark Frost\xe2\x80\x99s surreal drama is coming to Showtime 25 years after the original ABC series finale.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cThat gum you like is going to come back in style.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'After days of speculation and rumor,', 'fans finally have some good (and concrete) news to look forward to: The surreal and seminal 1990s drama, from creators David Lynch and Mark Frost, will be returning in 2016.', 'Showtime announced via press release that Lynch and Frost will write and produce each of the nine episodes in the limited series, which will air on Showtime in 2016, 25 years after the series wrapped up its run. Even more intriguing: Lynch is attached to direct each of the nine installments. The series, which will go into production next year, will be set in the present day and will continue plots that were left dangling when the show was canceled in 1991.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe mysterious and special world of', 'is pulling us back,\xe2\x80\x9d said Frost and Lynch in a prepared statement. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re very excited. May the forest be with you.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Additionally, Showtime announced that it will be airing all 30 original episodes of', 'in preparation for the launch of the limited series.', 'Showtime released the following video today, teasing the return of', ':', '', 'Frost and Lynch took to Twitter to share the happy news.', 'Dear Twitter Friends\xe2\x80\xa6 it is happening again.', '', 'Dear Twitter Friends\xe2\x80\xa6 it is happening again.', '', ', which ran for two seasons between 1990 and 1991, captivated a nation as viewers attempted to decipher the dreamlike clues pointing toward who killed teenager Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee). As the investigation, led by FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) and Sheriff Harry S. Truman (Michael Otkean), progressed, dark secrets belonging to the severely quirky denizens of this seemingly idyllic Pacific Northwest town were unearthed. A subsequent movie,', ', released in 1992, filled in some of the blanks surrounding the final seven days of Laura Palmer\xe2\x80\x99s life and, in true Lynchian manner, also took place after the final episode. (Yes, the film is just that trippy and, as', 'prove, extremely powerful.)', 'The news of a possible resurrection had cropped up in recent years and began again in earnest with the release of', 'on Blu-ray earlier this year, containing those aforementioned deleted scenes from the prequel film. But on Oct. 3, the show\xe2\x80\x99s co-creators took to Twitter with a timed message that had fans reeling:', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style!', 'Dear Twitter Friends: That gum you like is going to come back in style.', 'The reference is one that is all too familiar to', 'viewers: a cryptic clue given to Cooper in a dreamlike state when he \xe2\x80\x94', '\xe2\x80\x94 visits the metaphysical Black Lodge. The other interesting element from that encounter with the Little Man From Another Place (Michael J. Anderson) is that Cooper also encounters the spirit of Laura Palmer herself, who tells Cooper that she will see him \xe2\x80\x9cin 25 years.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not only prophetic, but clearly of significance.', 'was, of course, set in the year 1989, making it 25 years ago that Laura and Cooper came face-to-face in the nonlinear timeline of the show. Spooky, no?', '', '11.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '12.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', '"Twin Peaks" To Return In 2016 With A Showtime Limited Series', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "How To Get Away With Murder" Doesn‰Ûªt Quite Get Away With Its FramingåÊDevice
Description: ['The Shonda Rhimes-executive produced legal thriller might be pushing some boundaries, but its over-reliance on a wonky narrative device is leaving something to be desired.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: Contains spoilers if you are not up to date on the show.', '', 'ABC', 'There are many things for which', '\xe2\x80\x94 from creator Peter Nowalk and executive producer Shonda Rhimes \xe2\x80\x94 ought to be celebrated. ABC\xe2\x80\x99s new legal thriller, which has aired two episodes to date, follows the Rhimes-ian ideals of its forebears, resulting in a show that is thoroughly modern and diverse, brimming with complicated characters who are inherently flawed and yet innately watchable.', 'Likewise, the show has already challenged several conventions of television, potentially depicting the first broadcast use of analingus (surely, this hasn\xe2\x80\x99t happened on network television before) and positioning a middle-aged black woman front and center while reveling in its depictions of her sexuality. In the pilot episode, Viola Davis\xe2\x80\x99 Annalise Keating is shown receiving oral sex from a man who is most definitely not her husband. It\xe2\x80\x99s a brave and bold start, intended to shock, and it announces that Annalise is not going to be powerful but desexualized, nor is she going to be the one merely doling out pleasure to someone else. The show\xe2\x80\x99s second episode followed up by having Annalise beg her cop boyfriend for help only to go home and engage in sex with her husband \xe2\x80\x94 whom she now suspects of murdering one of his students \xe2\x80\x94 only to roll over, a single tear falling from her left eye.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s a telling moment about Annalise\xe2\x80\x99s complexity and further jumpstarts the sexual politics on display within the show, and it\xe2\x80\x99s a milestone in terms of representation that it\xe2\x80\x99s Davis who is so far engaged in these bedroom gymnastics; it\xe2\x80\x99s rare to find a dark-skinned black woman on television who is presented as a sexual being in a positive or even neutral way.', 'But despite the impressive themes at work within', ', there are two narratives within the show that continue to jostle, rather unsuccessfully, against once another, even this early on in the series\xe2\x80\x99 run. There\xe2\x80\x99s the overarching narrative, one in which Annalise has put together a team of young law students \xe2\x80\x94 including Alfred Enoch\xe2\x80\x99s na\xc3\xafve Wes, Aja Naomi King\xe2\x80\x99s ambitious Michaela, Matt McGorry\xe2\x80\x99s slimy Asher, Karla Souza\xe2\x80\x99s timid Laurel, and Jack Falahee\xe2\x80\x99s sly Connor \xe2\x80\x94 and has them assist her with a case of the week,', '-style. In the second episode, they were tasked with undermining the prosecution\xe2\x80\x99s case against Annalise\xe2\x80\x99s client, an eccentric Colin Sweeney-esque millionaire (Steven Weber) who may have murdered his wife. The students flounder, they figure things out, they learn, and they end up helping Annalise. It\xe2\x80\x99s a pretty precise formula, one that has worked for', 'and countless other legal procedural dramas.', 'Then there\xe2\x80\x99s the other narrative at play here, one that is set several months in the future and which finds the aforementioned law students attempting to \xe2\x80\x94 you guessed it! \xe2\x80\x94 get away with murder, in this case the murder of Annalise\xe2\x80\x99s possibly-no-good husband Sam (Tom Verica), revealed to be the body at the end of the pilot. The students conspire, using information gleaned from Annalise\xe2\x80\x99s law class \xe2\x80\x94 whose nickname is the title of the show \xe2\x80\x94 in order to seemingly cover up a killing committed by\xe2\x80\xa6 Well, it\xe2\x80\x99s not entirely clear just yet whodunnit or why. Or even if Sam is an innocent victim or something more.', 'ABC', 'ABC', 'And here\xe2\x80\x99s where things begin to fall apart for', '. This sort of narrative device \xe2\x80\x94 the flash-forward and the', 'beginning of the series \xe2\x80\x94 owes a considerable debt to another legal thriller which used it for a similar purpose:', '. (Also to the very short-lived Fox drama', '.) The Glenn Close series, which ran for five seasons, was constructed in a similar way to', ': a tough and powerful criminal attorney, a na\xc3\xafve student, and blood and mayhem. It toggled back and forth between a future storyline in which a murder had been committed \xe2\x80\x94 teasing elements of the crime, its victim, and the investigation like crimson-hued breadcrumbs \xe2\x80\x94 and the present-day storyline, which was deeply at odds with where the central storyline had gone. Each episode began to fill in the details as the two storylines inexorably met up by the end of the season. (This device began to sag on', 'after a bit: It\xe2\x80\x99s a tough one to sustain season after season.)', 'And that\xe2\x80\x99s the same setup here within Nowalk and Rhimes\xe2\x80\x99', ': The blue-tinged future storyline, set two and a half months after the events in the present day, find the students struggling to keep their nerves intact as they react to the murder of Annalise\xe2\x80\x99s husband, who may or may not himself have been a killer. (This could be one of many, many red herrings heading our way.) But, so far, the show is having difficulty not buckling under the weight of such a cumbersome framework device. For one, there are too many characters at play who still seem to be little more than ciphers (I had to look up their names in order to remember them) so it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to be invested in their future crime or the circumstances surrounding it.', 'Additionally, the show was trying so desperately to trick the viewer into thinking that Wes and the others were helping Annalise escape punishment for her crime, that it quickly became clear that this was a diversion from the person that the students were actually trying to protect. As soon as punk bartender Rebecca (Katie Findlay) asked to use Wes\xe2\x80\x99 shower, it became only too clear that she was the one holed up in room 203 of a seedy motel. And, sure enough, she gets arrested after concealing a phone (the dead girl\xe2\x80\x99s?) in Wes\xe2\x80\x99 bathroom.', 'This is a problem. Yes, as mentioned earlier, we\xe2\x80\x99re only two episodes in so far on', 'and it\xe2\x80\x99s quite possible that the show could suddenly make this present/future dichotomy work for itself, but as it stands now, the use of the flash-forward device is far less interesting than it would have been to have told this story in a linear fashion. Instead, the show\xe2\x80\x99s writers begin their tale with the volume at 11, and it\xe2\x80\x99s impossible to sustain that creatively or organically, even if', 'ends up running only 13 to 15 episodes this season. Even more challenging: The suspense doesn\xe2\x80\x99t feel particularly earned, nor do the twists so far, because they\xe2\x80\x99re not only telegraphed, but also operating independently of the character developments in the present day.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99ll continue watching', 'for now (it was one of my favorite pilots of the current crop), even if I\xe2\x80\x99m less than invested in finding out how the flash-forward storyline will fold in on the current day goings-on. (Who knows, maybe the writers will tie this all up with a grand flourish.) Instead, I\xe2\x80\x99d far rather see these characters develop, their dynamics strengthening and fracturing over time, than see them fumble around in the woods with a corpse without understanding their motivations. As it stands now,', 'might be pushing boundaries when it comes to race and sexuality, but it seems to be killing its potential longevity at the expense of genuine storytelling.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"How To Get Away With Murder" Doesn\'t Quite Get Away With Its Framing Device', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏTrue Detective‰Ûù Season 2 Close To Naming Rachel McAdams As Its FemaleåÊLead
Description: ['UPDATED: McAdams is said to be joining Vince Vaughn and Colin Farrell in HBO\xe2\x80\x99s anthology drama; Taylor Kitsch is rumored to be the final member of the main cast.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '#TrueDetectiveSeason2', '', 'Getty Images', 'Jim Urquhart / Reuters', 'Getty Images', 'Those rumors that Colin Farrell would be starring in the highly anticipated second season of HBO\xe2\x80\x99s police anthology series', 'turned out to be, well, true, as the premium cable channel announced who would be filling two of the four lead roles.', 'Earlier this week, HBO confirmed the casting of Farrell in the Nic Pizzolatto-created drama and announced that the former star of', 'would be joined by Vince Vaughn (', ') for the eight-episode second season. Production on Season 2 is set to begin this fall in California, with the first two episodes to be directed by Justin Lin (', '), who most recently delved into television with the pilot of CBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '.', 'In', 'Season 2, Farrell will play Ray Velcoro, described by the network as \xe2\x80\x9ca compromised detective whose allegiances are torn between his masters in a corrupt police department and the mobster who owns him,\xe2\x80\x9d while Vaughn is set to play Frank Semyon, \xe2\x80\x9ca career criminal in danger of losing his empire when his move into legitimate enterprise is upended by the murder of a business partner.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'While details of the plot of Season 2 are vague, HBO did confirm that these next eight episodes will revolve around three cops and Vaughn\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9ccareer criminal,\xe2\x80\x9d who find themselves enmeshed in a conspiracy following a murder. Additional casting for the other two police officer roles will be announced by HBO at a later date.', 'UPDATE: More movement on the', 'casting front:', 'is reporting that Rachel McAdams (', ') is', 'as the third member of the main cast, likely to play one of the three police detectives at the center of the plot. Taylor Kitsch is now rumored to be the fourth and final member of the main cast, likely completing the trio of cops appearing in the second season.', 'The other names that were thought to have been to be contention for the female lead role included', '\xe2\x80\x94 despite the fact that she will be in rehearsals for the upcoming stage run of', ', opening in New York in February 2015 \xe2\x80\x94 Malin Akerman, and Jessica Biel.', 'When reached by BuzzFeed News, a representative from HBO declined to comment.', '"True Detective" Season 2 Close To Naming Rachel McAdams As Its Female Lead', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "Lost" Changed My Life In More Ways Than I CanåÊCount
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cGuys, where are we?\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'ABC', 'I saw the pilot episode of', 'a few months before it premiered on ABC exactly 10 years ago today \xe2\x80\x94 on Sept. 22, 2004.', 'I was working in television development at the time, and a box of pilots \xe2\x80\x94 they may have even been on VHS tapes \xe2\x80\x94 had just arrived from a talent agency. My co-workers and I gathered in a tiny, cramped office to sort through the 30\xe2\x80\x9340 screeners, most with titles and premises now forgotten, to find our copy of', '. Damon Lindelof was an unknown name to us then, but we were addicted to', ', the trippy espionage drama from', 'co-creator J.J. Abrams, who had also won our hearts with the wistful', '.', 'Twitter and social media as we now know them did not yet exist and, while we had followed the development of the super-expensive pilot in the Hollywood trades (when people still read printed trade publications), we knew nothing of the plot beyond the seemingly simple strangers-survive-a-plane-crash premise. We had no idea just what was in store for us as we dimmed the lights and hit \xe2\x80\x9cplay.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The 90-minute pilot was full of scares, surprises, and even a few laughs (that wonky polar bear!), and, most importantly, it introduced mysteries that had us immediately talking and questioning. And it\xe2\x80\x99s the latter that became a trademark effect of the show, one that would be closely associated with', 'until its finale in 2010 and well beyond, and one that was instrumental in helping to cement the show\xe2\x80\x99s massive success. (Almost 20 million people tuned in to the pilot when it aired.) What was this island? What was a crazed polar bear doing in the jungle? What was going to happen to these survivors and, to borrow the words of rocker Charlie (Dominic Monaghan), \xe2\x80\x9cWhere are we?\xe2\x80\x9d', 'ABC', 'ABC', 'This was still way before the Dharma Initiative, before the hatch and the resurrection pool, before time travel and the four-toed statue, before the \xe2\x80\x9cwe have to go back\xe2\x80\x9d wailing of a heavily bearded Jack Shepherd (Matthew Fox), and before Benjamin Linus (Michael Emerson) and The Others. It was before the show became a mystery box phenomenon and was instead about seemingly ordinary characters thrust together under extraordinary circumstances. Live together, die alone.', 'And in the pilot, the characters were largely archetypical: the Hero, the Lovers, the Rebel, the Explorer, the Jester, the Magician. John Locke (Terry O\xe2\x80\x99Quinn) sat on the beach, enraptured, an orange slice in his mouth becoming a haunting smile. Kate (Evangeline Lilly) put the oxygen mask on her injured captor before putting one on herself. Sawyer (Josh Holloway) attacked Sayid (Naveen Andrews), calling him a terrorist.', 'The pilot embraced the conflict of the situation, showing suspicion among the strangers. It was about the formation of a new society, its innate stresses, and about the way in which people deal with adversity. Is Jack an alcoholic? Is Charlie a heroin addict? What did Kate do to land herself in handcuffs? There was a sense of the unknown to these characters, their backstories \xe2\x80\x94 their lives before the crash of Oceanic Flight 815 \xe2\x80\x94 being teased out slowly and deliberately to a hungry audience. This was a narrative structure that would quickly become the baseline within', ', a pattern that would become so closely identified with the show when it\xe2\x80\x99s used on other television shows, the debt to', 'becomes apparent.', 'ABC', 'ABC', 'I was instantly hooked \xe2\x80\x94 it was unlike anything else I had seen on television, a mash-up of genres and tropes. It was', 'but scripted. It was', 'but instead of coconut radios, there was a puzzling French distress call. It was William Golding\xe2\x80\x99s', '\xe2\x80\x94 would this disparate group of survivors work together or turn on one another?', 'Over the coming months, the questions surrounding the island filled my head and, when I started my blog', 'in 2006,', 'was a first and favorite topic. I wrote hundreds of thousands of words about the show over the course of its six-season run. Like so many others, I theorized, deconstructed, and parsed each episode for meaning. Each time one question was answered, several others emerged to take its place, providing more fodder for critics and audiences alike.', 'Showrunners Lindelof and Carlton Cuse created storylines that operated on multiple levels, enticing, confounding, and amazing viewers, demanding that they not watch passively but become active participants in the show\xe2\x80\x99s mysteries, sleuthing every week \xe2\x80\x94 even between seasons \xe2\x80\x94 to make sense of the island and its inhabitants.', 'During the show\xe2\x80\x99s run, I changed jobs and then industries altogether. Like the castaways, I reinvented myself after setbacks \xe2\x80\x94 getting pink-slipped and looking for work \xe2\x80\x94 and other adversities. Other shows came and went, but my obsession with', 'remained steadfast and true, and I still felt the indescribable sense of wonder and awe that came from my initial viewing in that dark, cramped office.', 'Ten years later, I\xe2\x80\x99m now a husband and a father and my life, professional and personal, has changed immeasurably. And while I may not have been satisfied with how', 'ultimately ended, the epic journey to reach that destination \xe2\x80\x94 including both the highs and the lows, the revelations and the red herrings \xe2\x80\x94 helped shape both the television landscape and who I am today. And I wish, like Desmond Hume (Henry Ian Cusick), that I could send myself back in time and relive that first, fateful screening all over again.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Lost" Changed My Life In More Ways Than I Can Count', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "Downton Abbey" Season 5 Begins With AåÊJolt
Description: ['Julian Fellowes\xe2\x80\x99 costume drama begins its fifth year with a slew of domestic intrigues in place, as well as some new tensions.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'WARNING: Minor spoilers ahead!', '', '', 'Period drama', 'had begun to show signs of wear and tear, particularly in its', ', where the creakiness of the subplots began to match that of the house\xe2\x80\x99s ancient stairs.', 'It was, simply put, not the best year for the drama, which had come off the narrative highs of its third season, including the highly emotional deaths of two linchpin characters,', '(Dan Stevens) and Lady Sybil (Jessica Brown Findlay). But, in its fourth,', 'sagged into overt melodrama with storylines involving murder, blackmail, and the shocking and', 'of Anna Bates (Joanne Froggatt). For a series that once had such great promise and potential, it felt like the life had been sucked out of the show somewhat as it was forced to restructure in light of those two high-profile departures.', 'Resurrecting my crackpot theory that odd-numbered seasons of', 'are far superior to their even-numbered counterparts (I\xe2\x80\x99m looking at you, Season 2!), the fifth season opener of Julian Fellowes\xe2\x80\x99 period drama \xe2\x80\x94 which airs Sept. 21 on ITV in the U.K. and Jan. 4, 2015, on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', 'in the U.S. \xe2\x80\x94 offers a reinvigorated', ', one full of downstairs intrigues and domestic drama. The first episode back is a bit of a whirling dervish: There are so many subplots that it\xe2\x80\x99s almost impossible to account for all of them.', 'But rather than feel overwhelming, there\xe2\x80\x99s a particularly pleasing rhythm to all of this narrative dance work, with scenes that are short on time but long on significance. Long-simmering plots come to the boil. The ongoing love triangle between Lady Mary (Michelle Dockery), Lord Gillingham (Tom Cullen), and Charles Blake (Julian Ovenden) twists in a most unexpected direction, at least by the standards of the time. (It\xe2\x80\x99s 1924, after all.) The relationship between James (Ed Speleers) and Lady Anstruther (a particularly aptly cast Anna Chancellor) is explored with clarity, humor, and a potential resolution. Isobel (Penelope Wilton) and Violet (Maggie Smith) are once again at odds \xe2\x80\x94 their temporary cease-fire marred by a new twist in their rivalry, this time over Isobel\xe2\x80\x99s romantic prospects.', '', 'Throughout it all, the spectre of Gillingham\xe2\x80\x99s dead valet Mr. Green (Nigel Harman) hovers uneasily over the proceedings, threatening to destroy the fragile happiness of Anna and Mr. Bates (Brendan Coyle), whose devotion to each other appears even stronger now, despite suspicious eyes turning toward the couple. And the dark secret harbored by the tremulous Miss Baxter (Raquel Cassidy) \xe2\x80\x94 or at least part of it \xe2\x80\x94 is finally revealed after being teased out so thoroughly by both Fellowes and by the malevolent Thomas (Rob James-Collier), using it to gain a Svengali-like hold over the lady\xe2\x80\x99s maid.', 'Then there\xe2\x80\x99s poor Lady Edith (Laura Carmichael), whose anguish over secretly giving up the child she conceived with missing paramour Michael Gregson (Charles Edwards) becomes even more palpable with the baby \xe2\x80\x94 the adorably named Marigold \xe2\x80\x94 living on the estate, just out of her grasp. That Edith should still be able to check in on Marigold, as much as propriety might allow for, might help to assuage the loss that she feels, but the gravitational pull between mother and child may prove impossible for Edith to resist, even as she risks exposure. Edith has, most remarkably, of late become an incredibly sympathetic figure, and even her more damning actions in this episode (I won\xe2\x80\x99t spoil what they are exactly) don\xe2\x80\x99t derail the character\xe2\x80\x99s redemption. Carmichael infuses Edith with such pathos and barely restrained emotion \xe2\x80\x94 she appears to be perpetually on the verge of tears so far \xe2\x80\x94 that it\xe2\x80\x99s difficult not to empathize with the character, even when Lady Mary deploys a typically cutting remark against her sister toward the end of the episode.', 'On that front, Lady Mary seems to have returned to form, and Dockery appears to be relishing having Mary back at her sniping, eyebrow-raising best: She gets to fire off some of the sharpest lines of the episode, proving that she definitely inherited the deadly heat-seeking wit of the Dowager Countess (Maggie Smith).
