It was important to the narrative that Mary should mourn the death of Matthew, but it\xe2\x80\x99s equally important now that Mary is able to return to the character\xe2\x80\x99s innate mix of prickliness and charm as well. Dockery\xe2\x80\x99s Mary is smart, sly, and sexy and the episode gives her the ability to showcase these attributes while not restricting her from also being maternal and caring as well, proving that these modes of behavior are not mutually exclusive.', 'Elsewhere, the return of Harriet Walter\xe2\x80\x99s Lady Shackleton and the appearance of Chancellor\xe2\x80\x99s Lady Anstruther are welcome additions to the sprawling cast, which reduced its number by a few over the last two seasons. While it\xe2\x80\x99s unclear how much of an impact either character will ultimately make, their brief appearances in the first episode offer intriguing possibilities for future storylines. (Richard E. Grant\xe2\x80\x99s Simon Bricker, meanwhile, will show up in the second episode and I\xe2\x80\x99m already anticipating that he creates quite a stir at Downton.)', 'But the true joy of the episode, directed by returnee Catherine Morshead, is the elegant way in which nearly every character becomes enmeshed in a subplot or two, especially this early in the season. Part of the problem with Season 4 was that many of the characters had precious little to do except offer up stern looks or glower with surprise. That is not the case with the Season 5 premiere, fortunately: The aforementioned whirlwind of plot affords everyone the ability to participate in some way, from Miss Baxter and Molesley (Kevin Doyle) \xe2\x80\x94 who, yet again, offers some much-needed comic relief \xe2\x80\x94 to Carson (Jim Carter) and the Earl of Grantham himself, Robert (Hugh Bonneville).', 'The latter is given new focus here, as the show continues its exploration of shifting societal tides and mores and the ongoing transformation of the serving and ruling classes. Yes, there is a moment where Robert\xe2\x80\x99s privilege shows during an ornate dinner party, but there are also scenes of tenderness for Robert as well, allowing the Crawley paterfamilias the opportunity to interact in new ways with Cora (Elizabeth McGovern), Mary, and Tom Branson (Allen Leech). He and Mary have a particularly sweet exchange, and the final scene between Robert and Tom is particularly masterful and surprisingly touching, given the usual friction between the two men.', 'That is not to say that the episode is without flaw: There is a strain of far-too-easy-simplicity that crops up within', 'from time to time, a sense that you can see plots intersecting from a mile away, whether it be Daisy (Sophie McShera) looking to better her mathematics skills and \xe2\x80\x94 lo and behold! \xe2\x80\x94 local schoolteacher Miss Sarah Bunting (Daisy Lewis), Tom\xe2\x80\x99s new love interest, teaches mathematics! The outcome of a plot involving the household arrangements seems fairly certain, until a character saves the day and saves his or her job once more.', 'has the ability to surprise, so it\xe2\x80\x99s galling when Fellowes relies on telegraphing action in advance, or falls back on a structure (reversal-shift-reversal) that he\xe2\x80\x99s used with the same character a few times already.', 'But, even given that pitfall, I\xe2\x80\x99m intrigued to see at which destinations the promising fifth season of', 'arrives. It feels, even if temporarily, like a return to the glorious highs of past seasons \xe2\x80\x94 there\xe2\x80\x99s a mesmerizing instability and possibility to the first episode, a sense of shifting tectonic plates and dynamics between the characters. Change has never stopped short of the walls of the Abbey, but has instead permeated the actions of everyone, upstairs and down. If Fellowes can succeed at making such societal changes feel both personal and universal, and continue to propel the characters into new but logical directions in Season 5, I\xe2\x80\x99m more than happy to remain at Downton for many years to come.', 'Season 5 of', 'begins Sunday, Sept. 21, on ITV in the U.K., and Sunday, Jan. 4, 2015, on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', 'in the U.S.', '8.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Downton Abbey" Season 5 Begins With A Jolt', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 18 Gasp-Worthy Secrets About "Downton Abbey" Season 5 From TheåÊCast
Description: ['Michelle Dockery, Allen Leech, Laura Carmichael, and Joanne Froggatt share details about the new season with BuzzFeed.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: SPOILERS ahead if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t finished Season 4.', '', '1.', 'Reinvention is very big this season.', 'Judging from how often word \xe2\x80\x9creinvention\xe2\x80\x9d itself came up among the cast members.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s big social change in this season,\xe2\x80\x9d Michelle Dockery, who plays Lady Mary, told BuzzFeed. \xe2\x80\x9cYou can tell by the clothes, it\xe2\x80\x99s very, very modern. And Mary really embraces those changes. Reinvention is a good word.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'That spirit of renewal is perhaps nowhere more apparent than within the character of Lady Mary herself. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s the new Mary,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cBecause she\xe2\x80\x99s through the grief now and she\xe2\x80\x99s moving on with her life and embracing a social life again, and exploring things romantically and also taking on more responsibility with the estate. She\xe2\x80\x99s really kind of growing up and growing into a different person this time.\xe2\x80\x9d', '2.', 'But that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean Lady Mary will be choosing a new husband any time soon.', 'Yes, that means that the love triangle is still in full force and both Charles Blake (Julian Ovenden) and Anthony Gillingham (Tom Cullen) are back in Season 5. \xe2\x80\x9cThey are on the scene,\xe2\x80\x9d Dockery said. \xe2\x80\x9cMary doesn\xe2\x80\x99t settle with anyone any time soon; she was never going to. That\xe2\x80\x99s important, not just for the story, but for the audience, because Matthew [Dan Stevens] was such a well-loved character, and Dan, of course, so you can\xe2\x80\x99t really have Mary marry someone immediately. She\xe2\x80\x99s just feeling her way through things, really. She\xe2\x80\x99s still being very impulsive. I love that about her, that she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t always think things through. She\xe2\x80\x99ll make a decision and she goes with it, and then often, she\xe2\x80\x99ll regret it afterwards or think, in hindsight, she could have dealt with it better. I love that about her. It\xe2\x80\x99s a very human quality.\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'Evelyn Napier (Brendan Patricks), however, is far out of the running.', '\xe2\x80\x9cPoor Evelyn,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dockery. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s not really much hope for Evelyn. I think it was always going to be that way with Evelyn though; it\xe2\x80\x99s sort of the past now, for Mary.\xe2\x80\x9d', '4.', 'Anna (Joanne Froggatt) and Bates (Brendan Coyle) are still trying to find their way back together.', '\xe2\x80\x9cAnna is a changed person from what\xe2\x80\x99s happened,\xe2\x80\x9d Froggatt told BuzzFeed. \xe2\x80\x9cA little bit of her spark has just been put out for a while, because any sort of traumatic experience is not something that just disappears; it\xe2\x80\x99s something that stays with you and you hopefully learn to live with it.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But there is at least some hope for the star-crossed couple, even if Season 5 offers some more drama for the duo. \xe2\x80\x9c[Anna] and Mr. Bates are trying to heal themselves and heal their relationship and move forward, but it is difficult for them because there is this cloud hanging over them,\xe2\x80\x9d Froggatt said. \xe2\x80\x9cThe subject of Mr. Green [Nigel Harman] keeps getting brought back up and it\xe2\x80\x99s being thrust back at them. They are struggling to find the space to be able to heal, and even though Anna doesn\xe2\x80\x99t believe Mr. Bates had anything to do with Mr. Green\xe2\x80\x99s death \xe2\x80\x94 she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t think Mr. Bates knew it was Mr. Green \xe2\x80\x94 she has this niggling thing that she can\xe2\x80\x99t leave it alone. She can\xe2\x80\x99t quite work it out, and it\xe2\x80\x99s another anxiety for her, and it\xe2\x80\x99s another confusing emotion for her.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Their secrets may, however, come back to haunt them\xe2\x80\xa6 or bring them closer together in the end. \xe2\x80\x9cEach of them is keeping a secret from the other, but they\xe2\x80\x99re doing it for the other one\xe2\x80\x99s benefit,\xe2\x80\x9d she added. \xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99re doing it to protect the other person.\xe2\x80\x9d', '5.', 'Mary, meanwhile, will potentially be haunted by the action she took at the end of last season.', '\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s incredibly protective of Anna, which is why she does what she does with the burning of the ticket,\xe2\x80\x9d Dockery said. \xe2\x80\x9cThat continues into Season 5. Anna \xe2\x80\x94 she\xe2\x80\x99ll always have her back, but at the same time, it is this secret now. Mary is party to the crime now, because if it was Bates, Mary destroyed evidence, so she was taking a big risk there, but she was taking it for a friend. They\xe2\x80\x99d run over coals for each other. They\xe2\x80\x99re so close and it\xe2\x80\x99s lovely to see their relationship develop.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Having said that, however, Dockery admitted that there may be consequences for burning that train ticket, which tied Bates to the location of Mr. Green\xe2\x80\x99s death. \xe2\x80\x9cI think it will always haunt her,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s essentially destroying evidence. I think Mary has that attitude that she\xe2\x80\x99ll get away with it. Maybe she will because of who she is, but maybe she won\xe2\x80\x99t.\xe2\x80\x9d', '6.', 'Mary and Tom Branson (Allen Leech) grow closer.', 'ITV', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhat I love about Season 5 is the fact that that friendship that you see the beginnings of between Mary and Tom really comes into fruition,\xe2\x80\x9d Leech told BuzzFeed. \xe2\x80\x9cThey really become confidantes for each other in Season 5, and it\xe2\x80\x99s very much as brother-in-law and sister-in-law, but it goes beyond that. It starts as that, and it becomes a proper friendship\xe2\x80\xa6 I think Tom\xe2\x80\x99s clever enough never to get involved in relation to a romantic life. He very much keeps it as much as he can in relation to her asking for advice and vice versa, he\xe2\x80\x99d never put his foot in it.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Dockery agreed. \xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99re much closer,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s funny looking back, how she felt about Branson to begin with, with Sybil and Branson and how she wasn\xe2\x80\x99t for that relationship, and now they\xe2\x80\x99ve become very, very close. There\xe2\x80\x99s a similarity in what they went through, having lost a partner, so they spend quite a lot of time together on the estate and they\xe2\x80\x99ve become each other\xe2\x80\x99s confidante, which is something you never would have imagined in Season 1 \xe2\x80\x94 that Mary would be confiding in the chauffeur.\xe2\x80\x9d', '7.', 'Russian refugees will descend on Downton.', 'No, this is not a scene from the new season of', '(it\xe2\x80\x99s from', 'of all places), but it does depict Rade Serbedzija, appearing here as a shady mobster of sorts. Serbedzija will join the cast as Kuragin for Season 5, which will feature a Russian refugee subplot, one that heavily involves the Dowager Countess (Maggie Smith) and Lady Rose (Lily James).', '\xe2\x80\x9cThey open up the house, and Mary is a part of that,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dockery. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s very proud of Rose. She admires her for what she\xe2\x80\x99s doing. And of course, it\xe2\x80\x99s what then evolves with Violet\xe2\x80\x99s involvement with it all \xe2\x80\x94 without giving too much away \xe2\x80\x94 where Mary takes more of an interest\xe2\x80\xa6 She\xe2\x80\x99s not do-gooding quite as much as Rose is.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Laura Carmichael, who plays Lady Edith, added: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s Rose\xe2\x80\x99s project, really. You see Rose try and better herself in a very sweet way. She\xe2\x80\x99s maturing out of parties and decides she needs to do something worthwhile, and it\xe2\x80\x99s adorable. It\xe2\x80\x99s really lovely.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But don\xe2\x80\x99t expect Branson to get involved, given his revolutionary leanings. \xe2\x80\x9cHe would have some issues supporting it as much, given what happened in Russia at the time,\xe2\x80\x9d Leech said. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s a nice moment to play. I think that\xe2\x80\x99s the reason you don\xe2\x80\x99t see Tom getting so involved; obviously, he has some issues with the imperialist nature of some of the people who are there.\xe2\x80\x9d', '8.', 'Edith has hidden her illegitimate daughter on the estate, but that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that things will play out any easier with the child nearby.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe main thing for Edith now is the child,\xe2\x80\x9d Carmichael told BuzzFeed. \xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s had a baby, and she\xe2\x80\x99s having that awful feeling of being separated from your child, and she\xe2\x80\x99s living with that. And yet she cannot share that with anyone because it\xe2\x80\x99s too great a risk to her reputation.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But having the child nearby doesn\xe2\x80\x99t soothe her conscience in any way or remove the pangs of motherhood. \xe2\x80\x9cFor her, it has to be slightly comforting, but as you\xe2\x80\x99ll see throughout the season, we really see the struggle of doing that, of having the child live on the estate but nobody knowing why she has such a great interest in this orphan,\xe2\x80\x9d Carmichael said. \xe2\x80\x9cHow to balance that with her instinct \xe2\x80\x94 which is to see her as much as possible and be part of her life and be her mother without risking it coming out and without alienating the adoptive parents\xe2\x80\xa6 [That] is the thing that we really deal with, how the Drewe family copes with having the lady of the house come as often as she possibly can to see the child.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And those pop-ins add a patina of additional danger for Edith. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a drama waiting to happen,\xe2\x80\x9d said Carmichael. \xe2\x80\x9cEverything is on a knife-edge, really.\xe2\x80\x9d', '9.', 'But Mary isn\xe2\x80\x99t going to do Edith like Edith did her.', 'ITV', 'ITV', 'As in, she\xe2\x80\x99s not going to out Edith\xe2\x80\x99s secret the way that Edith nearly destroyed Mary\xe2\x80\x99s reputation by contacting the Turkish ambassador way back in Season 1.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI think they\xe2\x80\x99ve gone beyond that,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dockery. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think Mary\xe2\x80\x99s out to get one over Edith \xe2\x80\x94 she gets a little impatient with Edith when she\xe2\x80\x99s down and she\xe2\x80\x99s obviously got something going on, and Mary doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really know what it is. She gets very impatient with her, because Mary\xe2\x80\x99s very much a get-up-and-go sort of person \xe2\x80\xa6 and with Edith, she just finds it a little bit irritating that she\xe2\x80\x99s not happy.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Likewise, Carmichael said there hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been a rapprochement between the two Crawley sisters. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s still pretty frosty, to be honest,\xe2\x80\x9d said Carmichael of Mary and Edith\xe2\x80\x99s relationship. \xe2\x80\x9cThe lucky thing for Edith is that Mary doesn\xe2\x80\x99t know right now, so who knows what she would do with that information. I can\xe2\x80\x99t really tell you any more without giving it away. It\xe2\x80\x99s interesting.\xe2\x80\x9d', '10.', 'Likewise, the father-daughter relationship between Mary and Robert (Hugh Bonneville) remains complicated.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMary\xe2\x80\x99s always slightly battling with her father, but they manage to find common ground,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dockery. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s just the way that it is \xe2\x80\x94 I think he\xe2\x80\x99s still adjusting to her being in such a high position on the estate, and being a woman, and, as it goes on, he begins to \xe2\x80\x94 I guess he has faith in her, that she can take responsibility for what she has to do on the estate.\xe2\x80\x9d', '11.', 'The mystery surrounding the presumed death of Michael Gregson (Charles Edwards) will continue into Season 5.', 'Particularly, Edith\xe2\x80\x99s fixation with determining just what happened to her would-be husband after he arrived in Germany. (That story about him attacking a gang of brownshirt ruffians on his first night there strained credulity.) \xe2\x80\x9cIt continues to obsess her and the family really can\xe2\x80\x99t understand why,\xe2\x80\x9d said Carmichael. \xe2\x80\x9cThey met him a couple of times, they knew she was keen on him, but they don\xe2\x80\x99t have any idea about the extent of their relationship and the fact that she was pregnant by him and she\xe2\x80\x99s had his baby. That is a secret to the family, and it means that they can never fully empathize or be the caring family they need to be when she\xe2\x80\x99s going through this hell.\xe2\x80\x9d', '12.', 'Lady Rosamund (Samantha Bond) is a thorn in Edith\xe2\x80\x99s side. (And so too, potentially, is Violet.)', '\xe2\x80\x9c[Rosamund is] not historically very good at keeping a secret, but she\xe2\x80\x99s already outed it once. She\xe2\x80\x99s already let Violet know,\xe2\x80\x9d said Carmichael. \xe2\x80\x9cEdith therefore doesn\xe2\x80\x99t quite trust her in the same way.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And given that Edith has so few confidantes who know just what she\xe2\x80\x99s sacrificed, for her, \xe2\x80\x9cthe journey this season is how to cope, and what that feels like, and that\xe2\x80\x99s the story that [creator] Julian [Fellowes] really focuses on this year \xe2\x80\x94 how painful it is for Edith\xe2\x80\xa6 and what she can possibly do to get over that,\xe2\x80\x9d Carmichael said.', '\xe2\x80\x9cHowever much Rosamund and Violet care for Edith, their take on it is: \xe2\x80\x98You must move on and pretend it never happened for the sake of everyone and your reputation,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d she continued. \xe2\x80\x9cThey think it\xe2\x80\x99s the most caring thing to do. And that was true of so many people of this time, and so many women who have to give up children that they would have loved. It\xe2\x80\x99s incredibly painful, and you hear that they thought of their child every day, and many women have to do that, and what we see happen in Season 4 is how you cope. She couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite go the whole way, she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t quite let go, and therefore, it\xe2\x80\x99s dangerous. But yeah, Rosamund and Violet don\xe2\x80\x99t know that Edith brought the child back, so it\xe2\x80\x99s another secret to add to the pile.\xe2\x80\x9d', '13.', 'Ultimately, Season 5 is about \xe2\x80\x9cmotherhood\xe2\x80\x9d for Edith.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhat it\xe2\x80\x99s about this year, is seeing her as a mother, and the difference between her as a mother to Mary as a mother is interesting, and what that does to the pair of them is great,\xe2\x80\x9d said Carmichael. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s about motherhood.\xe2\x80\x9d', '14.', 'And yet, there\xe2\x80\x99s the hope of some sort of bond forming between Edith and Tom.', 'There were hints of an Edith-Tom friendship beginning in the fourth season and that carries through to Season 5 as well. \xe2\x80\x9cYou see a warmth between both Tom and Mary, and Tom and Edith, where they are confiding in each other,\xe2\x80\x9d said Leech. \xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99ve gone through tremendous stuff. While he lost a wife, they lost a sister, and they all have children now, and obviously Edith\xe2\x80\x99s going through her issues, so they do all become confidantes. They funny thing is, of course, the only people who don\xe2\x80\x99t confide in each other are Mary and Edith, because they still hate each other. That relationship\xe2\x80\x99s there as well, and obviously Edith has a really amazing storyline this year, and Tom comes in and out of that, tries to offer all the support he can.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s really lovely moments for the three of them, with their families and with their futures, either on their laps or by their sides,\xe2\x80\x9d he continued. \xe2\x80\x9cIt really is lovely to see that come together \xe2\x80\x94 and it kind of also heightens the fact that there\xe2\x80\x99s one daughter missing. I always thought that\xe2\x80\x99s really interesting. Tom\xe2\x80\x99s taken the place of Sybil [Jessica Brown-Findlay] in relation to these siblings.\xe2\x80\x9d', '15.', 'But it\xe2\x80\x99s not romantic, because that local schoolteacher \xe2\x80\x94 Sarah Bunting (Daisy Lewis) \xe2\x80\x94 is back as a love interest for Tom.', '\xe2\x80\x9c[Branson] has his dreams and aspirations to be as good a man as he can be, and Season 5 sees him wrestling with the idea of whether it\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be within Downton or without,\xe2\x80\x9d Leech said. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s his struggle throughout Season 5, and Sarah Bunting, who\xe2\x80\x99s the schoolteacher you saw at the end of Season 4, she stokes the fire a little bit in him again, because she\xe2\x80\x99s such a kind of firebrand in her own right. She\xe2\x80\x99s very like what Branson was when he first arrived at the house.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cThrough the season, you see him wrestling with the fact that she has no real understanding of the family now that he does. He doesn\xe2\x80\x99t see them as she does,\xe2\x80\x9d he continued. \xe2\x80\x9cHe has a great line: \xe2\x80\x98I don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in types, I believe in people.\xe2\x80\x99 The more he tries to explain this and show this to Sarah Bunting, the more he realizes that maybe there is a life outside of this. Maybe there\xe2\x80\x99s a life outside of this for him. She constantly says, \xe2\x80\x98There\xe2\x80\x99s more to you than this,\xe2\x80\x99 and I think some of that rubs off him.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'So does that mean that Branson will take Sybbie (Fifi Hart) and run off to America any time soon? \xe2\x80\x9cSeason 5 is him trying to figure out exactly [what he wants]:', '\xe2\x80\x9d Leech said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s definitely a real journey for him this year.\xe2\x80\x9d', '16.', 'But there\xe2\x80\x99s tension between Branson and the servants at Downton.', 'Remember how Thomas (Rob James-Collier) made a big thing out of trying to remind Branson that he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t one of them and wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a member of the Crawley family either? Well, it appears that Branson\xe2\x80\x99s in-limbo state will be a source of conflict between the chauffeur-turned-estate manager and his former downstairs colleagues \xe2\x80\x94 and not just with Thomas.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not only him,\xe2\x80\x9d said Leech. \xe2\x80\x9cMore people are beginning to see that maybe there\xe2\x80\x99s more to life than being a servant. Tom is an example of what you can do, what you can achieve \xe2\x80\x94 OK, the way he went about it was slightly against the grain, you know, eloping with one of the daughters, but a lot of people see him and resent him for the fact of where he sits now. That\xe2\x80\x99s a constant, constant struggle for the staff, and a constant struggle for Tom, and again, maybe a good reason why he needs to get out.\xe2\x80\x9d', '17.', 'Something is going on between Carson (Jim Carter) and Mrs. Hughes (Phyllis Logan), who took each other\xe2\x80\x99s hand at the end of Season 4.', 'Or is it? \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s bubbling away there,\xe2\x80\x9d said Froggatt. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re not quite sure what\xe2\x80\x99s going to go on with Carson and Mrs. Hughes, but nobody else knows about it. They keep it very much private and to themselves. But that beautiful scene where they held hands going into the sea, it was so cute. I\xe2\x80\x99d love to see more of Carson and Mrs. Hughes in their private state, because I love those scenes between them.\xe2\x80\x9d', '18.', 'The opening episode of Season 5 may or may not make you cry.', 'Leech confirmed that it may (though it took a while).', '\xe2\x80\x9cSomething sad happens? Something', 'happens,\xe2\x80\x9d said Leech. \xe2\x80\x9cVery dramatic. Sad?\xe2\x80\xa6 I haven\xe2\x80\x99t seen it\xe2\x80\xa6 Oh yeah, something sad does happen. Yeah. I\xe2\x80\x99ll confirm something sad does happen.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But nothing sad ever happens on', '! Oh, wait.', 'Something sad ALWAYS happens on', '. You\xe2\x80\x99ve been warned.', 'Season 5 of', 'premieres this autumn on ITV in the U.K. and on Jan. 4, 2015, on PBS\xe2\x80\x99', 'in the U.S.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '18 Gasp-Worthy Secrets About "Downton Abbey" Season 5 From The Cast', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 8 New Photos From "Downton Abbey" SeasonåÊ5
Description: ['The Crawleys and their servants are back for a new season of domestic drama and international intrigue this autumn on ITV and in Jan. on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Plus, George and Sybbie have grown up!', '', '1.', 'The latest season of', 'is nearly upon us, which means a new signature image featuring the cast\xe2\x80\xa6 which this time includes wee George and Sybbie up front with Lady Mary (Michelle Dockery) and Tom Branson (Allen Leech).', '2.', 'Lady Mary poses on a hunt with Tom Branson and possible paramour, Lord Gillingham (Tom Cullen). Does this point towards who Mary might have chosen as a potential future spouse? Hmmm.', '3.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s almost impossible for Thomas (Robert James-Collier) not to have a sly, mischievous smirk on his face.', '4.', 'Of all the possible romantic entanglements on the show, I\xe2\x80\x99m most intrigued by that between old friends Mr. Carson (Jim Carter) and Mrs. Hughes (Phyllis Logan), who took one another\xe2\x80\x99s hand at the end of Season 4.', '5.', 'There\xe2\x80\x99s an air of tension here in this photo of Mr. Bates (Brendan Coyle) and Anna Bates (Joanne Froggatt). Will their secrets from last year continue to haunt them in Season 5?', '6.', 'Isobel Crawley (Penelope Wilton) offers a knowing look at she tends to her trees.', '7.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not just me, right? Daisy (Sophie McShera) seems downright confident here.', '8.', 'Is Simon Bricker (Richard E. Grant) trouble for the Crawleys or something else altogether? Cora, Countess of Grantham (Elizabeth McGovern) poses with the latest arrival to Downton.', '9.', 'Bonus: it\xe2\x80\x99s baby George and Sybbie!', 'Courtesy of Nick Briggs/Carnival Films 2014 for MASTERPIECE', '10.', '', 'begins this autumn on ITV in the U.K. and begin Jan. 4, 2015 on PBS\xe2\x80\x99', '. Title: Shonda Rhimes Takes Over ABC‰Ûªs ThursdayåÊNights
Description: ['Three ShondaLand shows will air back-to-back-to-back on Thursdays, while ABC splits up the Marvel Universe.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Everything else is business as usual.', '', 'For the third time, Shonda Rhimes will have three shows airing on ABC, but for the first time ever, all three will air back-to-back-to-back. Yes, Thursdays become ShondaNight (trademark pending) as', 'shifts to 8 p.m.,', 'moves to 9 p.m., and', 'bows at 10 p.m.', '\xe2\x80\x9c[Rhimes] is one of the greatest voices on television and you\xe2\x80\x99ve seen us stumble at that 8 p.m. hour,\xe2\x80\x9d ABC Entertainment Group President Paul Lee said of the big Thursday night switch in a conference call with the press shortly after the 2014\xe2\x80\x932015 schedule was released. The plan is to use the monster success of', 'to \xe2\x80\x9cdrive into and lead out to', ',\xe2\x80\x9d Rhimes\xe2\x80\x99 new series starring Viola Davis.', 'And Lee isn\xe2\x80\x99t worried about moving', 'back to 8 p.m. for its 11th (yes,', ') season either. \xe2\x80\x9cWe really think', 'is such a strong show. It has such a built-in audience. The audience loves it\xe2\x80\xa6 We feel very confident in it,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee added. There was concern from some journalists about the adult content', 'offers airing at the earlier hour, where it once lived. \xe2\x80\x9cWe have no doubts that', 'is going to play great at 8 so that\xe2\x80\x99s really not an issue,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re going to make sure that what we air is appropriate.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'As far as the network\xe2\x80\x99s new content goes, Lee said ABC took a new approach. \xe2\x80\x9cWe actually went out and approached some of the strongest voices and best storytellers in the world,\xe2\x80\x9d he noted. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd we said, \xe2\x80\x98Bring us your passion projects.\xe2\x80\x99 And I really don\xe2\x80\x99t think they disappointed,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee continued, citing midseason drama', 'from John Ridley as a prime example. Lee called the show, which will replace', 'after it finishes its 15 or 16-episode run, \xe2\x80\x9ca very big swing for ABC.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The network is also diversifying with three of its new comedies:', 'and', ', which will debut in the fall, and', ', which will hold until midseason. \xe2\x80\x9cWe really wanted to reflect the changing face of America,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee said. Of', ', specifically, he added: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s really sizzling. It\xe2\x80\x99s a very, very, very distinctive voice. We really do think ABC reflects the new face of America.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Meanwhile, the network isn\xe2\x80\x99t doubling up on Marvel shows as', ', which Lee called a \xe2\x80\x9cS.H.I.E.L.D. origin story,\xe2\x80\x9d will serve as bridge programming between the fall finale and winter premiere of', ', which Lee referred to as a \xe2\x80\x9cself-starter.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cIt took a little bit of time to find our sea legs, but the back nine of shield are really excellent,\xe2\x80\x9d he admitted. \xe2\x80\x9cWe feel good about it.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Also bridging a gap is the medieval musical', ', which will air while', 'is on hiatus. \xe2\x80\x9cWe thought it\xe2\x80\x99d be a really fun idea to do a half-hour musical,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee said of', ', which he said is \xe2\x80\x9ctotally adorable.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'A few other notable details:', '\xe2\x80\xa2', ', starring Anthony Anderson scored the post-', 'time slot, which has been less of a blessing and more of a curse for the last few shows that resided there (', '', ',', ').', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Given', '\xe2\x80\x99s killer ratings, many wondered if ABC would test the reality show in a new time slot, but it will stay on Fridays, where it routinely wins the night.', 'and', ', a proven Monday night draw, are also staying put.', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Lee was also very confident in', '\xe2\x80\x99 move from Tuesdays to Wednesdays. He said he believes it was \xe2\x80\x9cthe best comedy of the year this year\xe2\x80\x9d and thinks it\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cperfectly positioned to stay on the network for a really long time.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\xa2 Critics were devastated by the loss of freshman comedy', 'and Lee admitted he too \xe2\x80\x9cwas sad to see it go.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cIt was a really great show and we certainly gave it a lot of promotion in a whole lot of different ways, but in the end, I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry it didn\xe2\x80\x99t come back,\xe2\x80\x9d he added.', '\xe2\x80\xa2 But! There is good news for', 'fans: After finally finding its footing again in Season 3, the show will get a full fourth season. \xe2\x80\x9cThe showrunners had a great idea of how we can just give it a little twist and reset the story,\xe2\x80\x9d Lee noted.', 'The full schedule is at the bottom of the story, and the new shows are now arranged in night-of-the-week order.', '3.', '', '(Tuesdays at 8 p.m.)', 'Karen Gillan (', ') and John Cho (', ')', '', 'Written and produced by Emily Kapnek (', ') with Julie Anne Robinson (', ') directing and executive producing', '', 'Amy Pond does comedy! Loosely based on', ', Gillan stars as Eliza Dooley, a self-obsessed twenty-something with a huge online following, who comes to realize that being popular online doesn\xe2\x80\x99t translate into having real friends. So in order to makeover her life, she asks a co-worker (Cho) to help change her image. Let\xe2\x80\x99s hope', 'is the theme song.', '', 'This premise looks like a wonderful\xe2\x80\xa6movie. Gillan\xe2\x80\x99s got the comedy bitch act down pat, but I have serious concerns about there being enough evolutionary material here to make it past the zygote stage. \xe2\x80\x94', '5.', '', '(Tuesdays at 8:30 p.m.)', 'Analeigh Tipton (', '), Jake McDorman (', '), Kurt Fuller (', '), Nicolas Wright (', '), Jade Catta-Preta (', '), Chloe Wepper (', ')', '', 'Written by Jeff Lowell (', ') who executive produced along with Peter Traugott (', '), Robin Schwartz, Rachel Kaplan, and Jon Liebman. Michael Fresco (', ') directed the pilot.', '', 'Dueling voice-overs illuminate what the opposite sex is actually thinking as a new relationship blossoms between Dana and Peter (Tipton and McDorman). Remember when Analeigh Tipton was on', '?', '', 'I adore the idea of going inside the brains of modern-day singletons, but as I learned in my twenties, there\xe2\x80\x99s not always a lot upstairs. But perhaps', ', which Paul Lee called \xe2\x80\x9cadorable,\xe2\x80\x9d can prove otherwise. \xe2\x80\x94', '7.', '', '(Tuesdays at 10 p.m.)', 'Ioan Gruffudd (', '), Alana De La Garza (', '), Joel David Moore (', '), and Judd Hirsch (', ')', '', 'Written and produced by Matt Miller (', ') with Dan Lin (', ') and Jennifer Gwartz (', ') executive producing. Brad Anderson (', ') directed the pilot.', '', 'A New York City medical examiner (Gruffudd) spends his days solving cases and his nights trying to figure out the cause of his immortality.', '', 'We\xe2\x80\x99ve seen detectives paired with dozens of average people (writers, freelancer crime solvers, magically resurrected turn of the century soldiers). Now we\xe2\x80\x99re getting a cop with an inexplicably eternal man. Everything else seems fairly routine. \xe2\x80\x94', '9.', '', '(Wednesdays at 9:30 p.m.)', 'Anthony Anderson (', '), Tracee Ellis Ross (', '), Laurence Fishburne (', '), Yara Shahidi, Marcus Scribner, Miles Brow, and Marsai Martin', '', 'Written by Kenya Barris (', '), who executive produced with Anderson, Fishburne, Larry Wilmore (', '), and James Griffiths (', '), who directed the pilot', '', 'Wild success has led an African-American family to wonder if they\xe2\x80\x99ve assimilated into white society too much. There is a character named Rainbow. That is all.', '', 'It only took one line for me to question this show. The teaser features a young (non-Jewish) boy telling his parents: \xe2\x80\x9cI want to have a bar mitzvah.\xe2\x80\x9d The attempted humor doesn\xe2\x80\x99t hit for me and if the teaser is any indication,', 'seems to take everything one step too far. I worry this show will offend a lot of people, but, as with all of these first looks, it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to say. \xe2\x80\x94', '11.', '', '(Thursdays at 10 p.m.)', 'Viola Davis (', '), Katie Findlay (', '), Matt McGorry (', '), Liza Weil (', '), Billy Brown, Aja Naomi King, Karla Souza, and Charlie Weber', '', 'Written by Peter Nowalk (', '), who executive produced with Shonda Rhimes (', ') and Betsy Beers (', '). Michael Offer (', ') directed the pilot.', '', 'Four law students studying underneath Annalise Keating (Davis) use the tricks they learn in her eponymous class to cover up a murder. TL;DR: Shonda enters the legal world with an Oscar-nominated actress at the helm!', '', 'This looks like', 'turned all the way up in terms of twistiness, as a group of law students use the skills they learn in their Criminology 101 class \xe2\x80\x94 or as Viola Davis\xe2\x80\x99 Professor Annalise Keating calls it, How to Get Away with Murder (the title!)\xe2\x80\x94 to do just that. Or they\xe2\x80\x99re helping Annalise get away with a murder of her own. Or something. Either way, people are talking fast and covering up secrets, and Davis is magnetic. We\xe2\x80\x99re already hooked. \xe2\x80\x94', '13.', '', '(Fridays at 8:30 p.m.)', 'Newcomer Cristela Alonzo, Carlos Ponce (', '), Terri Hoyos, Andrew Leeds, Sam McMurray', '', 'Alonzo and Kevin Hench (', '), who executive produce with Marty Adelstein (', '), Shawn Levy, and Becky Clements. John Pasquin directed the pilot presentation.', '', 'A law student (Alonzo) struggles to balance her work life, her home life, and her Mexican-American family\xe2\x80\x99s cultural expectations in this semi-autobiographical sitcom.', '', 'Laughs are as plentiful in this trailer as beers are in Cristela\xe2\x80\x99s house. In short, there are none. \xe2\x80\x94', '15.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Newcomer Hudson Yang (the son of a', '), Randall Park (', '), Constance Wu, and Forrest Wheeler (', ')', '', 'Writer Nahnatchka Kahn (', '), who executive produces with Jake Kasdan (', '). Lynn Shelton (', ') directed the pilot.', '', 'Based on Chef Eddie Huang\xe2\x80\x99s memoir, this 90s-set comedy follows a newly relocated immigrant family who must adapt to a new way of life when they trade the thriving metropolis of Washington, D.C. for suburban Florida.', '', 'Laughed harder \xe2\x80\x94 and more often \xe2\x80\x94 than I was expecting. The offensive-ish title aside, the butt of these jokes doesn\xe2\x80\x99t seem to be the Asian-American family at the center of the show, but rather, suburban American culture. If executed correctly, and it\xe2\x80\x99s a fine line the show is towing, this comedy has great potential. \xe2\x80\x94', '17.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Ryan Phillippe (', '), Juliette Lewis (', '), KaDee Strickland (', '), Clifton Collins Jr. (', '), Natalie Martinez (', '), Belle Shouse, and Indiana Evans', '', 'It hails from writer Barbie Kligman (', ') and executive producers Aaron Kaplan, Tracey Robertson, and Nathan Mayfield and director Charles McDougall (who has directed a zillion pilots including', ').', '', 'When Ben Garner (Phillippe) finds the dead body of a 4-year-old boy, he instantly becomes the police\xe2\x80\x99s main suspect, spurring him on a quest to find the real killer in order to clear his name.', '', 'The trailer looks great. But the problem with these kinds of elaborately plotted crime dramas tends to be revealed around Episode 7 or 8, when the writers are forced to come up with extraneous plots to sidetrack the characters en route to a resolution. But with such a short order,', 'shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to invent any time-killing detours. \xe2\x80\x94', '19.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Felicity Huffman (', '), Timothy Hutton (', '), Penelope Ann Miller (', ', Earl Brown (', '), Richard Cabral, Caitlin Gerard, Benito Martinez, Elvis Nolasco, and Johnny Ortiz', '', 'The pilot was written and directed by John Ridley (', '), who executive produces with former ABC Studios head of drama Michael J. McDonald', '', 'Revolves around a single crime (a young couple is attacked in their home) and the various people \xe2\x80\x94 friends, family, strangers \xe2\x80\x94 who are impacted by the heinous act.', '', 'The insanely amazing pedigree, both in front and behind the camera, is not going to waste, judging from this complex, heavy, and ultimately effective trailer. Whether or not there\xe2\x80\x99s enjoyment to be mined from this intense series is will only be revealed once subsequent episodes air. \xe2\x80\x94', '21.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Lily Rabe (', '), Barry Sloane (', '), Milo Ventimiglia (', '), Derek Webster, Brianna Brown, Catalina Denis, Kylie Rogers, and Kyle Harrison Breitkopf', '', 'Written by Soo Hugh (', '), who exective produced along with Steven Speilberg (', '), Justin Falvey (', '), Darryl Frank (', '), and Dawn Olmstead (', '). Mark Romanek (', ') directed the pilot.', '', 'Aliens begin their invasion by inhabiting the world\xe2\x80\x99s children, who are unwittingly helping unseen enemies as the clock counts down in a race to save humanity. Luckily, Rabe has experience with extraterrestrials from', '. (Yes, we all wanted to forget about that. Sorry.)', '', 'Though the basic premise of this sounded absurd (and though it is bound to draw comparisons to', 'and other similar horror film fare), the trailer looks truly chilling\xe2\x80\xa6as long as we don\xe2\x80\x99t actually see the creatures who are supposedly compelling these children to do awful things since the visual has been the weakest point in similar extra terrestrial stories. Losing Lily Rabe on', 'is a shame, but she is clearly throwing all of herself into this role and killing it. \xe2\x80\x94', '23.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Hayley Atwell (', ')', '', 'Michele Fazekas (', ') and Tara Butters (', ') executive produce along with Steve McFeely (', '), Christopher Marcus (', '), and Jeph Loeb (', ')', '', 'Yes,', 'comic-based show and ABC\xe2\x80\x99s second in the Marvel world specifically. Set in 1946, this one follows', '\xe2\x80\x99s Agent Peggy Carter as she juggles secretarial work and clandestine missions for Howard Stark, all while attempting to start dating again after losing the love of her life, Steve Rogers.', '', 'Nothing yet! The pilot hasn\xe2\x80\x99t been shot and ABC showed footage culled from Marvel\xe2\x80\x99s', 'One-Shot from last year.', '24.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Joshua Sasse (', '), Timothy Omundson (', '), Vinnie Jones, Mallory Jansen, Karen David, and Luke Youngblood', '', 'Written by Dan Fogelman (', '), who executive produces along with Alan Menken (', '), Glenn Slater (', '), and Chris Koch (', '), who also directed the pilot', '', 'Described by ABC as \xe2\x80\x9ca musical comedy fairytale\xe2\x80\x9d about Galavant (Sasse), a white knight turned drunkard after the love of his life (Jansen) runs off with an evil king (Omundson). Filled with a newfound sense of revenge, he sets out to reclaim what was once his. Award-winning composer Menken and lyricist Slater are behind the songs, but oh boy.', '', 'Paul Lee described this as a cross between', 'and', ', but that\xe2\x80\x99s not exactly something we need in 2015. It looks a lot like', ', except I did not laugh one time. Based on the response (or lack thereof) from the crowd at ABC\xe2\x80\x99s Upfront presentation, I\xe2\x80\x99m not alone. But maybe this can find the right level of camp and, therefore, an audience. \xe2\x80\x94', '26.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Zoe Boyle (Lavinia from', '!), Odette Annable, JoAnna Garcia Swisher, Dominique McElligott, Aaron McCusker, Azure Parsons, Desmond Harrington, Erin Cummings, Joel Johnstone', '', 'Stephanie Savage (', ') created and will executive produce alongside Josh Schwartz (', '), Stephanie Savage, Michael London, Len Goldstein, and Nick Cassavetes, who directed the pilot.', '', 'This 10-episode series, based on Lily Koppel\xe2\x80\x99s best-selling novel, was pushed from a summer berth to a mid-season 2015 premiere. (So interpret that as you will.) If it ever makes it to air, the \xe2\x80\x9860-set series will center on the ladies behind some of the biggest heroes in American history.', '', 'No trailer available yet.', '27.', '', '(Midseason, TBD)', 'Betsy Brandt (', '), Boris Kodjoe (', '), Callie Hernandez, Chris Conroy', '', 'Susannah Grant (', ')', '', 'Unsurprisingly, ABC picked up this upstairs/downstairs soap (previously known as', 'straight to series. It is set at a private country club. I cannot wait for', '.', '', 'No trailer available.', 'MONDAY', '8-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', 'TUESDAY', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '9-10 p.m.\xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', 'WEDNESDAY', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '8:30-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '9:00-9:30 p.m.\xe2\x80\x94', '9:30-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', 'THURSDAY', '8-9 p.m.\xe2\x80\x94', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', 'FRIDAY', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '8:30-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', 'SATURDAY', '8 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', 'SUNDAY', '7-8 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '8-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', 'correction', 'This post has been updated to change language originally taken from a press release.', '', 'You are signed in as', '.', "Shonda Rhimes Takes Over ABC's Thursday Nights", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: What To Watch (Or Avoid) On TV NextåÊSeason
Description: ['Spoiler alert:', 'isn\xe2\x80\x99t that bad.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed Entertainment staffers unite to break down the 2014\xe2\x80\x9315 season\xe2\x80\x99s new broadcast offerings.', '', 'You may still be mourning last season\xe2\x80\x99s losses of', 'and', ', but the upcoming 2014\xe2\x80\x932015 television season has a slew of new shows on the way.', 'This year, the broadcast networks are offering the usual hard-ass lady lawyers (Viola Davis\xe2\x80\x99 Annalise Keating on ABC\xe2\x80\x99s', '), quirky cop duos (played by Josh Duhamel and Dean Winters in the case of CBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '), and tortured superheroes (Batman\xe2\x80\x99s origins get the television treatment on Fox\xe2\x80\x99s', '). But, there is also an effort to shake things up this season, and literally diversify, particularly on ABC with', 'screenwriter John Ridley\xe2\x80\x99s gritty drama', ', Shonda Rhimes and Pete Nowalk\xe2\x80\x99s aforementioned', '(which gives the', 'creator oversight of an entire three-hour block), and some lighter fare in the form of comedies', 'and', '.', 'But before we get into our first impressions, it\xe2\x80\x99s important to note that what follows is exactly that: These pilots we\xe2\x80\x99re reacting to were made available to critics by the broadcast networks and these are not reviews because everything \xe2\x80\x94 from the music to the dialogue to the casting \xe2\x80\x94 is subject to change. What hits airwaves to the American public could be drastically different from what we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen. So, it\xe2\x80\x99s very possible our initial opinions upon seeing final review copies of these pilots closer to air could change. After all, some disappointing pilots have turned into some of television\xe2\x80\x99s greatest gems (cough', 'cough).', 'Without further ado, let\xe2\x80\x99s begin with this season\xe2\x80\x99s biggest network risk-taker\xe2\x80\xa6', '3.', 'ABC', '4.', '', '(Tuesdays at 8 p.m. on ABC)', 'A vapid and narcissistic twentysomething, Eliza Dooley (Karen Gillan), realizes that social media friends are not true friends, and joins forces with her co-worker, Henry Higenbottam (John Cho), to rebrand herself in this update of', '.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m torn on', '. I absolutely loved the off-kilter humor of Emily Kapnek\xe2\x80\x99s', ', which often pushed itself into dark satire territory, and I\xe2\x80\x99m hoping that this develops into something with a similar tone. John Cho is quite good and if Karen Gillan\xe2\x80\x99s accent weren\xe2\x80\x99t quite so stridently bizarre, I might have enjoyed this pilot more. There are some genuinely funny moments and throwaway lines, but how can this premise sustain itself indefinitely?', 'I too (initially) loved', 'and I too have no idea how a show with such a makeover storyline could survive for a half a season let alone multiple ones. But, horrible accent (', 'syndrome strikes again), torturously extended vomit gag, and embarrassingly trendy name aside,', 'pleasantly surprised me. And that\xe2\x80\x99s in large part thanks to the charisma and chemistry of Cho and Gillan.', 'The full picture is still developing.', '5.', '', '(Tuesdays at 8:30 p.m. on ABC)', 'A rom-com as told through the unfiltered thoughts of the couple involved \xe2\x80\x94 Dana (Analeigh Tipton) and Peter (Jake McDorman) \xe2\x80\x94 representing male and female perspectives on life and love.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m happy to watch boy meet girl, but it turns out that I have absolutely zero interest in hearing boy\xe2\x80\x99s thoughts as he attempts to woo said girl. Especially since the boy in question happens to be depicted as an incredibly stereotypical (\xe2\x80\x9cOooh, boobs!\xe2\x80\x9d) meathead. And the girl doesn\xe2\x80\x99t fare much better (\xe2\x80\x9cOooh, purses!\xe2\x80\x9d).', '\xe2\x80\x9cOooh, lilies!\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cOooh, please stop narratively thinking every clich\xc3\xa9 thing a man or woman would ever think in a really bad rom-com!\xe2\x80\x9d This was a painful 22 minutes of my life and, even though I thought the adorable deer-in-headlights vibe Analeigh Tipton gives off very much worked in', '(and for Tyra Banks on', '), it does not work here. And though I maintain', 'is grossly underappreciated, so are Jake McDorman\xe2\x80\x99s talents in this pilot. No thank you.', 'Read our minds: Never again.', '6.', '', '(Tuesdays at 10 p.m. on ABC)', 'Manhattan medical examiner Dr. Henry Morgan (Ioan Gruffudd) is secretly 200 years old and uses his position to attempt to uncover the cause of his immortality.', 'I can\xe2\x80\x99t remember when high-concept (he\xe2\x80\x99s immortal!) and low energy (the two leads) have come together so perfectly in a pilot. I like Ioan Gruffudd OK, and I actually feel like the Alana de la Garza', 'years are undersung \xe2\x80\x94 but together, holy snooze. I think', 'is going for a', 'vibe with a supernatural twist, and I could get into that. But it needs to sharpen, and the leads need to look awake. By the time', 'got to Judd Hirsch\xe2\x80\x99s role, I was like,', 'Maybe it helped that my expectations were low for', ': High-concept freshman series make me nervous, and I tend to steer clear of procedurals that aren\xe2\x80\x99t actually', '. But I found the show to be weirdly charming despite the marks against it. I also appreciate a mystery that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t dangle big questions in front of us \xe2\x80\x94 we know exactly as much as we need to know, and we\xe2\x80\x99ll learn more down the line. I could be very wrong about', ', but I\xe2\x80\x99m excited to keep watching to find out.', 'Our patience can only last so long.', '7.', '', '(Wednesdays at 9:30 p.m. on ABC)', 'Andre \xe2\x80\x9cDre\xe2\x80\x9d Johnson (Anthony Anderson) lives with his wife (Tracee Ellis Ross), four kids (Yara Shahidi, Marcus Scribner, Miles Brow, and Marsai Martin), and father (Laurence Fishburne) in a lux L.A. neighborhood. He just got a promotion and has everything he could materialistically ever want, but he worries his family is assimilating into white society too much.', 'I like the premise of this show and that it\xe2\x80\x99s part of ABC\xe2\x80\x99s effort to diversify its lineup for the 2014\xe2\x80\x932015 season. But', 'does so rather sillily with a major storyline in the pilot centering on Dre\xe2\x80\x99s son Dre Jr. (Scribner), who wants to go by \xe2\x80\x9cAndy,\xe2\x80\x9d plays field hockey, and wants a bar mitzvah. I am pretty sure the latter two things are only relatable to about 7% of the population. Not really ideal for a show in the tough post-', 'time slot. Still, it\xe2\x80\x99s certainly a step in the right direction and anything\xe2\x80\x99s better than', '.', 'What I like about', 'is that it feels deceptively light when, in fact, it\xe2\x80\x99s a lot more subversive than your typical ABC sitcom. And the themes it addresses are more relevant than ever. The commodification of black culture is nothing new, but it has been hotly debated in recent conversations about gay men appropriating black culture and divisive pop stars like Iggy Azalea. Here\xe2\x80\x99s a series that tackles the subject head-on in a way that\xe2\x80\x99s sharp and transgressive without being preachy \xe2\x80\x94 or worse, unfunny.', 'Good-ish.', '8.', '', '(Thursdays at 10 p.m. on ABC)', 'Professor Annalise Keating (Viola Davis) is a law professor at a prestigious Philadelphia university who, with her students (Alfred Enoch, Jack Falahee, Aja Naomi King, Matt McGorry, and Karla Souza), finds herself involved in a murder plot that leaves you aghast in the final seconds of the pilot.', 'This instantly addictive new series serves as irrefutable proof that Shonda Rhimes is not just an amazing writer, but also an incredible teacher (', '\xe2\x80\x99s creator, Pete Nowalk, cut his teeth on', 'and', '). And TV has found its next-great leading lady in Viola Davis, who should already be clearing shelf space for her Emmy.', 'Yes, I\xe2\x80\x99m very into Shonda Thursdays. Watching the pilot for', ', I thought about how', 'at first seemed like it was going to be a standard, soapy drama. And then it went nuts, and became the WTF show we now gasp at weekly with delight. (For how long it can sustain that, I have no idea, but I\xe2\x80\x99m along for the ride.) With', ', it seems like Rhimes and Nowalk are starting with WTF \xe2\x80\x94 as well as a morally complicated lead in Davis. I feel like the pilot has some tonal problems, and there are some weak spots among the actors (Alfred Enoch. Sorry, man). But those things can get better. And this pilot carried me along, and surprised me. Also, Viola Davis! Bow down.', 'In Shonda we trust.', '9.', '', '(Fridays at 8:30 p.m. on ABC)', 'Creator Cristela Alonzo stars as recent Mexican-American law school graduate of the same name who\xe2\x80\x99s working as a unpaid intern at a law firm while living with her sister (Maria Canals-Barrera), brother-in-law (Carlos Ponce), their two kids, and her mother (Terri Hoyos).', 'Alonzo is an absolutely delight and incredibly well-spoken about her desire to make this eponymous series a true reflection of Latin culture. If only those good intentions were evident in the pilot \xe2\x80\x94 which is a mess. However, if Alonzo can course-correct her show (and stop mugging for the cameras), ABC could have a sleeper hit on its hands.', 'Though I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t call the pilot a mess, it did feel like, at points, the eponymous character might as well be turning to the camera to say, \xe2\x80\x9cSee what I did there?\xe2\x80\x9d (Yes, Cristela. Yes, we did.) Still, Alonzo is a real gem and she has the charm to turn this show around and into something that will stay on the airwaves for a long while.', 'You may want to remember her name.', '10.', '', '(Midseason, TBA on ABC)', 'Based on chef Eddie Huang\xe2\x80\x99s memoir of the same name, this is the story of Haung\xe2\x80\x99s Taiwanese family\xe2\x80\x99s move from D.C. to Orlando, where his dad (Randall Park) opens up a barbecue restaurant in the \xe2\x80\x9990s, while his mom (Constance Wu) struggles to assimilate.', 'For all the', 'that sprouted up when this series was announced,', 'is quite deft in its handling of the American\xe2\x80\x93Asian-American culture clash\xe2\x80\xa6 and it\xe2\x80\x99s pretty freaking hilarious, which is also a good thing. The young actors playing the Haung brothers (Ian Chen, Forrest Wheeler, and Hudson Yang) are absolutely adorable, but the real scene stealer is the Haung matriarch Jessica, played perfectly by Wu. Her assessments of suburban mothers could not be more on point. ABC is now primed for a Jessica\xe2\x80\x93Beverly crossover with', '. Please and thank you.', '', 'follows the model of', ', not only in helping to diversify ABC\xe2\x80\x99s lineup, but also of offering serious cultural commentary in the form of a family sitcom. The intentionally eye-catching title is quickly forgotten once you\xe2\x80\x99re watching the charming series \xe2\x80\x94 until you\xe2\x80\x99re suddenly caught off-guard by the utterance of a racial slur. But that\xe2\x80\x99s the thrill of a series that, if the pilot is any indication, isn\xe2\x80\x99t afraid to push buttons, provided the humor is directed at the racists, not at the targets of racism.', 'Certified fresh.', '11.', '', '(Midseason, Thursdays at 10 p.m. on ABC)', 'After he discovers the body of his neighbor\xe2\x80\x99s son in the woods, family man Ben Garner (Ryan Phillippe) becomes a murder suspect in Detective Andrea Cornell\xe2\x80\x99s (Juliette Lewis) investigation.', 'I already watched', 'once, and I\xe2\x80\x99m sort of unsure why ABC would ask me to endure it a second time. Also, WTF is Juliette Lewis doing in this thankless detective role? Does she have some gambling debts that need to be paid off?', 'Not only is this', ', but it\xe2\x80\x99s also', ',', ', and plenty of other film and TV projects that have come out in the past year or two and beyond. If you\xe2\x80\x99re going to attack heavily trodden territory, at least do it well. I could not have been more bored during this pilot, except for Juliette Lewis\xe2\x80\x99 death stares that had me rolling on the floor. Juliette Lewis is better than this, dammit!', 'The truth is out there: This is not good.', '12.', '', '(Midseason, Sundays at 9 p.m. on ABC)', 'Young war vet Matt Skokie and his wife Lily are attacked in their Modesto, Calif., home, killing him, leaving her unconscious, and stirring up racial tensions in this pilot written, directed, and produced by John Ridley (', ').', '', 'is relentlessly gritty from its very first moments. It does feel a little like a dark cable drama, which is probably what ABC\xe2\x80\x99s banking on here, but I was actually more impressed by the restraint. Although the pilot isn\xe2\x80\x99t overly violent or deliberately shocking, it\xe2\x80\x99s still hard to watch thanks to captivating, heartbreaking performances by Timothy Hutton and Felicity Huffman, among others.', 'I completely agree with your \xe2\x80\x9crelentlessly gritty\xe2\x80\x9d description, Louis, but I found it forcibly so. The roles that the white characters and Hispanic characters took on came across as cliched to me and I did not at all enjoy the way in which this pilot was shot. At times, the way the voiceover didn\xe2\x80\x99t match the scene on screen even made already complex exposition confusing. It felt to me like an attempt to re-create', 'and it largely didn\xe2\x80\x99t work. The twist at the end certainly upped the stakes, but a lot would have to change to make me watch', 'week after week.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s unclear whether the grittiness will prove to be too much for viewers, but it would be a crime not to check out the first episode.', '13.', '', '(Midseason TBA on ABC)', 'Something otherworldly is manipulating the children in the Washington, D.C., area, convincing them they are playing a game that leads to the death of their parents, and Claire Bennigan (Lily Rabe) is called in to investigate.', 'While I love the idea of aliens planning an invasion by slowly \xe2\x80\x94 and secretly \xe2\x80\x94 befriending Earth\xe2\x80\x99s children, I\xe2\x80\x99m not as enamored with the execution. Also, the crashed ship subplot is a little too on the nose. But after three sublime seasons of', ', Rabe has secured my undying loyalty and earned this series a few more episodes in hopes it can find its feet.', 'Not a fan. The ending \xe2\x80\x94 which I won\xe2\x80\x99t spoil here \xe2\x80\x94 made me so irate that I wanted to burn my television and may also incense a certain segment of the population. I hear that they\xe2\x80\x99re retooling the show significantly, so this pilot may never air in the form in which we watched it. (Which would be a good thing.) Even though I love Rabe and invasion dramas, this is a swift pass for me.', 'Jace, I think you need to remember your television has survived', 'and', 'in recent years, so', 'is certainly not burning-precious-technology-worthy. I too love, love, love Rabe and though I\xe2\x80\x99m sad to see her miss out on', 'for this alien invasion drama, I enjoyed it far more than I thought I would. The child actors are excellent as well and the lack of visual on the extraterrestrial only makes the mystery more eerie. I pray they keep it that way.', 'is certainly nothing new, but unlike', ', at least it handles its hackneyed premise well. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s worth a chance.', 'Some of us are shouting.', '14.', '', '(Midseason, Sundays at 8 p.m. on ABC)', 'A fairy tale-themed half-hour musical comedy about a dashing hero named Galavant (Joshua Sasse) who goes after the evil King Richard (Timothy Omundson) who stole the love of his life, Madalena (Mallory Jansen), scored by Alan Menken and Glenn Slater.', 'Oh boy. I just\xe2\x80\xa6 Louis, I don\xe2\x80\x99t even know if I have the words. I watched', 'many, many times in my day and this did not even sorta, kinda pale in comparison to the dark humor that Mel Brooks\xe2\x80\x99 Middle Ages musical offered. I am also pretty sure every song in this show was called \xe2\x80\x9cGalavant.\xe2\x80\x9d Take it far, far away.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m so sad. On paper,', 'is exactly what I want to see more of on TV \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s original, it\xe2\x80\x99s bizarre, and it has singing and dancing. But this pilot was nearly unwatchable, and, believe me, I have a very high tolerance for bad musicals. The whole thing was weirdly self-congratulatory for being completely mediocre and repetitive throughout. By the end, I just felt embarrassed for everyone involved. Hey, at least they can sing?', 'Tone-deaf.', '15.', 'CBS', '16.', '', '(Mondays at 9 p.m. on CBS)', 'Oddball genius Walter O\xe2\x80\x99Brien (Elyes Gabel) assembles a team of other oddball geniuses to solve complicated global crises using their collective hacking skills and other nerd tricks.', 'When the network pilots arrive in late spring, I watch them using a system of rewards and punishments based on what I think I\xe2\x80\x99m going to like. I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to lie: I had put', 'in the punishment pile! And then I quite liked it. Elyes Gabel (one of Dany\xe2\x80\x99s bloodriders,', 'geeks) is an unconventional lead for a network show. Not just because he\xe2\x80\x99s a man of color, but he seems smart and curious in a way that is just rare. Maybe because he\xe2\x80\x99s not a jerk, which is how geniuses are usually portrayed. I\xe2\x80\x99m also interested in how this show both dances around and engages with autism. And finally, I liked Katharine McPhee\xe2\x80\x99s character \xe2\x80\x94 a waitress mom to a genius kid \xe2\x80\x94 who from the description and the trailer seemed tacked on. Being surprised is a good thing in life. I will watch you again,', '.', '', 'wasn\xe2\x80\x99t my most pleasant surprise this season, but like you, Kate, I liked it a lot more than I expected to. And I think I may have even enjoyed it more than she did. To me, this feels like one of those rare nerdy action series that actually delivers the right balance of nerddom and dramatic set pieces. It\xe2\x80\x99s especially hard for a pilot setting up a procedural series to get this right, so I was doubly impressed. And while I\xe2\x80\x99m getting a little tired of autism as a storytelling device, I really admired', 'for addressing the elephant in the room and portraying it not as a disability but as a different way of thinking. Well played.', 'Packs a surprising sting.', '17.', '', '(Wednesdays at 10 p.m. on CBS)', 'Lieutenant Beth Davis (Maggie Q) and Detective Jack Larsen (Dylan McDermott) are members of the LAPD\xe2\x80\x99s Threat Assessment Unit, where they investigate cases related to stalking.', 'I don\xe2\x80\x99t watch', 'or any of CBS\xe2\x80\x99s initials-based shows, but creator Kevin Williamson has known how to push my thriller buttons since 1996\xe2\x80\x99s', 'and this semi-procedural about stalkers is right in my wheelhouse. The cold open is chilling, the premise is brimming with potential, and Maggie Q deserves to be TV\xe2\x80\x99s biggest star.', 'Good lord, Jarett, calm down! I like Maggie Q too. And I think we can be happy for her that this show will probably be a success. But I can\xe2\x80\x99t shake the feeling when I watch Williamson\xe2\x80\x99s shows that his work has no moral core when it comes to violence, particularly violence against women. I had to stop watching', '; I just can\xe2\x80\x99t live in that world, even in fiction. I\xe2\x80\x99m not a wimp, but I can\xe2\x80\x99t watch', '\xe2\x80\x94 too much home invasion, murders of entire families, and violence against kids \xe2\x80\x94 and I feel the same about', '.', 'I shrugged this pilot off, but the more I think about it, the worse it sits with me. As a horror movie fan, I\xe2\x80\x99m reluctant to dismiss portrayals of violence against women as inherently misogynistic \xe2\x80\x94 but there is something particularly insidious here. I\xe2\x80\x99d be OK with the concept if I felt like this show wanted to be something other than a procedural, but the pilot lacked any depth. As with', ', it appears as though shocking displays of violence and forced suspense will take the place of character development and believability.', 'A restraining order may be needed.', '18.', '', '(Thursdays at 9:30 p.m. on CBS)', 'Ronny McCarthy (Tyler Ritter) doesn\xe2\x80\x99t fit in with the rest of his sports-loving, loud-mouthed Boston family. But that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t stop patriarch Arthur (Jack McGee), a high school basketball coach, from hiring Ronny as his new assistant.', 'I wish I could offer a thoughtful analysis of this show\xe2\x80\x99s portrayal of gay men (not great) or large family dynamics (equally underwhelming), but I was too busy asking myself, \xe2\x80\x9cWhy, Laurie Metcalf, why?!?\xe2\x80\x9d every five seconds while watching this pilot.', 'Much to my surprise, I actually kind of dug it. And let me clarify \xe2\x80\x94 I don\xe2\x80\x99t think', 'is necessarily a show for me, but I do think it\xe2\x80\x99s a solid addition to CBS\xe2\x80\x99s lineup and the kind of series I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t mind tuning into every so often. There\xe2\x80\x99s something so refreshing about a sitcom, particularly an old-school multi-cam sitcom, in which there are plenty of gay jokes but none at the expense of the main character being gay. And Laurie Metcalf is great, but that goes without saying, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t it?', 'Might be worth rooting for.', '19.', '', '(Sundays at 8 p.m. on CBS)', 'Brilliant former CIA analyst-turned-college professor Elizabeth McCord (Tea Leoni) returns to the public sector when she\xe2\x80\x99s drafted into the role of secretary of state by the president following the unexpected death of her predecessor. But when Elizabeth begins to think his death is suspicious, she must navigate the tricky waters of international politics, domestic strife, scheming colleagues, and potentially even murder.', '', 'clearly wants to be', ', but is only', 'at the moment. Luckily, it\xe2\x80\x99s got an excellent premise and an even better star in Tea Leoni. If the writers can lean on real-life events for story inspiration, as', 'has masterfully done, it could evolve into a fascinating examination of global politics.', 'I agree \xe2\x80\x94 Leoni is excellent here, but I think I liked this pilot a lot more than you. While there are maybe some stylistic or thematic overlaps with', '(which is, these days, great), I feel like they\xe2\x80\x99re different shows; the stakes are higher here by far and become even more so by the end of the episode. There\xe2\x80\x99s intrigue, family dynamics, and political tensions to explore. And it\xe2\x80\x99s great to see CBS getting back into the prestige drama game.', 'Hold our calls.', '20.', '', '(Midseason TBA on CBS)', 'The world of Battle Creek, Michigan\xe2\x80\x99s gruff Detective Russ Agnew\xe2\x80\x99s (Dean Winters) is rocked when startlingly good-looking and equally charismatic Special Agent Milton Chamberlain (Josh Duhamel) opens an FBI field office at the local police station. Everyone in Battle Creek is enamored with Milt, except for Russ, who he\xe2\x80\x99s chosen as his partner.', '', 'confused me. Tonally, it\xe2\x80\x99s all over the place, and in the pilot at least, it has not figured out how to balance its comedy with its crime plots. I also found it to be somewhat interminable. But I liked Dean Winters (I always do), I thought Josh Duhamel put his woodenness to good use, and I laughed a few times. This show was way', 'from the start, since it was a discarded old project by Vince Gilligan and CBS picked it up the week before the', 'series finale. I don\xe2\x80\x99t know who its audience is. I don\xe2\x80\x99t think I\xe2\x80\x99m one of them. Jaimie, help?', 'I wish I could help you, Kate, but I am equally as lost. The overly quirky exposition seemed like Gilligan\xe2\x80\x99s strange attempt to move Bryan Fuller-style through some dark subject matter (you know, like, double homicide). I agree with you that both Winters and Duhamel are well-cast, but that\xe2\x80\x99s not enough to carry this mess of a pilot. If it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t for the musical cues, I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t know whether I was supposed to be smiling or scared.', 'There is still a lot to be solved.', '21.', 'NBC', '22.', '', '(Mondays at 10 p.m. on NBC)', 'Charlie (Katherine Heigl) is the CIA analyst who briefs the president (Alfre Woodard) every day on international flare-ups. And that president was also nearly Charlie\xe2\x80\x99s mother-in-law \xe2\x80\x94 until her fianc\xc3\xa9 died under mysterious circumstances.', 'I know it\xe2\x80\x99s an unpopular opinion, but I love Katherine Heigl and found this show to be an excellent star vehicle for her. Plus, unlike so many new drama pilots, I was excited by the mysteries presented by episode\xe2\x80\x99s end and curious to see how they play out over the first season.', 'I love her too, so we\xe2\x80\x99ll just talk about her with each other, Jarett, and leave everyone else to their miserable lives. The set up of this show is ridiculous, of course: Agent Heigl! But I enjoyed this pilot, especially the workplace friendships, which is a huge part of a lot of people\xe2\x80\x99s lives, and rarely accurately portrayed on TV. There is also, of course, the matter of the high-stakes, world-in-the-balance plotting that presumably will weave its way into every episode \xe2\x80\x94 I\xe2\x80\x99m less excited about that, frankly. But if that\xe2\x80\x99s what it takes to see President Alfre Woodard every week, I\xe2\x80\x99ll take it.', 'Guys, I hate to ruin your perception that everyone hates Heigl \xe2\x80\x94 and I know there are plenty of misguided individuals who do! \xe2\x80\x94 but I find her to be, at worst, inoffensive, and at best, quite compelling. I\xe2\x80\x99m still not sure this is the right vehicle for her. To me, the pilot felt like a weaker version of', 'or', '(actually, at this point,', 'is its own weaker version of', '). And while I do want to see more of President Alfre Woodard, Kate, I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure I can trudge through vague military conspiracies and terrorist activities, complete with grainy flashbacks.', 'Not quite an affair to remember.', '23.', '', '(Tuesdays at 9 p.m.)', 'Annie (Casey Wilson) is frustrated by the fact that her longtime boyfriend Jake (Ken Marino) has yet to propose. When he does actually propose and it\xe2\x80\x99s a disaster, the couple resolve to hold off on the engagement until they can get the proposal right.', 'As the world\xe2\x80\x99s biggest', 'fan (self-appointed, but, whatevs) I am thrilled to have Casey Wilson back on TV \xe2\x80\x94 and speaking David Caspe\xe2\x80\x99s words no less! So I\xe2\x80\x99m willing to overlook this pilots flaws (\xe2\x80\x9cDo I actually like either of these characters?\xe2\x80\x9d will be something you ask yourself a lot) and inherent redundancy (', 'is basically', 'without Penny\xe2\x80\x99s five friends) in the hopes it evolves into a show half as funny as Caspe\xe2\x80\x99s last creation.', 'I have nothing', 'Casey Wilson per se\xe2\x80\xa6 Oh wait, yes I do. It\xe2\x80\x99s called', '! And good god, this was equally painful. I could barely get through Annie\xe2\x80\x99s (Wilson) diatribe about why she\xe2\x80\x99s angry Jake (Ken Marino) didn\xe2\x80\x99t propose to her on their vacation that coincidentally leads to her bashing every family and friend the two somehow seem to have, all of whom are conveniently hiding in Jake and Annie\xe2\x80\x99s apartment where he planned to propose. Also, Dan Bucatinsky, you are too young to play one of Wilson\xe2\x80\x99s dads. No, just no.', 'So much for our happy endings.', '24.', '', '(Wednesdays at 8 p.m. on NBC)', 'Laura Diamond (Debra Messing) struggles to balance her work as a homicide detective with her home life, including her estranged husband Jake (Josh Lucas) and their two unruly kids.', '', 'is about a cop who is also a mother, but the police scenes are played with such an intense degree of seriousness that it makes the playful treatment of the family portions feel incredibly inappropriate. It dawned on me about halfway through the pilot that this show would have worked so much better if, instead of modeling Debra Messing\xe2\x80\x99s character on Olivia Benson (played by Mariska Hargitay on', '), the EPs based Laura on Hargitay; then their lead character would star on a procedural TV show and mix the world of Hollywood with raising a family.', 'No. Just\xe2\x80\xa6no. I watched this and couldn\xe2\x80\x99t help but imagine that the police scenes were somehow a fantasy world that Messing\xe2\x80\x99s Laura retreats into when she can\xe2\x80\x99t handle the strain of her life. But that would be another, potentially better show! Instead,', 'makes Laura caustic and unlikeable and I have a hard time buying her as a hardened \xe2\x80\x9ctype-A\xe2\x80\x9d detective or as anything other than a caricature. This was a painful slog.', 'There is no mystery as to how bad this is.', '25.', '', '(Thursdays at 9 p.m. on NBC)', 'Hard-ass judge Rebecca Wright (Kate Walsh) spends her downtime boozing and partying it up. That is, until she gets saddled with eight-year-old Robby (Theodore Barnes), whose parents Rebecca sent to prison.', 'Not the year\xe2\x80\x99s worst comedy, nor the best. It\xe2\x80\x99s got a lot of potential \xe2\x80\x94 and Kate Walsh is clearly having a blast embracing her inner wild child \xe2\x80\x94 but I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure that\xe2\x80\x99s enough to support a multi-season run.', 'I still do not buy Kate Walsh\xe2\x80\x99s brassy Rebecca Wright as a reputable judge, but I am into her no-fucks attitude and her relationship with the adorable Robby.', 'is kind of like', ', but with a female lead, and I don\xe2\x80\x99t hate it, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t really like it either.', 'Judgment delayed.', '26.', '', '(Thursdays at 9:30 p.m. on NBC)', 'A dating app drone and a lawyer finally meet cute after very nearly coming in contact with each other time and time again.', '', '? This romantic comedy seems to be drawing way too overtly from', ', from the \xe2\x80\x9cThis is the story\xe2\x80\x9d narration at the opening (it\xe2\x80\x99s Katey Sagal providing the voice work) and the calculations of how long their story takes place or the chances of their best friends hooking up to the hipstery-almost-JGL-and-Zooey quality that Ben Feldman and Cristin Milioti (aka The Mother) bring and the way-too-cutesy title. (His name is Andrew! Hers is Zelda!) If they pulled back on on the more smarmy elements (and the OTT shrewish dating app boss), this could be a sweet-sour rom-com. As it is, I found parts of it as grating as Celine Dion\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cMy Heart Will Go On,\xe2\x80\x9d a favorite of Andrew\xe2\x80\x99s.', 'Ah, the miracle of great casting. There were definitely moments in this pilot that I didn\xe2\x80\x99t love, but when I think back to', ', my heart swells. It\xe2\x80\x99s honestly a little embarrassing how quickly I fell for the two leads, but I already loved Ben Feldman and Cristin Milioti, and their chemistry was apparent from the get-go. I\xe2\x80\x99m already concerned about where this show is headed, and I do think the jokes could be stronger, but I\xe2\x80\x99m so charmed I\xe2\x80\x99m willing to give the series a little time to find its footing.', 'A bit like alphabet soup: It\xe2\x80\x99s comforting, but feels canned.', '27.', '', '(Fridays at 10 p.m. on NBC)', 'Based on comic book', ', a reluctant demon hunter and exorcist is drawn back into the never-ending battle between Heaven and Hell.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not like I feel ashamed of what I\xe2\x80\x99m about to say, but it\xe2\x80\x99s going to come out like I am: I really like', '! And I like that NBC is committed to building a genre block on Friday nights around it (along with', ', and the failed attempt of', '). So I had high hopes for', ', or whatever level hopes are when you want to have another clever, escapist show to watch. Those hopes were not met. It\xe2\x80\x99s OK? It\xe2\x80\x99s not terrible? I liked Matt Ryan as John Constantine, and Harold Perrineau is dancing as fast as he can as a semi-scary angel (or something?). But it all felt lifeless. And they\xe2\x80\x99ve already recast Lucy Griffiths, the pilot\xe2\x80\x99s female lead, but aren\xe2\x80\x99t reshooting the pilot. Which I find so confusing, and seems to scream WE\xe2\x80\x99RE DOOMED. But stranger things have happened than this show finding its feet; NBC tends to give its Friday night dramas a long leash.', 'Kate, I know you love', ', but I found', 'so confoundingly predictable! The pilot spends so much time and effort on establishing Lucy Griffiths\xe2\x80\x99 i
