Title: ‰ÛÏTwin Peaks: The Missing Pieces‰Ûù Makes You See ‰ÛÏFire Walk With Me‰Ûù In A DifferentåÊWay
Description: ['David Lynch unveiled nearly 90 minutes of deleted and extended scenes from his 1992 film', 'at a Los Angeles theater last night.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'It was intense and weird.', '', 'WARNING: The following contains information about the identity of Laura Palmer\xe2\x80\x99s killer. If, by some chance, you are reading this and haven\xe2\x80\x99t finished the more than two decades-old series, stop reading before you are spoiled.', '', ', David Lynch\xe2\x80\x99s follow-up prequel to cult classic television series', ', has always been an odd beast. It recounts the final seven days of the life of Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee), whose inexplicable and brutal murder is the impetus for the short-lived drama that riveted viewers when it aired between 1990 and 1991. It is also about the similarly brutal murder of Teresa Banks (Pamela Gidley), a woman killed a year before Laura in a similarly ritualistic manner whose death puts FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan) on alert, following the disappearance of one of his colleagues investigating her murder.', 'One would expect that the film is a strict prequel, but it is not:', 'plays with time in a unique and nonlinear fashion, making it both prequel and sequel in an odd, contradictory sense. Like', ', it is both dreamy and nightmarish, making the conflation of time make sense slightly more. There are visions and sigils, haunted rings and groves of trees, whirring ceiling fans and rustling curtains. The film itself is cryptic and strange, embracing a full-tilt Lynchian mode that the director successfully curtailed in the ethereal', '.', 'is about dreams, desire, and death. It is about answers and more questions. And it is also an unflinching look at the horrors of incest.', 'The completed film, released in 1992, was a box office bomb, receiving', '; it was booed at Cannes when it premiered at the film festival.', 'is an odd curio: It\xe2\x80\x99s a film that attracts and repulses at the same time, its emphasis on evoking the oddness of', 'but with a sharper, more graphic edge that isn\xe2\x80\x99t sanded down at all, thanks to the absence of almost the entire cast. Kyle MacLachlan, who played the intrepid Cooper in the show, barely appeared in the film. The quirky denizens of the Washington border town \xe2\x80\x94 whose own thwarted passions and crimes provide a sharp narrative spine to the show \xe2\x80\x94 are largely shoved into the background, as the film focuses more on Laura\xe2\x80\x99s home life and those involved in her murder. The final week of Laura\xe2\x80\x99s life \xe2\x80\x94 rendered impressively by Lee, whose riveting performance is criminally overlooked here \xe2\x80\x94 is a mix of pleasure and pain, a sad end to a tortured life as she comes face to face with the man who had abused her and raped her for so many years: her father, Leland Palmer (Ray Wise), in the guise of the malevolent BOB.', '', 'And yet those looking for answers within', 'discovered only more questions and more than a little \xe2\x80\x9cgarmonbozia\xe2\x80\x9d (pain and sorrow), in the form of creamed corn and a lot of head-scratching imagery. A cliffhanger ending for', 'found Cooper in the Black Lodge, attempting to rescue his girlfriend, Annie (Heather Graham), only to find himself trapped while BOB escaped into the world into his body. Quick flashes of Cooper and Annie turn up in', ', offering a glimpse at what happened after the final episode of', ', a glittering lure in the darkness.', 'With the release of', ', however, Lynch opted to release a series of deleted and extended scenes from', 'that not only expand upon Laura\xe2\x80\x99s murder and her state of mind in the days before her death, but also offer deeper hints about the end of the series. At a crowded Los Angeles theater on July 17, Lynch unveiled the footage \xe2\x80\x94 dubbed \xe2\x80\x9cThe Missing Pieces\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 for the first time, and the assembled crowd of journalists, fans, and cast and crew members watched as numerous subplots from', ', which had ended up on the cutting room floor, were brought back to life, more than 20 years after the film was released.', 'These deleted scenes range from the bizarre to the truly heartbreaking; they shine a stark light on Laura\xe2\x80\x99s relationships with those around her, including the dynamic at play between her, her fragile mother (Grace Zabriskie), and her father, and that with Donna Hayward (Moira Kelly, replacing the show\xe2\x80\x99s Lara Flynn Boyle), her far more innocent best friend. One sequence depicts Laura at the Haywards\xe2\x80\x99 house and reveals a sad longing for a sense of normalcy, one glimpsed in the easy intimacy between Dr. Will Hayward (Warren Frost), Eileen (Mary Jo Deschanel), and Donna\xe2\x80\xa6 which is at odds with the horror unfolding at Laura\xe2\x80\x99s house. While the film goes to great lengths to capture the trauma experienced by Laura, there are scenes of exquisite happiness as well, such as when Leland, Sarah, and Laura join hands to recite a Norwegian phrase (\xe2\x80\x9cHello! How are you? My name is Leland/Laura/Sarah.\xe2\x80\x9d) around the dining room table. These light and playful scenes \xe2\x80\x94 Sarah\xe2\x80\x99s crazy laugh alone makjng it worth inclusion \xe2\x80\x94 are in stark contrast to the pain and sorrow of many of Laura\xe2\x80\x99s other scenes, including one in the Briggs\xe2\x80\x99 basement in which she begs Bobby (Dana Ashbrook) for cocaine in order to dull the constant horror of her life.', '', 'Some of the scenes are little more than fragments. Laura becomes transfixed by the ceiling fan in the hallway outside her bedroom, an otherworldly voice calling to her and freezing her in place, a creepy smile slowly passing across her face, until she\xe2\x80\x99s awakened from her reverie by her mother. In another, she snorts cocaine from a small plastic bag with a key in it, secreted in a locked diary, a clue that will play into the murder investigation in the show. In another, she hides in the bushes, waiting for James (James Marshall), as Leland arrives home: As he makes his way up the stairs towards the house, Laura waits in terror that he will spot her, his eyes darting wildly towards her hiding place. There\xe2\x80\x99s a phone call between Laura and Dr. Jacoby (Russ Tamblyn), in which he begs her to make him a tape and we sense Laura\xe2\x80\x99s vexed frustration with these silly, stupid men who want to own her. There\xe2\x80\x99s a high-speed drive to a redneck bar for Laura and Donna and some drunken guys, a sign that reads something like Cana-DUH and the U.S. of Fucking \xe2\x80\x9cA\xe2\x80\x9d slung above the wooden bar. The sight of logging trucks passing by as they walk down the road is a glimpse at the world of the past, of another time, of wood and death and possibility.', 'Some of these deepen the aura of dread surrounding the overarching plot or Laura\xe2\x80\x99s inevitable end. Others are simply unnecessary detours. There is a long scene in which Chris Isaac\xe2\x80\x99s Agent Chester Desmond beats up a local police officer in order to transport Teresa Banks\xe2\x80\x99 body to Portland. Another has Desmond and Sam Stanley (Kiefer Sutherland) interviewing Teresa\xe2\x80\x99s employer as a worker noisily fixes a light bulb. Another has Stanley showing Cooper the letter \xe2\x80\x9cT\xe2\x80\x9d that was found beneath Teresa\xe2\x80\x99s fingernail. A quick scene has \xe2\x80\x9cthe dashing\xe2\x80\x9d Cooper playing a game with the always-unseen Diane, in which he has to guess what the secretary has changed about her office. (It\xe2\x80\x99s sort of adorable.) The terrifying world of the Little Man From Another Place and his cohorts is given a little extra time, with a series of scenes capturing a bizarre meeting between the Little Man, BOB, Mrs. Tremond (Frances Bay) and her grandson, a jumping child in a pointed white mask, and what appear to be demonic lumberjacks. There are additional close-up shots of a mouth screaming in agony or pleasure, unnerving in both in its intensity and shot composition.', 'The vast majority of the Twin Peaks-set scenes not involving Laura didn\xe2\x80\x99t make it into', ', which means that the diverse and weird cast of characters from the show didn\xe2\x80\x99t turn up in the completed film.', 'seeks to reverse that, restoring a scene with Pete (Jack Nance) and Josie (Joan Chen) in which they argue with an elderly customer about the sizing of a two-by-four. Leo (Eric Da Re) forces Shelly (M\xc3\xa4dchen Amick) to learn how to properly scrub the floor of their kitchen. Norma (Peggy Lipton) and Big Ed (Everett McGill) have an entire subplot about their star-crossed affair, as do Sheriff Harry Truman (Michael Otkean), Deputy Andy Brennan (Harry Goaz), and spacey police station receptionist Lucy Moran (Kimmy Robertson) \xe2\x80\x94 theirs involves the appearance of drug trafficker Bernard Renault, whose death in the early episodes of', 'leads to a series of misunderstandings and murders.', '', 'One subplot involving David Bowie\xe2\x80\x99s long-lost Phillip Jeffries is somewhat fleshed out while left deliberately vague. In the film, Jeffries mysteriously appears at the FBI field office in Philadelphia, muttering about \xe2\x80\x9cJudy,\xe2\x80\x9d an encounter he had with the Little Man and BOB, the month of Laura Palmer\xe2\x80\x99s murder (\xe2\x80\x9cFebruary, 1989\xe2\x80\x9d), and that Cooper isn\xe2\x80\x99t who he appears to be\xe2\x80\xa6 before vanishing in front of Gordon Cole (Lynch). What is revealed here is that (A) Jeffries appears to teleport from an Argentine hotel and (B) when Jeffries vanishes from Gordon\xe2\x80\x99s office, it\xe2\x80\x99s to return to that same hotel in a flash of smoke and fire, the wall behind him singed and black. (That a terrified hotel bellhop loses control of his bowels is also part of this odd scenario.) Just who Judy is remains a mystery, and there are no further scenes that indicate her identity or just what is causing Jeffries to teleport around the world.', 'However, while this plot is left deliberately hanging (potentially for a planned sequel or two), the scenes about the ending of', 'glimmer with possibility: One is a longer version of the final scene of the show, in which Cooper, having escaped the Black Lodge, goes to brush his teeth and sees the reflection of BOB in the mirror (\xe2\x80\x9cHow\xe2\x80\x99s Annie?\xe2\x80\x9d he grunts over and over again), before savagely smashing his head against the glass. In this version, he lays down on the floor so that Harry and Hawk (Michael Horse) can discover him, claiming that he \xe2\x80\x9cslipped.\xe2\x80\x9d Elsewhere, Annie is transported to the hospital from Glastonbury Grove and rushed to the ER in a scene that takes place in the hospital corridor, her body slick with blood. Later, she whimpers in her coma the words that Laura hears in a dream \xe2\x80\x94 another example of the conflation of time \xe2\x80\x94 before a nurse steals the accursed ring off her finger. It\xe2\x80\x99s this ring that plays a role throughout', ', seen on the hand of Teresa Banks before her murder (Desmond searches in vain for it before finally seizing it, and disappearing in the process) and displaying a sigil that plays a role in', 'as well.', '', 'When Cooper appears in the Black Lodge in one scene, that ring appears on an ornate pedestal in front of the Little Man; in another, the scene replays the same way but this time the ring is not visible, and Cooper realizes that Annie must have it. And then the ring is slipped off Annie\xe2\x80\x99s finger in the hospital. Just what Cooper\xe2\x80\x99s epiphany means is unclear: Is Annie now vulnerable to possession from the spirits? Is this nurse marked for death? Putting on the ring is what seals Laura\xe2\x80\x99s fate: When BOB is unable to possess her, he stabs her in a fit of rage.', 'As', 'goes on, it begins to coalesce into something\xe2\x80\xa6 it\xe2\x80\x99s not quite a film in its own right, but rather a series of vignettes that capture stolen moments. Some give us a deeper portrait of Laura and those around her \xe2\x80\x94 laughter at a family dinner table, a woman crying in an empty diner, the Log Lady (Catherine Coulson) hearing Laura\xe2\x80\x99s screams echo through the night, electricity crackling through power lines. It adds up to something alternately funny and heartbreaking, terrifying and uplifting. There\xe2\x80\x99s a rare humor and a raw horror at play here, subtly shifting the tone of', 'in the process.', 'may not pull back the curtain on the larger mysteries of', 'or give us a definitive look at what happens to Cooper after his possession (other than his presence in the Black Lodge and him comforting Laura, whose spirit has arrived there \xe2\x80\x94 more time shifts!), but what these deleted and extended scenes do is give us a deeper appreciation both for what Lynch\xe2\x80\x99s maligned film set out to do and for the incredibly nuanced and powerful performance achieved by Lee here. Laura isn\xe2\x80\x99t a character in', ', but rather an emblem. Here, Lee gives television\xe2\x80\x99s most famous dead girl a profound sense of vulnerability, exploring both her flaws and her strength in the face of a harrowing experience.', 'might best be summed up in a sentence uttered by Lara Flynn Boyle\xe2\x80\x99s Donna in the show \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99m having the most beautiful dream and the most terrible nightmare all at once.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 and', 'turns up the temperature on that whole statement, resulting in a film that pulses with Hitchcockian tension but also a strange and ineffable humanity.', '', 'will be released on Blu-ray on July 29.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Twin Peaks: The Missing Pieces" Makes You See "Fire Walk With Me" In A Different Way', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "Scandal" Season 4 Will Launch On SeptemberåÊ25
Description: ['Mark your calendars, gladiators.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'ABC announced today that Season 4 of the Shonda Rhimes-created drama', 'will launch Thursday, Sept. 25 at 9 p.m., leading into Rhimes\xe2\x80\x99 new drama,', ', which stars Viola Davis.', 'Speaking at the Television Critics Association summer press tour, ABC Entertainment President Paul Lee revealed that the fourth season of', 'will consist of 22 episodes, returning to a regular episodic count after a slightly truncated third season in order to accomodate star Kerry Washington\xe2\x80\x99s pregnancy.', ', meanwhile, will air \xe2\x80\x9c15 or 16\xe2\x80\x9d episodes this coming season, per Lee.', '3.', 'Pour yourself a glass of red wine and settle in,', 'fans\xe2\x80\xa6', 'ABC', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Scandal" Season 4 Will Launch On September 25', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: 31 Actors Who Deserve First-Time Emmy Nominations
Description: ['It\xe2\x80\x99s time for some fresh blood!']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'No disrespect meant to perennial faves, but the increasing predictability of the outstanding acting Emmy nominations has lent the annual awards show a sense of repetition.', 'And while those nominations would definitely be warranted again this year, it\xe2\x80\x99s time to inject a much needed sense of surprise into the Aug. 25 proceedings by honoring these 31 deserving first-time nominees, presented below in alphabetical order:', '3.', 'Uzo Aduba,', 'The fact that Aduba exclusively refers to this character by her given name, Suzanne, and not her disparaging nickname, Crazy Eyes, helps explain why you feel so much empathy for Litchfield\xe2\x80\x99s most unhinged inmate. Which is not to undersell the insanity; in fact, because Aduba created such a three-dimensional human being, watching the character\xe2\x80\x99s unsettling conniption fits becomes a test of the viewer\xe2\x80\x99s emotional endurance. \xe2\x80\x94Jarett Wieselman', '4.', 'Lizzy Caplan,', 'Strong, insightful, unexpected, and sexy are adjectives that apply to Lizzy Caplan\xe2\x80\x99s career-redefining performance and to her', 'character, Virginia Johnson. But perhaps the most significant accomplishment is that Caplan is able to infuse the progressive Johnson with a sense of modernity without making her a forward-thinking character in retrospect. Through her performance, the viewer can sense the impending revolution because it\xe2\x80\x99s never openly winked at. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '5.', 'Olivia Colman,', 'Ricocheting between comedy and hard-hitting drama \xe2\x80\x94 and proving equally adept at both \xe2\x80\x94', 'is one of the finest actors working today. In Chris Chibnall\xe2\x80\x99s mystery drama', ', she gives her character, DS Ellie Miller, newly returned to work after having her second child, such intense authenticity and emotion that it seems impossible that Ellie doesn\xe2\x80\x99t exist in real life. (Colman so thoroughly eradicates all evidence that Ellie is a mere fictional character.) Ellie\xe2\x80\x99s anguish as she loses her innocence, as she investigates the murder of her friend\xe2\x80\x99s 11-year-old son, is so incredibly painful to watch that your heart breaks watching her attempt to keep her psyche in one piece. In a show that is brimming with strong performances, it\xe2\x80\x99s Colman\xe2\x80\x99s that remains haunting long after the credits have rolled. Ellie \xe2\x80\x94 and Colman \xe2\x80\x94 stay with you in the best possible way. \xe2\x80\x94Jace Lacob', '6.', 'Hugh Dancy,', 'While Mads Mikkelsen has the showier role (playing a sociopathic cannibal will do that for ya), Dancy was tasked with the grander challenge this season as Will Graham found himself imprisoned for the first stretch of episodes \xe2\x80\x94 forcing Dancy to find fresh acting notes while working in the same confined space \xe2\x80\x94 and lying through his teeth for much of that time.', 'As a result, Dancy was required to layer multiple truths into every scene, offering him a unique opportunity to play with perception and the outward manipulation of his scene partners. The result was a decadent blend of mischief and mental instability. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '7.', 'Ilana Glazer and Abbi Jacobson,', 'Before it even began,', 'had a high bar set for it: executive-produced by Amy Poehler, and immediately compared to the critically acclaimed', '. But these brilliant performers rose to the challenge by creating something truly unique and embodying Ilana and Abbi with equal parts gritty realism and high-concept stoner weirdness. They play off each other so well that it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to imagine giving favor to one over the other: They fuse together to form a pair of best friends that are as relatable as they are fucking weird. \xe2\x80\x94Louis Peitzman', '8.', 'Joel Kinnaman,', 'While Season 2 put a major damper on everyone\xe2\x80\x99s enthusiasm for this once-addictive crime drama, the one thing that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t changed throughout the show\xe2\x80\x99s run is Kinnaman\xe2\x80\x99s hypnotic performance. Season 3 featured a whole new Detective Holder. Clean, responsible, and screaming internally, the actor was a model of duality, seamlessly blending Holder\xe2\x80\x99s desire for change with the duty he now felt to keep up appearances. A truly fascinating portrait of a man on the edge. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '9.', 'Annet Mahendru,', 'The nuanced and provocative performance delivered by Afghan-born Russian-Indian actor Mahendru often needs no translation. On the second season of FX\xe2\x80\x99s Cold War espionage drama', ', Mahendru\xe2\x80\x99s triple agent Neena Sergeevna found herself battling against a broken heart (and some broken bones) after numerous betrayals. But Neena is the consummate fighter whose war is anything but cold, and Mahendru imbues her character with both flinty courage and immense fire, the combination of which is enough to set the Rezidentura ablaze. In the process, she all but steals the show out from under her experienced co-stars. \xe2\x80\x94J.L.', '10.', 'Tatiana Maslany,', 'The most glaring omission from 2013 is now 2014\xe2\x80\x99s most mandatory nomination, as Maslany was once again tasked in Season 2 with differentiating five physically identical clones (including one who is transgender, transitioning from female to male) through nothing but accents and physicality.', 'But the real success of her performance is that each creation is so distinct, it consistently feels like you\xe2\x80\x99re watching five different actors: an acting accomplishment that actually sells the fundamental conceit of the show, ensuring', 'never feels gimmicky. In short, week in and week out, Maslany easily delivers the most impressive performance currently happening anywhere on television. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '11.', 'Melissa McBride,', 'The zombie apocalypse has affected everyone differently on AMC\xe2\x80\x99s uber-popular drama, but no character has undergone a greater transformation than Carol Peletier, who started as her husband\xe2\x80\x99s meek victim but in the wake of his death, evolved into a woman of strong moral and physical conviction. Her beliefs were tested in the most recent season, when she was forced to make the heartbreaking (but, ultimately correct) decision to murder Lizzie, a young girl who\xe2\x80\x99d been driven to the dark side by their warped world. McBride has flawlessly realized every stage of her character\xe2\x80\x99s progression, and lent them all such a strong sense of necessity that the audience never even contemplated revolting. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '12.', 'Rory McCann,', 'Among the many performances from', '\xe2\x80\x99 sprawling ensemble, McCann\xe2\x80\x99s as Ser Sandor \xe2\x80\x9cThe Hound\xe2\x80\x9d Clegane stood the tallest. Like Arya Stark (Maisie Williams), his hostage-cum-pupil in the brutal ways of the world, we were at once repulsed and compelled by the Hound\xe2\x80\x99s weary, pragmatic, and ultimately tragic cynicism. McCann\xe2\x80\x99s best scene: the moment when he recounts the story of how his older brother burned his face and his father let it happen, delivered with perfect, heartbreaking understatement. And yet, when HBO submitted', 'Season 4 performances for Emmy consideration, McCann\xe2\x80\x99s name', '\xe2\x80\x94Adam B. Vary', '13.', 'Kate McKinnon,', 'Whether she\xe2\x80\x99s playing straight, gay, male, female, or Bieber, McKinnon \xe2\x80\x94 in her second season on', '\xe2\x80\x94 emerged as the show\xe2\x80\x99s most versatile comedienne since Kristen Wiig. Dependably playing stock characters, slaying impersonations, and turning risky bits into recurring hits (who\xe2\x80\x99d have seriously thought hearing the frustrations of', 'would become a consistent laugh-riot?) underscores the fact we\xe2\x80\x99ve only begun to see the depths of her insane brilliance. Or should that be brilliant insanity? \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '14.', 'Wendi McLendon-Covey,', 'On paper, Beverly Goldberg is an aggressively overbearing helicopter mom with a borderline-inappropriate infatuation with her children. But the winning McLendon-Covey has filled her colorful creation with so much love, every embarrassing action and obsessive tendency is completely justified \xe2\x80\x94 and endlessly endearing \xe2\x80\x94 because her heart, like her hair, is simply too big. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '15.', 'Chris Messina,', 'The Aaliyah dance. The red glasses. The ass grab. While it\xe2\x80\x99s easy to single out individual moments of hilarity from the comedy\xe2\x80\x99s second season, what often goes overlooked is how quietly Messina has turned his character into the beating heart of', '. Danny\xe2\x80\x99s struggles with love are just as harrowing as Mindy\xe2\x80\x99s, and, yes, OK, Danny ended up dumping Mindy, but Messina\xe2\x80\x99s soulful eyes told you it broke his heart to break hers. So while there\xe2\x80\x99s no doubt', 'landed jokes and slayed choreography, he should actually be celebrated for the sheer amount of heart and emotion with which he infuses the entire show. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '16.', 'Joe Morton,', 'For most of the show\xe2\x80\x99s first two seasons, Kerry Washington was the epicenter of the popular, salacious ABC drama. And no disrespect to the leading lady or her white trench coats, but Season 3 of', 'gave praise \xe2\x80\x94 and excellent monologues \xe2\x80\x94 to the veteran actor, who played Olivia\xe2\x80\x99s controlling and manipulative father. Morton took Shakespearean speeches and added his own firm and terrifying flare. He turned chats in the park into captivating scenes and was the villain everyone wanted more of, even as he threatened to topple the order of Olivia\xe2\x80\x99s universe. \xe2\x80\x94Emily Orley', '17.', 'Niecy Nash,', 'HBO\xe2\x80\x99s hilarious hospital comedy boasted a trio of sublime performances from stars Alex Borstein, Laurie Metcalf, and Niecy Nash, but the', 'alum is the only one yet to score an Emmy (Borstein was twice nominated for', ', and Metcalf won three times for', '). Through the newly reassigned Didi Forchette, Nash not only served as the audience\xe2\x80\x99s wide eyes, but employed an inspired mix of dedication and exasperation,', '. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '18.', 'Jessica Par\xc3\xa9,', 'Hew and cry all you want, Megan Draper haters. Some of the best Don Draper moments from the first half of Season 7 revolved around his wife as she strove and struggled to make her career in Los Angeles \xe2\x80\x94 and learned to survive, and maybe even thrive, well outside the long shadow of her husband\xe2\x80\x99s judgment and approval. And Par\xc3\xa9 took them on with zero concern about whether Megan\xe2\x80\x99s actions may come off as selfish \xe2\x80\x94 like when she cast out Don\xe2\x80\x99s pregnant \xe2\x80\x9cniece.\xe2\x80\x9d You may not like Megan, you may think she\xe2\x80\x99s a mess, but in Par\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x99s hands, you always understood who she was. \xe2\x80\x94A.B.V.', '19.', 'Lennon Parham and Jessica St. Clair,', 'Acting Emmy nominations obviously cannot be shared, but if the Academy was to ever make an exception, it should be for the absolutely wonderful double act (and real-life best friends) Parham and St. Clair accomplish every week on USA. Elements of improvisation course throughout the comedy (created by the pair), highlighting the enormity of their talents. That rapid-fire back-and-forth not only sells the show\xe2\x80\x99s central friendship but is also responsible for some of the year\xe2\x80\x99s most hilarious \xe2\x80\x94 and quotable \xe2\x80\x94 conversations. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '20.', 'Teyonah Parris,', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s taken a long time for', 'to turn its attention to its very few black characters \xe2\x80\x94 and certainly some of that was by design, as the monied world embodied by the show became itself more aware of the lives that had heretofore been at best on the margins. But when Parris, as quietly adroit SC&P secretary Dawn Chambers, confronted her callous new boss Lou Avery (Allan Havey) after he let slip that her race meant she couldn\xe2\x80\x99t be fired, she commanded the spotlight, revealing an exasperated anger she had kept hidden from the office \xe2\x80\x94 and, largely, the audience. But it was Parris\xe2\x80\x99 smile in Joan\xe2\x80\x99s office, as Dawn privately relished her newfound position of power, that is exactly the kind of brilliant, subtle acting that the Emmys should always celebrate. \xe2\x80\x94A.B.V.', '21.', 'Hayden Panettiere,', 'Is', 'a great show? No, far from it, in fact. But throughout all the underwhelming storylines and insane soap opera antics, Panettiere has served up a sterling performance as self-sabotaging starlet Juliette Barnes. An infectious concoction of sugar and spice, Panettiere consistently elevates her creation above the rest (yes, that includes the flawless Connie Britton), turning the incredibly polarizing diva into someone you actually want to root for. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '22.', 'Yara Pilartz,', 'SundanceTV\xe2\x80\x99s', 'featured one of the year\xe2\x80\x99s strongest ensembles, all of whom would be worthy of acting nominations. But it was Pilartz\xe2\x80\x99s performance \xe2\x80\x94 as Camille, a 15-year-old who feels developmentally crippled compared with her 19-year-old twin sister, Lena \xe2\x80\x94 that resonated the most deeply. Lending her character a sense of maturity well beyond her years allowed Camille\xe2\x80\x99s immature actions to stand in even starker contrast to the undeniable sense of stunted adulthood that permeated the unforgettable performance. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '23.', 'Andrew Rannells,', 'The trick to being a successful guest star is recognizing that you have a very limited amount of time to make an impression and maximizing that screen time without becoming a camera hog. No one grasped that balancing act this year better than Rannells, who through Elijah provided some of the year\xe2\x80\x99s best one-liners, caustic put-downs, and dress shorts. In further proof of Rannells\xe2\x80\x99 exceptional contributions to', ', creator Lena Dunham is bringing him back full-time in Season 4. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '24.', 'Emmy Rossum,', 'First things first, this show has no business in the comedy category \xe2\x80\x94', '\xe2\x80\x94 since Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s dysfunctional family drama is one of the most powerful, troubling, and difficult shows on television. That said, I won\xe2\x80\x99t knock their hustle in trying to get some long overdue awards show attention because it\xe2\x80\x99s borderline criminal that Rossum\xe2\x80\x99s work has yet to be acknowledged by the Academy.', 'Luckily this would be a wonderful time to right that wrong, as Fiona Gallagher faced her most crippling endurance tests this season. Tests that Fiona unexpectedly failed \xe2\x80\x94 allowing Rossum to do her best and most emotionally raw work to date. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '25.', 'Timothy Simons,', 'HBO\xe2\x80\x99s genius political satire requires all of its actors to endure hard knocks with a forced smile, and no character has suffered more than Simons\xe2\x80\x99 Jonah Ryan, the perennial punching bag for Selina Meyers\xe2\x80\x99 staff. And for good reason. As tall as he is annoying, the aggressively incompetent turncoat spent Season 3 flip-flopping with a dizzying frequency, but Simons continued to evoke compassion for his creation by keeping his passion for politics and need for inclusion right at the surface. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '26.', 'Allison Tolman,', '\xe2\x80\x9cDecent\xe2\x80\x9d is the word that\xe2\x80\x99s been firmly attached to', ', an cop working a murder case in Bemidji, Minn.; indeed, her fundamental decency is what makes her the moral center of the show. But the character\xe2\x80\x99s nuances play across Tolman\xe2\x80\x99s face \xe2\x80\x94 Molly\xe2\x80\x99s tenacity, vexation, and humor show in her minutely wrinkled brow and her darting eyes often more so than in her pointed dialogue, delivered in a Minnesotan singsong. Although the show\xe2\x80\x99s creator', '', 'isn\xe2\x80\x99t about gender dynamics, Tolman\xe2\x80\x99s performance of the frustrated, persistent policewoman says otherwise. \xe2\x80\x94Ariane Lange', '27.', 'Albert Tsai,', 'Child actors often come across as precocious line-reciters, not thoughtful performers. But in his first major screen role, the 9-year-old star of ABC\xe2\x80\x99s brilliant but canceled blended family comedy made every joke, aside, and piece of dialogue feel like it organically came straight from Bert\xe2\x80\x99s wonderfully enthusiastic mind. Whether he was screaming for salmon, performing Bertwheels, or crashing after his first taste of coffee, Tsai was the source of the year\xe2\x80\x99s most charming debut performance. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '28.', 'Christopher Evan Welch,', 'Welch didn\xe2\x80\x99t live to see his character, the deliciously eccentric billionaire investor Peter Gregory, appear on screen on HBO\xe2\x80\x99s subversive comedy', ', as he died four months before the premiere at age 48. What Welch left behind in Peter Gregory was a breakout performance, a pitch-perfect role as a socially awkward tech genius who bristles, squirms, and shouts his way out of nearly every encounter. Welch so ably inhabits this commanding role that much of', 'exists within his shadow. This is a virtuoso performance that goes beyond mere comedy \xe2\x80\x94 he captures the energy, vitality, passion, and oddness of an angel investor. Capital in every way. \xe2\x80\x94J.L.', '29.', 'Jeremy Allen White,', 'Since the pilot, Rossum\xe2\x80\x99s Fiona and White\xe2\x80\x99s Phillip \xe2\x80\x94 better known as Lip \xe2\x80\x94 have worked in tandem, a brother/sister act of perfectly choreographed spontaneity. So in a season that brought Fiona to her knees, it\xe2\x80\x99s no surprise that Lip finally stood on his own two feet. Taking control of the Gallagher clan was a good look on White as his brilliant delinquent juggled school and familial responsibilities while never losing that endlessly appealing edge. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '30.', 'Mae Whitman,', 'Long', ', Whitman put her tear ducts through the wringer last season as Amber \xe2\x80\x94 the self-assured character she\xe2\x80\x99s taken on a stunning five-year journey of self-discovery \xe2\x80\x94 was forced to deal with a smattering of emotional setbacks. Beginning with the dissolution of her engagement to Ryan (Matt Lauria) and ending with, as a direct result of their split, her soldier ex returning to war where he was gravely injured. What made Whitman', '\xe2\x80\x99s most valuable player in Season 5 was her enduring ability to express a seemingly bottomless reservoir of emotions \xe2\x80\x94 both happy, sad, and stoned \xe2\x80\x94 without a visible trace of effort. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', '31.', 'Bellamy Young,', 'Shonda Rhimes\xe2\x80\x99 political soap opera is designed so that viewers champion the illicit affair between Olivia Pope (Kerry Washington), the show\xe2\x80\x99s protagonist, and President Fitzgerald Grant (Tony Goldwyn), her soulmate. That leaves Mellie Grant (', '), Fitz\xe2\x80\x99s wife and first lady, out in the cold.', 'But over the last three seasons, audiences have warmed to Mellie, thanks to the cunning combination of character-expanding writing and Young\xe2\x80\x99s deeply sympathetic performance. Season 3 offered audiences the biggest reason to sympathize with Mellie yet \xe2\x80\x94 she was raped by her father-in-law years ago and secretly suffered under the fear her eldest son was fathered as a result of this horrific act \xe2\x80\x94 and Young dazzled by bringing the difficult storyline to life. It takes an actor of enormous talents to transform a villain into a hero, but Young has proven to be woman enough for the job. \xe2\x80\x94J.W.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '31 Actors Who Deserve First-Time Emmy Nominations', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: First ‰ÛÏDownton Abbey‰Ûù Season 5 Trailer Offers A ForebodingåÊReturn
Description: ['\xe2\x80\x9cThings are changing.\xe2\x80\x9d']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The start of', '\xe2\x80\x99s fifth season is still a ways off \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s expected to air in September on ITV in the U.K. and in January on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', 'in the U.S. \xe2\x80\x94 but British broadcaster ITV has released the first teaser for Season 5, which is long on atmosphere if short on actual new content from the upcoming season.', 'Set against the backdrop of familiar scenes of everyday life at Downton (i.e., shots taken directly from the now-iconic opening credit sequence), the unwavering voice of trusted butler Carson (Jim Carter) offers some foreboding words of dread about what might be coming to the great house and its inhabitants this season:', 'Pretty ominous, no?', 'Among the new faces set to appear this season on', ': Richard E. Grant (', ',', '), Anna Chancellor (', '), and Rade Sherbedgia (', '), while Dame Harriet Walter and Peter Egan will reprise their respective roles as Lady Shackleton and Lord Flintshire.', '4.', 'Season 5 of', 'will air this autumn on ITV and in January on PBS\xe2\x80\x99s', '.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'First "Downton Abbey" Season 5 Trailer Offers A Foreboding Return', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: Watch The First 12 Minutes Of ‰ÛÏRectify‰Ûù SeasonåÊ2
Description: ['The searing and heartbreaking SundanceTV drama, which was one of the', ', returns for a second season on June 19.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Here are the opening minutes, exclusively on BuzzFeed.', '', 'Season 1 of SundanceTV\xe2\x80\x99s superlative drama series', 'ended with Daniel Holden (Aden Young) \xe2\x80\x94 a former death row inmate released after 17 years, thanks to a legal technicality that secured his freedom \xe2\x80\x94 being beaten nearly to death by a group of men in a cemetery.', 'Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s attack \xe2\x80\x94 carried out on the instructions of the brother of Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s teenage girlfriend Hanna, whom he was found guilty of raping and murdering \xe2\x80\x94 was an act of harsh brutality, one that was at odds with the', ', the sensation of feathers falling onto bare skin or of the awesome sight of a sunrise or a grove of trees or a statue.', 'In its first season, the Ray McKinnon-created show depicted good and evil in a small Southern town, using Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s release as a rubric for exploring crime and punishment, innocence and guilt, and the way that Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s family \xe2\x80\x94 and the town of Paulie, Ga. \xe2\x80\x94 moved on without him or didn\xe2\x80\x99t. In just six episodes, the first season of', 'precisely and gorgeously captured the sense of Daniel being trapped in amber, of existing outside of time, of coming home and realizing that you don\xe2\x80\x99t recognize anything or anyone, least of all yourself.', 'On June 19, the 10-episode second season of', '(the first 12 minutes of which can be seen below) picks up those threads immediately after Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s vicious beating at Hanna\xe2\x80\x99s grave, offering a look inside Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s subconscious mind as he returns to a prison of sorts. But it\xe2\x80\x99s the scenes in the hospital between the women in Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s life \xe2\x80\x94 Abigail Spencer\xe2\x80\x99s ferocious crusader Amantha, J. Smith-Cameron\xe2\x80\x99s tremulous Janet, and Adelaide Clemens\xe2\x80\x99 soulful Tawney \xe2\x80\x94 that crackle with electricity here. What\xe2\x80\x99s said and unsaid carries enormous weight and power in these brief scenes and speaks toward a lifetime of pain and confusion\xe2\x80\xa6and sets up what promises to be another intense season of', '.', 'SundanceTV', 'SundanceTV', '4.', 'Watch the first 12 minutes of Season 2 of', ':', '5.', 'Season 2 of', 'begins Thursday, June 19, at 9 p.m. on SundanceTV.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Watch The First 12 Minutes Of "Rectify" Season 2', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The Whole Of ‰ÛÏOrange Is The New Black‰Ûù Season 2 Is Greater Than The Sum Of ItsåÊParts
Description: ['After a sterling first season, expectations were high for the sophomore season of Jenji Kohan\xe2\x80\x99s female prison drama.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Fortunately, Season 2 proved to be just as juicy, sweet, and tart as you\xe2\x80\x99d want it to be. (MAJOR SPOILERS ahead.)', '', '', '\xe2\x80\x99s stunning second season manages to be ambitiously large and somehow intimate. It\xe2\x80\x99s the equivalent of a pointillist painting: From up close each dash and dot has its own individual identity and meaning, but when viewed at a distance, they coalesce into something altogether different and dependent on its parts.', 'In its', ', Jenji Kohan\xe2\x80\x99s', 'offers a scathing indictment of a broken system, using Litchfield Penitentiary as a stand-in for the failings of society as a whole. As the season progresses and conditions at Litchfield become worse and worse \xe2\x80\x94 because of venal officials, embezzlement schemes, force majeure, and general lack of empathy or interest \xe2\x80\x94 it becomes clear that these inmates have permanently slipped through the cracks as the most basic requirements of the prison system (keeping these women \xe2\x80\x9csafe and clean\xe2\x80\x9d) are not even being met. (The bubbling up of sewage from the toilets becomes an emblem of the corruption and rot at work here.)', 'The freedom of choice within the non-Litchfield lives of the corrections officers \xe2\x80\x94 even Fig (Alysia Reiner), the mercenary assistant warden, gets some deeper shading this season as her life implodes \xe2\x80\x94 appears to be wholly at odds with that of the women the officers are sworn to protect. Healey (Michael J. Harney), who\xe2\x80\x99s in a miserable marriage to a Russian mail-order bride, enters therapy to deal with his anger issues and creates a \xe2\x80\x9cSafe Place\xe2\x80\x9d for the inmates to open up as a way of compensating, perhaps, for his ineffectualness. Joe Caputo (Nick Sandow), the masturbatory administrator, becomes a hero of sorts over the course of the season until he too is seduced by power, opting not to do the right thing or even listen to it, such as when Matt McGorry\xe2\x80\x99s Bennett confesses that he got inmate Daya (Dascha Polanco) pregnant. The truth becomes an inconvenience, something to be shrugged off and compartmentalized. It\xe2\x80\x99s far easier, then, just to put a Band-Aid on matters, to drag out a nun (Beth Fowler\xe2\x80\x99s Sister Jane Ingalls) to make a pre-scripted statement. Caputo sees himself as a savior of these women, but he chooses ultimately to perpetuate the broken system that surrounds them. The prison officials are, in actuality, also just as trapped \xe2\x80\x94 by red tape, by bureaucracy, by personal desire, by anger issues \xe2\x80\x94 as the inmates.', '', 'And in Season 2, viewers see just how dire things have become at Litchfield. Gone are the days of yoga and free doughnuts. Heroin floods the prison, thanks to the arrival of sociopath Vee (the great Lorraine Toussaint in a tour de force performance); bathrooms fester from raw sewage; a shot quota is initiated; the backup generators are missing fuel; rats circle out-of-date donations during a tropical storm; a hunger strike begins as an attempt to protest the savage use of SHU as a punishment; and Jimmy (Pat Squire), a senile and elderly inmate, is given \xe2\x80\x9ccompassionate release,\xe2\x80\x9d dumped at a bus station when she becomes a problem that officials don\xe2\x80\x99t feel like solving.', 'Whereas before there was some semblance of unity, fractures develop not only in Litchfield\xe2\x80\x99s infrastructure, but in its interpersonal relationships: Factions form, dissolve, and reform. Best friends Taystee (Danielle Brooks) and Poussey (Samira Wiley) are at one another\xe2\x80\x99s throats. Suzanne (Uzo Aduba) becomes violent under the tutelage of Vee, her brutal confrontation with Poussey revealing just how damaged Taystee and her friends have become since Vee arrived. The relationship between Piper (Taylor Schilling) and the devious Alex (Laura Prepon, who appears in four episodes this season) splinters yet again, as does Piper\xe2\x80\x99s on-again-off-again romance with Larry (Jason Biggs). The \xe2\x80\x9cfamily\xe2\x80\x9d gathered around ex-prison cook Red (Kate Mulgrew) falls apart entirely without her as their anchor, with Nicky (Natasha Lyonne) and the others turning their back on their former protector. Even Pennsatucky (Taryn Manning) falls out with her fellow laundry room meth heads after she gets new, shiny white teeth.', 'Throughout it all, there\xe2\x80\x99s the notion here that prison is a crucible that tests one\xe2\x80\x99s character, revealing ultimately who each of the inmates truly is. Piper embodies this notion, telling an old couple, while on furlough to attend her grandmother\xe2\x80\x99s funeral, that prison hasn\xe2\x80\x99t diminished who she was, but has revealed who she truly is. That carries through the season as a whole; Lorna Morello (Yael Stone) is exposed as a lunatic stalker, but inside the prison, she is somehow thoughtful and kind, gracious and loyal. Prison strips away the artifice to display one\xe2\x80\x99s true character at the core. Piper is tougher than she knew; her fight with Pennsatucky at the end of Season 1 reinforced this. Her gentility and na\xc3\xafvet\xc3\xa9 have been somewhat (for Piper, anyway) stripped down. She sees the skull beneath the skin now; she sees life for what it is: a farce.', 'And like any farce, deceptively minor incidents balloon into larger significance. Take for example, a seemingly innocuous encounter between Vee and terminal cancer patient Miss Rosa (Barbara Rosenblat). Rosa says that Vee is a \xe2\x80\x9cvery rude woman\xe2\x80\x9d after Vee forces her to move tables in the cafeteria, and that rudeness is the thing that comes back to bite Vee in the end. After managing to escape Litchfield following her attack on Red, Vee tries to flag down a passing van \xe2\x80\x94 unaware that it\xe2\x80\x99s driven by Rosa, who has also escaped prison, aided by Morello. Rosa, recognizing Vee (\xe2\x80\x9calways so rude, that one\xe2\x80\x9d), instead runs her over. There\xe2\x80\x99s a fitting irony here: Rudeness, like karma, is a shadow that you cannot outrun. A chance encounter becomes one\xe2\x80\x99s ultimate end; as Vee\xe2\x80\x99s body hits the ground, her eyes, tellingly, are open. After an entire season of intense and almost Shakespearean plotting and scheming over control of the tunnel and black market operations, that this is Vee\xe2\x80\x99s ultimate fate \xe2\x80\x94 run down by a woman whom she slighted and who had nothing to do with the contraband plot \xe2\x80\x94 is incredibly significant.', 'Netflix', 'Prison is some metaphorical fire, burning away one\xe2\x80\x99s civilized fa\xc3\xa7ade to reveal some essential truth beneath the surface, and Season 2 of', 'demonstrates this even further. With little control over their freedom of movement, the smallest act takes on larger meaning within Litchfield, such as the selection of a hairstyle. One of Vee\xe2\x80\x99s first Svengali-like manipulations of Suzanne is to remove the tightly coiled Bantu hair knots so closely associated with her, requiring her to change a facet of herself. (In doing so, Suzanne becomes far more violent under Vee\xe2\x80\x99s care than before.) Likewise, Taystee exchanges her curls for tight cornrows; it\xe2\x80\x99s a signifier that she\xe2\x80\x99s not the same Taystee as before. As Vee extends her control over Black Cindy (Adrienne C. Moore) and Watson (Vicky Jeudy), her own hair changes, moving from the matted and tamped-down style she has upon her arrival at Litchfield to a lush mane once she secures a hold over Taystee and her friends. Offering more than just cake, she promises protection and a lioness\xe2\x80\x99 hold.', 'But the hair metamorphoses extend beyond Vee\xe2\x80\x99s crew. Pennsatucky, in looking for a new identity, opts to have her hair chopped off after falling in with Big Boo (Lea DeLaria) during the storm. Piper emerges from prison for her 48 hours of furlough with her hair blonder and shinier, thanks to Sophia (Laverne Cox). And Red, faded and gray after falling out of power in Season 1, opts for a visit to Sophia in order to restore her fiery mane. When she steps out of the chair, she has not only reclaimed her thirst for power, but also the redness of her roots.', 'Yet, it\xe2\x80\x99s Red who realizes that the war between her and Vee does not define her, nor does her slip into vicious reprisal. Still, their battle \xe2\x80\x94 over who controls the flow of contraband into Litchfield \xe2\x80\x94 turns deadly. After Taslitz (Judith Roberts) mistakenly shanks an unnamed black prisoner (thinking she\xe2\x80\x99s Vee), the tension between the two groups moves from a simmer to a full-on boil. Red attempts to strangle Vee with some plastic wrap on a deserted loading dock, picking her moment well, but she can\xe2\x80\x99t bring herself to finish the job. (\xe2\x80\x9cThis place is getting to me,\xe2\x80\x9d she says, ruefully.) Vee, however, has no such compunctions, slocking Red repeatedly in the greenhouse. Red retains her humanity but nearly loses an eye; Vee, however, knows that you can\xe2\x80\x99t play at war \xe2\x80\x94 you have to go all in or not at all.', 'Netflix', 'Season 2 can be seen as being structured around the war between Red and Vee, the two women acting as poles between which much of the action occurs. Characters fade in and out of focus in the second season, allowing for Miss Rosa, Sister Ingalls, Morello, Poussey, and others to get their own flashback episodes; likewise, the season begins with Schilling\xe2\x80\x99s Piper transported to another prison altogether, forcing her to contend with new characters and situations. Inasmuch as Piper acts as the audience\xe2\x80\x99s entry to the narrative \xe2\x80\x94 her na\xc3\xafvet\xc3\xa9 is contrasted here with that of new inmate Brook Soso (Kimiko Glenn), a self-absorbed political activist \xe2\x80\x94 the second season of', 'reminds us that this is a true ensemble; Episode 2, \xe2\x80\x9cLooks Blue, Tastes Red,\xe2\x80\x9d is entirely Piper-free, but doesn\xe2\x80\x99t feel lacking as a result.', 'For all of the audience apathy that Piper (sometimes fairly) receives, Schilling delivers a tremendous performance this season. While glimpses of the old Piper emerge from time to time, Season 2 finds a stronger, deeper Piper who has been tempered by her experiences at Litchfield and elsewhere. The scene of Piper drinking a 40 and eating fast food on the bridge, alone, would indicate just how far this character has come. She has accepted her criminality and sees herself through a different lens. Her prison sentence isn\xe2\x80\x99t a detour from her life; this', 'her life. That her pristinely ordered life outside of Litchfield falls into chaos this year \xe2\x80\x94 with her ex-fianc\xc3\xa9 Larry falling in love with her best friend Polly (Maria Dizzia) \xe2\x80\x94 adds to the feeling that she too has become something else. (Though not entirely \xe2\x80\x94 note Piper\xe2\x80\x99s sheer bliss when she discovers her favorite cashmere sweater in a box at the apartment she had shared with Larry.)', 'If Season 1 was about world-building for', ', Season 2 is about disruption, with Vee throwing the makeshift structure of Litchfield into disarray. It\xe2\x80\x99s seen most palpably in the way that the bond between Poussey and Taystee is broken by Vee\xe2\x80\x99s interference. But in denouncing Vee for the villain that she is, Taystee is finally able to salvage her relationship with Poussey, though their dynamic remains strictly platonic, much to the latter\xe2\x80\x99s dismay. All it takes is a waterlogged copy of', ', some Amanda-Mackenzie role-playing, and a meaningful hug to reposition these two best friends. Their enmity remains one of the most heartbreaking elements of the second season, but their reconciliation is truly a high point in Season 2\xe2\x80\x99s denouement. In a show that deals this profoundly with female dynamics, this is a testament both to the writing of these characters and to the gifted performances of both Brooks and Wiley. In learning more about the backstories of both, we see some of the circumstances that led them to Litchfield, but in that scene in the library, which depicts the grace of friendship and compassion, we see that there is the possibility of redemption for almost anyone.', 'Netflix', 'That Taystee chooses Poussey is noteworthy, because it affirms the tug of war between the small and the large; she chooses the intimacy of friendship over the large family that she previously dreamed of. (Vee turns this personal dream of Taystee\xe2\x80\x99s into something rotten and misshapen.) And', '\xe2\x80\x94 the very embodiment of a small moment transforming into huge consequence \xe2\x80\x94 rather than by the larger-than-life schemes swirling around her, which include a mistaken identity murder plot, poison (when Annie Golden\xe2\x80\x99s Norma tries to harvest arsenic from apple seeds), and even voodoo, a subplot that pays off the tortured backstory of abused prison cook Gloria Mendoza (Selenis Leyva). These are small brushstrokes that coalesce to form a larger portrait of these women\xe2\x80\x99s lives in prison.', 'In Litchfield, something as small and trivial as a haircut can take on much bigger meaning. A family becomes something that is self-made, cobbled together from strangers craving a sense of belonging that goes beyond their individual needs. The cracked walls of the prison, containing a warren of bunks and cells, form an escape hatch of sorts from the world at large, a place that reveals individuals\xe2\x80\x99 cruelty and kindness in equal measure, a place that both corrupts and saves. It is a place where the dots and dashes can be at war with one another or unified in purpose. Because of that,', 'is bigger than any single character, bigger than Piper or Vee or Taystee; it is their collective story but it also, thankfully, ours as well.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'The Whole Of \xe2\x80\x9cOrange Is The New Black\xe2\x80\x9d Season 2 Is Greater Than The Sum Of Its Parts', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "Orange Is The New Black" Season 2 Lives Up To TheåÊHype
Description: ['The second season of the Netflix prison drama is a gripping, beautiful, majestic thing.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: Spoilers for Season 2 ahead!', '', 'Netflix', 'There are the television shows that you love to watch but that drift from powerful and provocative to comforting background noise, and then there are those that arrive with the momentous force of a revolution, issuing a clarion cry that is impossible to resist.', 'Women\xe2\x80\x99s prison drama', ', which returns for its second season on June 6, is most definitely the latter, a groundbreaking and deeply layered series that explores crime and punishment, poor circumstance, and bad luck. (At its heart, it is about both the choices we make and those that are made for us.) It constructs a gripping narrative that owes a great deal to the work of Charles Dickens, a social-minded and sprawling story that captures essential truths about those at both ends of the economic continuum. Just as in the Victorian era, within the world of Litchfield Penitentiary, everything is in its place and in its place is everything: Each of the characters is a cog in a larger machine.', 'The literary tradition of Dickens \xe2\x80\x94 so notably captured in HBO\xe2\x80\x99s 2002\xe2\x80\x932008 crime drama', '\xe2\x80\x94 is keenly felt within', ', as the action shifts between disparate characters in each episode, exploring their inner lives and hidden pasts. There is a strong sense of righteous indignation in the face of a broken and corrupt system, the failures of Litchfield a microcosm for the breakdown within the larger society. In the sixth episode of Season 2, Officer Susan Fischer (Lauren Lapkus) \xe2\x80\x94 perhaps one of the more genuinely sympathetic of the corrections officers \xe2\x80\x94 goes so far as to make the comparison, as she eavesdrops on the inmates\xe2\x80\x99 telephone conversation recordings. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s so interesting, all these lives,\xe2\x80\x9d she says, her eyes gleaming with unrestrained excitement. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s like Dickens.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'The Jenji Kohan\xe2\x80\x93created Netflix drama seemed to come out of nowhere last summer but quickly became', '.', '\xe2\x80\x99s first season was the triumphant arrival of an ambitious drama whose tone ricocheted with purpose from the contemplative to the absurd. In the process, the show gave a voice to a group of women, from whom society would shy away, depicting life at a minimum-security prison with appropriate grit and sympathy. No character \xe2\x80\x94 not even putative lead Piper Chapman (Taylor Schilling), who ended the season by brutally attacking fellow prisoner Tiffany \xe2\x80\x9cPennsatucky\xe2\x80\x9d Doggett (Taryn Manning) \xe2\x80\x94 was wholly good or bad, but existed somewhere in the middle of that moral spectrum. At times, the effort to survive in the world of Litchfield meant casting off the entire notion of what it meant to be a good person, reflexively stopping to see the world in such simplistic ways.', 'Instead,', 'offers a deftly nuanced glimpse into a world of thieves and murderers, patsies and criminal masterminds, amoral corrections officers and corrupt prison officials. As in', 'before it, characters shifting into focus or retreating to the background allows for a structure that can accommodate a multitude of personalities while shining a spotlight on different individuals each episode, providing a context that allows the audience to see her not just as an inmate, but as a woman. That sense of equality carries over across racial lines, focusing on each of Litchfield\xe2\x80\x99s factions in turn. What makes these women tick, the pasts that they\xe2\x80\x99ve left behind, the heartbreak and loss that led them to this point is slowly teased out through flashbacks that feel, at times, revelatory. Likewise, when the unseen eye of the show pivots to focus on Litchfield\xe2\x80\x99s guards, there is the inescapable sense that they too are imprisoned.', 'That conviction of purpose feels especially apt within the first six episodes of', '\xe2\x80\x99s second season, which demonstrate an incredibly strong return. While the first season of the show was a sleeper hit, audience anticipation for Season 2 is at an all-time high; there is a lot riding on how well', 'can sustain the energy, tension, and creativity of the first season. If these first six episodes are any indication, the show is just as freshly tart and sweet as the first go-around.', '', 'In the second season opener (and here\xe2\x80\x99s where the spoilers begin), Piper, who has been in solitary confinement since her confrontation with Doggett, finds herself in a situation that is straight out of Dickens\xe2\x80\x99 Circumlocution Office, an absurd sequence of events whose purpose is concealed from Piper herself. As she\xe2\x80\x99s transported to an unknown destination, the seemingly irrational nature of her travel would feel almost like a farce, if it weren\xe2\x80\x99t so entirely terrifying for Piper.', 'The episode quickly sets up a new set of circumstances for Piper and introduces an entirely new set of oddball characters \xe2\x80\x94 cockroach-trainers, an astrologically obsessed sex pest, and Lori Petty as an inmate who smuggles a glob of Vaseline in her ear \xe2\x80\x94 as Piper tries to regain a semblance of equilibrium amid the unknowable. There are plot devices at play \xe2\x80\x94 like the tension between coincidence and fate \xe2\x80\x94 that feel straight out of a Dickens novel, but which don\xe2\x80\x99t warrant spoiling here, because they\xe2\x80\x99re just that surprising and in keeping with the show\xe2\x80\x99s ability to engineer suspense and tension out of the seemingly mundane. A mystery about the Piper\xe2\x80\x93Doggett fight emerges and is quickly resolved, its resolution both satisfying and unnerving.', 'Subsequent episodes focus on characters whose pasts haven\xe2\x80\x99t yet been explicitly spelled out just yet. A series of Taystee (Danielle Brooks) flashbacks depicts her childhood and teen years and introduces a new character to the mythology of the show: the manipulative and dangerous Vee, played with exquisite oiliness by the great Lorraine Toussaint. Vee is a Fagin-like character, gathering unwanted urchins and promising them warm dinners and a home for their participation in crime, in this case, the drug trade. As she bakes multigrain bread and cooks organic fare for their dinners, the implications of Vee\xe2\x80\x99s insidious nature are apparent: You can only come home if you\xe2\x80\x99ve fulfilled your obligations. As such, Vee seems to be straight out of a Dickens novel, a dodgy operator who knows how to get under people\xe2\x80\x99s skin and make them do the dirty work for her. When Vee shows up at the prison, her presence within the narrative destabilizes the entire wonky order of Litchfield itself. She\xe2\x80\x99s a disruptor and an agitator; her very arrival spells danger.', 'Likewise, details emerge about the backstories of cerise-lipped Morello (Yael Stone) \xe2\x80\x94 which will likely generate some very intense discussion when viewers reach her episode \xe2\x80\x94 as well as that of Samira Wiley\xe2\x80\x99s Poussey (a heartbreaking tale of love, loss, and intolerance), and Selenis Leyva\xe2\x80\x99s prison cook Gloria (whose past unfolds in a story about battered women, crimes of necessity, and the cleansing power of fire), and Uzo Aduba\xe2\x80\x99s Suzanne aka \xe2\x80\x9cCrazy Eyes,\xe2\x80\x9d whose painful flashback episode establishes her as a deeply tragic and sympathetic figure. In the case of Poussey and Suzanne (who\xe2\x80\x99s referred to by her real name more often in Season 2), the reasons behind their arrivals at Litchfield remain unclear, even as pieces of their formative years point towards future issues. (It bears mentioning that the two girls who play the younger Suzanne within the flashbacks \xe2\x80\x94 as well as Aduba herself \xe2\x80\x94 are extraordinary.)', 'Netflix', 'Netflix', 'Suzanne in particular remains pivotal to the central action, not just because of her relationship to Piper. She makes an easy and quick mark for Vee, who sees precisely how the other women exclude Suzanne and exploits it to her own advantage. If Suzanne was a cipher in the show\xe2\x80\x99s first season \xe2\x80\x94 a character who not only quoted Shakespeare, but often performed the role of one of his fools \xe2\x80\x94 the second season deepens her character significantly while still retaining her unpredictability and explosive passion. Aduba excels at the scenes both where Suzanne is overcome with emotion and where she\xe2\x80\x99s trapped by it; as a result, she is', '\xe2\x80\x99s MVP at times. (Laura Prepon, who plays Piper\xe2\x80\x99s ex-girlfriend and betrayer Alex Vause and who gave the show\xe2\x80\x99s first season a tremulous sense of frisson,', '.)', 'The second season effortlessly sets up two overarching plots that both potentially threaten the status quo. Piper, under the guidance of self-absorbed ex-fianc\xc3\xa9 Larry (Jason Biggs), begins to snoop around the prison, looking for proof of corruption and complicity, the na\xc3\xafve soap-maker becoming a social crusader. (Her transformation is not limited to her budding expose-writer; a new prisoner\xe2\x80\x99s obliviousness acts as a yardstick by which to measure Piper\xe2\x80\x99s growth and transition into a more hardened inmate, a \xe2\x80\x9clone wolf\xe2\x80\x9d who sees the error of her naivet\xc3\xa9.)', 'Likewise, Vee\xe2\x80\x99s campaign of control and her sly manipulation of those around her forces formerly strong relationships to fracture and old alliances to buckle. She is a woman used to getting her own way and the ease with which she influences her fellow inmates is scary to watch. As such, she\xe2\x80\x99s quickly set up as a rival of excommunicated former cook Red (Kate Mulgrew), who has retreated to a sort of solitary confinement of her own since her loss of power, her roots white, her flame-red hair diminished. There is a fantastic scene between Red and Vee that sees the former rivals reunited, their enmity transformed into something resembling mutual respect or admiration. After all, they are both members of the old guard, stalwarts who have been through quite a few wars in their own time. It\xe2\x80\x99s Vee\xe2\x80\x99s arrival \xe2\x80\x94 and her sudden influence \xe2\x80\x94 that reawakens the beast within Red, as she sets out to reclaim her kingdom or forge a new one.', 'In', '\xe2\x80\x99s second season, these power struggles \xe2\x80\x94 along with the sort of greed, inequity, and the inefficiency of bureaucracy that are so prevalent in the works of Dickens \xe2\x80\x94 have not only taken root in Litchfield but threaten to choke an already restrained populace. Even in this place of imprisonment, the urge to grow, to find comfort, to learn, and to love is no different than the concerns of the inhabitants of Victorian England or our own world today; they\xe2\x80\x99re just confined behind bars and barbed wire.', 'Season 2 of', 'will be available beginning June 6 on Netflix.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Orange Is The New Black" Season 2 Lives Up To The Hype', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: AMC Has Found A New Don Draper And He‰Ûªs Ginsberg‰Ûªs Worst Nightmare
Description: ['The Lee Pace\xe2\x80\x93led', ', set in 1983 Dallas, offers up a pitch-perfect pilot about ambition, greed, and visionary dreamers at the heart of the tech revolution.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'has made the world safe for period dramas: Nearly every cable network seems to be launching a time capsule program (and quite a few broadcasters have tried and failed) designed to penetrate our cynicism and trap a bygone era in amber. As', ', the blue chip iteration of the period drama, wraps up its seven-season run, Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s', 'and even', ', HBO\xe2\x80\x99s', ', and AMC\xe2\x80\x99s', 'have sprung up in its shadow.', 'Which brings us to AMC\xe2\x80\x99s latest deep dive back in time, the \xe2\x80\x9980s\xe2\x80\x93set computer drama', '(which begins June 1 in', '\xe2\x80\x99s 10 p.m. Sunday time slot). The title is a reference to a line of code about self-destruction and that impulse carries over into the insidious behavior patterns of the show\xe2\x80\x99s lead character, mysterious ex-IBM salesman Joe McMillan.', 'Played with precise intensity by Lee Pace, Joe looks like a Patrick Nagel illustration come to life, all hard angles, jutting shoulders, and slick eyebrows, who turns up in Texas and launches a complex game against his former employers by cloning an IBM computer. He is a riddle in more ways than one: a charming confident man who conceals some dark secrets that are only touched upon in the pilot episode.', 'Though his mysterious past remains as such throughout the episode, we know that Joe is a dark and potentially malevolent figure. For one, there are the scars on his chest, which point toward\xe2\x80\xa6 well, I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure what yet. And then there\xe2\x80\x99s the fact that he wrecks his brand-new apartment early on, picking up a baseball bat that holds a telling inscription from his father (daddy issues!) and connecting it with a ball thrown in the air.', 'As the ball careens around the glass-enclosed apartment, we see the damage Joe is doing, not just to his surroundings, but to the people he\xe2\x80\x99s encountering on his curious mission. It\xe2\x80\x99s no coincidence that Joe is introduced to the audience as he runs over an armadillo, trailing destruction in his wake, wherever he goes, not unlike', '\xe2\x80\x99s Don Draper before him.', 'And besides the dark past and path of destruction, Joe also shares Don\xe2\x80\x99s enviable ability to sell anyone on anything and his magnetic sleight of hand works to his advantage when convincing others to do his dirty work. (That he appears to be a complete fraud \xe2\x80\x94 or at least, a bald-faced liar \xe2\x80\x94 adds a layer of depth to a character that is inherently not as confident as he appears to be.) And because this is set in 1983, the era of power suits and consummate greed, of Reagan and Thatcher politics, Joe\xe2\x80\x99s conniving and ambition seem to fit the inherent values of the time. It\xe2\x80\x99s screw or be screwed, and Joe\xe2\x80\x99s plot has him playing Hannibal crossing the Alps in order to conquer and control.', 'He collides first with college student Cameron Howe (Mackenzie Davis), a combative computer prodigy whom Joe tries to sweet-talk in her classroom, in an arcade, and then in an arcade backroom, where their bodies collide with the forgotten debris, a palpable heat exploding between them. But their quickie turns sour when Joe insults Cameron. Later, however, she\xe2\x80\x99s the salvation of his grand scheme. Davis is the true breakout of', '. Seemingly coming out of nowhere (a turn in the Zac Efron film', 'and an episode of MTV\xe2\x80\x99s one-and-done series', '), Davis delivers a fiery, incandescent performance that\xe2\x80\x99s impossible to look away from. She makes Cameron both vulnerable and sharp-edged, a feisty and out-of-place punk whose caustic appearance and attitude reinforce, rather than belie, her impressive programming skills.', 'Then, there\xe2\x80\x99s Gordon Clark (Scoot McNairy), an embattled, embittered family man whose dreams have all turned to ash. He previously created a new computer with his wife, Texas Instruments drone Donna (Kerry Bish\xc3\xa9), but failed to turn it into a success. And he\xe2\x80\x99s since become a whiny drunk and a pathetic sad sack at work. The kind who drops his morning doughnut in the parking lot and he picks it up, brushes it off, and eats it without a second thought, and ignores his kids\xe2\x80\x99 pleas to fix their broken Speak and Spell. He\xe2\x80\x99s an easy target for Joe and quickly, the charming puppet master has Gordon ripping apart an IBM computer in order to reverse-engineer its guts.', '', 'The sequence in which the duo performs the heavy lifting of this enterprise \xe2\x80\x94 Joe gripping a pen and writing down a series of numbers as Gordon calls them out \xe2\x80\x94 ought to be tedious, but in the hands of', 'creators Chris Cantwell and Chris Rogers, it becomes, like the pilot itself, something exhilarating and extraordinary. A series of blinking lights becomes a sword to cut through a Gordian knot, the ones and zeros shifting into not a means to an end, but rather a road map to the future itself. And it\xe2\x80\x99s Joe that is the catalyst for waking up Gordon\xe2\x80\x99s slumbering ambition and drive. \xe2\x80\x9cThis puts the future squarely in the hands of those who know computers not for what they are but the potential of what they can be,\xe2\x80\x9d Joe reminds Gordon. \xe2\x80\x9cComputers are not the thing. They are the thing that gets us', 'the thing.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Joe and Gordon\xe2\x80\x99s employers at Cardiff Electric have other ideas, however. And it\xe2\x80\x99s Joe\xe2\x80\x99s machinations that put him squarely at odds with the small-time company\xe2\x80\x99s head of sales, John Bosworth (Toby Huss), whose suspicions start pinging the second city slicker Joe walks in the door before reaching an intolerable high-pitched decibel when he realizes that Joe has played them for fools from the start. By forcing their hands, Joe has pushed Cardiff Electric into the computer cloning business, but his motivations remain murky and unclear. Just what is Joe\xe2\x80\x99s endgame? What is he hiding? And what happened when he walked out of IMB a year earlier? Pace brings a level of dynamic energy to a character that might otherwise seem like a sociopath, a distant cousin of Patrick Bateman perhaps, a menacing Gordon Gekko-type crossed with Steve Jobs.', 'Joe is a visionary and a disruptor and that\xe2\x80\x99s a compelling mix for a lead character, even one who is ultimately as unknowable as Joe is within the pilot episode of', '. But in the hands of Cantwell and Rogers, the show\xe2\x80\x99s first installment is a pulsing and thrilling episode that contains much promise for where the series might go, as Joe and Cardiff Electric disrupt the hegemony of IBM via some stolen ideas.', 'Joe creates an arms race on the forefront of the technological revolution and the result, at least if the pilot is anything to go by, is intoxicating to watch. Like Gordon,', 'might ultimately flame out (critics haven\xe2\x80\x99t seen beyond Episode 1), but the bare bones of the series opener offer up an incredibly appealing cast, exquisitely sculpted dialogue, and a gorgeous soundtrack that makes the wait for the second episode absolutely unbearable.', 'begins Sunday, June 1, at 10 p.m. on AMC.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'AMC Has Found A New Don Draper And He\xe2\x80\x99s Ginsberg\xe2\x80\x99s Worst Nightmare', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The Midseason Finale Of ‰ÛÏMad Men‰Ûù Is One Giant LeapåÊForward
Description: ['Don\xe2\x80\x99t be fooled: Matthew Weiner\xe2\x80\x99s period drama has always been about the future.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: Contains spoilers for \xe2\x80\x9cWaterloo.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', 'For a show about the past,', 'has always been about the desperate pressing of the future against the figurative glass. In looking back to the 1960s, the show has held up a tarnished mirror to our own society, our own failings, our own future. A moon landing is full of promise; an old man lives just long enough to see the impossible made possible. Old ways \xe2\x80\x94 and the literal old guard \xe2\x80\x94 slip away. Companies perish and new ones are formed. Alliances, once fractured, are renewed.', 'This dance is eternal, the combustive pressure between the past and the future, between cynicism and hope. That embrace that occurs toward the end of the episode, between Don (Jon Hamm) and Peggy (Elisabeth Moss), is more than just a hug: It\xe2\x80\x99s a willing and proud acceptance of a new order.', 'The midseason finale of', '(\xe2\x80\x9cWaterloo\xe2\x80\x9d), written by Carly Wray and Matthew Weiner and directed by Weiner, potentially revealed the series\xe2\x80\x99 endgame. (Though, unfortunately for us,', '\xe2\x80\x99s seven final episodes won\xe2\x80\x99t air until sometime in 2015.) \xe2\x80\x9cWaterloo\xe2\x80\x9d is a superlative piece of television that captures the hope and beauty (and awe) of the 1969 moon landing, juxtaposed against the potential collapse of Sterling Cooper and Partners, as the struggle between disintegration and cohesion takes place behind the scenes.', 'Much discussion is made of how people react to the future, whether it\xe2\x80\x99s with cynicism (Sally, initially) or fear (Ginsberg, alarmed to the point of insanity by the IBM 360 computer), resignation (Ted Chaough) or acceptance.
