Influenced by a cute boy, Sally (Kiernan Shipka) initially recoils against the possibilities that the future offers, seeing only a cynical view of the cost of the moon landing, rather than what it means for mankind, sitting on the shoulders of giants. The cost of all things weighs heavily on the show; the characters, after all, are always selling something: a product, the false lure of a happy life, the emblems of happy hearths and childhoods. (Christina Hendricks\xe2\x80\x99 Joan even sold herself at one point.) And the moon landing was an expensive, if seismic, moment in the history of humankind: As we\xe2\x80\x99re reminded, it cost $25 billion, though that seems a small amount for such a monumental leap forward.', 'AMC/ via', 'That discussion of the price tag is wholly at odds with the sentiment embodied by the song-and-dance performed by the late Bert Cooper (Robert Morse) in Don\xe2\x80\x99s mind: \xe2\x80\x9cThe moon belongs to everyone / The best things in life are free / The stars belong to everyone / They gleam there for you and me.\xe2\x80\x9d The scene functions as a curtain call for', 'actor Morse, a final bow before the door to his office closes for the last time, and a refutation against the cynicism and greed embodied by several characters. Bert, as staunch a member of the old guard as possible, lived to see a man step foot on the moon, but his death in the moments after signal a closing of his time.', 'Though Bert speaks of Napoleon, the notion of exile \xe2\x80\x94 both self-imposed and not \xe2\x80\x94 plays out in the characters of Don and Ted (Kevin Rahm). Don, of course, came back from exile to fight for what he believes is his: his company, his job, his vision. Ted has resigned himself to a half-life in California, a palm tree-festooned Elba, and a shocking death wish is symbolized by his descent, sans engine, toward those orange groves. If these two are \xe2\x80\x9cone person,\xe2\x80\x9d as Roger (John Slattery) says, then one hopes they\xe2\x80\x99ll both emerge through the new deal, which has SC&P becoming a subsidiary of McCann, healed by their respective struggles. Both have been diminished, but it\xe2\x80\x99s Don who refuses to admit defeat. (\xe2\x80\x9cNo man has ever come back from leave, even Napoleon,\xe2\x80\x9d says Bert. \xe2\x80\x9cHe staged a coup but he ended up back on that island.\xe2\x80\x9d) Whether this new deal ends up being Don\xe2\x80\x99s Waterloo remains to be seen.', '', 'In his final episode, Bert ends up being the bearer of wisdom in so many ways. Besides the Napoleon reference, there\xe2\x80\x99s the notion of control that he kicks up, one that has implications both for the deal that Roger is engineering and for the show itself. \xe2\x80\x9cWhoever is in control is in charge,\xe2\x80\x9d says the besocked Buddha himself. But the issue of \xe2\x80\x9ccontrol\xe2\x80\x9d goes beyond counting the votes among the partners. It\xe2\x80\x99s about a control that exceeds mere mechanics.', 'Don relinquished authority when he lost control of the room at the end of Season 6, in that disastrous Hershey\xe2\x80\x99s pitch where he came clean about his past. He lost control because he told the truth about himself. He immolated the mystery that surrounded him (embodied by what Harry Hamlin\xe2\x80\x99s Jim Cutler calls a \xe2\x80\x9ccloud of mystery\xe2\x80\x9d) and destroyed the myth. Like the Great and Powerful Oz revealed to us, people don\xe2\x80\x99t want to see what\xe2\x80\x99s behind the curtain. Jim says that he was \xe2\x80\x9cdeeply unimpressed\xe2\x80\x9d after seeing the true face of Don, \xe2\x80\x9ca bully and a drunk\xe2\x80\xa6 a football player in a suit.\xe2\x80\x9d (\xe2\x80\x9cThe most eloquent I ever heard you was when you were blubbering like a little girl about your impoverished childhood,\xe2\x80\x9d as Jim spits with venom at Don.)', 'But Don regains his influence when he reclaims control of the room: in selling Ted on Roger\xe2\x80\x99s plan. It\xe2\x80\x99s not about Don salvaging his mojo in front of Burger Chef \xe2\x80\x94 a task he rightfully bestows upon Peggy \xe2\x80\x94 but in playing the role of salesman with Ted in front of the partners. Don can sell nostalgia or fur coats; he can sell the future itself, as he does here. Roger might be the president in this new arrangement, but his reliance on Don, who is essential to the plan, cedes control back to the man from whom the partners removed all agency. Roger needs Don for the deal to work, and he needs Don to win over Ted\xe2\x80\xa6and Don once again crafts a narrative of a perfect future in order to win over his former rival.', '', 'Likewise, it\xe2\x80\x99s Peggy who is firmly in control of the room during the Burger Chef pitch. While it initially seems as though Don will be the one giving the presentation, an eleventh-hour switch means Peggy\xe2\x80\x99s placed into the position of power here, no longer relegated to being \xe2\x80\x9cthe voice of moms.\xe2\x80\x9d She is a leader in her own right, and she constructs her own personal narrative \xe2\x80\x94 both real and mythic \xe2\x80\x94 in order to win over the client. It\xe2\x80\x99s not the same words that Don would have used or issued in the same manner; instead, Peggy draws on her own experiences, her sadness, her loss, her interactions with surrogate son Julio (Jacob Guenther) in order to create a compelling pitch. It is, in many ways, her', ', echoing the Season 1 pitch that Don gives to Kodak. It\xe2\x80\x99s a moment of transformation, of conflating truth and fantasy, of taking control. It\xe2\x80\x99s a huge leap forward for Peggy. She is an astronaut, and the setup to her presentation \xe2\x80\x94 a deep, unending silence broken only by the sound of her own coughing \xe2\x80\x94 is clearly meant to mirror that of Aldrin and Armstrong.', 'Peggy and Don have a long and complicated history together and Season 7 of', 'forced the duo to work together in a way that felt awkward for them both. But this is a moment of profound growth for each of them and the pride that Don feels in his prot\xc3\xa9g\xc3\xa9 is quite apparent; their embrace by the stairs of SC&P when Peggy gets the news that they\xe2\x80\x99ve won the account is beautifully wrought: It is not that tremulous kiss on the hand that he gave her when she left the agency, designed to reinforce both her femininity and his male superiority. Instead, their embrace is both proud and honest, a hug between two equals. It is what seven seasons of struggle between the two have led up to, an acknowledgement that Peggy isn\xe2\x80\x99t beneath him but beside him.', 'And it\xe2\x80\x99s Peggy\xe2\x80\x99s pitch that connects to the song that Bert sings to Don in his final appearance. \xe2\x80\x9cThe best things in life are free\xe2\x80\x9d refers to that dinner table, that sense of connection that we\xe2\x80\x99re so ravenous for, those simple \xe2\x80\x9csupper\xe2\x80\x9d interactions. (These are at odds with the surprising greed embodied by Joan, who is still smarting from the loss of her IPO money.) The story that Peggy spins is about fantasy, of forging connections at a time when there is an endemic breakdown in familial relations. It\xe2\x80\x99s about looking at Polaris in the night sky, which is \xe2\x80\x9cbetter than TV.\xe2\x80\x9d It\xe2\x80\x99s holding onto those small moments of connection and intimacy, whether it\xe2\x80\x99s the family in Peggy\xe2\x80\x99s Burger Chef pitch, looking for an oasis amid the chaos of life, or a chaste and unexpected kiss between Sally and the family friend with the telescope (Elijah Nelson) as she attempts to undo her own cynicism and therefore not become her mother.', 'AMC', 'To struggle against resignation,', 'tells us, is what life is truly about \xe2\x80\x94 to find joy in the simple pleasures of life, to look up at the moon and see what is possible. Which is why the conversation between Don and Megan (Jessica Par\xc3\xa9) before he leaves for Indiana is so disheartening:', '\xe2\x80\x9cThey want me to move on.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cWell, maybe you should. Aren\xe2\x80\x99t you tired of fighting?\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cYes.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'It sharply echoes the sense of doom that Ted feels in California, but that struggle \xe2\x80\x94 that fight \xe2\x80\x94 is the nature of life itself. Don has always been a fighter, but in admitting defeat here, he\xe2\x80\x99s not just talking about the battle within the agency but also within his marriage to Megan. The moving on that he\xe2\x80\x99s discussing isn\xe2\x80\x99t just professional, but personal. The dissolution of their marriage wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a \xe2\x80\x9cconscious uncoupling,\xe2\x80\x9d but something more insidious and slow, worming its way through their union.', '', 'When Don could have moved across the country to be with Megan, he didn\xe2\x80\x99t, instead indulging in the worst kind of self-pity and wallowing in his empty apartment. But when faced with the prospect of starting over in California with his wife, he can\xe2\x80\x99t bring himself to do so. The fight has gone out of their marriage. This is one leave from which he will not be returning. There\xe2\x80\x99s the sense that this has run its course and reached its natural conclusion. Even as he promises to take care of her, it\xe2\x80\x99s the words casually uttered by his ex-wife, Betty Francis (January Jones), earlier in the episode that take root here; Megan, like Betty, has already begun to think of Don as a \xe2\x80\x9cbad boyfriend\xe2\x80\x9d from another time.', 'There is a lot of truth there, even as Don and Megan have sidestepped their own issues all season, reduced to being tourists in one another\xe2\x80\x99s lives. But even if Don won\xe2\x80\x99t fight for her or fight to keep their marriage intact, he realizes that Roger\xe2\x80\x99s plan will keep him at the agency he built and will also keep the employees in their jobs, potentially sacrificing his own freedom (if only for five years) for the greater good. \xe2\x80\x9cA leader is loyal to his team,\xe2\x80\x9d says Bert. \xe2\x80\x9cDon doesn\xe2\x80\x99t understand that.\xe2\x80\x9d But by the end of', '\xe2\x80\x99s midseason finale, Don finally does come to that conclusion, as does Roger.', 'Perhaps it\xe2\x80\x99s the sight of a man walking on the moon \xe2\x80\x94 or the death of \xe2\x80\x9cgiant\xe2\x80\x9d Bert Cooper \xe2\x80\x94 that snaps both men out of their respective reveries, but Don and Roger both prove that they might just have the right stuff to steer the agency headlong into the future. They are not the faded men clinging to hope for a better day but unwilling to act (\xe2\x80\x9cSo let\xe2\x80\x99s have another cup of coffee / And let\xe2\x80\x99s have another piece of pie,\xe2\x80\x9d Roger quotes to Bert), but are instead explorers taking that first step into the darkness. After all, the telescope that appears throughout \xe2\x80\x9cWaterloo\xe2\x80\x9d (Bobby\xe2\x80\x99s initially still in its box, Megan\xe2\x80\x99s on plain view on her balcony, and elsewhere) points toward the stars, toward the future, toward the unknown, toward the bright and burning possibilities of what comes next.', 'AMC / via', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'The Midseason Finale Of \xe2\x80\x9cMad Men\xe2\x80\x9d Is One Giant Leap Forward', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 10 Burning Questions About "X-Men: Days Of Future Past,"åÊAnswered
Description: ['Producer-screenwriter Simon Kinberg explains why Wolverine was sent back and not Kitty Pryde; how Prof. X came back to life; and what this all means for the future of the X-Men.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: MAJOR SPOILERS!', '', 'Warning: The following post contains MAJOR SPOILERS for', '(as well as a few other', 'movies).', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Kevin Winter / Getty Images', 'If you ask an', 'comics fan about his or her favorite storylines from the series, you are most likely to hear one of two titles (or both):', ', and the issues called \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past.\xe2\x80\x9d Writer-producer Simon Kinberg has been at the center of adapting both of those respective runs into feature films, as co-writer of 2006\xe2\x80\x99s', '(directed by Brett Ratner), and as the producer and the sole credited writer on', ', which opened this weekend.', 'As part of its larger story about a \xe2\x80\x9ccure\xe2\x80\x9d for mutations,', 'incorporated', ', which saw Jean Grey (Famke Janssen) transform into the rage-filled, destructively powerful Phoenix. Over the course of the film, Rebecca Romijn\xe2\x80\x99s Mystique and Ian McKellan\xe2\x80\x99s Magneto lost their powers, and James Marsden\xe2\x80\x99s Cyclops and Patrick Stewart\xe2\x80\x99s Professor X were killed off \xe2\x80\x94 obliterated, really. Fans were not happy with the film, and it eventually earned a reputation as one of the most disappointing comic book adaptations of the last 15 years.', 'Kinberg, it appears, would agree. \xe2\x80\x9cThere are things I regret about', ',\xe2\x80\x9d he told BuzzFeed. In fact, the screenwriter saw', '\xe2\x80\x94 in which the consciousness of Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) is sent back to 1973 to prevent the horrific events of the future \xe2\x80\x94 as an explicit chance to right the wrongs of that earlier film. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s no question from me that both for the characters and for the writer,', 'was a chance to do things differently.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But making the \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d arc \xe2\x80\x94 which is really just a two-issue stand-alone narrative \xe2\x80\x94 function as a feature film within the established parameters of the previous six', 'movies and spin-offs still led Kinberg to make some noticeable changes and pointed creative decisions. Below, he explained to BuzzFeed why and how he brought \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d to the screen.', '1. Why did Kinberg, Singer, and the rest of the filmmaking team choose to adapt \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d?', '', 'At first, they didn\xe2\x80\x99t. Initially, Kinberg and', 'director Matthew Vaughn were looking to make a straight follow-up movie with the prequel film\xe2\x80\x99s cast. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd then someone at the studio suggested bringing in Ian and Patrick to book-end the movie,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg, \xe2\x80\x9cnot having anything to do with the \xe2\x80\x98Days of Future Past\xe2\x80\x99 storyline, but just to bring them into the film. And that\xe2\x80\x99s when we were like,', '.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d', 'After Vaughn dropped out, Singer, who had produced', ', stepped in to direct, and he and Kinberg began the tricky work of integrating the sprawling film series into the established \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d comic book storyline. \xe2\x80\x9cThe challenge obviously is, when you\xe2\x80\x99re adapting from a different medium, characters are slightly different from the way they were in the books,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to make adjustments.\xe2\x80\x9d', '2. One of the biggest adjustments is that in the comics, Kitty Pryde goes back in time. But in the film, Wolverine gets that job. Why?', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', '20th Century Fox', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt didn\xe2\x80\x99t come from a place of wanting to make Wolverine front and center, because we could have done that without sending him back in time,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg, who added that the film could have simply used the 1973 era Wolverine within the plot. Instead, Kinberg wanted to remain true to the \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d narrative, in which it\xe2\x80\x99s someone\xe2\x80\x99s future consciousness that is sent back in time into their past body. One problem: The Kitty Pryde of the movies wasn\xe2\x80\x99t even born in 1973. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce we made the decision that we\xe2\x80\x99re gonna send someone\xe2\x80\x99s consciousness back in time, given that we cast Ellen Page \xe2\x80\x94 and we loved Ellen Page as Kitty \xe2\x80\x94 we couldn\xe2\x80\x99t send her back to the days of Michael Fassbender and McAvoy and Jen Lawrence; she\xe2\x80\x99d be, like, negative 20 years old,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe couldn\xe2\x80\x99t actually have her consciousness wake up in her body, because it would be a sperm cell.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And that\xe2\x80\x99s where the plot of', 'had to immediately diverge from the comic. With Kitty Pryde out of the running as the one being sent back in time (and instead becoming the sender), Kinberg turned his attention to other options. \xe2\x80\x9cWe talked about different versions: We talked about Bishop getting sent back \xe2\x80\x94 which you see some remnants of in the opening of the film \xe2\x80\x94 we talked about Cable,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd then very quickly, we got to Wolverine, because of the fact that the same actor plays him in the past and the future.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Because Jackman\xe2\x80\x99s Wolverine has a mutant healing factor and longevity, he quickly became the frontrunner. \xe2\x80\x9cHe seemed the prime candidate to have consciousness in the same actor\xe2\x80\x99s body without a ton of makeup or visual effects because he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t age,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce we started down that path \xe2\x80\x94 and this was separate from the comics \xe2\x80\x94 for me, it was the most interesting, emotionally, from a character\xe2\x80\x99s standpoint, because of his relationship to the older Xavier.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'He continued, \xe2\x80\x9cFrom the beginning of working on', 'the movie, Matthew [Vaughn] and I were really interested in this film being more centered on young Charles. In a way,', 'was the origin of Magneto, and this would be the origin of Professor X, and we just thought, because of the way we left [Xavier] at the end of', ', having lost his legs and lost Erik and lost his sister [in] Raven, that that would be an interesting character to pick up years later, and see what happened to him and then see how he gets from this hopeless place to \xe2\x80\x94 or at least a step closer to \xe2\x80\x94 the hope and beneficence of [the] Patrick Stewart [version].\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The payoff, Kinberg said, is one that is uniquely suited to a film about the theoretical possibility of time travel, allowing for a space time loop that advances the characters themselves. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce we talked about bringing Wolverine back in time, I knew what was going to be intriguing about that was that the character, Wolverine, who had been essentially saved and mentored by Professor Xavier, was going to use those same lessons to save and mentor the young Xavier. The irony of that felt really rich to me, and I\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen that dynamic in a time travel movie before.\xe2\x80\x9d', '3. Is that why Kitty Pryde was given the power of sending a consciousness back through time, which she didn\xe2\x80\x99t have before?', '', 'shows Kitty \xe2\x80\x94 who has the power of intangibility, allowing her to phase through solid objects \xe2\x80\x94 suddenly manifesting the ability to project a person\xe2\x80\x99s consciousness back through time. For Kinberg, the answer to the quandary of how to get Wolverine\xe2\x80\x99s consciousness to 1973 lay in Grant Morrison\xe2\x80\x99s seminal run on', ', in which several mutants suddenly gained secondary mutations. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s sort of secondary powers that a lot of mutants have, so that gave us a little bit of a feeling of license to expand a character\xe2\x80\x99s powers,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cGiven that we saw her phasing with other characters before, we felt like there was a hopefully natural leap that we would make, that in the same way that we\xe2\x80\x99d seen her phase people through space, she could phase someone through time.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Kinberg was clear that he wanted to honor the original \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d storyline in', 'and have Kitty connected to the consciousness shift somehow, which is why she ended up as the sender. \xe2\x80\x9cIn terms of the physics of it, Bryan Singer is obsessed with the logic and the physics of these things, that, you know, defy the laws of physics. So, we did talk to people a lot, ranging from professors of theoretical physics to \xe2\x80\xa6 James Cameron,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cWe talked to a lot of people about time travel, about different theories of time travel, about different theories of astral-projection, and that\xe2\x80\x99s, I guess, how and why we felt like we could take the leap with the power.\xe2\x80\x9d', '4. The comic version of \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d has a strong Holocaust allegory that, save the opening shots, is largely absent from the film. Was that deliberate?', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cWell, we do start the movie with a concentration camp in the middle of Manhattan,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg about the film\xe2\x80\x99s opening sequence, which depicts a dystopian New York City under the thumb of the Sentinels. \xe2\x80\x9cThat first scene, the first image of the movie, is the camp in Central Park, which was important to us, and I hope sets the tone that that is the world of the future if they don\xe2\x80\x99t change it. So the truth is, we don\xe2\x80\x99t have that many scenes that take place in the future. We have the opening scene that sets it up, and then very quickly they\xe2\x80\x99re in the monastery and Logan\xe2\x80\x99s being sent back in time, and we\xe2\x80\x99re really just cutting to them in the monastery. We wanted to create a hideout for them, which is not totally dissimilar from some of the imagery in the original books, even though the location\xe2\x80\x99s different. It\xe2\x80\x99s a little bit of the subway tunnels, but we wanted to create that world. It was a location that felt exciting and visually interesting, and retained some of the desperation of locations in the books.\xe2\x80\x9d', '5. So, what other changes were made from the comic in order to honor what had happened in the previous films?', '20th Century Fox', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'In the comic, the target of Mystique\xe2\x80\x99s plot \xe2\x80\x94 which in turn allows for the Sentinels to take over North America \xe2\x80\x94 is Senator Kelly. In the film, the target is the Sentinels\xe2\x80\x99 creator, Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage), who becomes the locus point for the action. \xe2\x80\x9cBecause of what Bryan had done in', 'and', 'with Senator Kelly, it made it hard for Senator Kelly to be the target of the plot in the past,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg, who added that Kelly\xe2\x80\x99s age in 1973 would have made it difficult for him to have been a believable U.S. senator.', 'Additionally, the timeframe had to be quite narrow because of the actors\xe2\x80\x99 real ages. \xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\x9873 was about as far forward as we could push that time period given that', 'took place 10 years earlier, and it\xe2\x80\x99s only been a few years since we shot that film. So, as much as we can say mutants don\xe2\x80\x99t age quite the same as humans, anything past 10 years, you start to say,', '\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'The Senator Kelly-Bolivar Trask swap is one of the biggest changes at play here. But another significant departure from the comic is the fact that Mystique \xe2\x80\x94 the straight-up villain within the comic version of the story \xe2\x80\x94 is amped up significantly in the film. The stakes are upped for her character as well, due to her dynamics with Xavier and Magneto, respectively her childhood friend (as Raven) and the man who appealed to her more villainous tendencies (as Mystique). \xe2\x80\x9cThe characters as they evolved in the movies \xe2\x80\x94 the original movies as our \xe2\x80\x98future\xe2\x80\x99 and', 'as our \xe2\x80\x98past\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x94 they\xe2\x80\x99re slightly different,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cThere [are] details and nuances of character that are slightly different, and so, as much as a lot of the impulse of our movie was to correct some of the things that we\xe2\x80\x99ve gotten wrong in the previous films, people also feel very connected to those characters now. The dynamic between Charles and Raven may be slightly different than the dynamic between Raven and Charles in the comic, but those are choices that were made and honored.\xe2\x80\x9d', '6. And making JFK a mutant \xe2\x80\x94 what was that all about?', '', 'For fun! To explain why Magneto had not been up to many shenanigans after the end of', ', Kinberg placed him in prison for the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. \xe2\x80\x9cPersonally, I just really like the idea of explaining', 'with a character that can move metal,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg with a chuckle. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd then, as that subplot fleshed out, it seemed more interesting that in fact Erik hadn\xe2\x80\x99t killed JFK, but had been trying to stop it. And that was the explanation for a bullet that curves. And from there, the question was,', 'And then it just seemed interesting if the answer was,', 'Given the mystery of his life and the power of that family and the mysterious deaths in that family, it just, it didn\xe2\x80\x99t seem totally outrageous that in a world of mutants, he may have been one.\xe2\x80\x9d', '7. So, uh, how did Magneto get his powers back? And how did Prof. X get his', 'back?', '20th Century Fox / Via', '20th Century Fox / Via', 'One of the biggest complicating factors to making', 'was somehow bringing Magneto back to fighting strength, and Prof. X back to life. Kinberg was at pains to make clear that he and Singer knew this was not a simple problem to solve. \xe2\x80\x9cWe talked about that a lot,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. In both cases, the very end of', 'did provide at least a storytelling starting point for Kinberg and Singer, especially with regard to Magneto.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere is a scene before the credits where Magneto\xe2\x80\x99s playing chess, and you see that he can just make the chess piece move, so there\xe2\x80\x99s a hint that he\xe2\x80\x99s starting to regain his powers,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cThe leap from there was that cure from', 'didn\xe2\x80\x99t work exactly the way they thought it would, and so we just leaped forward however many years, and he\xe2\x80\x99s got his powers back.\xe2\x80\x9d Simple enough.', 'Prof. X, however, was a much trickier puzzle.', 'hinted that Prof. X\xe2\x80\x99s consciousness had been transplanted into another man\xe2\x80\x99s comatose body, but that still didn\xe2\x80\x99t resolve how that body came to look exactly like Patrick Stewart\xe2\x80\x99s by the time the character appeared in the end-credits teaser for 2013\xe2\x80\x99s', '. \xe2\x80\x9cWe tried at some point in', 'having some dialogue about how he was brought back together,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was using other mutant powers to reconstitute him. [But] we just didn\xe2\x80\x99t end up putting it in the movie that had enough explanations and exposition already in it.\xe2\x80\x9d In other words, they just wanted Prof. X back, damnit.', '8. Was this part of hitting a big reset button on the X-Men universe?', '20th Century Fox', '20th Century Fox', '20th Century Fox', '\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s no question for me that, as the co-writer of', ', as the writer of [', '], there are things I regret about', 'that I felt this movie could correct,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a unique and weird opportunity to be able to go back and revise, in a way, decisions you made a decade ago. And actually, weirdly, that was something I tapped into a bit in terms of the actual story and emotion of the overall', ', because obviously, these guys are going back in time to tell their younger selves not to make mistakes they know they\xe2\x80\x99re going to make. So if anything, it\xe2\x80\x99s like I went back in time and had that chance \xe2\x80\x94 if you could do it over again, knowing then what you do now, would you? And I would \xe2\x80\x94 I would do things differently. I mean, I would do things differently on every movie I\xe2\x80\x99ve worked on, but certainly there are specific things. There were choices made at the time, or forced at the time, that I wish we had done differently, and this movie allowed us to do that.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Kinberg is quick to add that there', 'parts of', 'that he \xe2\x80\x9creally likes,\xe2\x80\x9d and that at least one major death in the film was \xe2\x80\x9cout of our control\xe2\x80\x9d: Scott Summers (James Marsden). \xe2\x80\x9cIronically, James Marsden was only available to us for a very limited amount of time on', 'because he was off with Bryan [Singer] in', '. And so, the way he gets dispatched in', 'is in some ways because we only had him for a couple of days. But yeah, there\xe2\x80\x99s no question from me that both for the characters and for the writer,', 'was a chance to do things differently.\xe2\x80\x9d', '9. Will we ever get to see more of Rogue other than the', 'shot of her in', '?', '', 'Ah, Rogue. The character, played by Anna Paquin, was meant to have a decent-sized role in', ', with Magneto and Prof. X sent on a mission to rescue her from captivity. \xe2\x80\x9cThat was something that wasn\xe2\x80\x99t really inspired by the comics,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was something that was really my own fault. I wanted to have one final mission for Ian and Patrick, for old Magneto and Xavier. It was a pretty significant subplot, and when you watched the movie with the subplot in it, it [played] as it was written, which was as a detour. In a movie that has as many plot lines and characters to follow in two time periods as we have, we couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford any detours, so we cut it out of the movie.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'That led Singer to declare in December that Rogue wasn\xe2\x80\x99t in the film at all, but ultimately', 'in the rebooted future (barely justifying Paquin\xe2\x80\x99s rather jarring solo title card in the end credits). But fear not \xe2\x80\x94 the Rogue rescue sequence will almost certainly make its way to fans. \xe2\x80\x9cFrom what I understand, it will be seen on Blu-ray, DVD, or whatever technology exists in a year, and I think people will love it,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a really great sequence. It\xe2\x80\x99s as good as anything in the movie, it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t fit into the movie.\xe2\x80\x9d', '10. Where was the iconic wanted poster from the cover of the first issue of \xe2\x80\x9cDays of Future Past\xe2\x80\x9d?', 'Marvel', 'Marvel', 'Of all the changes and omissions between the comic books and the film, this is the one that stings the most for Kinberg. \xe2\x80\x9cThe thing we really tried to get into the movie and we never could, in a way that felt cool, was the wanted poster,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cThat\xe2\x80\x99s probably my biggest regret, that we never figured out a way to really properly get that in the film, because it\xe2\x80\x99s so iconic. I have such emotional associations with that image,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, sighing. \xe2\x80\x9cBut you can\xe2\x80\x99t get everything.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'You are signed in as', '.', '10 Burning Questions About "X-Men: Days Of Future Past," Answered', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "X-Men: Days Of Future Past" May Not Please Diehard Fans, But It‰Ûªs An Explosive Spectacle
Description: ['A lifelong X-Men comics fan and a comic book dilettante debate director Bryan Singer\xe2\x80\x99s latest film, which finds the mutants traveling through time to prevent their extinction (and the internal logic that comes with that).']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'WARNING: Minor spoilers ahead!', '', '', 'We begin our conversation with something of a confession, Jace: I have never counted myself as much of a reader of the X-Men comics books. Nonetheless, I was well aware when walking into', 'with you that I was about to watch an adaptation of perhaps the second most coveted storyline in comic franchise\xe2\x80\x99s history. Second, of course, to the Dark Phoenix storyline. And given how furious my X-Men comics fan friends were about how 2006\xe2\x80\x99s', 'treated the Dark Phoenix story \xe2\x80\x94 and, frankly, how bad that movie was in general \xe2\x80\x94 I was prepared for this movie to be similarly disappointing, for me, and for you, a major X-Men comics fan.', 'But I was not disappointed! I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t close to being overwhelmed, either, but I did enjoy the movie on its own terms as a piece of well-crafted superhero cinema. Did you?', 'I feel deeply conflicted about it. It is a bit of spectacle, yes, with some nice special effects, but it didn\xe2\x80\x99t coalesce into something powerful or moving for me, which is somewhat depressing given the source material.', 'is definitely up there with the Dark Phoenix Saga and', 'as some of the most significant and powerful stories in the X-Men canon. But this felt, ultimately, somewhat toothless.', '', 'Strong words! I know that the', 'comic is often enormously grim \xe2\x80\x94 and the film certainly starts out that way, with shots lingering on piles of dessicated and decaying corpses amid a concentration camp in New York\xe2\x80\x99s Central Park. And there are some shocking deaths in the first reel \xe2\x80\x94 which are, no real spoiler here, quickly done away with thanks to some of Kitty Pryde\xe2\x80\x99s time-travel mojo. But the film quickly becomes something of a zippy and rousing time-travel adventure, with James McAvoy\xe2\x80\x99s Charles Xavier doing all of the angsty heavy lifting with a rather on-the-nose heroin addiction metaphor.', 'Yes, Xavier\xe2\x80\x99s addiction metaphor was way too obviously structured, and provided a way too overt crucible for the man who is meant to be the moral compass of the franchise. I want to address the strangeness of Kitty\xe2\x80\x99s new power set in a bit. But what the film accomplishes is diminishing the raw power of the original plot, which is rooted in a Holocaust analogy. The stakes are high in both the comic and the film, and we see that single shot of a concentration camp in the opening sequence, but the metaphor is quickly dissipated. In the comic, we\xe2\x80\x99re forced to experience the reality of the survivors in the concentration camp in the future, survivors who are branded with clothes that immediately identify them as mutants, much like the yellow star in Nazi Germany. They\xe2\x80\x99re fighting for their very survival and against extinction.', 'The film, however, isolates this largely by making the Sentinels the symbolic force they\xe2\x80\x99re battling: unseen, uncaring automatons with whom they engage in some pyrotechnic-heavy skirmishes before being whisked away\xe2\x80\xa6 or undone altogether, thanks to Kitty\xe2\x80\x99s abilities. (In the comics, they\xe2\x80\x99re seeking to prevent a nuclear disaster unleashed by Europe upon the U.S. and battling Sentinels who have taken over North America. Trask here is little more than a figurehead.) Other than that first shot, the concentration camps aren\xe2\x80\x99t seen or mentioned. The action is far removed from these places of death, set in Moscow or a cliffside village in China. As a result, there\xe2\x80\x99s less of an urgency and a sense that humanity\xe2\x80\x99s errors repeat themselves.', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Once Wolverine is zapped back to 1973, it becomes pretty clear that the stuff in the future is far less central to the film than the stuff in the past. Which I\xe2\x80\x99m actually totally fine with \xe2\x80\x94 outside of Ian McKellan and Patrick Stewart, I find the prequel cast to be far more engaging, especially Jennifer Lawrence\xe2\x80\x99s Raven/Mystique. I also appreciated that no one even hints at the fact that Peter Dinklage\xe2\x80\x99s Bolivar Trask is a dwarf \xe2\x80\x94 the contrast is self-evident, and Dinklage\xe2\x80\x99s performance is otherwise agreeably understated. My favorite section may be all the stuff with Quicksilver (Evan Peters); he\xe2\x80\x99s just great fun, an increasingly rare commodity in superhero movies that aren\xe2\x80\x99t made by Marvel Studios.', 'Well, for a film about people with visible and invisible differences, I really felt like it was an odd choice that no one singles out Dinklage\xe2\x80\x99s Trask for his own difference. (Intentional perhaps, but it struck a strange chord.) But I do agree that Lawrence is incredible here as Mystique, whose sense of morality has been perhaps inexorably compromised. Peters\xe2\x80\x99 Quicksilver is a lot of fun and adds some dynamic visuals, but then he disappeared without a trace! (OK, fine. He appears in one quick cut later in the film, but still.)', 'It did seem odd that someone so useful is left at home for the rest of the film, but he is just a teenage boy, and Xavier is, at his core, most interested in the welfare of children. But I want to get at the fundamental theme of this movie \xe2\x80\x94 which, it seems, deviates from the theme of the', 'comics: namely, the importance of persecuted minorities to live openly, and attempt to live in harmony, with those who would oppress them.', '20th Century Fox / Via', '20th Century Fox / Via', 'That\xe2\x80\x99s always been a core principle of the X-Men and an important one: For a group of people that are feared and hated by those representing baseline \xe2\x80\x9cnormalcy,\xe2\x80\x9d what does it mean to live in the open? There\xe2\x80\x99s a sequence in the film that I found especially telling \xe2\x80\x94 and considering the issues swirling around director Bryan Singer right now, really prescient and intriguing \xe2\x80\x94 in which Mystique and Nicholas Hoult\xe2\x80\x99s Beast are photographed by the media in their true forms. The notion of having one\xe2\x80\x99s true face in front of the cameras, of being revealed for what you are, of being outed, seems really relevant right now.', 'You know, I agree and disagree with that. At the risk of getting too far off on a historical tangent, I kept thinking throughout the movie about how the 1970s was a period of growing visibility and political power for LGBT people, especially in major urban centers \xe2\x80\x94 and how AIDS is often believed to have set back the movement by a decade at least. Singer has made no secret of how he sees these films as an explicit allegory to LGBT rights \xe2\x80\x94 there\xe2\x80\x99s that great scene in', 'where Iceman\xe2\x80\x99s mom asks him if he\xe2\x80\x99s ever tried', 'being a mutant. But with LGBT rights making such amazing strides in the last few years, a movie largely stuck in the past that is about attempting to avoid a horrific future \xe2\x80\x94 a horrific future we don\xe2\x80\x99t seem to be living now, at least from an LGBT perspective \xe2\x80\x94 feels a bit off to me? Certainly, the Holocaust metaphor in', 'had much more relevance in the 1980s at the height of the AIDS crisis. Or maybe I\xe2\x80\x99m just placing too much cultural weight on a comic book movie.', '20th Century Fox', '20th Century Fox', 'Well, there', 'actually a metaphor for the AIDS crisis within the comics \xe2\x80\x94 the Legacy Virus, which was killing mutants rapidly before spreading to the general population. And the X-Men have certainly offered a stand-in for any persecuted minority group; they represent the spirit of inclusiveness \xe2\x80\x94 creating your own family, rather than inheriting one, etc. This storyline ran at the height of 1980s Reagan-Thatcherism, the Cold War, and the Star Wars weapon systems, amid a vastly materialistic society in which normalcy seemed to be the ultimate prize to be attained.', 'In the comic, Kitty Pryde is a 13-year-old Jewish teenager who finds her place in the world by joining a group of misfits with abilities that often cause terror in \xe2\x80\x9cnorms.\xe2\x80\x9d That her older, wiser, hardened persona is sent back in time into the body of her naive and innocent 13-year-old self within Chris Claremont\xe2\x80\x99s original plot is significant: There\xe2\x80\x99s something to be said for the horrors of war and deprivation and what they do to a person. (We see how those horrors play out within the future versions of Wolverine, Storm, Colossus, Magneto, and others.) The fact that they\xe2\x80\x99re fighting against the Mutant Registration Act is also important; their struggles are that of civil rights in a world that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t understand them or their self-identification. Additionally, it\xe2\x80\x99s absolutely intentional that Kitty is Jewish in a story that functions as a metaphor for the Holocaust, but it\xe2\x80\x99s Wolverine who gets sent back in the film, largely because Hugh Jackman has to be the star of this film.', 'And if Singer\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cgay male gaze\xe2\x80\x9d ever announces itself in this film, it\xe2\x80\x99s with the first scene of Wolverine arriving in 1973. (Spoiler alert: Logan be nekkid.) But you\xe2\x80\x99ve teased me with a discussion of Kitty Pryde and her powers \xe2\x80\x94 I also know she is a figure of deep affection for many fans, so do you think she was used well in the film? Certainly it\xe2\x80\x99s nice to see Ellen Page on screen again!', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'I love Ellen Page and I have a particular affection for Kitty Pryde as well. Was she used effectively here? That\xe2\x80\x99s debatable. She functions largely as a prop within the story, a convenient power set that is not explained at all within the larger context of the time-travel plot. Her power is intangibility: We\xe2\x80\x99re given a great visual for this as she and Bishop (Omar Sy) speed through walls in order to enter a vault. But how exactly does Kitty send people\xe2\x80\x99s consciousnesses back through time? By phasing through time and space? It\xe2\x80\x99s not explained at all and it\xe2\x80\x99s strange. It\xe2\x80\x99s what immediately took me out of the plot because it just didn\xe2\x80\x99t make any sense to me at all.', 'I have always been amused by comic book fans who say that someone\xe2\x80\x99s powers don\xe2\x80\x99t make sense, because this is a world in which a man can levitate an entire stadium and drop it over the White House.', 'Ha. Yes, but there needs to be an internal logic at work. If you can levitate an entire stadium, can you suddenly also shape-shift?', 'We\xe2\x80\x99re going to get nowhere debating \xe2\x80\x9cinternal logic\xe2\x80\x9d in regard to a world in which characters are largely given powers that are useful in battle but have no precise biological imperative. (Don\xe2\x80\x99t take the bait, Jace!) But I think your point speaks to a larger tension within feature film adaptations of comic books, namely that filmmakers feel like they have far more leeway with changing plots, characters, and locations than the filmmakers of, say, the Harry Potter movies, or the Hunger Games films. The internal continuity within these X-Men movies is already a complete mess \xe2\x80\x94 like, is anyone going to explain how Magneto got his powers back after the end of', ', or how Prof. X came back to life? But I gather that the films have made mincemeat of so many beloved elements of the comics that many fans have thrown up their hands and basically expect to be disappointed. Fair?', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Alan Markfield / 20th Century Fox', 'Very fair, really. And I accept that there is a continuity here that isn\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily dependent upon decades of continuity from the comics; there are bound to be decisions that leave die-hard fans scratching their heads (Alex Summers, the brother of Scott Summers, is alive in the \xe2\x80\x9960s?) or are just strange decisions to make change for the sake of making change. These films have gotten incredibly convoluted because of spinoffs, reboots, and sequels. Screenwriter Simon Kinberg, who wrote', ', also wrote', '. Yet, he seems determined to undo a lot of the action of that film. (SPOILER alert!) And', 'appears (on the surface anyway) to tie off the action and characters from those first three films. Will Iceman, Kitty, etc. appear in', '? It\xe2\x80\x99s far more certain that McAvoy and Fassbender will return in the next film, despite the fact that the timeline seems impossibly contorted as a result. (End SPOILER alert!)', 'Which I don\xe2\x80\x99t mind! Again, my favorite moments in the', 'movies have been when the characters\xe2\x80\x99 powers are used in a way that surprises and delights me \xe2\x80\x94 I remember fist-pumping when Magneto draws the iron out of the blood of his prison guard in', ', which is a really disturbing thing to fist-pump over when you think about it, so I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to think about it. When I\xe2\x80\x99m asked to believe in a world with so many fantastical people with so many (Jace bait alert) seemingly arbitrary powers, concerns about internal plot logic take a back seat to concerns about having a good time. I\xe2\x80\x99ve just never expected the X-Men movies to be as good \xe2\x80\x94 as', '\xe2\x80\x94 as', ',', ', or the very first', 'movie.', 'But shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t we hold them to the same standard?', '', 'I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure. Marvel Studios has made clear that superhero movies aren\xe2\x80\x99t as much a rigid genre as they are another way to tell stories \xe2\x80\x94 be they paranoid political thrillers (like the fantastic', ') or quasi-medieval fantasy adventures (like the not-so-fantastic', '). And I\xe2\x80\x99m more interested in measuring these films against other films', 'them, which aren\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily superhero films. In', '\xe2\x80\x99s case, I\xe2\x80\x99d compare it both to other X-Men movies \xe2\x80\x94 and I think it\xe2\x80\x99s one of the stronger of the lot \xe2\x80\x94 and time-travel movies \xe2\x80\x94 where I think it could have had a lot more fun with the weirdness of moving through time. But that\xe2\x80\x99s me, a comic book dilettante. What\xe2\x80\x99s your final verdict on this film?', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s a fun diversion, one that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily add up to anything revolutionary or earth-shattering. The lack of logic \xe2\x80\x94 about Kitty\xe2\x80\x99s powers and how time travel could theoretically work (that future timeline would still exist, albeit as an alternate timeline!) \xe2\x80\x94 disappoint. Ultimately, I liked the film, which might be damning with faint praise somewhat. Considering how much Singer is in the news right now, I had expectations that the film would perhaps divert attention away from his legal issues. But I kept thinking about Singer throughout. And that\xe2\x80\x99s perhaps not the best thing in a film about people with vast power exacting a power play upon those without.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"X-Men: Days Of Future Past" May Not Please Diehard Fans, But It\'s An Explosive Spectacle', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏBig Bang Theory‰Ûù Is Moving To Mondays For A While (Thanks To Football)
Description: ['Football shakes up the CBS schedule a bit as mainstays move around, but after that, it will be business as usual.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Football is shaking up the CBS schedule at the start of the 2014\xe2\x80\x932015 season. The Thursday night NFL acquisition will see', 'temporarily moving to Mondays at 8 p.m., in addition to some other changes.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s going to greatly enhance our lineup, but it\xe2\x80\x99s not going to define us,\xe2\x80\x9d said Kelly Kahl, the senior executive vice president of CBS primetime, of', 'during a press presentation where the schedule was revealed.', 'Thursdays will kick off with the NFL on Sept. 11 and then, on Oct. 30, it will be business as usual with', 'moving back to Thursdays at 8 p.m., followed by sophomore comedy', ', then', '(which shifts back to the 9 p.m. slot for its 12th and final season), new series', ', and hit drama', ', which dominates the Thursday 10 p.m. time slot.', 'Nina Tassler, the president of CBS entertainment, said after going into last season with the announcement that', 'was coming to an end, CBS decided to do the same with', '. \xe2\x80\x9cWe know that fans respond to that,\xe2\x80\x9d she noted. As for whether or not she\xe2\x80\x99d like to see Charlie Sheen\xe2\x80\x99s character rise from the dead for the final season, Tassler said slyly, \xe2\x80\x9cI would like to see whatever [creator] Chuck [Lorre] would like to do.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'CBS\xe2\x80\x99s comedy game is seeing some shifts at large. The 2014\xe2\x80\x932015 season marks the end of the network\xe2\x80\x99s longstanding two-hour Monday night comedy block with', '(which will transition to', 'post-football) and', 'only taking up an hour of the evening. Then, new drama', 'takes over at 9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat we love about having it at 9, it embraces a lot of the wit and humor that we have in our signature comedies,\xe2\x80\x9d Tassler noted of the newcomer, starring Katherine McPhee. \xe2\x80\x9cIt also has a lot of heart and action that our hit procedurals have as well. So we saw it as a great bridge.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Kahl noted, \xe2\x80\x9cThis year we have a really strong drama year. Last year, we had a really strong comedy year.\xe2\x80\x9d CBS canceled four of its comedies from the 2013\xe2\x80\x932014 season, renewing', 'and', '. \xe2\x80\x9cCertainly comedy is tough,\xe2\x80\x9d Tassler added. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not a science. There\xe2\x80\x99s no formula. It\xe2\x80\x99s about chemistry \xe2\x80\xa6 And we believe we do it better than anybody\xe2\x80\xa6 Anybody anywhere would give their arms and legs to have [', '] on their schedule.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Some other notable details:', '\xe2\x80\x94 CBS is all year round now, y\xe2\x80\x99all! \xe2\x80\x9cYou have to think about big auspices all year round,\xe2\x80\x9d Tassler said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are officially retiring the phrase \xe2\x80\x98midseason\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\xa6 We have fall, winter, spring, and summer.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x94', ', which will enter its 25th season later this year, moves to Fridays at 8 p.m. Its previous Sunday timeslot will see some changes as well.', ', which moves from Wednesdays, will air on Sundays at 10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x9cWe need a show that people love, a show that\xe2\x80\x99s still strong, a show that people will wait up for till 10:30 some weeks,\xe2\x80\x9d Kahl said, since the Sunday night lineup has been known to be delayed on CBS thanks to football.', '\xe2\x80\x94 The new Tea Leoni drama', 'will air at 8 p.m. on Sunday, followed by mainstay', '(\xe2\x80\x9cYou thought this season was big. Next season will be even bigger,\xe2\x80\x9d Tassler said), before', 'rounds out the night. CBS seems particularly proud of', ', with Tassler noting that star Tea Leoni \xe2\x80\x9chas been offered virtually every series over the course of the past 10 years.\xe2\x80\x9d She closed a deal on this show in two days.', '\xe2\x80\x94 When', 'ends its run (Tassler was certain not to divulge episode orders, noting \xe2\x80\x9cyou want to stay flexible, which we are; you want to stay nimble, which we are\xe2\x80\x9d), the latest spin-off', ', will take over that 10 p.m. Sunday slot. But that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean the end of', '. Tassler doesn\xe2\x80\x99t think the original is near its end just yet. \xe2\x80\x9cWe think the schedule could support both [', 'and', '] in the future,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.', '\xe2\x80\x94 Meanwhile,', ', which followed the original series on Tuesdays last season, is moving over to the 10 p.m. Monday slot. \xe2\x80\x9c10 p.m. [on Mondays] was not up to our standards and we have pretty high standards,\xe2\x80\x9d Kahl said of the move. (The time slot previously hosted', 'and then', ', both of which were canceled.) \xe2\x80\x9cWe thought it could absolutely stand on its own.\xe2\x80\x9d The latest member of the NCIS family,', 'will take', '\xe2\x80\x99 spot, followed by', ', which stays put after previously growing on Tuesdays at 10 p.m.', '\xe2\x80\x94 CBS\xe2\x80\x99s psychological thriller from Kevin Williamson', ', which Tassler called a \xe2\x80\x9cgreat companion piece to', ',\xe2\x80\x9d will take over', '\xe2\x80\x99s Wednesday night 10 p.m. time slot. Tassler said Williamson, who currently has shows on Fox and The CW (', 'and', ', respectively), studied CBS procedurals for his projects. \xe2\x80\x9cLeave it to Kevin to come up with a very scary, suspenseful show,\xe2\x80\x9d she added. \xe2\x80\x9cIt should scare the bejesus out of all of us.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x94 Tassler also revealed that', ', from executive producers Carter Bays and Craig Thomas. The project, which was to star indie star Greta Gerwig and feature the voice of Meg Ryan, will likely be shopped to other networks by studio 20th Century Fox Television. \xe2\x80\x9cThere were elements of the pilot that didn\xe2\x80\x99t work out,\xe2\x80\x9d Tassler said. \xe2\x80\x9cThey certainly can [shop it], but we reached out, tried to do a redo\xe2\x80\xa6 It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t what they wanted to do.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x94 Matthew Perry\xe2\x80\x99s', ', an update of the classic Neal Simon play, and the latest drama from', '\xe2\x80\x99s Vince Gilligan', ', will debut', 'later in the season. Returning shows', 'and', 'are holding as well.', 'The full schedule is at the bottom of the story, and the new shows are now arranged in night-of-the-week order.', '3.', '', '(Mondays at 9 p.m.)', 'Katharine McPhee (', '), Elyes Gabel, Robert Patrick (', '), Eddie Kaye Thomas, Ari Stidham', '', 'Nick Santora (', '), who executive produces with Alex Kurtzman, Roberto Orci, Heather Kadin, Justin Lin, Scooter Braun, and Walter O\xe2\x80\x99Brien (on whose life the show is based)', '', 'The government tasks a man with the fourth-highest IQ in the world (Gabel) to lead a team of equally savvy geniuses to fend of a wide array of technologically-advanced attacks. Along the way he meets a waitress (McPhee), whose son displays the kinds of gifts that would make him a perfect addition \xe2\x80\x94 one day \xe2\x80\x94 to their team.', '', 'With', ', CBS is playing to two of their biggest strengths: team-based procedurals and the fish-out-of-water fun that comes from a lay person being surrounded by geniuses. The trailer, which is equal parts engaging and exciting, indicates that those are two great tastes that actually go together very well. \xe2\x80\x94', '5.', '', '(Tuesdays at 9 p.m.)', 'Scott Bakula (', '), Zoe McLellan (', '), CCH Pounder (', '), Lucas Black, Paige Turco', '', 'Gary Glasberg (', '), who will executive produce with Mark Harmon', '', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s pretty much like', ', but this spinoff will instead follow the personnel at the New Orleans office, who handle cases across the lower southeast of the United States. It will delve into the NOLA scene, which attracts many military officers on leave. So\xe2\x80\xa6 more cases, new scenery.', '', 'If the audible groan from the crowd at CBS\xe2\x80\x99s upfront presentation as soon as this show was mentioned is any indication, it seems people may be growing tired of the NCIS franchise. That said, if anyone can charm the pants off an audience, it\xe2\x80\x99s Scott Bakula. This trailer \xe2\x80\x94 culled from footage from the two-part backdoor pilot that aired on March 25 and April 1 \xe2\x80\x94 is only a very quick look at the new drama set in the town that\xe2\x80\x99s fast becoming a favorite on television (see', ',', '), so it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to say if it\xe2\x80\x99ll recapture the magic that Mark Harmon\xe2\x80\x99s original series casts. \xe2\x80\x94', '7.', '', '(Wednesdays at 10 p.m.)', 'Maggie Q (', '), Dylan McDermott (', '), Marian Klaveno, Victor Rasuk', '', 'Kevin Williamson (', ')', '', 'Set in the Threat Management Unit of the LAPD,', 'follows two officers (Q and McDermott) with very different approaches to crime solving, but similar reasons for accepting the job. One can only hope that these stalkers don\xe2\x80\x99t employ Edgar Allen Poe masks during their crimes. (Shudder.)', '', 'Tassler called this the scariest show that CBS has ever produced, and she is a woman of her word. From the malevolent mask that opens the clip to the shifting carpet conclusion, the edge of my seat was occupied throughout. It\xe2\x80\x99s also nice to see some flecks of humor peppering the trailer because not enough mirth often leads me to change the channel. \xe2\x80\x94', '9.', '', '(Thursdays at 9:30 p.m. after football)', 'Jack McGee (', '), Joey McIntyre (', '), Jimmy Dunn, Tyler Ritter, Laurie Metcalf (', '), Kelen Coleman', '', 'Brian Gallivan (', '), who executive produces with Will Gluck. Mike Sikowitz (', ') will serve as showrunner.', '', 'This multi-camera comedy centers around a loud, brash, and sports-crazed Irish-Catholic Boston family that lives together in a three-floor house\xe2\x80\xa6 and the one member of the clan who dares to move out.', '', 'The humor here seems to heavily weigh on the singular gay son in a traditional big Boston family and for the uber-traditional CBS, that\xe2\x80\x99s a bit of a risk. Let\xe2\x80\x99s just hope the laughs come from a respectable place. There is plenty of potential here, particularly with Laurie Metcalf as the McCarthy matriarch, and, as Tassler pointed out at the upfront presentation, this show makes for two (Joey McIntyre and Donnie Wahlberg) members of New Kids On The Block now on CBS. For this, we should all be grateful. \xe2\x80\x94', '11.', '', '(Sundays at 8 p.m.)', 'Tea Leoni (', '), Tim Daly (', '), Bebe Neuwirth, Geoffrey Arenda, Patina Miller, Erich Bergen, Katherine Herzer', '', 'Barbara Hall (', '), who executive produces with Morgan Freeman, Lori McCreary, and Tracy Mercer. David Semel directed the pilot.', '', 'Lean in: After taking time off to raise her family, Elizabeth McCord (Leoni) is hired as secretary of state where she immediately makes waves \xe2\x80\x94 and headlines \xe2\x80\x94 for her unusual approach to international diplomacy.', '', 'With a strong female protagonist in Leoni\xe2\x80\x99s Elizabeth Faulkner McGill, who is also a working mother,', 'is very clearly designed to appeal directly to', '\xe2\x80\x99s audience (also why CBS is pairing the two dramas on Sunday nights). I have some doubts, however, that those fans will take as passionately to this series after watching the decent, but uninspiring trailer. Once the groundwork is laid, I\xe2\x80\x99m hoping future episodes will dedicate more time to examining political crises through McGill\xe2\x80\x99s nonpartisan eyes, much in the way', 'has doled out incredibly topical social commentary through legal cases. \xe2\x80\x94', '13.', '', '(Sundays at 10 p.m.)', 'Patricia Arquette (', ')', '', 'Written and produced by', 'vets Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker, and Ann Donahue. Jerry Bruckheimer and Jonathan Littman are executive producing.', '', 'Special agent Avery Ryan (Arquette) works to solve crimes as the head of the Cyber Crime Division of the FBI. The concept for the spinoff was integrated into an episode of the original', 'that aired in April. And the series marks Arquette\xe2\x80\x99s post-', 'return to primetime.', '', 'No trailer available yet.', '14.', '', '(TBD)', 'Matthew Perry (', '), Thomas Lennon (', '), Lindsay Sloane, Sarah Baker (', '), Wendell Pierce (', ')', '', 'Perry wrote the pilot script, based on Neil Simon\xe2\x80\x99s classic Broadway play, and will executive produce with Joe Keenan (', '), Eric Tannenbaum, Kim Tannenbaum, Carl Beverly, and Sarah Timberman (', ').', '', 'Perry steps into the role of messy bachelor Oscar Madison, who must learn to get along with his comically mismatched roommate, persnickety Felix Unger (Lennon). Hilarity undoubtedly ensues.', '', 'No trailer available yet.', '15.', '', '(TBD)', 'Josh Duhamel. And that\xe2\x80\x99s all you need to know. (Amiright ladies?) But also: Dean Winters, Janet McTeer, Kal Penn, Edward Fordham Jr., and Aubrey Dollar.', '', 'Creator Vince Gilligan (', '), who executive produces with with Mark Johnson (', ') and showrunner David Shore (', ')', '', 'This new detective series, which has actually been in development for a decade, is set in Battle Creek, Michigan, and follows Detective Russ Agnew (Winters) and FBI agent Milton Chamberlain (Duhamel), who patrol the quasi-mean streets of the town. Bryan Singer is also attached to direct and executive produce. So\xe2\x80\xa6 yeah.', '', '(As soon as this trailer, which played at the upfront presentation, is released by CBS, we\xe2\x80\x99ll add it here!) As the beginning of this trailer points out, Josh Duhamel is dreamy and that\xe2\x80\x99s something CBS is banking on with this new show I\xe2\x80\x99m tempted to refer to as a dramedy.', 'hits a new note, not just for the network, but for creator Vince Gilligan, who is doing something very different from', 'here. Yes, the show has the traditional good cop-bad cop dynamic with Duhamel as the former and Dean Winters as the latter, but there was far more quirkiness and comedy in the trailer than one would have assumed based on the surface details. \xe2\x80\x94', 'MONDAY', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(while football airs),', '', '8:30-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', 'TUESDAY', '8- 9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', 'WEDNESDAY', '8-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '', 'THURSDAY', '8-11 p.m. EST, 5-8 p.m. PST \xe2\x80\x94', '(Sept. 11-Oct. 23)', '(As of Oct. 30)', '8-8:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '8:30-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '9-9:30 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '9:30-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '', 'FRIDAY', '8-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '9-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '', 'SATURDAY', '8-10 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '', '', 'SUNDAY', '7-8 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '8-9 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94', '(new)', '9-10 p.m \xe2\x80\x94', '', '10-11 p.m. \xe2\x80\x94 In the fall:', ', later in the season:', '(new)', 'correction', 'This post has been updated to change language originally taken from a press release.', '', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Big Bang Theory" Is Moving To Mondays For A While (Thanks To Football)', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: 16 New And Returning TV Shows Worth Watching ThisåÊSummer
Description: ['Lee Pace in an \xe2\x80\x9980s computer-programming drama, a Victorian horror mash-up, sex researchers, Jack Bauer,', ', and female prisoners?']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Check, check, check, check, check,', 'check.', '', '1.', '', '(Monday, May 5, at 8 p.m. on Fox)', 'Kiefer Sutherland\xe2\x80\x99s seemingly unkillable Jack Bauer is back as', 'returns this summer with', '. The action moves from Los Angeles to London in this 12-episode limited-series event that finds Jack racing against the clock to thwart a terrorist attack. Expect explosions, Jack yelling (though it takes a full two hours to see Jack growl \xe2\x80\x9cdamn it!\xe2\x80\x9d for the first time), whiplash-inducing plot twists, and some familiar faces, including Kim Raver and William Devane, as well as Mary Lynn Rajskub, whose Chloe seems to be emulating Lisbeth Salander here. Plus, Yvonne Strahovski (', ') joins the cast as a disgraced CIA agent; other additions include Gbenga Akinnagbe, Tate Donovan, and Benjamin Bratt. Your mileage will vary based on how much you enjoyed', 'the first time around; this newest iteration puts a British-accented spin on the formula, though Sutherland\xe2\x80\x99s Jack Bauer feels like a bit of a relic of a bygone era at this point.', '2.', '', '(Monday, May 5, at 10 p.m. on FX)', 'After a seemingly interminable hiatus between seasons (seriously, it was last on in September 2012, a full 19 months ago), Louis C.K.\xe2\x80\x99s mordantly charming comedy', 'returns for a sterling fourth season that finds the hapless comedian struggling with back pain, Jerry Seinfeld\xe2\x80\x99s wrath, and an encounter in the Hamptons with a model (Yvonne Strahovski again!) that seems to recall the (wrongly) maligned', 'episode where Hannah stumbles into the arms of Patrick Wilson\xe2\x80\x99s Joshua. In true', 'fashion, however, things go from awkwardly wonderful to strange to absurdly terrifying rather quickly. What follows is powerfully incisive comedy at its most wicked and witty, as', '\xe2\x80\x99s fourth season proves more than worth the wait.', '3.', '', '(Sunday, May 11, at 10 p.m. on Showtime)', 'I am not a horror fan, so the fact that I quickly found myself obsessed with John Logan\xe2\x80\x99s', ', a period mash-up of such familiar characters as Dr. Victor Frankenstein, Mina Murray, and Dorian Grey, speaks volumes about its savage spell. Featuring Josh Hartnett, Eva Green, Billie Piper, and Timothy Dalton,', 'is a gory Victorian portmanteau, sliding between the sinister and the sizzling as it recasts characters from our collective nightmares. Addictive and nightmare-inducing, in the best possible way.', '4.', '', '(Sunday, June 1, at 10 p.m. on AMC)', 'Tina Rowden / AMC', 'The 1980s. Computer programmers. Lee Pace. (Need I say more?) Named for a line of computer code (with a dramatic effect),', 'is a stellar period drama set against the backdrop of IBM\xe2\x80\x99s meteoric rise in the personal computing business. Pace plays a former IBM executive harboring a secret who forces his new employers \xe2\x80\x94 Cardiff Electric \xe2\x80\x94 into a race against Big Blue when he attempts to reverse-engineer an IBM computer with the help of down-on-his luck engineer Gordon Clark (Scoot McNairy). Look for Mackenzie Davis\xe2\x80\x99 explosive tousle-haired programmer Cameron Howe to steal nearly every scene she appears in\xe2\x80\xa6and for one of the year\xe2\x80\x99s best opening sequences, set to a pulsing synth track. The result is a thrilling drama that crackles with electricity as it depicts desperate dreamers and schemers who see the future as something malleable, and computers as \xe2\x80\x9cthe thing that gets us to the thing.\xe2\x80\x9d Sweet dreams are most definitely made of this.', '5.', '', '(Full season available Friday, June 6, on Netflix)', 'Just how Piper Chapman (Taylor Schilling) manages to get out of that season-ending predicament with Tiffany \xe2\x80\x9cPennsatucky\xe2\x80\x9d Doggett (Taryn Manning) \xe2\x80\x94 and what happened to Pennsatucky (my money\xe2\x80\x99s on new teeth) \xe2\x80\x94 will finally be revealed when Jenji Kohan\xe2\x80\x99s superb prison drama', 'returns for its second season. (', ': Piper is in', '.) And, given that the entire second season of', 'will be made available at the same time (look for many, many people to call in sick to work on release day), we\xe2\x80\x99ll soon have many new reasons to be stressed for Piper and the gang at Litchfield.', '6.', '', '(Thursday, June 19, at 9 p.m. on SundanceTV)', 'Season 2 of Sundance\xe2\x80\x99s extraordinary drama', '\xe2\x80\x94 which I named the', '\xe2\x80\x94 finds newly released death-row inmate Daniel Holden (Aden Young) moving past his initial unease in an environment he no longer understands. Daniel\xe2\x80\x99s trying to take control of his own destiny in a \xe2\x80\x9cdangerous and unpredictable world\xe2\x80\x9d that is not too happy to see him wandering about among the law-abiding citizens of this small town. His presence has not only opened old wounds but creates a butterfly effect on those around him, his family members (including Abigail Spencer\xe2\x80\x99s charmingly combative Amantha) and the potential perpetrators of the crime that landed him on death row in the first place. Ray McKinnon\xe2\x80\x99s spellbinding drama, which will have 10 episodes for its second season, pokes at the dark underbelly of the American dream, presenting a sobering picture of crime and punishment, damnation and salvation, beauty and horror.', '7.', '', '(Sunday, June 29, at 8 p.m. on PBS)', 'Sally Wainwright\xe2\x80\x99s winning comedy', 'returns for its second season as reunited childhood sweethearts Alan (Derek Jacobi) and Celia (Anne Reid) begin to plan their new life together amid an unexpected second chance at love. But secrets from the past threaten their present-day joy. As Alan recovers from his heart attack at the end of Season 1 and Gillian (Nicola Walker) and John (Tony Gardner) dance around their one-night stand, long-buried secrets from the past threaten Alan and Celia\xe2\x80\x99s happiness in new ways. This could be tea cozy television, but a strong undertow of social relevance (ageism, widowhood, same-sex attraction, teen pregnancy) gives', 'some substantive heft. Utterly charming. (Check your local listings for details.)', '8.', '', ':', 'and', '(Sunday, June 29, at 9 p.m. on PBS)', 'Courtesy of ITV for MASTERPIECE', 'Courtesy of ITV for MASTERPIECE', 'is back with two of its most famous sleuths in tow.', '\xe2\x80\x94 about the young Inspector Morse (here as an ambitious Constable Morse, played by Shaun Evans) as he solves crimes in 1960s Oxford \xe2\x80\x94 and', '\xe2\x80\x94 which finds David Suchet stepping into the Belgian detective\xe2\x80\x99s spats for two of the final four Agatha Christie adaptations \xe2\x80\x94 return to offer some deliciously twisty period mysteries. Your \xe2\x80\x9clittle gray cells\xe2\x80\x9d thank you. (Check your local listings for details.)', '9.', '', '(Sunday, June 29, at 10 p.m. on HBO)', 'Based on the novel by Tom Perrotta and overseen by', '\xe2\x80\x99s Damon Lindelof, HBO\xe2\x80\x99s highly anticipated new drama', 'charts what happens to a small suburban community in the wake of a global Rapture, when half the world\xe2\x80\x99s population simply disappears in the blink of an eye. Justin Theroux plays a local chief of police who attempts to create order in a chaotic new world; the rest of the sprawling cast includes Amy Brenneman, Christopher Eccleston, Liv Tyler, Charlie Carver, Max Carver, Carrie Coon, Ann Dowd, Michael Gaston, Emily Meade, Annie Q, Margaret Qualley, Amanda Warren, and Chris Zylka.', '10.', '', '(Monday, June 30, at 10 p.m. on CBS)', 'The ongoing adaptation of Stephen King\xe2\x80\x99s novel of the same name, from executive producers Neal Baer and Brian K. Vaughan, had more than a few loopy charms in its uneven first season, as the inhabitants of Chester\xe2\x80\x99s Mill struggled to survive after a massive dome of unknown origin plonked itself down over the town. Murder, butterflies, cryptic messages from ghosts (?), monarchs, mini-domes, and bloody visions soon followed in its wake. I\xe2\x80\x99m curious to see if the second season of', 'can recover from some of its woeful missteps last year and present a narrative that is somewhat tethered to an emotional reality.', '11.', '', '(July TBA on FX)', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99ve forgotten what', 'star Corey Stoll looked like with hair, you\xe2\x80\x99re in for a surprise, which Guillermo del Toro\xe2\x80\x99s', 'has in spooky abundance. Stoll plays a beleaguered CDC official whose team is investigating an odd viral outbreak that points toward \xe2\x80\x9can ancient and evil strain of vampirism.\xe2\x80\x9d But this isn\xe2\x80\x99t a modern-day', '\xe2\x80\x94 there are no kitschy trappings, only a truly horrific and gory high-stakes battle between humanity and the undead in Manhattan\xe2\x80\xa6and some of the most intense and disturbing scenes ever on television. Not for the faint of heart,', '\xe2\x80\x94 which is executive produced by', '\xe2\x80\x99s Carlton Cuse \xe2\x80\x94 also decidedly does not make for appropriate dinner viewing. You\xe2\x80\x99ve been warned!', '12.', '', '(Wednesday, July 9, at 9 p.m. on CBS)', 'Steven Spielberg executive produces this Halle Berry-led thriller \xe2\x80\x94 presented as yet another limited-series event \xe2\x80\x94 about Molly Woods, a female astronaut (Berry) who returns home after 13 months in outer space and attempts to reconnect with her family. The only catch: She may have brought something back with her, a passenger of the unwitting space explorer whose presence may forever alter human existence. Just what is Molly pregnant with? How was she impregnated? And what inexplicable thing did Molly see in space that could unlock these mysteries? The 13-episode series also stars Goran Visnjic, Camryn Manheim, Michael O\xe2\x80\x99Neill, Hiroyuki Sanada, Pierce Gagnon, and Grace Gummer.', '13.', '', '(Sunday, July 13, at 10 p.m. on Showtime)', 'Season 2 of Showtime\xe2\x80\x99s period drama', 'returns for another look into the inner workings of sexuality. As researchers William Masters and Virginia Johnson, Michael Sheen and Lizzy Caplan anchor a show that examines what truly makes us human at a very different time in American society. Knowing that the duo eventually marry in real life only makes the frisson between the two that much more fraught and powerful. The show\xe2\x80\x99s extraordinary ensemble cast \xe2\x80\x94 which includes Caitlin Fitzgerald, Nick D\xe2\x80\x99Agosto, Teddy Sears, Beau Bridges, and Allison Janney \xe2\x80\x94 fill out a striking tableau of desire, both thwarted and realized.', '14.', '', '(Full season available Friday, Aug. 1, on Netflix)', 'Apparently, you can\xe2\x80\x99t kill', ', which has miraculously managed to survive not one, but two cancellations. Based on the stunning Danish mystery drama', ',', 'will wrap up its narrative with a six-episode final season, this time on Netflix. The Season 3 finale saw Detective Linden (Mireille Enos) shoot and kill her former lover/boss (Elias Koteas) after it was revealed he had been brutally murdering homeless teens in a string of killings that linked back to a previous case Linden had worked on. Just what will the end mean for Linden and Holder (Joel Kinnaman), and how similarly will it play out to the conclusion of the Danish original? Find out this summer.', '15.', '', '(Sunday, Aug. 24, at 9 p.m. on PBS)', 'Former', 'star Jack Davenport anchors this period drama, set in 1961 London, as a gifted surgeon hoping to make a difference in the lives of his female patients. The stylish series also stars Zoe Boyle, Joanna Page, Sarah Parish, and Iain Glen. Just don\xe2\x80\x99t get too attached: ITV opted not to commission a second season, which means that this six-episode season is all the', 'you\xe2\x80\x99re ever going to get. (Check your local listings for details.)', 'You are signed in as', '.', '16 New And Returning TV Shows Worth Watching This Summer', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Don‰Ûªt Worry, Adam Driver Will Still Be OnåÊ‰ÛÏGirls‰Ûù
Description: ['HBO confirms to BuzzFeed that Driver will be returning for Season 4 of the comedy in the wake of the announcement that he\xe2\x80\x99s been cast in']

Title: ABC To Remove Bryan Singer‰Ûªs Name From Ads For His New Show AmidåÊLawsuit
Description: ['BuzzFeed has confirmed that ABC will re-cut currently airing commercials for its new drama,', '.']
