Title: ‰ÛÏMad Men‰Ûù Returns With An Intoxicating Beginning Of TheåÊEnd
Description: ['Creator Matthew Weiner prepares for the endgame with the first of 14 episodes that start to tie up the AMC period drama.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Warning: Minor spoilers ahead!', '', '', 'The first episode of', '\xe2\x80\x99s final season is an outstanding installment, offering up new beginnings for several of Sterling Cooper & Partners\xe2\x80\x99 employees while pushing the series inexorably towards its ultimate end. And given the list of potential plot points that critics were forbidden to share with readers about the first episode of the final season of', ', it even feels like a bit of a spoiler to say that much about the Season 7 premiere, which airs on April 13 on AMC.', 'Much discussion has already been made about creator Matthew Weiner\xe2\x80\x99s stern warnings about disclosing information about the plot, characters, setting, and even year in which the new season is set. It\xe2\x80\x99s challenging, therefore, to discuss the actual content of the show itself, but not impossible: There are simply more fiery hoops for critics to squeeze through ahead of broadcast.', 'It is, of course, Weiner\xe2\x80\x99s prerogative as a show creator, to set these guidelines and boundaries. As the visionary behind', ', he is looking to create an atmosphere in which the viewer comes to each episode without preconceptions formed on dreaded spoilers. Each episode \xe2\x80\x94 and season \xe2\x80\x94 is therefore a blank slate; episode previews are long on atmosphere and decidedly short on hooks. A phone rings, someone downs a drink, a glance is delivered across a smoke-filled room.', 'In the age of Spoiler Culture, it\xe2\x80\x99s refreshing for the viewer experience, allowing for the audience to be unencumbered by information that could either derail one\xe2\x80\x99s enjoyment or curtail the pleasure of the unknown. In a more philosophical sense, pre-knowledge of something forces you into a set of circumstance in which your opinion is altered by dint of expectations. And without those, anything and everything is possible: A plot twist can surprise or shock, elicit glee or panic. The universe of the show is closed off and therefore unknowable.', 'For a show \xe2\x80\x94 and a showrunner \xe2\x80\x94 that is determined to capture the ebb and flow of life itself, that\xe2\x80\x99s something to be cherished and, well, treasured. And', 'prides itself both on the details and on the bigger, sweeping themes of its narrative, serving up a world of flawed individuals from whom it\xe2\x80\x99s impossible to turn away. They make mistakes, fall, and get up again. They\xe2\x80\x99re trapped in amber, existing in a different time period that feels in ways eons from the present day, but', 'captures what it means to be alive and how that feels. And it does so with a slick style and pulsing sensitivity that sets the show apart from the slew of copycats that followed in its wake. Weiner has created a modern bildungsroman in the narrative art style of the today; it\xe2\x80\x99s tethered both to the past and the present and to the future.', ', it whispers. (Thank you, George Santayana.)', 'Michael Yarish / AMC', 'The April 13 episode, \xe2\x80\x9cTime Zones\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 written by Weiner and directed by Scott Hornbacher \xe2\x80\x94 is, in many ways, the beginning of the end for', '. Unlike the past few seasons (which kicked off with double-sized entries), Season 7 of', 'begins with a one-hour episode that sets the stage for the final act of a narrative that has unspooled over the last six seasons. Without treading into spoiler territory, I will say that it\xe2\x80\x99s an episode of transformation and confrontation \xe2\x80\x94 or, as one character says in the opening scene:', 'It is indeed the beginning, but also the end. There\xe2\x80\x99s a reason that January is named after Janus, the two-faced Roman god: Every ending is the beginning of something else, and every beginning is the ending of yet another something. Janus was the god of beginnings and of transitions, meaning that he held sway over the duality of life itself: war and peace, openings and closings, the past and the future, the beginning and the end. (It\xe2\x80\x99s worth noting here that these first seven episodes of', '\xe2\x80\x99s seventh season is subtitled \xe2\x80\x9cThe Beginning,\xe2\x80\x9d while the second seven will debut in spring 2015.) In walking through a door, you\xe2\x80\x99ve both entered and exited. And sometimes, those doors just break, as they do here. Once you\xe2\x80\x99ve let in an icy despair, they may prove impossible to close once more.', 'Don Draper (Jon Hamm) and Peggy Olson (Elisabeth Moss) once again anchor the show in remarkable, profound ways. Their trajectories, which dovetailed for a while, provide the show with its narrative spine \xe2\x80\x94 their decisions and missteps informing both the intellectual and emotional journeys of', 'at large. For characters who have had to reinvent themselves \xe2\x80\x94 often refusing to deal with their psychic scars in the process \xe2\x80\x94 Season 7 represents possibly their last chance at reinvention.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s no mistake that the end of Season 6 offered up the motif of the \xe2\x80\x9chomesteader,\xe2\x80\x9d or explorer, presenting an opportunity to strike out in a new direction, and a means of creating a potential new identity. The season opener\xe2\x80\x99s not-too-subtle title reflects the method by which this could occur; Los Angeles, after all, beckoned to quite a few characters at the end of last year\xe2\x80\xa6though the City of Angels may not be as heavenly as the name implies. There is a patina of dread to some of these scenes; wolves howl at night outside Megan Draper\xe2\x80\x99s Hollywood Hills home. There are threats both seen and unseen, as well as a sense of impermeable isolation. (Devotees of the fan theory that emerged last season \xe2\x80\x94 namely that Jessica Par\xc3\xa9\xe2\x80\x99s Megan will be murdered by followers of Charles Manson \xe2\x80\x94 will likely have a field day with this development. Sigh.)', 'There\xe2\x80\x99s a scene in which Hamm\xe2\x80\x99s Don slouches on the couch in front of a glowing television screen, enjoying the fiction of what the film offers: a false lure toward an idyllic past that never existed, a fable about our past experiences, no more real than a myth about Janus himself. There\xe2\x80\x99s surely a meta statement in there as well about looking through the prism of', 'in order to find a time that appears better, more stylish, more idealized than our own.', 'That air of deception permeates \xe2\x80\x9cTime Zones,\xe2\x80\x9d in which characters lie to others and to themselves, concealing the truth about their situations, their feelings, their angst, and their heartbreak. Confidence can be the best illusion; when alone, however, there is a sadness welling up within several of these characters that is truly gut-wrenching. And, as the show has previously posed, the question of \xe2\x80\x9cAre you alone?\xe2\x80\x9d is one that hovers uneasily over the action, taunting us with the eternal, unspoken answer.', 'With only 14 episodes to wrap up this story, there is a lot of ground to be covered, though \xe2\x80\x9cTime Zones\xe2\x80\x9d focuses largely on its major cast members (both professional and personal), i.e., Don, Peggy, Roger (John Slattery), Pete (Vincent Kartheiser), and Joan (Christina Hendricks). Roger has a provocative storyline that is at turns surprising and telltale, dealing with forgiveness and oblivion. More than anyone, it\xe2\x80\x99s Roger who seems to be most embracing the brave new world of this era. Peggy has sacrificed her personal life on the altar of professional success, and I\xe2\x80\x99m curious to see just how this plays out for her this season, particularly as she faces new obstacles at work.', 'I refuse to reveal just what Pete is up to, but Kartheiser once again infuses his role with humor and pathos. Joan is once more delicately walking a tightrope at the office, but she throws herself into a task with poise and caution, breaking a gender barrier that seemed impenetrable earlier. The ghost of Herb Rennet is nowhere to be seen. Don and Megan have new challenges to tackle as well, existing as they seemingly do living two separate lives, on two separate coasts. (Their reunion scene is a masterstroke of beautiful framing, buoyed by a killer soundtrack and some slick props, the slickest of which is a strutting Megan herself.)', 'Don\xe2\x80\x99s insistence to Megan that their happiness could be reclaimed by turning to the past looks to be particularly untenable. California, which represented a smoggy Paradise for Don, is not someplace you can return to, it seems. (He appears to be conflating, at the end of Season 6, California with Disneyland.) It\xe2\x80\x99s something intangible and now out of reach. It\xe2\x80\x99s the whiff of lost youth that can\xe2\x80\x99t be rebottled. Your problems, Weiner\xe2\x80\x99s', 'would argue, always have a way of catching up to you, no matter how fast or how far you run.', 'And there\xe2\x80\x99s Don, raging against the city he loves, unable to shut the door, powerless to keep the past or the present at bay. A sojourn to California is a vacation from the quotidian reality of life itself, but the mess that you leave behind is right there where you left it upon your return. Don has perhaps never been closer to that flailing, falling silhouette in the opening credits of', 'and, as we approach the very end of the show\xe2\x80\x99s run, there\xe2\x80\x99s something terribly exciting about seeing just where he \xe2\x80\x94 and the characters \xe2\x80\x94 land after the fall.', 'Season 7 of', 'begins Sunday, April 13, at 10 p.m. on AMC.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMad Men\xe2\x80\x9d Returns With An Intoxicating Beginning Of The End', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏTwin Peaks‰Ûù Is 24 Years Old And It Still Haunts YouråÊDreams
Description: ['David Lynch and Mark Frost\xe2\x80\x99s grand opus celebrates nearly a quarter century of influencing television.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Damn fine show.', '', '', 'Nearly 25 years after it first premiered on ABC,', '\xe2\x80\x94 the brainchild of David Lynch and Mark Frost \xe2\x80\x94 continues to exert an inescapable gravitational pull on the imaginations of viewers and on the television landscape as a whole. Yes, there is still the totemic power of such influential series such as', ', or', ', or', ', but', 'remains a powerful shorthand for ethereal, riveting mystery, and for good reason.', 'Nominally about the investigation into the murder of homecoming queen Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee), the serialized drama was responsible for creating the nightmares of many as it delved into both the seedy underbelly of a seemingly idyllic town in the Pacific Northwest and into a haunting dream world where giants and dwarves roamed the halls of the Great Northern Hotel, perfect cherry pie could be had at the local greasy spoon, and murder most foul could rip a town in two. The show itself embraced the somnambulist visuals of its co-creator, infusing the whodunnit with a lyrical, somber, and, at times, terrifying feel. (You all know which moments I mean: a tableau of lovelorn teenagers singing a song segues into a nightmarish encounter. A skipping record signals doom. Red curtains part to reveal horrors.)', 'For those of us who experienced the show as it aired, tuning in each week to gather more clues about Laura\xe2\x80\x99s killer and marvel at the deductive reasoning skills of the show\xe2\x80\x99s resident Sherlock, FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan), it\xe2\x80\x99s almost impossible to describe the strange appeal that', 'had and the hunger to solve the murder in the days before Twitter,', 'message boards, or social media at all. It was a true watercooler show in the days when such things as watercooler conversation still existed. It caused many a sleepless night as you pondered just what the dwarf meant, or whether Laura\xe2\x80\x99s lookalike cousin Maddy Ferguson (also played by Lee) was connected somehow to the specifics of her death.', 'But Laura\xe2\x80\x99s murder was a MacGuffin of sorts: It was intended merely as an introduction to this odd little place and these very strange individuals that populated the town of Twin Peaks. And that town itself represented a sort of thwarted and idealized past, one stuck in the facade of the 1950s, a great society that prided itself on its saddle shoes and fitted angora sweaters, where unspeakable acts occurred behind closed doors. What the show did was take the viewer inside the conscious and subconscious minds of those quirky denizens, giving us a saintly hero in the form of Cooper who would be tempted again and again with the easy lures of lust, power, and complacency. Teenagers investigated the murder of their peers, biker gangs squared off as torch singers swayed in the half-darkness at boozy backwater bars, femme fatales ran their red lacquered nails over the backs of their oblivious lovers.', 'took our collective desires and dreams and ran them through the dark prism of classic film noir.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s Laura\xe2\x80\x99s best friend, Donna Hayward (Lara Flynn Boyle) \xe2\x80\x94 reeling from the murder and a blossoming affair with Laura\xe2\x80\x99s secret lover James Hurley (James Marshall) \xe2\x80\x94 who says it best: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s like I\xe2\x80\x99m having the most beautiful dream\xe2\x80\xa6 and the most terrible nightmare, all at once.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'And that\xe2\x80\x99s', 'in a sentence, really.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Twin Peaks" Is 24 Years Old And It Still Haunts Your Dreams', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! Title: 53 Possible Ways Season 3 Of ‰ÛÏScandal‰Ûù CouldåÊEnd
Description: ['Shonda Rhimes\xe2\x80\x99 political thriller always leaves you guessing, but entertainment editorial director Jace Lacob and staff writer Emily Orley take a stab as to what might happen by the end of the third season.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Let the wild speculation begin!', '', '', '1. Maya\xe2\x80\x99s bomb explodes on the campaign trail, leaving the fates of several characters \xe2\x80\x94 including Fitz \xe2\x80\x94 unclear as the show goes on its summer hiatus. CLIFF-HANGER!', '2. Fitz is killed when the bomb goes off, widowing Mellie in the process. Olivia is understandably distraught, as her actions lead to Maya being able to plant the bomb.', '3. Fitz is killed when the bomb goes off and Cyrus runs in his spot on the Republican ticket. He becomes the first openly gay man to win the presidency.', '4. Adnan turns on Maya and traps her in a room with the bomb. Adnan becomes a member of Olivia Pope & Associates and Harrison\xe2\x80\x99s girlfriend.', '5. Andrew nobly saves Fitz from death, but is himself killed in the process. This gives Mellie even more reason to hate her husband and to feel like he has \xe2\x80\x9ctaken everything\xe2\x80\x9d from her.', '6. Fitz is killed when the bomb goes off. Because Sally is the sitting vice president, she ascends to the Oval Office as Fitz\xe2\x80\x99s successor. Olivia is distraught and vows to get Sally kicked out of office.', '7. Realizing that she failed to stop Maya when she had the chance, Quinn sacrifices herself to stop Maya\xe2\x80\x99s plot and is killed in the process. Charlie kills Maya in an act of vengeance and ends up joining Olivia Pope & Associates.', '8. Maya plants a bomb in the White House. Fitz, Andrew, and Mellie are taken to the secret bunker in the basement, but since Olivia already used her clearance to get down there once, she is left upstairs and thrown against the wall in the bomb blast. Everything goes black.', '9. Charlie dies saving Quinn from the blast. Quinn rejoins OPA, though her passion for Olivia\xe2\x80\x99s mission has been tempered from her time with B613 and with Charlie. She wants nothing to do with Huck.', '10. Quinn attempts to sacrifice herself in order to stop Maya\xe2\x80\x99s plot, but Huck saves her at the last moment.', '11. Feeling betrayed, Charlie attempts to kill Quinn when he realizes that she has been plotting against him and B613. She is saved by Huck.', '12. Charlie attempts to kill Huck, believing him responsible for Quinn\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty issues. Quinn kills Charlie in order to save Huck.', 'ABC', 'ABC', '13. Quinn finds Maya and the bomb. She is able to kill Maya but, with the clock ticking, cannot figure out how to dismantle the bomb. With only 60 seconds left on the timer, she is forced to call Huck for help, and he walks her through how to stop the timer.', '14. Huck finds Maya, but instead of killing her, he kidnaps her and takes her to an empty storage house. He calls Quinn and gives her the first opportunity to drill into Maya\xe2\x80\x99s side as an apology.', '15. Fitz is killed in the bomb plot; Andrew and Mellie launch a campaign to retake the White House in the next election. In a surprising twist, Andrew picks Mellie to be his running mate.', '16. Fitz is killed in the bomb blast and Andrew fills his spot on the Republican ticket. He runs and wins the presidency. Suddenly, a year has passed. Andrew, Mellie, and Teddy, now one happy family, are all playing in the Oval Office.', '17. Andrew and Mellie run away together and are therefore nowhere near the bomb blast when it goes off. Guilt overtakes them.', '18. As Command, Jake sacrifices himself to protect Fitz from the blast. He dies, horrifically.', '19. Jake still sacrifices himself to save Fitz, but is only horrifically injured.', '20. The bomb never goes off! It\xe2\x80\x99s a smoke screen to divert attention away from Maya\xe2\x80\x99s real mission.', '21. Lauren discovers the bomb while waiting for Fitz backstage on the campaign trail. She is able to dismantle it and save everyone. She finally insists that she is given a raise!', '22. Maya and Eli are both killed, freeing Olivia from their tortured history. In the aftermath, she packs a bag and disappears from Washington without telling anyone where she is going.', '23. Eli kills Maya in front of Olivia. Unable to deal with her hatred, he turns the gun on himself.', '24. Maya murders Eli in front of Olivia. Olivia draws a gun and shoots her mother, killing her. As Maya bleeds out, she asks her daughter for forgiveness. Olivia shoots her again.', '25. Maya stabs Adnan when she attempts to flee the country without her co-conspirator. Mama Pope doesn\xe2\x80\x99t stand for that.', '26. B613 is vanquished forever, and the truth about this insidious espionage agency is brought out into the light.', '27. Despite the fact that the public believes B613 has been shut down, Eli reclaims his role as Command, acknowledging that someone has to protect the Republic at all cost.', '28. Jake is revealed to have been secretly working with Maya and Adnan all along, which is why the two haven\xe2\x80\x99t been brought in by B613. Jake wants Fitz dead and helped engineer everything that happened this season.', 'ABC', 'ABC', '29. Eli makes good on his promise to destroy his successor and has Jake kidnapped; Jake is thrown in the hole as Eli reclaims the role of Command.', '30. David Rosen discovers the existence of the bomb and, unable to get in touch with anyone at OPA, tries to stop it from going off, but he is killed in the process.', '31. Jake realizes that David Rosen is a loose end, one that connects him to the murder of James Novak, and kills him in order to prevent anyone from discovering his involvement. Abby discovers his body and screams. Cut to black.', '32. In a surprising twist, it is Sally who is killed when Maya\xe2\x80\x99s bomb goes off, leaving the seat of the vice president open. Fitz must appoint a new vice president and, going against Olivia\xe2\x80\x99s wishes, appoints a new VP who is not Andrew.', '33. Quinn tells Charlie to stop calling her \xe2\x80\x9cRobin.\xe2\x80\x9d (\xe2\x80\x9cIt doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make you Batman,\xe2\x80\x9d she screams.)', '34. Quinn and Olivia reconcile when Quinn provides valuable information that takes down Maya Pope. But Quinn says that she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t want to return to OPA.', '35. Quinn and Olivia reconcile under the same conditions, but Quinn', 'return to OPA and tearfully offers Olivia cup of coffee, promising never to leave again.', '36. Quinn and Olivia reconcile. Quinn demands a promotion and full dental coverage.', '37. When Fitz tells Mellie that he is going to divorce her, Mellie shoots Fitz.', '38. When Mellie tells Fitz that she and Andrew are going to be a couple, Fitz proposes to Olivia, even though they cannot get married.', 'ABC', '39. Olivia tells Fitz that she can\xe2\x80\x99t be with him anymore, that Vermont will never happen, and that he has to make his marriage to Mellie work. She hands him a jar of homemade jam.', '40. Olivia tells Fitz that she can\xe2\x80\x99t be with him anymore, that Vermont will never happen, and that he has to make his marriage to Mellie work. He dies when the bomb goes off. Olivia realizes that she\xe2\x80\x99s lost the love of her life.', '41. Olivia has sex with Jake in order to save the country once more.', '42. After a near-death experience when a bomb goes off on the campaign trail, Fitz and Mellie realize they can\xe2\x80\x99t waste any more time being miserable together and they get divorced. Mellie marries Andrew and Fitz marries Olivia and they take his helicopter to Vermont to look for houses.', '43. Publius II, an unknown source, starts leaking information to journalists all over town. The truth about Daniel Douglas Langston\xe2\x80\x99s death is revealed. Sally and Cyrus are taken into custody. No one knows where Maya or the bomb is located.', '44. In the aftermath of the bomb blast, Olivia and Fitz flee D.C., heading to parts unknown.', '45. Olivia wears a white coat.', '46. Olivia convinces her mom to not detonate the bomb by giving her a', 'expensive bottle of red wine.', '47. Olivia drinks a large glass of red wine after saving the Grant administration and Fitz\xe2\x80\x99s life. There\xe2\x80\x99s a knock at the door. Olivia answers it. An unknown assailant shoots her.', '48. Jake discovers the bomb and dismantles it. Maya, making a getaway, is stopped by Olivia. She tells Olivia that the bomb was simply a distraction and she is working for a terrorist organization that is going to attack Washington D.C. at an undisclosed time and place. And then she disappears.', '49. Jake, Quinn and Charlie trace the bomb to the campaign trail. Jake calls Olivia to protect her, revealing his true feelings for her. Olivia is able to help stop the bomb from going off. But Olivia goes looking for Jake and finds him with a gun to Eli\xe2\x80\x99s head. Olivia must decide if she\xe2\x80\x99s going to kill Jake to save her father or let her father die. Cut to black.', '50. Olivia finds Maya and pulls a gun on her. But Eli enters and makes Olivia put down her weapon, promising he\xe2\x80\x99ll protect her. She does, and he reveals that he has been working with Maya the entire time to take down B613 and the president.', '51. Eli\xe2\x80\x99s time \xe2\x80\x9cworking\xe2\x80\x9d in the basement of the Smithsonian has actually been spent investigating every move Maya\xe2\x80\x99s made in the last two decades. The bomb ends up going off, seriously harming Fitz, Mellie, and Andrew, and their fate remains unknown. Maya returns to her hotel room to gather her papers and flee the country, but Eli is one step ahead of her, waiting in the room. He kills Adnan and calls acting President Langston. He offers her Maya in exchange for funding of a new organization that he will head up: B614.', '52. The bomb is dismantled and everyone thinks they\xe2\x80\x99ve walked away unscathed. But the real bomb drops when Mellie\xe2\x80\x99s rape is leaked to the public. Fitz watches the news unfold in the Oval Office and immediately tries calling Mellie, but the phone just keeps ringing.', '53. The entire third season of', 'is Olivia Pope\xe2\x80\x99s dream. She wakes up in a state of delirium to discover that she is in the hole!', 'ABC', 'airs Thursdays at 10 p.m. on ABC.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '53 Possible Ways Season 3 Of \xe2\x80\x9cScandal\xe2\x80\x9d Could End', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: A Tech World Insider Reviews HBO‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏSilicon Valley‰Ûù
Description: ['No stranger to the strangeness of the tech world, BuzzFeed founder Jonah Peretti offers his take on HBO\xe2\x80\x99s hilarious and incisive comedy', '.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'TL;DR: He liked it. A lot.', '', 'Huffington Post', 'Silicon Valley', '', 'Don\xe2\x80\x99t confuse', 'for a tech-savvy', '. It might be the anti-', ', but it isn\xe2\x80\x99t the new', '. The characters are too awkward, the interactions with women are too stilted, and it is hard to imagine men, even geeky men, watching this show with the same vicarious pleasure many of them got from', '.', 'As a startup founder, I was very excited to see this show, but didn\xe2\x80\x99t have any preconceptions and hadn\xe2\x80\x99t read anything about it. Watching the first few episodes, it is clear that it will be very enjoyable for people who aren\xe2\x80\x99t in the industry and impossible to resist for people who are.', 'The world Mike Judge created isn\xe2\x80\x99t very realistic, but it takes many real trends and extrapolates them into hilarious parody. People from the Bay Area startup world will be very familiar with the raw material of Judge\xe2\x80\x99s satire: the cult-like utopian company campuses filled with logos, branding, and free snacks; the earnest insistence that every startup is \xe2\x80\x9cchanging the world\xe2\x80\x9d; the competitiveness of billionaire moguls to win deals; the single-industry town with a tech monoculture where everyone (your grocery store clerk! your doctor!) has a startup idea they want to pitch; the obsession with ownership percentages and stock options; and, as the show develops, the stresses and challenges of actually building a business from nothing.', 'Jaimie Trueblood / HBO', 'The show is clearly 100% fictional and I am sure HBO\xe2\x80\x99s lawyers made sure that none of the characters could be confused with real people. But I know the startup world will be discussing the similarities between Peter Gregory (Christopher Evan Welch) and Peter Thiel, who are both eccentric libertarian billionaires who invest in startups but make big macroeconomic bets on global markets and give kids grants to drop out of college. (Though Gregory is clearly patterned off of Thiel, he is a more eccentric caricature.', 'and judge for yourself.) And the CEO of Hooli (Matt Ross) is clearly patterned after Marc Benioff, since they both run B2B enterprise companies that serve corporate clients while also bettering the world through charity, destroying the competition, and seeking spiritual council from gurus.', '\xe2\x80\x94 the show and the actual place \xe2\x80\x94 has some very compelling characters.', '', 'The show covers the entire range of people you see in the Valley \xe2\x80\x94 the venture capitalists and tech company CEOs to the incubator hopefuls \xe2\x80\x94 but everyone is more colorful and interesting than in real life: Most programmers aren\xe2\x80\x99t as funny or as weird as the ones you see in the show, most tech company \xe2\x80\x9cbro-grammers\xe2\x80\x9d are actually not that bro-y, most CEOs and VCs aren\xe2\x80\x99t particularly colorful. A documentary about Silicon Valley culture would have lots of VCs riding around on bikes in those tight shorts on the weekend and having meeting after meeting during the week where they \xe2\x80\x9cpass\xe2\x80\x9d on startups; lots of developers sitting in front of computers for hours without talking; lots of Stanford and Ivy League-educated tech company workers having civilized conversations in conference rooms about technical and business problems; and a few more adventurous folks racing cars on private tracks, flying civilian drones, kite surfing, and skiing too fast in Tahoe. But the real Silicon Valley would be', 'less entertaining than watching Judge\xe2\x80\x99s show.', 'Jaimie Trueblood / HBO', 'There is a trend of more people wanting to be startup founders and more people thinking it is cool to build a company. This is mostly a good development, although it does lead to poseurs who do it for the wrong reasons. It is like a new version of a kid joining a band to say they are in a band and not because they love making music. But the show parodies these wannabes; it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t encourage them!', 'Ultimately, I highly recommend', 'and was thoroughly entertained watching the first five episodes in one sitting. But I recommend it for the comedy, not the startup ethnography. The show will not elucidate what Silicon Valley is \xe2\x80\x9creally like,\xe2\x80\x9d except in a highly fictionalized, exaggerated, absurdist form. But the show delivers real laughs, not just chuckles, and that is almost as rare these days as starting a company that becomes the next Dropbox.', 'Watch the trailer for', ':', '', 'airs Sunday, April 6 at 10 p.m. on HBO.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'A Tech World Insider Reviews HBO\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cSilicon Valley\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: 7 Reasons "Call The Midwife" Is One Of The Best Shows On Television
Description: ['Besides the number of times this period drama makes you sob like a baby.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'The third season of BBC\xe2\x80\x99s', '\xe2\x80\x94 which wrapped up last month in the U.K. and begins on March 30 on PBS in the States \xe2\x80\x94 attracted an audience of more than 10 million viewers when it aired across the Atlantic, a figure that puts it on nearly equal footing with', '. But that series gets far more attention than this subtle and superb period drama.', 'Set in 1950s East End London and based on Jennifer Worth\xe2\x80\x99s memoirs,', 'tracks the lives of a group of young midwives and the sisterhood of nuns with whom they work at Nonnatus House. Babies are born, labors \xe2\x80\x94 both real and figurative \xe2\x80\x94 undertaken, and love blossoms and fades. It is an extraordinary show about birth and death and what comes in between. As written by Heidi Thomas and her talented staff,', 'manages to be both warm and profound in equal measure, opening a window to a time long gone yet offering a glimpse into the eternal and the transitory. It\xe2\x80\x99s tea cozy television with a very deep soul.', 'But if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t yet watched', '(or have already fallen in love with its easy charms), here are seven reasons why it is worth watching. (Warning: Minor spoilers ahead.)', '1.', 'The show offers not only the varying perspectives of four very distinct characters, but also from two points in time.', 'While most definitely an ensemble drama,', 'most often utilizes the perspectives of the four young midwives at the story\xe2\x80\x99s center: confident Jenny Lee (Jessica Raine), sophisticated Beatrix \xe2\x80\x9cTrixie\xe2\x80\x9d Franklin (Helen George), clumsy Camilla \xe2\x80\x9cChummy\xe2\x80\x9d Fortescue-Cholmondeley-Browne (Miranda Hart), and meek Cynthia Miller (Bryony Hannah).', 'The quartet of woman could not possibly be more different from each another, yet somehow, their dynamic works remarkably well: As they sip Babycham and listen to records after hours, they embody a certain spirit of unity and power. Raine\xe2\x80\x99s Jenny \xe2\x80\x94 based on memoirist Worth \xe2\x80\x94 anchors the show in both a physical and emotional sense, seeing as it\xe2\x80\x99s narrated by \xe2\x80\x9cmature Jenny\xe2\x80\x9d (Vanessa Redgrave), looking back on her life at Nonnatus House. The duality of perspectives presented, the innocence of contemporary Jenny juxtaposed against the experience of her future counterpart, gives the show a patina of gravitas. It helps as well that the disembodied voice belongs to Redgrave, whose heartfelt narration is one of the hallmarks of the show.', '2.', 'Chummy may have once offered comic relief, but her arc this season is nothing short of gut-wrenching.', 'There are many reasons why Hart\xe2\x80\x99s Chummy has been a breakout character over the three seasons the comedian has played the role. But the physical comedy that the pratfall-prone actress displayed early on (like while', ') has been replaced with emotional depth and pathos. And in the third season, Hart delivers a staggering performance that is at once jaw-dropping and heartbreaking for its fierceness and nuance. That it conflates her fraught dynamic with her emotionally distant mother, Jenny\xe2\x80\x99s innate tenderness, and a stunning look at dying with dignity gives her arc a palpable sense of importance and grace. Hart may be known for her humorous roles, but as Chummy, she delivers several scenes that establish her as a serious dramatic actor and reduce the viewers to jagged sobs.', '3.', 'The journey of Sister Bernadette, as she leaves the sisterhood to take a vow of marriage, is incredible.', 'When we were first introduced to Sister Bernadette in the first season, I had no idea that the young nun\xe2\x80\x99s storyline would prove to be one of the most compelling and insightful looks at the tug of war between the religious and secular ever to appear on television. As played by the divine Laura Main, Sister Bernadette \xe2\x80\x94 now called Shelagh Turner \xe2\x80\x94 is a standout character of the highest order, not least of which for the heartache and realism that Main infuses into the role.', 'As she falls in love with Dr. Turner (Stephen McGann), she is forced to choose between the pull of her heart and the vocation for which she left the secular world behind. On a lesser show, this storyline might have been incredibly saccharine or exploitative, but here, Shelagh\xe2\x80\x99s struggle to find her own path and to choose romantic love was rendered as something incredibly poignant and powerful. Post-marriage to Dr. Turner, Shelagh continues to question her role in the world in Season 3, finding that there are always hard choices to be made and that secrets loom even between the best of individuals.', '4.', 'The births are sometimes beautiful, sometimes terrifying, and sometimes both.', 'Neal Street Productions', 'Neal Street Productions', 'For a show that is about midwifery, there is bound to be a lot of birth along the way and', 'excels in these scenes, which depict the joy, horror, fear, and beauty of bringing a life into the world with a degree of realism that can be shocking at times. (I watched Season 2 of', 'with a pregnant wife, who found herself alternately intrigued and alarmed by some of the deliveries.)', 'Each birth has its own risks and pitfalls, and the show is careful to show both sides of the process, allowing the viewer to see the same event from both the midwife\xe2\x80\x99s perspective as well as that of the mother. But the show doesn\xe2\x80\x99t stray into the realm of melodrama: There\xe2\x80\x99s a frankness and a richness to these scenes that can bring tears to your eyes, whether or not you have ever had a child yourself. (But you may find yourself wishing that you had one of these remarkable midwives with you in the delivery room.)', '5.', 'The new characters are just as intriguing as the mainstays.', 'There have been some departures along the way (Jane Sutton, we hardly knew you!) and quite a few additions to the cast of', 'over the last three seasons. But what the show has excelled at, among its other virtues, is adding new characters who don\xe2\x80\x99t feel like window dressing, but who further the series\xe2\x80\x99 scope, like brusque new midwife Patsy Mount (Emerald Fennel), innocent Sister Winifred (Victoria Yeates), Jenny\xe2\x80\x99s paramour Alec Jesmond (Leo Staar), and dishy curate Tom Hereward (Jack Ashton), who quickly catches Trixie\xe2\x80\x99s eye. What each of these new characters has in common is that they feel innately organic to the narrative; they\xe2\x80\x99re never intruders, but rather indispensable extensions of the world in which the characters live. And the third season broadens out the world of the show and adds a sense of modernity that is in keeping with the era in which it\xe2\x80\x99s set.', '6.', 'The show sensitively handles social issues with a deft hand.', 'Neal Street Productions', 'doesn\xe2\x80\x99t fall back on melodramatic staples, but rather fiercely and bravely examines the darker recesses of the human condition: The struggles of a new mother in the throes of puerperal psychosis are investigated with intense clarity and humanity, as is another storyline involving a woman suffering from severe agoraphobia and PTSD. The show never shies away from its unflinching look at the lives of those people whom it encounters: mothers and fathers, husbands and wives, midwives and doctors. Another episode deals with an institutionalized woman with Down syndrome who authorities discover is pregnant; again, rather than offer a twee solution,', 'handles the plot with characteristic emotional intelligence and bravery. It\xe2\x80\x99s these moments that give the show its inherent weight; they\xe2\x80\x99re one-episode plots that are wrapped up, but their resolutions never feel tidy or small. They\xe2\x80\x99re facets of a larger prism through which to view the human experience.', '7.', 'The nuns have secrets of their own, as well as hidden inner lives.', 'Neal Street Productions', 'Neal Street Productions', 'Neal Street Productions', 'The three elder nuns at the center of', '\xe2\x80\x94 saintly Sister Julienne (Jenny Agutter), stern Sister Evangelina (Pam Ferris), mercurial Sister Monica Joan (Judy Parfitt) \xe2\x80\x94 each have their own rich inner lives, which are slowly parsed out over time. There is a hint here about the life of privilege possibly led by senile Sister Monica Joan and a whisper of tragedy in the life of Sister Evangelina. While Shelagh\xe2\x80\x99s transformation from Sister Bernadette \xe2\x80\x94 first embodied in a scene where she beautifully removes her wimple, revealing the face of a young woman who is envious of the freedoms experienced by the secular midwives down the hall \xe2\x80\x94 unfolded over the course of two seasons, the backstories of the other nuns remain shrouded in mystery.', 'These are stories to be leisurely unwound as one would a skein of yarn. There is history there \xe2\x80\x94 loss and grief, joy and pleasure \xe2\x80\x94 that is hidden beneath the surface, waiting to be explored. And', 'will, in time, reveal just what made these women take the calling to their vocation, the lives they left behind, and the secrets they too keep. It is a show, ultimately, about women and sisterhood, the common bonds of the delivery room, and of the joy of bringing life into the world and caring for it.', 'Season 3 of', 'begins Sunday, March 30 at 8 p.m. on PBS. Check your local listings for details.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '7 Reasons "Call The Midwife" Is One Of The Best Shows On Television', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Was That ‰ÛÏGood Wife‰Ûù Twist Cheap Or Profound?
Description: ['No one saw that coming, not even BuzzFeed Entertainment Editorial Director Jace Lacob and Senior Editor Louis Peitzman, who discuss the shocking reveal on the legal drama.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'MAJOR SPOILERS AHEAD, if you haven\xe2\x80\x99t watched.', '', 'CBS', 'CBS', 'The March 23 episode of', '(\xe2\x80\x9cDramatics, Your Honor\xe2\x80\x9d) pushed the critically acclaimed legal drama into new directions, courtesy of an unexpected plot twist that somehow stayed under wraps until it unfolded on air.', '(If you haven\xe2\x80\x99t yet seen Sunday\xe2\x80\x99s episode, stop reading right now. I mean it. STOP. Just stop. There are', 'ahead and if you\xe2\x80\x99ve somehow managed to avoid finding out what happened, this is your last chance to do so.)', 'On this week\xe2\x80\x99s episode, Will Gardner (Josh Charles) was shot and killed by his client \xe2\x80\x94 college student Jeffrey Grant (Hunter Parrish), who had been accused of murdering a woman he claimed was a stranger \xe2\x80\x94 during an eruption of gunfire in the courtroom after Jeffrey was seized with panic for his life and reached for a deputy\xe2\x80\x99s gun. What followed was traumatic to watch: Will bleeding out on the floor of the courtroom, and then his body being discovered by Kalinda (Archie Panjabi) and Diane (Christine Baranski) on a gurney in the hospital.', 'For some, it was the perfect way for Josh Charles\xe2\x80\x99 Will to leave the show, one that closed the door on any reconciliation between him and Julianna Margulies\xe2\x80\x99 Alicia. For others, it felt like a cheap twist. We debate just how well the show handled Will\xe2\x80\x99s death and what it means for', '.', 'I was genuinely shocked by the twist. Jaw-on-the-floor, didn\xe2\x80\x99t-see-that-coming shocked. And for a split-second, I didn\xe2\x80\x99t believe that Robert and Michelle King would actually kill off Will, who is nominally the male lead. But what', 'has proven itself willing to do is to shake the foundations of its narrative in unexpected ways. And that\xe2\x80\x99s what Will\xe2\x80\x99s death has done. And in the Age of Spoilers, that they managed to keep it a secret is another miraculous feat. While I\xe2\x80\x99ll miss Will, I love that the show was able to surprise its viewers in such a kick-to-the-gut sort of way.', 'I was surprised too, though perhaps not as surprised as you were, thanks in part to the fact that CBS was heralding this as, \xe2\x80\x9cthe episode of', 'that you can\xe2\x80\x99t miss.\xe2\x80\x9d I hate that. If you warn me that a big twist is coming, I will spend the entire episode waiting for a major character to die, and that ruins a lot of the suspense. But I digress. I will say that, yes,', 'is willing and able to pull the rug out from under its viewers \xe2\x80\x94 and I think that\xe2\x80\x99s why I was a little let down by Will\xe2\x80\x99s abrupt death. It felt cheap, the kind of twist another lesser show would use.', 'doesn\xe2\x80\x99t need a random shootout to shock us.', 'Wait a minute: It needs to be said that Josh Charles had decided to leave the show a la Dan Stevens and', 'and was meant to leave at the end of Season 4 and came back under a short-term deal for the fifth season. To me, there\xe2\x80\x99s no way to write Will out of the show that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t feel cheap except for him dying, likely in some chance way. To me, the fact that it happened under such unexpected and illogical circumstances compounded the tragedy. This wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a protracted cancer storyline where Will learns he\xe2\x80\x99s dying and has to say good-bye to Alicia. There is no good-bye, no closure, no catharsis about the time they lost fighting. His life ended, sadly and without reason.', 'Oh god, a drawn-out death storyline would have been the worst. Now that you\xe2\x80\x99ve thrown that out there, I\xe2\x80\x99m starting to warm to the shootout. But no, I have to believe there were other ways to handle Charles\xe2\x80\x99 exit. I have a lot of faith in the writers of', ', and I think there were other directions they could have taken the story that would have felt more organic and true to the tone of the show. I do, however, like the lack of closure, and I think it was important for Will and Alicia to end their relationship on such tenuous footing. But while on one level I appreciate the meaninglessness of his death \xe2\x80\x94 insofar as that feels true to life \xe2\x80\x94 I have trouble getting behind the randomness when it could have carried more thematic weight.', 'That\xe2\x80\x99s just it \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s senseless and brutal and truly shocking in that respect. There is an element of randomness to it: What if that cop had had the clasp on his holster secured? What if Jeffrey hadn\xe2\x80\x99t been accused of a crime that he seemingly didn\xe2\x80\x99t commit? What if he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t terrified for his life within Cook County holding? Will\xe2\x80\x99s death is inorganic to the show and that\xe2\x80\x99s why it matters, really. It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the climax to a season-long arc; it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t about the rivalry between the two firms, or even about his doomed romance with Alicia. It came out of nowhere. He was shot to death by his client. In a courtroom. With Diane a room away. And he died somewhere between that room and the hospital. The reveal isn\xe2\x80\x99t operatic, but gut-wretching as Kalinda and Diane peel back that sheet. It\xe2\x80\x99s horrifying in its very simplicity.', 'Absolutely agree with you there. What I loved about that moment is that they teased the dramatic scene of doctors struggling to save Will\xe2\x80\x99s life on the table, when in fact he was DOA. That added to the brutality, and Kalinda\xe2\x80\x99s and Diane\xe2\x80\x99s reactions completely floored me. That we didn\xe2\x80\x99t get to see Alicia\xe2\x80\x99s immediate reaction was great, too. I thought all of this was handled well \xe2\x80\x94 the best it could be, really, given the circumstances \xe2\x80\x94 but I still don\xe2\x80\x99t think the circumstances themselves were necessary. It\xe2\x80\x99s the best a cheap twist can be, because', 'is a great show, but it never needed the cheap twist. At least we can agree on the execution.', 'I think that you\xe2\x80\x99re right about that juxtaposition between the chaos of that one room and the stillness of the one where Will\xe2\x80\x99s body is. But that\xe2\x80\x99s where the show thrives where others would have failed. Killing off a character could be inherently thought of, on any show, as potentially cheap. But I refuse to agree that this is a cheap twist. To me, in an era where character deaths are essentially played out, this one had meaning and consequences for the characters in a palpable, major way. There is no escaping the fact that Alicia and Diane and everyone will have to confront Will\xe2\x80\x99s death head-on. But his death also means ending the love triangle that Alicia was trapped within.', 'And how happy are we that the love triangle is over? Always one of the least interesting aspects of the show. I am more interested in Kalinda and Cary than I was in Alicia and Will, and I am not interested in Kalinda and Cary. And I\xe2\x80\x99m excited to see where the show goes from here, in terms of Alicia and Diane\xe2\x80\x99s relationship. Obviously they now share this common loss, but can that erase everything else that happened between them? Honestly, though, I still think there were more stories to be told with Alicia and Will \xe2\x80\x94 and I get that the writers\xe2\x80\x99 hands were tied because of Charles\xe2\x80\x99 decision to leave \xe2\x80\x94 but I want more there. That was a major part of what made this season so exciting.', '', 'Ultimately, it comes down to the writers turning what they had at their disposal into something workable and meaningful. Josh Charles leaving', 'ensured that there won\xe2\x80\x99t be any more Will-Alicia storylines, and that\xe2\x80\x99s fine because at least we\xe2\x80\x99re not forced to suffer awkward plots that we don\xe2\x80\x99t want to see: like, \xe2\x80\x9cJosh Charles guest stars on a new episode of', ', when Will visits Chicago after living as a monk in Nepal for two years!\xe2\x80\x9d I think he had to die in order to make this departure stick, as it were. As for moving forward, it seems clear to me that a merger could be in the cards (a re-merger?) and that Alicia and Diane will perhaps make peace. However, I disagree that Kalinda and Cary aren\xe2\x80\x99t interesting, though I am far more invested in the Alicia-Kalinda dynamic, even though we haven\xe2\x80\x99t seen a hint of their friendship in several years now. Maybe Will dying will mean that the two will actually appear in a scene together.', 'Please! There is so much more to be done with the relationship between Alicia and Kalinda, and we\xe2\x80\x99ve been deprived for far too long. As I said, I\xe2\x80\x99m still excited to see what happens next, even if I\xe2\x80\x99m not thrilled about what led to it.', 'has had a few missteps along the way, and it\xe2\x80\x99s always been adept at correcting itself, so despite being somewhat disappointed by the way Will\xe2\x80\x99s exit played out, I\xe2\x80\x99m cautiously optimistic. Bringing back Louis Canning (Michael J. Fox) in any capacity is a good thing. I\xe2\x80\x99m also curious to see how Jeffrey\xe2\x80\x99s storyline will play out, if at all, because I\xe2\x80\x99m still convinced he didn\xe2\x80\x99t do it! And I want Will\xe2\x80\x99s death to have some tangible effect besides what it means for the characters \xe2\x80\x94 prison reform, perhaps?', 'Michael J. Fox returning as Louis is really a good thing! And I agree: Jeffrey didn\xe2\x80\x99t kill Dani, which we\xe2\x80\x99ll likely learn next week when Hunter Parrish returns. I think that Finn (the new Matthew Goode character) will likely have to bear that cross when that fact comes out, as his prosecution led an innocent man to open fire on a courtroom. You don\xe2\x80\x99t come back from that without scars, both physical and psychological ones. On the other front, I don\xe2\x80\x99t see a need for course-correcting here, however. This was a meaningful way to add a patina of loss and tragedy onto the Will-Alicia dynamic and Will\xe2\x80\x99s death will have lasting consequences for everyone, at both firms. If the show is, as the Kings have long held, about the education of Alicia Florrick, there are tough lessons to be had here. The March 16 episode (\xe2\x80\x9cA Few Words\xe2\x80\x9d) showed us an Alicia who was getting back into the law and facing numerous obstacles; Will offered her a lifeline and transformed her life when no one else would. With Will gone, those elevator doors have closed for the last time. And Alicia may have to force them open herself. That\xe2\x80\x99s progress for the character and for the show. And I defy anyone who sees his death as manipulative or cheap. It mattered to the audience and to the characters. Will won\xe2\x80\x99t be soon forgotten, and that\xe2\x80\x99s the best that any of us \xe2\x80\x94 fictional or real \xe2\x80\x94 can hope for.', 'airs Sundays at 9 p.m. on CBS.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Was That "Good Wife" Twist Cheap Or Profound?', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great!
