Title: A Lover And A Hater Debate The "Veronica Mars"åÊMovie
Description: ['BuzzFeed\xe2\x80\x99s Entertainment Editorial Director Jace Lacob and Chief Los Angeles Correspondent Kate Aurthur sat down to discuss the sequel film.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'They agreed on one thing. Maybe two.', '', '', 'Ah,', '. A long time ago, we used to be friends\xe2\x80\xa6 And I\xe2\x80\x99m honestly happy that the former teenage sleuth is back in the', 'feature film, which I quite enjoyed. Yes, I\xe2\x80\x99m one of those people who has watched all three season of the UPN-CW drama several times over, and that may have played a role in my feelings about the film. But I feel like, while you loved the show, you didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel the same way about the film?', 'Yes, I loved the show \xe2\x80\x94 or at least the first season, which I thought was close to perfect. After that, I found it sporadically great, with Kristen Bell being wonderful throughout, but the plots and her supporting cast hit-or-miss. (Season 3 was almost all miss, sadly.) As for the movie, I wanted to love it! And there were a few moments when I was transported and delighted, mostly, of course, because of Bell, who has worked steadily but hasn\xe2\x80\x99t yet equalled her', 'heights. I just thought it all felt so\xe2\x80\xa6 small. I had other problems with it, but let\xe2\x80\x99s leave it at that for now. What did you like about it?', 'Well, I\xe2\x80\x99ll be honest and say that the third season of', 'was\xe2\x80\xa6 not very good. But those first two seasons \xe2\x80\x94 which had really taut, byzantine mysteries \xe2\x80\x94 felt closer in spirit to the film, which offers some genuinely surprising twists and callbacks. But the false note that the show ended on doesn\xe2\x80\x99t diminish the pleasure that comes from catching up with Bell\xe2\x80\x99s Veronica and the rest of the characters in the film, such as Tina Majorino\xe2\x80\x99s Mac, Ryan Hansen\xe2\x80\x99s Dick, and Krysten Ritter\xe2\x80\x99s Gia. Yes, the movie is a bit of fan service (given that it was, well, entirely funded by the fans) and it certainly plays that way, even with the recap at the beginning designed to catch non-viewers up. (Are non-viewers going to see this movie? I doubt it.) And the film does offer a really fascinating look at how these characters have grown and changed in the time since the show concluded\xe2\x80\xa6 though Neptune seems just as trapped in its noir-tinged class warfare as before.', 'Before I criticize it, I want to say a few things I really liked about the movie. Have I mentioned Bell? Bell. Bell\xe2\x80\x99s a ringing, Bell on wheels, Bell and whistles, etc. Her delivery is sharp, and she punctuates everything she says with wit (but not wink), intelligence, and when the scene calls for it, a deep sadness. If only Rob Thomas \xe2\x80\x94 who created', 'and is responsible for its excellence, but has never directed a film before \xe2\x80\x94 didn\xe2\x80\x99t squash so many of her jokes with his clunky directing. But back to the praise! Bell and her co-star Jason Dohring, as Logan, still have chemistry, both romantically and by being able to throw ping-pong-fast dialogue at each other. Gaby Hoffmann and James Franco (playing himself) both have inventive little arcs. I also liked the continued menace in Neptune; and I liked the sense that the characters, whom we haven\xe2\x80\x99t seen for years, really have progressed in their lives \xe2\x80\x94 they\xe2\x80\x99re all kind of different now, imperceptibly but actually. But, Jace, didn\xe2\x80\x99t seeing the gang back together make you a little sad about the gang? The ensemble was fine for TV, but in a movie, I just got kind of depressed watching the Piz and Wallace of it all.', 'Warner Bros.', 'Warner Bros.', 'I\xe2\x80\x99ll agree with that: The Piz and Wallace of it all was depressing, in a way. I have nothing personally against Chris Lowell or Percy Daggs III, but if you compare their on-screen presence to that of Bell or Dohring, you can see the inequalities at play in a way. Just look at the dynamic between between Bell and Lowell and then compare it to the sizzle that happens every time Veronica and Logan are in a room together. But that\xe2\x80\x99s also an issue with how Piz as a character has been constructed and presented. He\xe2\x80\x99s not the most exciting choice \xe2\x80\x94 he\xe2\x80\x99s the safest choice. And I\xe2\x80\x99ll agree that there\xe2\x80\x99s an almost haphazard quality to the direction; at times the film seems to lag a little, but then individual scenes are themselves devoid of air. There\xe2\x80\x99s a deft sharpness to the dialogue and delivery (again, especially Bell\xe2\x80\x99s) that, yes, does get lost at times.', 'I feel like I\xe2\x80\x99m going to be able to convince you that this movie isn\xe2\x80\x99t very good. And maybe isn\xe2\x80\x99t even a movie! Which is actually my biggest feeling after having seen it.', 'Wait, wait, wait. How is this not a movie? It has a distinct narrative arc that focuses not only on Veronica but on the other Neptune-based characters; there\xe2\x80\x99s a mystery that progresses through a beginning, middle, and an end. (A rather interesting mystery, it ought to be said.) While that whodunit is rather shortform compared to, say, those within Season 1 and 2 of', ', it\xe2\x80\x99s a whodunit nonetheless, with the discovery of a crime (one with a connection to Veronica), multiple suspects, an investigation, and a resolution. And the film itself offers an ending of sorts (or a new beginning?) for the titular character, who returns to spelunk amid the noir underpinnings of the show. And, while imperfect, I quite liked the film!', 'The mystery is fine. Like, it\xe2\x80\x99s OK. But it didn\xe2\x80\x99t feel high stakes, even though there\xe2\x80\x99s supposed to be an entirely corrupt infrastructure within the town. There\xe2\x80\x99s no real jeopardy; the villains aren\xe2\x80\x99t scary. There\xe2\x80\x99s nothing that feels like an inventive leap from a season-long arc to a film-length one. It\xe2\x80\x99s student film-y, and a JV effort at that. It exists more for in-jokes and callbacks than for any other reason. The characters don\xe2\x80\x99t develop within the movie \xe2\x80\x94 if anything, the final lesson is that it\xe2\x80\x99s good', 'to go forward in your life. I fear that the key minds behind', 'have the same problem! (Yes, I feel horrible writing that out loud.)', 'KATE! I\xe2\x80\x99d ask if we saw the same film, but I was sitting next to you at the screening. And you seemed to enjoy it at the time! Yes, there are a lot of callbacks and in-jokes layered throughout the film and the notion of returning to one\xe2\x80\x99s past is clearly an intended theme, but I did feel as though the characters develop \xe2\x80\x94 or at least Veronica and Logan do, which is ultimately the central conceit here. I\xe2\x80\x99ll grant you this: The other characters are basically window dressing for the romantic arc. They\xe2\x80\x99re victims or villains, or collateral damage. And, as I said earlier, there is definitely a fan service element here.', '', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not like I was miserable watching it. I just wish it were on Showtime. I\xe2\x80\x99m torn about this whole return-from-the-dead thing in popular culture. On the one hand, I feel like if you love something, set it free \xe2\x80\x94 it\xe2\x80\x99s OK that things don\xe2\x80\x99t last as long as we might want, and as we know, that\xe2\x80\x99s much better than lasting too long. On the other hand, I support what my friend Robert Lloyd, a TV critic at', ', called', 'when writing about', '\xe2\x80\x99 Kickstarter project. If the creator and actors want it, and the fans want it, why not? I just wish for everyone that the final product achieved the heights the show could sometimes hit. It does not.', 'Well, that\xe2\x80\x99s a subjective metric, arguably. And perhaps there is a half-life to these types of projects: Over time, there\xe2\x80\x99s an exponential decay to the concept. Veronica as a teenage sleuth had a sort of Rian Johnson-', '-like noir: high school as hardboiled crime scene. Sometimes you can\xe2\x80\x99t go back and sometimes you shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t. Sometimes, these concepts have just run their course, even though they were potentially canceled before their time. The', 'film felt tonally similar to the series that birthed it in a way that', 'on Netflix certainly did not, in terms of feel or format. But my question is: Would it ever be possible for a spin-off feature film, one that clocks in at a scant two hours, to achieve what this show\xe2\x80\x99s narrative did in three seasons of character development?', 'I felt like', 'did a good job scaling the', 'story into what felt like a real movie. And to keep calling this frothy bit of foam \xe2\x80\x9cnoir\xe2\x80\x9d seems like self-hypnosis, Jace! Making a standalone movie out of a TV series is hard, there\xe2\x80\x99s no question. I guess I just want for Veronica (and', ') what Rob Thomas and the movie don\xe2\x80\x99t want: for her to move on. From Neptune, from Logan, from Piz. There\xe2\x80\x99s a whole world out there with new people in it.', 'That reminds me of something someone said to me long ago: \xe2\x80\x9cOur childhoods cannot be recovered, nor recovered from.\xe2\x80\x9d And that\xe2\x80\x99s the quest of most adults isn\xe2\x80\x99t it: to deny the gravitational pull of one\xe2\x80\x99s childhood and past and to struggle to move beyond it? Why should it be any different for Veronica? Neptune represents something dark and foreboding within her life, something to be confronted, and indeed recovered and recovered from.', '', 'Now you\xe2\x80\x99re sounding like the light-as-a-feather addiction metaphor Veronica uses throughout the movie to justify her inability to let go of things that really do seem to be bad for her. There\xe2\x80\x99s one joke in the movie when Veronica goes to her 10-year high school reunion and says to a queen bee-type (if we know her, I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t remember her): \xe2\x80\x9cI knew you\xe2\x80\x99d be here. You\xe2\x80\x99ve been sitting here since graduation, haven\xe2\x80\x99t you?\xe2\x80\x9d Sadly, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think Veronica is one to talk.', 'It was Madison Sinclair! She was switched at birth with Mac? She spit in Veronica\xe2\x80\x99s roofied drink at Shelly Pomeroy\xe2\x80\x99s party and gave it to Veronica way back when and Veronica then unknowingly had sex with Duncan? Ringing any bells? Madison was one of Veronica\xe2\x80\x99s tormentors\xe2\x80\xa6 and Veronica, despite her return to Neptune here, did get out. She gave up her life as a PI and got the hell out of that town. While I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to spoil the ending or the character arc here, sometimes it\xe2\x80\x99s important to confront your demons. Or Madison Sinclair, as it were.', 'I remember the name, and now I remember that plot. But I think we\xe2\x80\x99re both now just symbols of why this movie worked for you and not for me. If we can agree on one thing, perhaps it\xe2\x80\x99s this: God help anyone who sees this movie who hasn\xe2\x80\x99t watched the show.', 'We can most definitely agree on that. Even with the recap sequence at the top of the film, it is a particularly dense mythology to pierce without the aid of a guide, if you\xe2\x80\x99ve never seen the show. Certainly, some elements (such as the reunion between Veronica and Logan, or the bad blood between Keith and the sheriff\xe2\x80\x99s department) go over your head completely. Is it designed to get people to go back and watch the show for the first time after seeing the film? I\xe2\x80\x99m not sure it is.', 'It\xe2\x80\x99s not something a movie would do. I know you agree with me in your heart.', 'hits theaters Friday, March 14.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'A Lover And A Hater Debate The "Veronica Mars" Movie', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: ‰ÛÏMad Men‰Ûù Creator Matthew Weiner On The Show‰Ûªs Jet-Setting FinalåÊSeason
Description: ['The mastermind behind AMC\xe2\x80\x99s period drama tells BuzzFeed what to expect from the final go-around with the ad men and women before the April 13 premiere.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Over the course of its last six seasons, AMC\xe2\x80\x99s period drama', 'has taken the audience into the inner lives of the damaged ad men and women who glide through the 1960s often on a volatile mix of booze, self-loathing, and bad behavior. In the hands of its creator, Matthew Weiner, the show has offered a window into the souls of these characters, offering up their flaws and their virtues, their successes and their losses.', 'With the show concluding next year, it does feel as if it\xe2\x80\x99s the end of an era, both for its network AMC and for the television landscape as a whole, as well as Weiner, who will have spent 15 years of his life developing, writing, and bringing', 'to fruition. \xe2\x80\x9cI feel very lucky and I feel, at times, overwhelmed,\xe2\x80\x9d Weiner told BuzzFeed. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s so much work to do that it hasn\xe2\x80\x99t really hit me, but I am overwhelmed by this sector of my life coming to a close. It\xe2\x80\x99s pretty gigantic. I feel a lot of responsibility \xe2\x80\x94 no matter what the reaction is 24 hours afterward \xe2\x80\x94 that these 92 hours will fit together as a whole. It\xe2\x80\x99s a big piece of work done by hundreds of people and I\xe2\x80\x99m proud and surprised that I\xe2\x80\x99ve gotten to this point. And also, I feel really lucky that I get to end it on my own, without having the plug suddenly pulled or something. What a luxury. I keep talking about what a responsibility it is, but it\xe2\x80\x99s a luxury to be able to end the story how you want.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'As the Emmy Award-winning drama approaches its final season \xe2\x80\x94 with two seven-episode arcs set to air in April 2014 and April 2015 \xe2\x80\x94 Weiner spoke at length to BuzzFeed about', '\xe2\x80\x99s seventh season, wrapping up the show\xe2\x80\x99s narrative, and what lies ahead for Don Draper (Jon Hamm), Peggy Olson (Elisabeth Moss), and the rest of Sterling Cooper & Partners. What follows is an edited transcript of the conversation.', '', 'I mean, I\xe2\x80\x99m nine episodes into it. We\xe2\x80\x99re', 'confronting it. I\xe2\x80\x99m in a full-contact embrace with it! I don\xe2\x80\x99t think about it because I just want to treat it like a regular season on some level, and that\xe2\x80\x99s what I do in between. I\xe2\x80\x99m so exhausted at the end of one, that I just gotta recharge and see what\xe2\x80\x99s on my mind.', 'The interesting thing is that we came back with this split season, and I had this 14-episode story to tell, but what I didn\xe2\x80\x99t realize is that I would have to do two premieres and two finales in one season. On the one hand, you look at last season and say, \xe2\x80\x9cOK, the seventh hour of Season 6 was the merger. That\xe2\x80\x99d be a great place to stop.\xe2\x80\x9d We\xe2\x80\x99ve always organically had a midpoint in the show. This has required a little bit more focus. What it really comes down to is the responsibility of where we\xe2\x80\x99re going to leave everybody, and what we have to say \xe2\x80\x94 not just about these people\xe2\x80\x99s lives, but about the entire experience of the show on some level.', 'Of course. It\xe2\x80\x99s not something you can think about while you\xe2\x80\x99re working, but you do wonder if people will watch it for a long time. I think that the way the TV business is \xe2\x80\x94 the fact that my kids are watching', 'with me \xe2\x80\x94 it is possible to watch everything ever made. Whatever resonance it has \xe2\x80\x94 and it could go in style or out of style \xe2\x80\x94 it will, I think, be available, and that\xe2\x80\x99s the way to think about things.', '', 'No, and I\xe2\x80\x99m not going to say when it ends \xe2\x80\x94 you have to watch \xe2\x80\x94 but in my fantasy of the show going on this long, which I did not believe it would when I started it, I did want to cover a long period in these characters\xe2\x80\x99 lives, and unlike a lot of TV, not make it an abstract\xe2\x80\xa6 and keep doing stories and never have it move on. The intention of the show starting in 1960 was to reframe or revise people\xe2\x80\x99s concept of what it was like to live then, and show how similar it was to now, or how different it was \xe2\x80\x94 and all of the sex and all of the reframing of that, and not being', '. Still, I would hope we would look back on the show and look back on the people with nostalgia. And that is kind of satisfying to me, to have a long journey in the characters\xe2\x80\x99 lives where all these things happen to them. Their lives are very dramatic, granted, but there is an accumulative effect to it. That was my hope, to ask,', '? I\xe2\x80\x99m interested in the entire passage of time in these people\xe2\x80\x99s lives. When we started the show in April of 1960, it was clearly the height of the \xe2\x80\x9950s. Growing up, I graduated high school in the mid-\xe2\x80\x9980s, and drastic differences between the late \xe2\x80\x9970s and the early \xe2\x80\x9980s are not apparent until much later.', 'Well, I mean, the Beatles are just an incredible story, one that will be told over and over again, and we\xe2\x80\x99re not really telling that story. But to think about them, all the work they did before they came to the United States, and that they are gone by the end of this period. The leaps and bounds of creative expression that went on is pretty impressive. Looking at that last album, even though it\xe2\x80\x99s not the last album released, there is something about that medley that is, to me, the apex of the collaborative experience that they had as a band, the differences that they had as a band, and I just always loved that the album actually ends, almost like', 'did, in the middle of a song. It\xe2\x80\x99s just, \xe2\x80\x9cCut!\xe2\x80\x9d You know, that last note of \xe2\x80\x9cHer Majesty\xe2\x80\x9d? So I just admire it in artistic expressionism, looking at wrapping up the show. I\xe2\x80\x99m writing an ending, and it will, whether I like it or not, frame the entire 92-hour experience of the show in some way. So, I was impressed with how the Beatles dealt with that responsibility.', 'Jamie Trueblood / AMC', 'I\xe2\x80\x99d like to think that every season is the beginning of something new. Sometimes it takes a while for the audience to get used to that. But this was the beginning of the end. These are the last 14 hours of the show. They\xe2\x80\x99re pretty dense. We\xe2\x80\x99ve found that the desire to focus on the main characters is palpable because there\xe2\x80\x99s not a lot of real estate. Suddenly, 14 hours doesn\xe2\x80\x99t seem like that much. But it is a new story, as we do every season, but that story is our life story.', 'Well, that\xe2\x80\x99s the state of mind I want you to have when you watch the premiere. (', ') Obviously, we take the events of the show very seriously. They did happen to those characters and they do affect their lives. And a lot of what we\xe2\x80\x99re writing about in this final season is about consequences. That was a dire circumstance for Don professionally, a drastic situation for him personally, and it seemed that perhaps, that is the beginning of something. Or perhaps that\xe2\x80\x99s just an event, but it', 'a kind of reconciliation. And one of things that I\xe2\x80\x99ve been interested in this whole time is,', 'Not just,', ', but just because you feel different doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean that change is going to happen to everyone else. The other thing to look forward to, I think, is a new story, which is about our relationship with the material and the immaterial world. There is the reality of ambition, money, these things in our life that are material, and then the other part of our life: the internal world and the immaterial world. We\xe2\x80\x99ve sort of investigated that on some level in the past, but this last season is really, really about that. We\xe2\x80\x99ve seen the world through Don Draper\xe2\x80\x99s eyes and we\xe2\x80\x99ve watched Don Draper and that tension is something that we are really investigating in this last season.', '', 'The poster is derived from the story. We always have a conversation \xe2\x80\x94 Linda Schupack at AMC and myself \xe2\x80\x94 about what the next season is going to be about and this is the poster for half of the next season. Asking Milton Glaser to give us an abstract representation of something that is both psychedelic and art deco and Milton Glaser\xe2\x80\xa6 It was the creation of an ad for the show. It was the first time we used the icon of the character and it was a great way to say, \xe2\x80\x9cOK\xe2\x80\xa6 Don\xe2\x80\x99s in', 'world now.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'They certainly ended in a bad place and Peggy\xe2\x80\x99s personal life \xe2\x80\x94 like Don\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x94 remains a disaster: She stabbed her boyfriend; she had an affair with a married man, who dumped her; and she has work, and, you know, that\xe2\x80\x99s important to her. As for what\xe2\x80\x99s going to happen, you have to watch. Her story last season was really about not having any choices. She went out on her own to the new firm and the next thing she knows, the agencies have merged. And she has this relationship with Ted (Kevin Rahm), who respects her creatively besides being in love with her. And there\xe2\x80\x99s Don, who won\xe2\x80\x99t stand for it and does not have that relationship with her. We put her through that because we felt that\xe2\x80\x99s where she was. Professionally, she\xe2\x80\x99s OK. Is that enough? That\xe2\x80\x99s part of the story.', 'Jamie Trueblood / AMC', 'If they\xe2\x80\x99re in the gallery photos, they\xe2\x80\x99re gonna be in the show.', 'I think they should expect, as much as they can, to see our version of resolution. But what I\xe2\x80\x99m really interested in is the last chapter, not in these people\xe2\x80\x99s lives, but what', 'in these people\xe2\x80\x99s lives.', 'Take a first look at three images from the seventh and final season, released Tuesday by AMC.', '', '', '', 'The final season of', 'begins Sunday, April 13, at 10 p.m. on AMC.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"Mad Men" Creator Matthew Weiner On The Show\'s Jet-Setting Final Season', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: What If ‰ÛÏSeinfeld‰Ûù Had Used Suggested Hashtags?
Description: ['Don\xe2\x80\x99t forget to tweet using the hashtag #IWasInThePool.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '#MustSeeTV indeed.', '', 'creators Larry David and Jerry Seinfeld may have claimed that the show \xe2\x80\x94 which ran on NBC from 1989 to 1998 \xe2\x80\x94 was about nothing, but devotees of the beloved comedy know that that\xe2\x80\x99s not exactly true. Individual episodes centered around some facet of everyday life (from marble rye to a cologne that smells like you just came from the beach) and many of those so-called nothings have since become iconic moments in popular culture.', 'While Twitter didn\xe2\x80\x99t exist when', 'was on the air originally, imagine a world in which NBC could have guided our social media-based thoughts with those now-ubiquitous suggested hashtags that pop up every time you\xe2\x80\x99re watching a current television series.', 'From Season 1, Episode 1, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Seinfeld Chronicles\xe2\x80\x9d', 'From Season 2, Episode 6, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Chinese Restaurant\xe2\x80\x9d', 'From Season 2, Episode 13, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Deal\xe2\x80\x9d', 'From Season 3, Episode 1, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Note\xe2\x80\x9d', 'From Title: ‰ÛÏ12 Years A Slave‰Ûù Wins Best Picture And Makes OscarsåÊHistory
Description: ['Director Steve McQueen becomes the first black man to win an Academy Award for Best Picture.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'In the 86 years since The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences started handing out Oscars, not a single black man has been given a statuette associated with the Best Picture category. That changed on March 2 as director Steve McQueen accepted the Best Picture award for', '.', 'The film\xe2\x80\x99s win is remarkable not only for making Oscar history, but for how infrequently black people even have been nominated in this category \xe2\x80\x94 there have been a few previous nominations, including Quincy Jones for', ', Lee Daniels for', ', Broderick Johnson for', ', and Reginald Hudlin for', '.', 'Speaking in the press room backstage, McQueen said of the history of the win: \xe2\x80\x9cObviously, it\xe2\x80\x99s a mark of development. It\xe2\x80\x99s just obviously a progression. The background characters are now in the foreground and their lives are being recognized in a way, more ever than before. I think people are ready for this narrative. People want to look at this history. If we don\xe2\x80\x99t know our past, we\xe2\x80\x99ll never know our future.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'With the Academy\xe2\x80\x99s recent efforts at expanding', '\xe2\x80\x94 through membership and leadership (Cheryl Boone Isaacs became the first black president of the organization) \xe2\x80\x94 as well as recognizing diverse nominees and winners over the last 15 years, this win points to a hopeful broadening of voices and stories within filmmaking in general. And McQueen\xe2\x80\x99s win was accompanied by a win for Best Director for Latino Alfonso Cuar\xc3\xb3n for', ', another historic event.', 'Also, backstage,', 'producer Brad Pitt said, \xe2\x80\x9cI love this film and I love this filmmaking. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s important that we\xe2\x80\x99re dealing with our history. It\xe2\x80\x99s important that we understand our history, not for any kind of guilt, but so we can understand who we were so we can understand who we are.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'When John Ridley, who won the award for Best Adapted Screenplay for', '(based on Solomon Northup\xe2\x80\x99s 1853 memoir), was asked in the press room what it means to be the second black screenplay winner (the first being Geoffrey Fletcher for', '), he said, \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m very proud, I\xe2\x80\x99m very humble, and I\xe2\x80\x99m very hopeful for the future.\xe2\x80\x9d', '3.', 'Here\xe2\x80\x99s the', 'team celebrating the win!', 'AMPAS', '4.', '', '', 'buzzfeed.com', 'You are signed in as', '.', '"12 Years A Slave" Wins Best Picture And Makes Oscars History', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Title: ‰ÛÏThe Americans‰Ûù Season 2 Arrives Just As U.S.‰ÛÒRussian Relations TurnåÊIcy
Description: ['After Sochi, the wolf, the bitter protests, and human rights violations, the second season of the FX Cold War drama arrives at the perfect time to look back at failed Soviet ambitions.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Minor spoilers ahead.', '', '', 'With the closing of the Sochi Olympics earlier this week, Russia is on our collective minds once more: FX has rather cannily picked the perfect time to launch the second season of its gripping Cold War drama', ', which revolves around a set of married Soviet sleeper agents, Elizabeth (Keri Russell) and Philip Jennings (Matthew Rhys), in suburban 1980s Washington, D.C.', 'Yes,', 'has car chases and street brawls, silly wigs and costume changes (not to mention one scene in particular that pushes the boundaries of basic cable depictions of sexuality), but these elements are window dressing for what lies at the true heart of the series: an exploration of national and personal identity. While the show might depict the high-stakes Cold War skirmishes and battles between the U.S. and the Soviet Union, there is a canny investigation of ideology, loyalty, and self-identity unfolding within these characters, even as the collateral damage they create in their wake mounts.', 'The risky missions and the tradecraft that the Jenningses embrace \xe2\x80\x94 dead drops, legends, and sleeper cell mentalities \xe2\x80\x94 become emblematic for thwarted Soviet ambition. Until the Sochi Olympics, this intracountry strife and its secret wars seemed so far removed from our daily life, but', 'arrives at a time when Russia is once more at the forefront of the news cycle. The futility of these spies\xe2\x80\x99 operations is a tacit reminder of the fluidity of the international stage and the shortness of memory of its participants.', 'In the show\xe2\x80\x99s first season, the audience quickly learned the stakes for the Jenningses. They live on a seemingly placid street across from Stan Beeman (Noah Emmerich), who, coincidentally, is the FBI agent tasked with tracking down undercover KBG officers. And the duo is also in constant fear both of being unmasked and of having their children \xe2\x80\x94 Paige (Holly Taylor) and Henry (Keidrich Sellati), who initially have no idea what their parents are doing \xe2\x80\x94 taken from them.', 'FX', 'FX', 'And Season 2 of', ', which begins on Feb. 26, deepens the conflicts dramatically. These spies aren\xe2\x80\x99t just strangers to their children, but also to each other and, ultimately, to themselves. As Elizabeth and Philip doubt themselves and the choices they\xe2\x80\x99ve made (such as exposing their children to the corrupting influence of the West), their daughter Paige has positioned herself on a collision course with the truth, slowly realizing that her parents\xe2\x80\x99 odd behavior is somehow inexplicable. A Season 2 subplot involving a promise Elizabeth made to another couple pays off magnificently when it comes to her own desire to protect her children from the truth. It seems even Soviet spies believe that protecting their own means lying to them about the badness of the world outside.', 'is ultimately about the lies we tell each other and the even deadlier ones we tell ourselves. For all of Elizabeth\xe2\x80\x99s diligent planning and bloodthirsty resolve, it never dawned on her that Paige and Henry could themselves be in danger as a result of her and Philip\xe2\x80\x99s traitorous lifestyle and \xe2\x80\x94', '\xe2\x80\x94 the Jenningses quickly find themselves at risk from unseen enemies after a brutal attack reveals that their identities may be known. Even as Elizabeth\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty to Mother Russia never waivers (despite Philip\xe2\x80\x99s ongoing romance with the capitalist lures of the West), she agrees to take on a secret mission unknown to the Center that reflects her growing fears, as well as the knowledge that she and Philip have perhaps irrevocably put their children in jeopardy.', 'Philip tries to juggle the resurrection of his relationship with Elizabeth with that of his faux-marriage to mousy FBI secretary Martha (Alison Wright), whom he is using to spy on her employers and Stan. There\xe2\x80\x99s something deeply satisfying about seeing Philip explore his rapport with Martha by enacting behaviors that Elizabeth could never countenance. Which is the real Philip: the one at home with his wife and kids, or the \xe2\x80\x9canimal\xe2\x80\x9d bedding Martha under false pretenses?', 'Russell is once more at the top of her game as the complex, deadly Elizabeth. Recovering from her gunshot wound she received at the end of last season, Russell\xe2\x80\x99s Elizabeth willingly thrusts herself once more into harm\xe2\x80\x99s way. But despite the scars she carries, Elizabeth remains a hauntingly terrifying figure even as Rhys cuts a (largely) sympathetic one; Russell delivers one scene in particular that positions her character as a figure of menace, a crowbar at her side. And now that the will-they-or-won\xe2\x80\x99t-they-get-back-together tension between Elizabeth and Philip has been resolved (for the time being, anyway), Rhys and Russell are given new challenges to overcome as they square off as husband and wife, particularly as Rhys\xe2\x80\x99 Philip finds that the Clark persona affords him a chance to transgress, a notion that troubles Elizabeth \xe2\x80\x94 certainly no stranger to using her sexuality in service of her cause \xe2\x80\x94 to no end.', 'FX', 'FX', 'Their pas de deux is echoed in the tortured relationship between Stan and Nina (Annet Mahendru), his former mole inside the Residence and now a double agent working for the Soviets, as his own marriage continues to crumble. The always-compelling Emmerich and Mahendru \xe2\x80\x94 a true breakout star this season \xe2\x80\x94 fill their scenes together with a deep undercurrent of tension. What will happen when Stan learns the truth about his beautiful Russian mistress? As for Nina, can she ever regain her sense of equilibrium after being betrayed by the man she loved, a man that she learned can lie right to her face after they\xe2\x80\x99ve made love?', 'posits that every dynamic is rooted in deception.', 'But is it possible to root for communist infiltrators? Absolutely, or at the very least to feel sympathy for their doomed mission, given that we know how this coldest of wars turned out in the end. What happens specifically to Elizabeth and Philip remains hazily unclear at this point, but the endgame remains distinctly clear as they must ultimately fail: The Soviet Union crumbles, and the U.S. emerges the victor in this particular war of wills. And the second season of', 'finds Jenningses pushed against a wall in more ways than one as new enemies emerge and old rivals return.', 'This all compounds to create an almost vertiginous tone within the', '\xe2\x80\x99 second season. The first five episodes of Season 2 press point toward this season being a particularly strong one, with some electrifying narrative arcs jumpstarted within the first episode. It took the first season a few episodes to find itself, but Season 2 of', 'quickly coalesces into a taut and unpredictable sequence of episodes. There\xe2\x80\x99s a sense of danger and intrigue embedded within these upcoming installments that remind the viewer that, while these events may be rooted in the semi-distant past, the show\xe2\x80\x99s nuanced explorations of the concerns of the family and of the self remain provocatively contemporary.', 'Season 2 of', 'begins Wednesday, Feb. 26 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on FX.', 'You are signed in as', '.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe Americans\xe2\x80\x9d Season 2 Arrives Just As U.S.\xe2\x80\x93Russian Relations Turn Icy', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: "Parks And Recreation" Webisode Offers Scintillating Debate With The HapleyåÊGroup
Description: ['Ya\xe2\x80\x99 heard, Perd?']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'BuzzFeed has a first look at the new', 'webisode, which revolves around Pawnee\xe2\x80\x99s favorite news anchor and most notable pundits.', '', '', 'NBC has given BuzzFeed a first look at the new', 'webisode, \xe2\x80\x9cThe Hapley Group,\xe2\x80\x9d which looks at Pawnee\xe2\x80\x99s (very) late-night cable access news magazine program of the same name.', 'Airing from 2:45 to 6:15 a.m.,', 'has local newscaster Perd Hapley (Jay Jackson) welcoming some of Pawnee\xe2\x80\x99s most recklessly opinionated pundits \xe2\x80\x94 including', '\xe2\x80\x99s Joan Callamezzo (Mo Collins), Crazy Ira (Matt Besser), The Douche (Nick Kroll), and a new character, conservative firebrand Mike Patterson (Seth Morris) of', '\xe2\x80\x94 as they discuss the hot topics of the day. In this case, these titans of thought debate a ban on public smoking, the Olympics, and Obamacare.', 'Not surprisingly, Joan Callamezzo had some strong thoughts on the public smoking ban in Pawnee, Ind.', 'NBC', 'Perd did not.', 'NBC', 'And there\xe2\x80\x99s even a commercial for the Pawnee Farmers\xe2\x80\x99 Market After Dark and the infamous Chardbodies.', 'NBC', 'You can watch BuzzFeed\xe2\x80\x99s first look at', '\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cThe Hapley Group\xe2\x80\x9d below.', 'airs Thursdays at 8:30 p.m. on NBC. Title: Watch The First 12 Minutes Of SundanceTV‰Ûªs ‰ÛÏThe RedåÊRoad‰Ûù
Description: ['Get a sneak peek at the latest original drama series from the network behind', ',', ', and', ', exclusively on BuzzFeed.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Khal Drogo alert!', '', 'Sundance Channel', 'Sundance Channel', 'Sundance Channel', 'SundanceTV \xe2\x80\x94 the sister network to cable heavyweight AMC \xe2\x80\x94 has been on a roll in the last year, launching such gripping thrillers as Jane Campion\xe2\x80\x99s gorgeous', ', the riveting parolee drama', '(which I named the', '), and its', '.', 'Later this month, the network will launch its latest original drama', ', created by Aaron Guzikowski (who wrote last year\xe2\x80\x99s', '). Set in a small community in upstate New York,', 'depicts the deep racial tensions between white locals and the members of a Native American tribe, who live in the nearby mountains and are unrecognized by the federal government. Local sheriff Harold Jensen (', '\xe2\x80\x99s Martin Henderson) attempts to keep the peace, even as he finds himself drawn into the conflict between the two groups, a conflict that has deep personal roots both for Jensen and his brittle wife, Jean (', '\xe2\x80\x99s Julianne Nicholson), as well as a dangerous local thug Phillip Kopus (', '\xe2\x80\x99 Jason Momoa), whose pasts are linked through tragedy and loss. As Jensen struggles to keep his troubled family together, a series of events threatens to unleash unspeakable violence.', 'Oh, and did I mention that the show also features Lisa Bonet and Tom Sizemore, the latter of whom plays a shadowy drug lord? But it\xe2\x80\x99s the presence of Momoa \xe2\x80\x94 whose predatory glare as Kopus is enough to freeze one\xe2\x80\x99s blood \xe2\x80\x94 that infuses', 'with moments of brutality and foreboding.', 'You can watch the first 12 minutes of', 'below, courtesy of our friends at SundanceTV.', 'begins Thursday, Feb. 27 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on SundanceTV.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Watch The First 12 Minutes Of SundanceTV\'s "The Red Road"', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'fans, mark your calendars: On Tuesday, Feb. 4 at 11 a.m. ET/8 a.m. PT, BuzzFeed will premiere a brand-new', 'trailer.', 'The highly-anticipated action-adventure film, based upon the book series by', ', is set in a future where people are sorted into', '. And those who fail to be categorized \xe2\x80\x94 like Tris Prior (Shailene Woodley) \xe2\x80\x94 are deemed \xe2\x80\x9cDivergent.\xe2\x80\x9d But when Tris uncovers a dark conspiracy to destroy all \xe2\x80\x9cDivergents,\xe2\x80\x9d she must discover why these outcasts pose such a threat to society.', 'In addition to Woodley, the movie, which arrives in theaters on March 21, stars Theo James, Kate Winslet, Maggie Q, Ashley Judd, Tony Goldwyn, Mekhi Phifer, and Miles Teller.', 'Take a look at a 15-second teaser before BuzzFeed unveils the newest', 'trailer on Feb. 4:', 'will open in theaters and IMAX on March 21, 2014.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'All-New "Divergent" Trailer Will Debut Exclusively On BuzzFeed On Feb. 4', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions.
