Title: Live Updates: Ferguson Braces For Grand Jury‰ÛªsåÊDecision
Description: ['St. Louis County prosecutor is expected to announce at 8 p.m. CT Monday whether the grand jury decided to indict police Officer Darren Wilson for the shooting death of Michael Brown.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon issued a state of emergency last week, calling up the National Guard to assist local law enforcement.', '', '', 'What We Know So Far', 'Updates', '', '', 'LAPD on tactical alert in response to looming grand jury decision.', 'The Los Angeles Police Department went on a citywide tactical alert Monday ahead of the decision from the grand jury tasked with deciding whether to indict Officer Darren Wilson.', 'The move, said LAPD Officer Drake Madison, allows the department to keep officers from an earlier shift available.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe hold on to (officers) a little bit longer to monitor what\xe2\x80\x99s going on,\xe2\x80\x9d Madison said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe will not and cannot condone violence and vandalism, but we do want to help people express their opinions.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Also on Monday, pastors of the Praises of Zion Baptist Church held a press conference with the LAPD calling for peaceful demonstrations.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe are expecting the best, but prepared for the worst,\xe2\x80\x9d Madison said.', '', '', 'St. Louis County Police Chief Jon Belmar said Monday evening that his primary concern was the safety of residents.', '', '', 'Protests began Monday evening in several locations around Ferguson.', '', '', 'Gov. Jay Nixon called Monday afternoon for \xe2\x80\x9cpeace, respect, and restraint.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Nixon described spending time with Ferguson residents as well as speaking with faith leaders and law enforcement in the area.', '\xe2\x80\x9cTogether, we are all focused on making sure the resources are on hand to protect lives, protect property and protect free speech,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'St. Louis County Executive Charlie Dooley echoed the governor\xe2\x80\x99s focus on protecting public safety and First Amendment rights.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI do not want people to think they need to barricade their doors or take up arms,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are not that kind of community.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'St. Louis Mayor Francis Slay pointed to Sunday night\xe2\x80\x99s protest in Shaw as a success. There, protesters temporarily blocked traffic with only two instances of vandalism, and no serious injuries, he said.', 'Protesters may again be allowed to slow traffic, he said, and residents who disagreed with them should be prepared for some inconveniences.', '\xe2\x80\x9cTurning violent or damaging property will not be tolerated,\xe2\x80\x9d he said.', 'Dan Isom, director of the state\xe2\x80\x99s department of public safety, said law enforcement had spent the last months training and preparing for Monday night\xe2\x80\x99s announcement.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe plan is designed for all contingencies,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, \xe2\x80\x9cbut we hope that officers will only observe peaceful protests.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Watch the full press conference here.', '', '', '', 'The St. Louis County prosecutor\xe2\x80\x99s office said Monday it will release evidence heard by the grand jury if Officer Darren Wilson is not indicted,', '.', 'Prosecutor Bob McCulloch had promised for months to release the evidence in the interest of transparency. He previously sought a court order for permission, but on Monday, his office said he would release it regardless of any action by a judge.', '', '', 'The Missouri Fraternal Order of Police announced it was taking its website down, citing \xe2\x80\x9csecurity concerns.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '', '', 'Quiet in Ferguson ahead of news of the grand jury decision, reports BuzzFeed News\xe2\x80\x99 Joel Anderson.', '', '', 'All public school districts in Ferguson announced that classes would be canceled on Tuesday.', '', '', '', '', 'Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon planned to speak Monday evening in advance of an announcement of the grand jury\xe2\x80\x99s decision.', 'A number of area school districts canceled activities in advance of the announcement.', 'Some businesses also closed their doors and boarded up windows.', 'Officials prepared the area around the courthouse for potential protests, and', '.', 'Still, the Ferguson Public Library vowed to stay open.', 'A number of churches also said they would provide safe haven.', '', '', 'St. Louis County Police asked for donations of gift cards and other items on Monday for its officers preparing to work during protests in Ferguson.', '', '', '', 'Prosecutor\xe2\x80\x99s office confirms decision to be announced Monday.', 'The St. Louis County grand jury has heard months of evidence concerning the confrontation between Brown, 18, who is black, and Wilson, who is white.', '', '', 'Attorney says decision to be announced Monday evening.', 'Attorney for Michael Brown\xe2\x80\x99s family, Benjamin Crump, told the Associated Press that the St. Louis County prosecutor\xe2\x80\x99s office said the grand jury has made its decision whether to indict Darren Wilson for the shooing of the unarmed teen.', 'The grand jury has been considering a number of possible charges in connection with the Aug. 9 shooting including first-degree murder, second-degree murder, voluntary manslaughter or involuntary manslaughter.', '', '', 'Several news organizations, including', 'and the', ', are reporting that a decision has been reached by the grand jury on whether to charge Darren Wilson. A press conference by the St. Louis County prosecutor is expected Monday.', '', 'While it is reported there will be an announcement that a decision has been reached, it is still unclear if the actual decision will be released on Monday.', '', '', 'Officer Darren Wilson gets married.', 'While the grand jury deliberated about whether to charge Darren Wilson with fatally shooting Michael Brown and protesters\xe2\x80\x99 questioned the officer\xe2\x80\x99s whereabouts, he had secretly been planning a wedding.', 'A public information official at the Department of Revenue Recorder of Deeds confirmed to BuzzFeed News that Officer Darren Wilson entered the St. Louis County office in October in Clayton, Missouri (a 20-minute drive from Ferguson), to obtain a marriage license.', 'On Oct. 24, he was wed to 37-year-old Barbara Spradling, also a Ferguson police officer. Greg Kloeppel, one of Wilson\xe2\x80\x99s attorneys, attended the ceremony.', 'Public records indicate that the couple had previously been married; the divorce settled in November 2013. They currently own a home together in Crestwood, Missouri, roughly 17 miles away from Ferguson.', 'Meanwhile, on Sunday, Michael Brown, Sr. and his wife, Cal, were', 'at West Calvary Mission Baptist Church. It was an event that the entire family, including Michael Brown, Jr., had planned several months ago.', '', '', 'Officer Darren Wilson has been', 'with major television personalities to negotiate an interview.', 'This is a developing story. Check back for updates and follow', 'on Twitter.', "Live Updates: Ferguson Braces For Grand Jury's Decision", 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Michael Brown‰Ûªs Neighborhood In Ferguson IsåÊDying
Description: ['No matter what decision the grand jury makes, the residents of Michael Brown\xe2\x80\x99s apartment complex have made up their minds \xe2\x80\x94 they want out']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '.', '\xe2\x80\x94 Four months ago, Jenay Robinson and her two cousins looked at a modest two-bedroom apartment for only $550 a month in the Canfield Green Apartments.', 'Sure, the Canfield Green area was known as a hotbed of drugs and crime. But Jenay, a 19-year-old community college student and Steak \xe2\x80\x98n Shake employee, didn\xe2\x80\x99t have a lot of options.', 'She and her cousins signed a one-year lease on Aug. 1.', 'Eight days later, Michael Brown, their friend and onetime classmate, lay bleeding to death outside their new apartment.', '\xe2\x80\x9cOur first month here was hell,\xe2\x80\x9d Jenay said a few days ago.', 'They wanted out \xe2\x80\x94 and they were not alone. Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death has caused Canfield Green, long troubled by drugs, crime, and aggressive policing, to hemorrhage tenants. About a dozen residents interviewed over the past week were unanimous: Anyone who can leave is doing so.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI will say a lot of residents have moved out over the past several months,\xe2\x80\x9d said Randy Lipton, president of the St. Louis-based Lipton Group, which owns Canfield Green. He declined to give figures, but only 60% of the apartment\xe2\x80\x99s 450 units were occupied as of Friday, according to an employee in the leasing office who didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to be identified. While she wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t say how much the occupancy rate had fallen since August, she did say, \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s down.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Parking lots are virtually empty. Unkempt shrubbery reaches through the chain-link fence that rings the perimeter of the complex. At least one building has no signs of life at all \xe2\x80\x94 there are no cars in front, and all the windows along the back remain dark at night. Canfield Green often looks abandoned.', 'A new round of protests are expected at the apartment complex and throughout Ferguson after a St. Louis-area grand jury decides whether to indict Darren Wilson, the white police officer who killed the 18-year-old Brown. The decision is expected any day.', 'Canfield Green\xe2\x80\x99s remaining residents are playing a familiar role in an old American racial drama. They fled to this suburb of 21,000 to escape the perils of the city, only to watch whites retreat even further to the outer suburbs, taking the promise of economic prosperity with them. Now Canfield Green\xe2\x80\x99s residents find themselves trapped in the same kind of segregated, violent, deteriorating neighborhood they had hoped to leave behind.', 'That process took years, but since Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death, the change at Canfield Green has been swift and ominous. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a ghost town over here now,\xe2\x80\x9d said David Whitt, a 35-year-old married father of three who\xe2\x80\x99s lived here for a year and a half. \xe2\x80\x9cNobody wants to live like this.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Brown was shot walking through the complex where he was living with his grandmother. Hundreds of residents saw his body lie for four hours in the street under the hot August sun \xe2\x80\x94 and they cannot escape the memory. In the middle of Canfield Drive, near the very center of the apartments, dozens of people come every day to visit the makeshift memorials: mounds of stuffed toy animals, potted flowers, and candles. Some take pictures or record short videos of the memorials, one in the median of the two-lane street that runs through the complex and the other at the base of a nearby light pole. Other visitors leave a memento of their own, maybe another teddy bear or perhaps a baseball cap. A few take in the morose scene silently.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThis used to be a beautiful community,\xe2\x80\x9d said a 68-year-old man who\xe2\x80\x99s lived at Canfield Green for 18 years and didn\xe2\x80\x99t wish to be identified. \xe2\x80\x9cThen we went through a cycle of drugs, crack, and then marijuana, and now back to crack. I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t recommend anyone move over here.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'In the 1960s, Ferguson annexed a wide swath of property near Canfield Drive and West Florissant Avenue. Canfield Green, which opened in 1978, was one of four large complexes clustered in this isolated corner of town.', 'Initially, Canfield Green was considered a safe and affordable option for middle-class people looking to eventually buy a home in the area. The complex had as many whites as blacks through the 1980s, former and current residents say.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt was a nice, diverse group of tenants,\xe2\x80\x9d said Hubert Hoosman Jr., a black real estate consultant in Ferguson who lived at the complex in its first couple of years. \xe2\x80\x9cI had lots of white neighbors. It was very well maintained.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'By the end of the decade, relentless socioeconomic forces swept through the St. Louis area. Many whites in Ferguson continued their migration to the outer suburbs while black residents took their place seeking better schools, nicer stores, safer streets, and more promising work.', 'A recent report by the NAACP\xe2\x80\x99s Legal Defense Fund notes that Ferguson was 85% white and 14% black in 1980; today, Ferguson is 29% white and 67% black, according to the 2010 Census. \xe2\x80\x9cThese rapid demographic changes \xe2\x80\x94 and the discriminatory practices that enabled their development \xe2\x80\x94 laid the groundwork for the racial tension that has surfaced in Ferguson,\xe2\x80\x9d', '.', 'Black people in America are always attempting to escape segregation, while white people often flee when blacks move into their neighborhoods. \xe2\x80\x9cOnce a place gets about 35% black, it\xe2\x80\x99s probably going to be 90% black,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jeff Smith, a former Missouri state senator and urban policy professor at the New School in New York, whose observation is supported by', '. \xe2\x80\x9cI just watched it happen in neighborhood after neighborhood. You could see it happening in Ferguson too.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Today, Canfield Green sits in the midst of one of Ferguson\xe2\x80\x99s most troubled areas. A', '', 'of crime data found that the relatively small area along West Florissant Avenue and east of it \xe2\x80\x94 the site of the most violent clashes between protesters and police following Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death \xe2\x80\x94 accounted for nearly a fifth of all serious crimes reported in Ferguson between January 2010 and August 2012.', 'That area, located on the very fringe of the town\xe2\x80\x99s boundaries, is mostly composed of four apartment complexes: Canfield Green, Northwinds, Oakmont, and The Versailles. They have little in common with the town\xe2\x80\x99s neighborhoods of mostly single-family homes, but now, perhaps more than ever, their fates are linked.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe prices on existing listings have been coming down very rapidly,\xe2\x80\x9d said Claire Jackson, a real estate agent who\xe2\x80\x99s trying to sell a two-bedroom home about a mile from the apartments. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd sales were already slow in the area.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Luring new tenants is virtually impossible at Canfield Green, where some who live in the complex estimate occupancy has dropped to somewhere between 25% and 50% despite the front office\xe2\x80\x99s claims.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWho wants to live in someplace like this?\xe2\x80\x9d said Lauera Smith, a 24-year-old unemployed college graduate who\xe2\x80\x99s lived here since February. \xe2\x80\x9cThis was a last resort. I didn\xe2\x80\x99t have anywhere else to go.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Those who remain say many of their neighbors left following the protests in August or were evicted because they lost their jobs and could no longer afford the rent.', 'It was an exceptionally rough stretch. Tear gas and gunshots filled the air almost every night in the weeks after Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death. Canfield Drive, the narrow street that runs through the complex, was clogged with protesters. Police closed off nearly all access points to the apartments with concrete barriers and fencing, hoping to frustrate demonstrators who came from out of town. That left some residents trapped, making it hard to get to work or school, let alone run errands.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt was very hectic,\xe2\x80\x9d said Reggie Rounds, a 57-year-old community activist who moved out of the complex in September. \xe2\x80\x9cWe had problems just every day existing. It changed everything in the community.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cLike many businesses in Ferguson, we have experienced severe hardship and struggle,\xe2\x80\x9d said Lipton, president of the company that owns Canfield Green. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are doing what we can to support our employees and residents. Our residents just want to return to normal, and obviously it\xe2\x80\x99s very difficult given the circumstances.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The company is still working to rent out its remaining units. On its website and Craigslist, it boasts of Canfield Green\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cbeautiful rolling hills with fitness trail,\xe2\x80\x9d individual balconies, large dine-in kitchens, and access to public transportation, among other amenities. \xe2\x80\x9cYou will be AMAZED by the out-of-this-world space,\xe2\x80\x9d says one ad. \xe2\x80\x9cStay calm and rent at Canfield Green,\xe2\x80\x9d says another. \xe2\x80\x9cYou can have it all,\xe2\x80\x9d', 'on the Lipton Group\xe2\x80\x99s website.', '', 'As bad as the previous months, nay, years, have been, Canfield Green\xe2\x80\x99s remaining residents fear what could happen to their homes following the grand jury\xe2\x80\x99s decision.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99re going to burn this motherfucker down,\xe2\x80\x9d predicted Robinson. She didn\xe2\x80\x99t specify whether she meant protesters or the police.', 'Either way, the tension is palpable. Residents inspect unfamiliar cars that idle in the parking lots. Others have encouraged their neighbors to shut out the media who are constantly recording footage near the memorials set up for Brown. Some believe that management is actively looking for reasons to evict them now.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think that\xe2\x80\x99s true at all,\xe2\x80\x9d Lipton said.', 'A handful of residents have organized Canfield Watchmen, a loose group that encourages neighbors to record encounters with police.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe were teargassed out of our whole neighborhood,\xe2\x80\x9d said Whitt, a spokesman for the organization. \xe2\x80\x9cWe have to look out for each other. It\xe2\x80\x99s open season on us n****s now.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'No matter what happens in the aftermath of the grand jury\xe2\x80\x99s decision, many of the remaining residents of Canfield Green have made up their minds.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI hate it,\xe2\x80\x9d said Tamera Cole, a 22-year-old who said her lease expires in February. \xe2\x80\x9cI can\xe2\x80\x99t wait to get out of here, just like everyone else.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Brown\xc3\xa2\xc2\x80\xc2\x99s Neighborhood In Ferguson Is Dying', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Ferguson Braces For An ‰ÛÏUprising‰Ûù
Description: ['Ahead of the grand jury\xe2\x80\x99s decision whether to indict Officer Darren Wilson for killing Mike Brown, cops are stockpiling weapons while organizers are trying to stop tensions from flaring into violence', 'Almost no one thinks things are getting better.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '.', '', 'FERGUSON, Missouri \xe2\x80\x94 At long last, virtually all Ferguson residents \xe2\x80\x94 black and white, young and old, rich and poor \xe2\x80\x94 have come to agree on something: Darren Wilson, the police officer who shot and killed 18-year-old Michael Brown this August, will not be indicted.', 'That consensus \xe2\x80\x94 remarkable in a town that was', '\xe2\x80\x94 can be seen in preparations that seem better suited for an impending war: boarded-up stores, daily non-violent training sessions across town, law enforcement agencies stockpiling riot gear and tear gas, and a governor who has said the National Guard will be on standby.', 'To be sure, the St. Louis County grand jury could decide to indict Wilson. The jurors \xe2\x80\x94 nine white and three black \xe2\x80\x94 have heard testimony for three months, part of prosecuting attorney Bob McCullouch\xe2\x80\x99s promise to present \xe2\x80\x9cabsolutely everything.\xe2\x80\x9d As the', '', ', McCullouch has chosen a highly irregular process that more resembles a jury trial, perhaps in an effort to shift responsibility for the decision to the jury instead of his office.', 'But whatever eventually happens to Wilson, the current collective belief about his fate exposes a deeper resignation: The rift between public officials and the black community here has not healed since the protests in August, and few expect that to change.', 'Maybe even more than the killing of Brown, many people here say, the undiminished hostility between police and black citizens has fueled a volatile mix of emotions.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI just get the feeling that it\xe2\x80\x99s going to get worse,\xe2\x80\x9d said Alma Morrow, a black clerk at a boarded-up beauty supply store on West Florissant Avenue, the site of the most violent clashes between protesters and police following Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death in August.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt goes beyond Mike Brown now. People over here are really mad,\xe2\x80\x9d Morrow said.', '', 'In the days following Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death, police fired tear gas, pepper spray, and rubber bullets at protesters \xe2\x80\x94 and faced criticism for their militarized approach.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWhat we\xe2\x80\x99ve seen so far is that if there\xe2\x80\x99s a little bit of violence, a real violent reaction to that can be worse,\xe2\x80\x9d said Peter Joy, a professor of criminal justice at Washington University in St. Louis. \xe2\x80\x9cI hope [police] respond in a way that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t escalate things. I hope they\xe2\x80\x99ve learned from the last time.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But while law enforcement agencies have met with several groups of protesters and undergone additional training in recent months, they\xe2\x80\x99ve also primed themselves for conflict.', 'The Missouri Highway Patrol has bought more shields and equipment, St. Louis metro police has spent nearly $100,000 on riot gear and repairs to damaged police vehicles, and St. Louis city police', 'upgrading helmets, sticks, and other \xe2\x80\x9ccivil disobedience equipment,\xe2\x80\x9d Police Chief Sam Dotson told the Associated Press.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe want the public to know that we are fully committed to preventing law breakers from threatening public safety,\xe2\x80\x9d St. Louis County Police Chief Jon Belmar said at the news conference with Nixon.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThese measures are not being taken because we expect problems,\xe2\x80\x9d said Nixon, who nonetheless said that he was prepared to call on the National Guard in the event of what he called an \xe2\x80\x9cuprising.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cTo all Missourians, to people around the country and around the world, we are going to keep this region safe,\xe2\x80\x9d Nixon said. \xe2\x80\x9cAs I\xe2\x80\x99ve said before: Violence will not be tolerated.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The authorities are hardly the only ones girding for conflict. Near where the worst violence was this summer, many businesses began boarding up windows weeks ago.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s going to be chaos,\xe2\x80\x9d said Mike Jacob, a clerk at Sam\xe2\x80\x99s Meat Market and More on West Florissant Avenue, a major thoroughfare where protests took place nightly and several stores were looted in the weeks after Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death. At Sam\xe2\x80\x99s, they earned their skepticism the hard way: The store was ransacked twice during riots in August.', 'Six local school district superintendents are so concerned about potential violence that they sent a letter to McCulloch asking him to announce the grand jury decision after 5 p.m. or on a weekend, preferably a Sunday when schools typically don\xe2\x80\x99t host events or activities. Fear has also driven up business at gun stores across the area.', '\xe2\x80\x9cSales are off the charts,\xe2\x80\x9d said Steven King, a white owner of Metro Shooting Supplies in Bridgeton, a mostly white suburb about 10 miles from Ferguson. He held up a stack of about 100 new applications for the federal background check needed to buy a weapon. \xe2\x80\x9cPeople are in fear of their lives. They\xe2\x80\x99re just scared to death. The rumors are that every single area is a threat.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'St. Louis routinely has one of the nation\xe2\x80\x99s highest violent crime rates, but Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death was the only homicide in Ferguson this year.', 'At least a few locals worry that all of these very public preparations for violent protests could be a self-fulling prophecy. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t think the reaction would have been as violent as what everyone is thinking,\xe2\x80\x9d said Hubert H. Hoosman Jr., who is black and owns a real estate consulting firm a few blocks from Ferguson\xe2\x80\x99s police station. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I do worry what it says that everyone keeps talking about it as if it\xe2\x80\x99s a given.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Not far from Hoosman\xe2\x80\x99s business is a store bearing an \xe2\x80\x9cI Love Ferguson\xe2\x80\x9d sign. The signs are part of a larger movement \xe2\x80\x94 mostly supported by white residents \xe2\x80\x94 within the town to push back against protesters and black residents\xe2\x80\x99 allegations of entrenched racial problems in Ferguson. Inside, the store\xe2\x80\x99s volunteers \xe2\x80\x94 all of them Ferguson residents \xe2\x80\x94 could barely contain their frustration.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI feel like we\xe2\x80\x99re being held hostage\xe2\x80\x9d by the protests, said Dorothy Kaiser, a white 78-year-old Ferguson native. \xe2\x80\x9cWe shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have to board up our windows.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'With Brown\xe2\x80\x99s killing, Ferguson joined a list of cities including Jasper, Texas; Jena, Louisiana; and Sanford, Florida, where racially charged incidents have shattered the illusion of racial harmony, exposing stark disparities and long-simmering resentments.', 'In Ferguson, whites comprise only 29% of the population, but they make up five of the six city council members, six of the seven school board members, and 50 of the 53 police officers. In the heat of the protests this summer, many black residents hoped for change. But now, with virtually everyone girding for more conflict, that hope has regressed to something more familiar: resignation.', 'Among many of Ferguson\xe2\x80\x99s black citizens, there\xe2\x80\x99s a pessimism born of years of grievances routinely ignored by most of Ferguson\xe2\x80\x99s white residents and by the town\xe2\x80\x99s predominantly white government. Those grievances include an off-year election calendar found to depress black voter turnout, a criminal justice system often used to prop up the town\xe2\x80\x99s budget by overpolicing traffic infractions (and then imposing late fees and interest), and a police force that has developed a reputation for using excessive force,', 'compiled by the NAACP\xe2\x80\x99s Legal Defense Fund.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe have a very corrupt system,\xe2\x80\x9d said Reggie Rounds, a former resident of the Canfield Green apartment complex where Brown was killed.', 'After Brown\xe2\x80\x99s death, and even at his funeral, community leaders pushed voter registration efforts. But on Election Day, Ferguson came up short: CNN', 'that only 204 residents registered to vote between Aug. 11, the Monday after Brown was shot, and Oct. 8, the registration deadline for the November election. Overall, only 42% of Ferguson\xe2\x80\x99s registered voters cast a ballot in the Nov. 4 election, which lagged behind the county\xe2\x80\x99s overall turnout rate of 44%.', 'Right now, much of the community organizing in Ferguson is focused not on hopes for long-term change but on fears of imminent violence. On Tuesday night, in a clammy church basement near Ferguson, Lisa Fithian took about 75 volunteers through three hours of exercises meant to prevent a violent conflict with police.', 'Fithian, who has organized non-violent protests around the country for more than 40 years, emphasized staying calm if officers meet them in the streets with riot gear, batons, and tear gas.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWe know they\xe2\x80\x99re trying to set us up,\xe2\x80\x9d Fithian said, \xe2\x80\x9cand we can\xe2\x80\x99t take the bait.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Almost Everyone In Ferguson Thinks Officer Darren Wilson Will Get Off', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: The Two MichaelåÊSams
Description: ['Michael Sam Jr. doesn\xe2\x80\x99t talk to his father, who has been caricatured in the press as an anti-gay man who abandoned his family.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'But there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot more to the story.', 'In a yellow-walled room in a Texas nursing home this July, a man in a wheelchair watched a flat-screen TV. He saw Michael Sam Jr. kiss his boyfriend and hug his small team of supporters \xe2\x80\x94 agents, coaches, and Pro Football Hall of Famer Jim Brown. The first out gay player drafted into the National Football League strode to the stage to receive ESPN\xe2\x80\x99s Arthur Ashe Award, an honor previously bestowed on Muhammad Ali, Pat Tillman, and Nelson Mandela. It was the climax of a star-studded evening in Los Angeles meant to announce Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s arrival as a national icon.', '', 'Michael Jr. thanked his agents, his publicist, the couple who welcomed him into their home in high school, supporters from the University of Missouri, and top officials with the St. Louis Rams, the team that had drafted him only two months earlier.', 'Finally, he gave a brief nod to his roots. \xe2\x80\x9cTo my mother, a single mother who somehow raised eight kids. I love you dearly.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Back in his cramped room at the nursing home, Michael Sam Sr. picked up his battered, flip-style phone and found his son\xe2\x80\x99s number. He left a message.', '\xe2\x80\x9cSo that\xe2\x80\x99s what you\xe2\x80\x99re going to do?\xe2\x80\x9d he recalled telling his son. \xe2\x80\x9cAfter all I\xe2\x80\x99ve done for you?\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Since Michael Jr. publicly announced he was gay in February \xe2\x80\x94 just days after he let his father know by text message \xe2\x80\x94 Michael Sr. has been vilified in the press. In the', ', Michael Sr. came off as a callous homophobe when he said, \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t want my grandkids raised in that kind of environment. \xe2\x80\xa6 I\xe2\x80\x99m old school. I\xe2\x80\x99m a man-and-a-woman type of guy.\xe2\x80\x9d When the ESPN documentary declared that Michael Sr. had \xe2\x80\x9cabandoned the family\xe2\x80\x9d and left his mother to raise Michael Jr. and his seven siblings on her own, Michael Sr. seemed the archetype of the intolerant and absent black father.', 'In none of these accounts did Michael Jr. come to his father\xe2\x80\x99s defense. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m closer to my friends than I am to my family,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Jr. told the', '.', 'But the father-son story of Michael Sr. and Michael Jr. is more than a conflict over whether Michael Sr. loved and supported his son. It\xe2\x80\x99s the tale of man who\xe2\x80\x99s been reduced to a caricature but whose actual life was shaped by the loss of child after child, some to death and some to crime. The rift between Michael Sr. and his youngest son started long before Michael Jr. came out and stems in no small part from those family tragedies.', 'Of course, those losses shaped Michael Jr. too, but he isn\xe2\x80\x99t saying how. Through his agent and publicist, he declined numerous requests for an interview. But it\xe2\x80\x99s not hard to see how, in order to succeed and perhaps just to survive, he might blame his father, fairly or not, for what happened to his family.', '', 'Michael Sr. spends most of his days at the DeSoto Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, about 15 miles southwest of Dallas. His electric hospital-style bed and almost all of his few belongings \xe2\x80\x94 a mini-fridge and a rolling dinner tray, mostly \xe2\x80\x94 are crammed into a corner of the room he shares with another patient. He locks his drawers because someone has been stealing his snacks.', 'He gets around in a wheelchair, having lost his ability to walk almost three years ago. He wears a gold chain around his broad neck, which bears a deep and long surgical scar that runs from the bottom of his hairline to somewhere past the neckline of his white undershirt. It\xe2\x80\x99s not clear he knows exactly what ailment has left him in a wheelchair. \xe2\x80\x9cI have a hole in my neck,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cBut I ain\xe2\x80\x99t gonna die in this motherfucker. I\xe2\x80\x99m getting out of here.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'At 55, he\xe2\x80\x99s one of the youngest and most vibrant residents at the nursing home. He has a paunch and false teeth, but he still possesses the thickly muscled shoulders and arms of someone nicknamed \xe2\x80\x9cHammer,\xe2\x80\x9d a handle he got on the football field and in the streets. His hands still make large fists; kicking ass was a family pastime.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMaaaannnn, I used to hit hard,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI taught all my sons to play football.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'He often rolls his wheelchair to a shaded patio, where he goes through Kool cigarettes like some people do cups of coffee. He banters with almost everyone. Especially the women. \xe2\x80\x9cBetter quit bending that ass over like that,\xe2\x80\x9d he tells one of the women staffers, a smile creasing his fleshy face. The woman smiles back. If she or other women staffers are offended by his behavior, they don\xe2\x80\x99t show it. At least a couple jokingly call him their boyfriend.', 'His phone rings throughout the day, bearing calls from his children or friends named \xe2\x80\x9dFrank Tha Cook\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cLittle Leroy.\xe2\x80\x9d The conversations usually cover his health, upcoming casino trips to Louisiana, and football, particularly the Cowboys, his favorite team since he was a boy.', 'One person who doesn\xe2\x80\x99t call is Michael Jr., who kept his distance as he ascended to fame and more recently when he tumbled out of big-time football.', '', 'After Michael Jr. publicly came out in February, even President Obama', '. On May 10, the St. Louis Rams drafted him, generating more praise. But despite the fact that he had been a star at the University of Missouri, where he became Co-Defensive Player of the Year in the powerful Southeastern Conference, he was chosen late. Only seven players were selected after him. He performed well during training camp and the preseason \xe2\x80\x94 but was still cut from the final roster on Aug. 30, touching off a debate about whether homophobia played a role in his release. The Cowboys signed him three days later to their practice squad, then dropped him on Oct. 21. He is now a free agent.', 'For the nearly two months that Michael Jr. was with the Cowboys, he lived a half hour away from his father. It was the closest they\xe2\x80\x99ve lived to each other in about 15 years. A family friend, Sean Woods, hoped it would finally bring the men together. \xe2\x80\x9cNow,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, Michael Jr. \xe2\x80\x9chas to deal with his daddy.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Yet the Michaels have exchanged only a few text messages and haven\xe2\x80\x99t spoken a word to each other, a quiet that has now lasted at least several months with no end in sight. Michael Sr. has mostly kept up with the vicissitudes of his son\xe2\x80\x99s career through updates on ESPN and phone calls from friends and family members.', 'Shortly after Michael Jr. was released from the Cowboys\xe2\x80\x99 practice squad, Michael Sr. sent a text to BuzzFeed News: \xe2\x80\x9cHey they cut Mike.\xe2\x80\x9d Asked if he\xe2\x80\x99d heard from his son recently, Michael Sr. texted back that Michael Jr. \xe2\x80\x9cwouldn\xe2\x80\x99t say a word to me honer [sic] thy father.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s like he was looking for an excuse to separate from us,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cNow we\xe2\x80\x99re just letting him have his limelight. We\xe2\x80\x99re tired of begging him to stay in the family.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'On the room\xe2\x80\x99s walls, Michael Sr. has pinned Father\xe2\x80\x99s Day cards, a corkboard with a calendar and pictures of his family, and, over his bed, a lengthy poem about angels. On a special spot on the wall \xe2\x80\x94 right over his flat-screen TV \xe2\x80\x94 are two pictures of Michael Jr. in his University of Missouri football uniform. Pointing at the pictures, Michael Sr. said he knew from the start that Michael Jr. would be special.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThat boy, he had some big nuts,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe was big when he was born. That boy had some big-ass balls.\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Wesley Sam, Michael Sr.\xe2\x80\x99s father, was also pretty ballsy. In 1947, he was living in Opelousas, Louisiana, when he heard on the radio about what\xe2\x80\x99s generally considered', ', an explosion at the Monsanto plant near Galveston, Texas. He headed right to the scene, figuring he could get work there.', 'He loaded cotton at the Galveston wharves for a few months before landing a job at the Monsanto plant. Yes, it had blown up, killing nearly 600 people, but he could make more money there than a black man could expect almost anywhere else.', 'He married Alberta, a fellow Opelousas native who spoke Creole, little English, and who couldn\xe2\x80\x99t read or write. With their 10 children, they moved into a three-bedroom, one-bathroom home at 1732 Thompson St. in La Marque: Wesley and Alberta had a bedroom, the girls had one, and the boys had the room at the back of the house. \xe2\x80\x9cI had a white boy type of life at home,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cThere wasn\xe2\x80\x99t nothing I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have wanted and gotten.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Alberta died at 46 following \xe2\x80\x9ca brief illness,\xe2\x80\x9d according to her obituary in the', '. Wesley Sam was a loving man, a capable cook, and obsessive about cleanliness \xe2\x80\x94 he would dust off his car every day, his surviving children said. But he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t quite up to the challenge of corralling all of those children. Who could? Instead he set his example through his work ethic, putting in a full day at Monsanto then mowing lawns with his sons in the evening. They\xe2\x80\x99d do 18 yards a day, Wednesday through Sunday.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMy dad was a workaholic before anyone called it that,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe\xe2\x80\x99d think you were sorry if you didn\xe2\x80\x99t have that work mentality in you.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Sr.\xe2\x80\x99s siblings went off to college, joined the military, and found middle-class jobs. His sister Geraldine would become La Marque\xe2\x80\x99s first black mayor.', 'Michael Sr., meanwhile, dropped out of school over the protests of his father but earned a GED. He wasn\xe2\x80\x99t much of a student anyway, and finding work in the area was a cinch for anyone who didn\xe2\x80\x99t mind getting a few smudges on their shirt. He worked in construction, at a chemical plant, and as a crane operator and a forklift operator.', 'Away from work, Michael Sr. and his brothers drank, chased women, and kept up the family tradition of fisticuffs. \xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99d be out in the front yard fighting,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said, grinning at the memory. \xe2\x80\x9cReal fighting. Not no slapboxing.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'One night in 1978, Michael Sr. met a woman named JoAnn Turner at a local nightclub. \xe2\x80\x9cShe was fine and good-looking,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd I walked her out.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Little more than a year later, JoAnn gave birth to a boy they named Russell. A year later, they had daughter Chanel. Julian was born in June 1982. They were young and in love, with three kids and jobs that paid middle-class wages. It didn\xe2\x80\x99t take long for Michael Sr. to settle into life as a family man, or long for it to be destroyed.', '', 'Here\xe2\x80\x99s a news brief from the Associated Press on Sept. 23, 1982, with a dateline from Texas City: \xe2\x80\x9cThe body of Chanel Roshaun Sam was found Monday night in about eight feet of water near a pier on which she had been playing. Her parents and neighbors searched for three hours before finding the body.\xe2\x80\x9d The little girl, 2 years old, had apparently drowned.', 'After several days of grief, and desperate to rescue JoAnn from her despair, Michael Sr. suggested they go to the courthouse. And so, six days after their daughter died, they were married.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI felt like she needed some support,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was the right thing to do, to bring something positive from it.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t enough. JoAnn turned to religion and became a Jehovah\xe2\x80\x99s Witness. Her conversion deepened the fissure in her marriage, because Michael Sr. was raised as a Baptist and felt his wife\xe2\x80\x99s new religion was too restrictive. She insisted the family not celebrate Christmas. \xe2\x80\x9cI celebrated it,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cBut she didn\xe2\x80\x99t celebrate it with me. I still bought the kids gifts.\xe2\x80\x9d (JoAnn didn\xe2\x80\x99t respond to requests for an interview.)', 'Michael Sr. found his solace shooting dice. On Friday and Saturday evenings, he would take his paycheck to a little wooden shack in Texas City and gamble away the family\xe2\x80\x99s money. JoAnn suspected the absences were because of another woman, Michael Sr. said. But a mutual friend of the couple gave her the scoop. In Michael Sr.\xe2\x80\x99s version of the story, the woman told JoAnn that \xe2\x80\x9che ain\xe2\x80\x99t screwing none of us\xe2\x80\x9d but was just gambling.', 'One Friday night, Michael Sr. recalled, he won $700 and left the shack with two friends on an impromptu trip to Boy\xe2\x80\x99s Town in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico, an infamous red-light district just across the Texas border. He didn\xe2\x80\x99t bother calling JoAnn to tell her that he was leaving town.', '\xe2\x80\x9cWeren\xe2\x80\x99t no cell phones back then, and I didn\xe2\x80\x99t stop and spend the 25 cents to call,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. When he returned Sunday, \xe2\x80\x9cshe bitched at my ass. But it was pretty funny. I had a blast.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The marriage continued to spiral, though Joshua was born in 1984 and Christopher in 1985. Michael Sr. finally filed for divorce in February 1986. A brief attempt at reconciliation resulted in the birth of Michelle in 1987. But the divorce was granted in 1988.', 'JoAnn was awarded primary parental responsibilities. Michael Sr. would have access to the children two weekends each month, and they divided up the holidays.', 'Michael Sr. was also ordered to pay JoAnn $250 each month for child support. Within a few months, JoAnn returned to court to complain that Michael Sr. wasn\xe2\x80\x99t meeting his obligation. Thus started a four-year battle over child support. Michael Sr. was charged with contempt of court at least 10 times stemming from his failure to pay, according to court records. Twice he was sent to county jail.', '', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt was because I was running around and spending money and shooting dice,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. JoAnn \xe2\x80\x9cneeded more money, and I was doing the very minimum. I should\xe2\x80\x99ve been doing more.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Typical of their on-again, off-again relationship, JoAnn gave birth in 1990 to Michael Jr. \xe2\x80\x94 right in the middle of their child support dispute \xe2\x80\x94 and the next year to Ashley, the eighth and last child they would have together. \xe2\x80\x9cMan, I had some phases with JoAnn,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said.', 'In July 1992, JoAnn went to court to sign off on an agreement to release Michael Sr. from county jail and to clarify the terms of the support payments. At that point, according to court documents, Michael Sr. was behind nearly $4,000 in payments.', 'During the Christmas holidays that year, Michael Sr. said, JoAnn made a surprise visit to his house. \xe2\x80\x9cShe wore one of those Mormon dresses \xe2\x80\x94 she knows that I like dresses,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, laughing. This time, he said, she demanded more than a night together.', 'On May 3, 1993, Michael Sr. and JoAnn went to the county courthouse once again \xe2\x80\x94 to get remarried.', '', 'Michael Sr. took no small pride in raising sons who were every bit the hell-raiser that he was. People around the neighborhood called him a man\xe2\x80\x99s man. \xe2\x80\x9cMy dad didn\xe2\x80\x99t take no shit off nobody, and I didn\xe2\x80\x99t take no shit off nobody,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cI wasn\xe2\x80\x99t a bad guy. But I was a \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99ll kick your ass\xe2\x80\x99 kind of guy.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cAll of his kids were muscular and some bad dudes,\xe2\x80\x9d said Charles Sam, Michael Sr.\xe2\x80\x99s brother.', 'The toughest of the bunch was also the oldest: Russell. As a freshman, he was pegged as a future football star at La Marque High School. Michael Sr. fondly remembers how Russell would walk around the neighborhood, \xe2\x80\x9calways ready to slap a motherfucker.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But, he said, \xe2\x80\x9cI kept telling him to get out of that gang shit.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Here\xe2\x80\x99s a clipping from the Galveston County', '. It reports that on Feb. 27, 1995, Russell was sent home early from La Marque High School for \xe2\x80\x9ccreating a disturbance.\xe2\x80\x9d A school administrator allowed Russell to walk home since his mother couldn\xe2\x80\x99t leave work to pick him up.', 'Instead of heading straight home, the newspaper said, Russell stopped at a house about a half mile from the school. He was breaking into the back door when the homeowner fired at him three times through a metal door. Russell was clutching a screwdriver when his body was found. No charges were filed against the homeowner (who was also black).', 'The anger welled up within Michael Sr., who casually knew the man who had killed his son. There weren\xe2\x80\x99t many strangers on that side of town. Michael Sr. got himself a handgun. \xe2\x80\x9cI was going to kill him,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cI was going to go over there and end him. But my daddy saved me. He wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t let me go over there.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'His father saved him', 'But Michael Sr. couldn\xe2\x80\x99t save his own sons.', 'At 5 feet 4 inches and 125 pounds, second-oldest son Julian had an unusually slight build for a Sam boy. He went by the nickname \xe2\x80\x9cIce Pick.\xe2\x80\x9d But he had a left arm that was made for pitching. \xe2\x80\x9cThat boy could throw,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe used to strike Russell out all the time. Those were the funnest days.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'But, Michael Sr. said, \xe2\x80\x9che wanted his own money\xe2\x80\x9d and begged his father to let him work. Michael Sr. eventually gave in, and Julian took a job with a local cable company.', '', 'Here\xe2\x80\x99s another headline from', ', this one from Oct. 22, 1998: \xe2\x80\x9cLa Marque mother looks for clues into son\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Julian was last seen outside La Marque\xe2\x80\x99s high school football stadium, where he had gone to buy tickets to the homecoming game. JoAnn told the newspaper, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat has me afraid is that he had just gotten paid, and had $200 on him.\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cI should just not have let him work,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. told BuzzFeed News. \xe2\x80\x9cI should have let him throw that ball. He would\xe2\x80\x99ve been a left-handed pitcher.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Julian', ', and 16 years later the police maintain his disappearance is still an open case.', 'When Michael Jr. was born, his parents were scarred by the drowning of their daughter and were feuding over child support. When he was 5, his oldest brother was gunned down. When he was 8, his second-oldest brother vanished.', 'His remaining brothers, Josh and Chris, tormented him constantly. \xe2\x80\x9cHis brothers picked on him,\xe2\x80\x9d said Michael Sr., who also grew up as the youngest brother in his family. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d have to go in there and tell them to quit that shit and leave him alone.\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Jr. told', '', 'for his older brothers.', 'Josh was also showing a precocious ability to find trouble in the streets of La Marque. \xe2\x80\x9cNo one had reached 18 yet,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said of his children. \xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t think [Josh] was going to reach it either.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Sr. and JoAnn decided that Hitchcock, a town only four miles away, might do them all some good.', 'Population 7,000, Hitchcock was founded in 1873 as a railroad station between Houston and Galveston. Today, it\xe2\x80\x99s a quiet two-stoplight town that sits along a state highway. By most socioeconomic markers \xe2\x80\x94 home ownership, median income, residents with college degrees (just 8.2%) \xe2\x80\x94 Hitchcock ranks below the Texas average.', 'The Sams settled into a well-kept rose-colored wood-frame house that sat along the railroad tracks and unkempt ditches on the black side of town. It seemed isolated enough from the troubles that La Marque had visited upon their family, but it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t.', 'La Marque police reopened the investigation into Julian\xe2\x80\x99s disappearance after getting reports that people had seen him in the area. \xe2\x80\x9cWe think he left on his own free will and we feel strongly he is alive,\xe2\x80\x9d the police chief told the', 'in October 2000.', '', 'JoAnn told the', 'that she also believed he was still alive. \xe2\x80\x9cHe was at that age of rebellion,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, suggesting he had run away from home. She told the newspaper that she wanted him to come home or at least call someone in the family to let them know he was OK.', 'In grief, Michael Sr. had quit his job at the post office. \xe2\x80\x9cI had always had a steady job, but I couldn\xe2\x80\x99t handle it no more,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cI felt closed in. Just thinking of it.\xe2\x80\x9d He found work as a crane operator but was laid off soon after. He got a job working for a local pipe company and was let go again. Finally, in the fall of 1999, a family friend told him he should consider truck driving. Michael Sr. went to school in Dallas, and four months later was on the road, coming back to Hitchcock when he could, mostly on weekends.', '\xe2\x80\x9cIt was a steady job,\xe2\x80\x9d he said, and one that answered a deeper need: \xe2\x80\x9cI had to get away. I wanted to get away.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'The marriage crumbled. Michael Sr. and JoAnn remain legally married but haven\xe2\x80\x99t lived as a couple since he moved to Dallas in 2000.', 'Michael Jr. was 10 when his father started his life on the road. With JoAnn working late hours and taking extra shifts to provide for the children, Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s older brothers had their run of the house \xe2\x80\x94 and the streets. \xe2\x80\x9cIt was bad,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Jr. said in an ESPN documentary about his life. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m a kid and I\xe2\x80\x99m seeing some hardcore drugs in my house. My mother didn\xe2\x80\x99t know about it. If I told her anything, my brothers said they would kill me.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Craig Smith, one of his high school football coaches, saw it for himself. \xe2\x80\x9cSometimes I\xe2\x80\x99d drive over to pick him up and honk the horn and one of his brothers would come out to see if I wanted to buy\xe2\x80\x9d drugs, he told a crowd at the school\xe2\x80\x99s annual football reunion dinner in late July.', 'The criminal records of Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s brothers support these accounts: Josh has been arrested more than 40 times, including four convictions for drug possession, and Chris has tallied nearly 20 arrests.', 'In April, Chris was sentenced to 30 years in state prison for breaking into a woman\xe2\x80\x99s home, choking her into unconsciousness twice, then using her credit card at a nearby restaurant. Josh was put in the Galveston County Jail in July on a minor offense and was released last month.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI got caught up in them streets,\xe2\x80\x9d Josh admitted during a June interview with BuzzFeed News, a rare evening this year when he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t locked up.', 'Little of this came as a surprise to family members. Cousins remember being warned to keep their distance. \xe2\x80\x9cWe knew it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the ideal upbringing,\xe2\x80\x9d said Joseph Sam, a nephew of Michael Sr. \xe2\x80\x9cThey were always in trouble.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'With his childhood saturated with grief and his older brothers descending into crime, Michael Jr. would have had to be a saint not to look for someone to blame. Conveniently, his father was already blaming himself.', 'Out on the road, far away from home, Michael Sr. remained tormented by the loss of his boys. Teaching them toughness had backfired; he\xe2\x80\x99d armed them with tools for survival in one world that wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t work in almost any other.', '\xe2\x80\x9cLife was going to be tough on them,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. \xe2\x80\x9cYour skin had to be tougher than the others. But I also wanted them to make the right decisions.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Somewhere in these years, Michael Sr. began to lose the last of his sons \xe2\x80\x94 not to death or crime, but to rejection.', '', 'On his first day of third grade, in a new town and new school, Michael Jr. was seated next to a chubby, snowy-haired boy. Michael Jr. wasn\xe2\x80\x99t saying much to his new seatmate. The silence went on for so long and got so awkward that eventually the boy spoke up.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI told the teacher that I didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to sit next to him because he was too quiet,\xe2\x80\x9d said Robert Dohman. \xe2\x80\x9cHe turns around and goes, \xe2\x80\x98Hey, blondie boy, I\xe2\x80\x99m not quiet!\xe2\x80\x99 And that\xe2\x80\x99s the way me and Michael get along now.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Jr. was voted \xe2\x80\x9cfriendliest\xe2\x80\x9d by his sixth-grade classmates and elected homecoming king in eighth grade. His popularity was a testament to his ability to navigate the unspoken color line of a small Southern town; most of his close friends were white.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMy grandma,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dohman, \xe2\x80\x9cwas very old-school and wasn\xe2\x80\x99t into all that racial mixing. But when I had Michael over, he\xe2\x80\x99d always be the first one to come over and give everybody a hug. Even her. He really changed the way my grandmother looked at black people. She would even smile when he came around.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Sr. said he saw little of the outgoing side of his son, saying he was quiet at home. But coaches and teachers remember him as a precociously self-assured teenager who could start a conversation with anyone. After football games, Michael Jr. was known for going into the bleachers \xe2\x80\x94 uniform and pads still on \xe2\x80\x94 to introduce himself to parents.', 'Michael could \xe2\x80\x9ctalk to a group of 15-year-olds and then set there and talk to a group of 55-year-olds and not feel out of place either,\xe2\x80\x9d said Smith, now head football coach at Hitchcock. \xe2\x80\x9cI just never had a student that could just go and talk to a group of people. He would make friends all the time.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Even in what was ostensibly enemy territory. Smith recalled a track meet at Danbury, a nearby town that is 90% white, less than 1% black, and had developed a reputation for being unfriendly to minorities. Except, apparently, Michael Jr.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI can remember some Danbury parents cheering and rooting for Michael running the 100-meter\xe2\x80\x9d dash, Coach Smith said. \xe2\x80\x9cYou just didn\xe2\x80\x99t see that, if you know anything about Danbury.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Maybe the biggest benefit of playing sports is that it kept Michael Jr. away from his brothers. The coaches, who also worked as teachers in the district, knew all about Josh and Chris: Their obvious athleticism had never proven to be worth the trouble. But Michael Jr. was charting a path different from the men in his family. Michael Jr. greeted people with hugs, not fists. He was going to be the first to graduate.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMichael was a good kid,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cHe said he didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to be like his brothers.\xe2\x80\x9d Left unsaid was that Michael Jr. clearly felt the same about his father.', '', 'On fall Friday nights, Michael Sr. said he would find a seat somewhere in Hitchcock\xe2\x80\x99s football stadium, away from the crowd and sometimes with his father, Wesley. After nearly 30 years as a father, he said, he could finally engage in the autumn ritual familiar across Texas.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t miss [any] home game his senior year,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. insisted.', 'There isn\xe2\x80\x99t anyone who can corroborate his perfect attendance. Family and friends say they\xe2\x80\x99re sure he went to some games but don\xe2\x80\x99t know about all of them. The coaches at Hitchcock High can remember seeing or, rather, hearing, Michael Sr. only once in four years: a game in Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s sophomore year.', '\xe2\x80\x9cI heard this guy yelling at Michael and I turned to Michael and asked him, \xe2\x80\x98Who the hell is that guy?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d Smith recalled. \xe2\x80\x9cMichael said it was his father. That\xe2\x80\x99s the only time I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen him.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Those stadiums can be hubs of activity on Friday nights, and coaches are notoriously focused on the events unfolding well away from the stands. It would be easy to miss someone on game night,', '?', '\xe2\x80\x9cLet me say this in a nice way,\xe2\x80\x9d Smith said. \xe2\x80\x9cI didn\xe2\x80\x99t know him, and I know a lot of people in town. I can look up in those stands and know who\xe2\x80\x99s there.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Sr. said he didn\xe2\x80\x99t make it a priority to spend any time with the parents of Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s friends or the alums and other regulars who would show up at school events \xe2\x80\x94 most of them white. \xe2\x80\x9cI never did know them,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cAnd I never tried to go out of my way.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Michael Sr. said he took a job with a trucking company based out of Ada, Oklahoma, so that he could arrive in Hitchcock by the start of kickoff Friday night. He assumed his son appreciated what he considered a significant sacrifice of time and money; coming back to Texas without a load meant he wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t get paid for the drive home.', 'It wasn\xe2\x80\x99t until earlier this year, when media outlets began saying that he had abandoned his son, that Michael Sr. learned he was being phased out of the story of his son\xe2\x80\x99s childhood. He never thought all those years on the road would mean that he wasn\xe2\x80\x99t there.', '\xe2\x80\x9cMichael\xe2\x80\x99s family was the city of Hitchcock,\xe2\x80\x9d said Dohman, Michael Jr.\xe2\x80\x99s childhood friend.', 'Told what Dohman said, Michael Sr. looked straight ahead, the anger washing over him. Sitting on that patio at the nursing home, he was, for a few moments, that angry Sam boy ready to fight.', '\xe2\x80\x9cThe city of Hitchcock didn\xe2\x80\x99t buy his goddamn clothes, a roof over his head, or the bed that he slept in,\xe2\x80\x9d Michael Sr. said. \xe2\x80\x9cThe city of Hitchcock can kiss my ass.\xe2\x80\x9d He paused. \xe2\x80\x9cI should have kept those gas receipts.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'Of course, Michael Sr. never thought he would need them. He also never thought the family of a high school teammate \xe2\x80\x94 a white one \xe2\x80\x94 would get so much credit.', 'Once Michael Jr. revealed in February his plans to become the NFL\xe2\x80\x99s first out gay player, the two media outlets with which his publicists coordinated the announcement wrote this:', ': Sam found a comfortable place off the field as well, in large part because of Ethan Purl, a classmate and the son of Ron Purl, the president of the local branch of Prosperity Bank. Ron\xe2\x80\x99s wife, Candy, made sure their house was part recreation center and part counseling hub for their children and their friends. By Sam\xe2\x80\x99s senior year, he had his own bedroom in the Purls\xe2\x80\x99 house, along with chores like cleaning the pool and carrying the grocery bags. \xe2\x80\x9cI look at our house as a kind of safe haven,\xe2\x80\x9d said Ron Purl, who keeps a photograph of Sam in his Missouri football uniform in his office. \xe2\x80\x9cHe is just another son. If he did something wrong, he got yelled at just like the others did.\xe2\x80\x9d', ': The relationship started when Candy Purl, Ronnie\xe2\x80\x99s wife, invited Michael to dinner during his freshman year of high school. Ronnie, a man with a personality much bigger than he is, discovered a kid he didn\xe2\x80\x99t recognize and demanded to know, \xe2\x80\x9cAnd who are you?\xe2\x80\x9d', '\xe2\x80\x9cWithout skipping a beat, my brother replied, \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m Michael Alan Sam Jr.!,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d said Ethan Purl, Ronnie\xe2\x80\x99s son. \xe2\x80\x9cA

Title: Dallas Cowboys Release Michael Sam From PracticeåÊSquad
Description: ['Sam to resume quest to become the first out gay player on an NFL roster.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'Michael Sam, the first out gay player drafted into the NFL, was released from the Dallas Cowboys today, the team announced.', 'Sam spent seven weeks with the Cowboys but was never promoted to the team\xe2\x80\x99s 53-man roster. He joined the club on Sept. 3 after being released the previous week by the St. Louis Rams, the team that drafted him near the end of the seventh round in May.', 'Sam later thanked the Cowboys for the opportunity in a series of tweets sent about an hour after he was reportedly released.', 'I want to thank the Jones family and the entire Cowboys organization for this opportunity, as well as my friends, family, teammates, (1/3)', 'and fans for their support. While this is disappointing, I will take the lessons I learned here in Dallas and continue to fight for an (2/3)', 'opportunity to prove that I can play every Sunday. (3/3)', 'The Cowboys', 'Troy Davis, a second-year pro from Central Florida, to the roster after Sam\xe2\x80\x99s release, according to dallascowboys.com.', 'Sam is now free to sign with another team, and to continue his pursuit of becoming the league\xe2\x80\x99s first out gay player on an NFL roster.', 'At the University of Missouri, Sam revealed his sexual orientation to his college teammates and friends long before deciding to tell national media outlets. He went on to finish his college career as one of the most decorated players in school history.', 'Sam ended his senior season as the SEC\xe2\x80\x99s Co-Defensive Player of the Year and made a number of All-American teams. Many league analysts had predicted Sam would be drafted somewhere in the first four rounds.', 'Instead, Sam lasted until the 249th pick in the draft \xe2\x80\x94 only seven players were selected after him. Explanations for his precipitous drop went from size \xe2\x80\x94 at 6-foot-2-inches and 260 pounds, Sam was too slow for linebacker and too small for the line \xe2\x80\x94 to NFL teams\xe2\x80\x99 reluctance about dealing with media scrutiny of an out gay player.', 'You are signed in as', '.', 'Dallas Cowboys Release Michael Sam From Practice Squad', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', 'This video may have privacy restrictions. Ensure that it is publicly visible to everyone.', '', 'Share this on Facebook \xc2\xa0', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! You'll get your first email soon.", 'Thanks for sharing.', 'Please try again later.']

Title: Jose Canseco Pranked Everyone By Saying His Finger FellåÊOff
Description: ['Update: The former baseball player', 'it was just a joke.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', '', 'You got us, Jose.', '', 'update', 'After claiming last week that his finger fell off during a poker tournament, former MLB player Jose Canseco', 'that the whole thing was a hoax that he cooked up after seeing a fake finger in a Halloween store.', '', '2.', 'Jose Canseco claimed he accidentally shot himself in the hand last week while cleaning a firearm at his Las Vegas home. He later underwent surgery and posted this photo:', 'Love you baby no matter how many fingers you have @JoseCanseco', '3.', 'After the incident, he thanked both the Las Vegas police and his fianc\xc3\xa9e:', 'Thank u to all the Las Vegas police officers and fire rescue that came so quickly and made the incident much easier to deal with.', 'Most thanks to my beautiful fianc\xc3\xa9 @ModelLeila for saving my life . She was so calm and handled everything perfectly like she was a doctor.', '5.', 'But the story turned awkward Friday when Canseco took to Twitter to tease updates on the accident:', 'Dam I was playing in a poker tournament last night and something crazy happened to my finger that I shot off and they put back on.', '7.', 'And then hours later, he delivered the news:', '8.', 'Even admitting that the finger was \xe2\x80\x9csmelling really bad.\xe2\x80\x9d', '9.', 'A person who captured video of the incident reportedly contacted Canseco\xe2\x80\x99s agent:', '12.', '\xe2\x80\xa6and now we are all just left wondering.', 'Jose Canseco Pranked Everyone By Saying His Finger Fell Off', 'Your link was successfully shared!', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', 'More Buzz', 'Note: once you save these links, they will no longer update automatically.', '', '', '', '', 'by', '', 'This cannot be undone.', 'BuzzFeed is currently working with select partners to help them track what\xe2\x80\x99s hot on their sites using the same advanced social tracking and analytics tools used on BuzzFeed.com.', 'If you\xe2\x80\x99re interested, contact us at', '.', "Please select the newsletters you'd like to receive.", 'Your email has been sent!', 'Get our awesome newsletter at', "Great! Description: ['An attempt to thank their fans with an online jersey for being \xe2\x80\x9cthe 1st NFL team with 1 million Twitter followers,\xe2\x80\x9d failed miserably when a user created a custom shirt displaying a racial slur.']

Title: 55 Missing People Who Need YouråÊHelp
Description: ['The', 'hashtag was created to bring awareness to the thousands of people who go missing in the U.S. each year.']
Body: ['', '', '', '', '', '', 'We challenge you, the internet at large, to help find these 55 missing people.', '', 'The', 'contained 84,136 active missing person records, as of December 31, 2013. Of those, people under the age of 18 accounted for 33,849 (40%) records.', 'BuzzFeed News reached out to law enforcement officials about each missing persons case and all new available information provided is included in the profiles below.', 'Please share this post using the', 'hashtag to create awareness for the thousands of missing persons in the United States and let\xe2\x80\x99s help the many families and friends find the information, or tip, that leads to a reunion.', '1.', '', ': Theresa Benn, Talladega County', '42', '', '5\xe2\x80\x995\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '108 pounds', '', 'Blonde', '', 'Unknown', '', 'Theresa Andrews and Theresa Dulaney', 'Theresa was last seen on Oct. 19, 2014, on her way to Talladega Motor Speedway in Lincoln, Alabama, according to the', '. Authorities are unsure whether or not she ever made it to the racetrack. Theresa was last seen wearing blue jeans, pink cowboy boots, a black tank top, and a rhinestone-covered belt.', 'If you have any information about Theresa please contact', '. You can remain anonymous if you wish.', 'For more information on missing persons in', '.', '2.', '', ': Brandon Lee Jividen, Rebecca Adams, and family, Kenai Peninsula Borough', 'Kenai Police Department', 'The family of Brandon Lee Jividen and Rebecca Adams were last seen in late May, 2014, in Kenai, Alaska, according to Kenai Police Chief Gus Sandahl. Sandahl told BuzzFeed News that locating the family is of the police department\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9chighest priority\xe2\x80\x9d and additional searches could happen if more information becomes available. The family is comprised of Brandon, Rebecca, and Rebecca\xe2\x80\x99s two daughters, Michelle and Jaracca Hundley.', 'If you have any information about Brandon, Rebecca, or the children, please contact the', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '3.', '', ': Huong Nguyen, Maricopa County', '64', '', '5\xe2\x80\x991\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '105 pounds', '', 'Black', '', 'Brown', 'Huong was last seen in the area of North 7th Place and East Cheryl Drive in Phoenix, Arizona, according to', '. All of her belongings were later discovered at her home.', 'If you have any information about Huong, please contact', '.', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '4.', '', ': Thomas Rettew, Fulton County', '4', '', '16', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Thomas was last seen on Sept. 1, 2002, according to the', '. His photo has been age-progressed to 14 years. Thomas may go by the nickname Mikey.', 'If you have any information about Thomas, please contact the', '.', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '5.', '', ': Elizabeth Sullivan, San Diego County', '31', '', '5\xe2\x80\x993\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '130 pounds', '', 'Black', '', 'Brown', 'Elizabeth was last seen on October 13, 2014, San Diego Police told BuzzFeed News, near her home in Liberty Station, San Diego, California. Her car was left at home and her phone has since been shut off.', 'If you have any information about Elizabeth, please contact', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '6.', '', ': Ambreen Amjad, Weld County', '53', '', '5\xe2\x80\x995\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '110 pounds', '', 'Black', '', 'Brown', 'Ambreen was last seen on March 14, 2014, at North Range Behavioral Healthcenter in Greeley, Colorado, where she was being treated.', 'If you have any information about Ambreen, please contact the', 'or', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '7.', '', ': Samuel Foley, Middlesex County', '16', '', '5\xe2\x80\x998\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '160 pounds', '', 'Blond', '', 'Brown', 'Samuel has been missing since Aug 15, 2014, from Clinton, Connecticut, but was last seen in New York City at 125th Street train station, according to the', '.', 'If you have any information about Samuel, please contact the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '8.', '', ': Nefertiri Trader, New Castle County', '33', '', '5\xe2\x80\x995\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '125 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Nefertiri was last seen on June 30, 2014, outside her home in New Castle, Delaware, according to', '. An eyewitness claims to have seen her being forced out of her home and into her silver 2000 Acura XL, Delaware license plate number 404893.', 'If you have any information about Nefertiri, please contact', 'or the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '9.', '', ': James Hawthorn, Palm Beach County', '79', '', '5\xe2\x80\x998\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '148 pounds', '', 'White', '', 'Unknown', 'James was last seen on July 11, 2014, near Thayer Lane in Jupiter, Florida, wearing a gray plaid shirt with brown stripes, gray pants, gray shoes, and wears sunglasses, according to the', '. It\xe2\x80\x99s possible he\xe2\x80\x99s traveling in a white 1994 Ford Escort.', 'If you have any information about James, please contact', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '10.', '', ': Brandon Wade, Lowndes County', '3', '', '15', '', 'Brown', '', 'Hazel', 'Brandon and his mother, Paula Wade (', '), were last seen on Oct. 14, 2002, at their home in Valdosta, Georgia, according to the', '. Robert has multiple tattoos, specifically one under his right eye and \xe2\x80\x9cDanae\xe2\x80\x9d on his right hand.', 'If you have any information about Robert, please contact the', 'or', '.', '', 'Click', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '21.', '', ': Jancer Garcia, Essex County', '17', '', '5\xe2\x80\x999\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '175 pounds', '', 'Black', '', 'Brown', 'Jancer went missing on Sept. 8, 2014, in Lynn, Massachusetts, according to the', '. She was last seen wearing a pink dress, white sneakers, and white socks.', 'If you have any information about Ivy, please contact the', '.', 'For more information on other missing persons in', '.', '27.', '', ': Jason Berglund, Buffalo County', 'Park County Sheriffs Office', '18', '', '5\xe2\x80\x999\xe2\x80\x9d', '', 'Unknown', '', 'Blond', '', 'Blue', 'Jason left the University of Nebraska-Kearney on Oct. 22, 2014, according to', '. His', 'was at an ATM (see above) in downtown Denver, Colorado. Police believe to have found his car at the Colorado Trailhead southeast of Bailey, Colorado, according to', '.', 'If you have any formation about Jason, please contact the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '28.', '', ': Zion Valdovinos, Clark County', '17', '', '5\xe2\x80\x998\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '145 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Zion was last seen on Oct. 13, 2014, according to', '. He might still be in the local area, or may have traveled to California.', 'If you have any information about Zion, please contact the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '29.', '', ': Mary Nunes, Coos County', '8', '', '18', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Mary was last seen on Oct. 22, 2004, according to the', ', when she was allegedly abducted by her mother,', ', and her stepfather,', '. Mary\xe2\x80\x99s photo is age-progressed to 17 years.', 'If you have any information about Mary, please contact the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '30.', '', ': Mila Kostadinova, Bergen County', '18', '', '5\xe2\x80\x992\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '90 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Hazel', 'Mila was last seen on June 2, 2014, in Cresskill, New Jersey, according to', '. She was wearing a gray sweatshirt, pajama pants, and brown Converse sneakers. She wasn\xe2\x80\x99t living at home at the time, but instead staying at a friend\xe2\x80\x99s house, according to her', '.', 'If you have any information about Mila, please contact the', 'or', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '31.', '', ': Beverly Orantes-Perez, Santa Fe County', '18', '', '5\xe2\x80\x994\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '130 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Beverly was reported missing by her mother on Aug. 25, 2014. According to', ', she was last seen Aug. 2, 2014, at her home on Rufina Street in Santa Fe. She has since deleted all of her social media accounts and has not been heard from since.', 'If you have any information about Beverly, please contact', 'or', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '32.', '', ': Connor \xe2\x80\x9cTrapper\xe2\x80\x9d Trapatsos, Albany County', '17', '', '5\xe2\x80\x997\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '140 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Brown', 'Connor is a missing college student from the College of Saint Rose in Albany, NY. He was last seen on Oct. 15, 2014, University at Albany Police told BuzzFeed News. Police say he has left no \xe2\x80\x9celectronic footprint,\xe2\x80\x9d as far as social media, cameras, and credit cards go, but urge to public to help out in anyway possible. He could still be in the area of Albany, but may be attempting to travel to Rochester.', 'If you have any information about Connor, please contact the', '.', 'For information on other missing persons in', '.', '33.', '', ': Charles Tobin, Wayne County', '29', '', '5\xe2\x80\x996\xe2\x80\x9d', '', '130 pounds', '', 'Brown', '', 'Blue', 'Charles was last seen on July 10, 2014, at his home in Seven Springs, North Carolina, according to a Lost & Missing', 'dedicated to him. She was enroute to Shelton, Washington, to visit family but has not been heard from since. Florence was driving a 2008 Lincoln Mark LT truck, license plate no.
